f.d: [32. kun tu bzang pos bstan pa'i le'u]
bam po lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa/

bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs la/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la sogs pa thams cad kyang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la gnas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te/ de'i tshe 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du phyogs bcu nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'khod pa bcu 'thon par gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'khod pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas pa sha stag go /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad kyang ming 'di zhes bya ba dag ste/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zab mo'i mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal gyi gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sprin sgra zab mo rnam pa tha dad pa'i mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje mi phyed pa'i gtsug gi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ngag gi lam mi g.yo bar kun tu 'gro ba'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grags pa snyan par kun tu rnam par grags pa'i 'od kyi gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ri'i rgyal po mi g.yo ba'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun nas blta ba'i gzugs rnam par dmigs pa'i 'od zer gyi rgyal po snang ba'i gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stobs bcu rnam par dag pa thub pa med pa'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba dag ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag de ltar 'thon ma thag tu de'i mod la/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad kyang langs par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po'i 'od ma gtogs par 'od thams cad kyang mi snang bar gyur te/ thams cad kyang zil gyis non par gyur to/ / sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa mang po'ang mngon par byung bar gyur te/ 'di ltar spos kyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab par byed pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / me tog gi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / byug pa'i sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / gdugs kyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / gos kyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / rin po che'i sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / ba dan gyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa'i sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab par bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / 'od zer gyi dra ba snang ba chen po'i sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / rin po che sna tshogs kyi gzhal med khang gi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / snying po byang chub kyi rgyan rnam par phye ba'i sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba'i gos kyi sprin chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par khyab pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gi seng ge'i khri mang po de dag las/ byang chub sems dpa' re re'i seng ge'i khri'i rgyan rin po che rnam par dag pa re re dang / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re las kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re zhing yang sems can gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re zhing yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re zhing yang byang chub sems dpa' 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re zhing yang dus 'byams klas pa thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur te/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag las dmigs pa re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang bcas pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang bcas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa/ sems can 'dul ba dang bcas pa/ ming gi 'khor lo dang bcas pa mang po yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus dag tu 'jig rten gyi khams gang dang gang du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par gyur pa de dag kyang yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'khod cing / pha rol tu phyin pa de dag thams cad yongs su sbyong ba yang yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / dmigs pa mang po de dag thams cad las dmigs pa re re zhing yang phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ sangs rgyas skye ba dang bcas pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo dang bcas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa/ sems can 'dul ba dang bcas pa/ ming gi 'khor lo dang bcas pa mang po yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' de dag phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus dag tu 'jig rten gyi khams gang du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par gyur pa de dag kyang yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'khod cing / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong ba byed pa dag kyang yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'di snyam du gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa na gang dang gang nas lhags /de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang dang gang gi zhabs kyi drung nas phyin snyam ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag lhags na gang nas lhags/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ni gang shed nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang zhig gi zhabs kyi drung nas 'dir phyin/ de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag thams cad la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de bas na khyed nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag 'jig rten gyi khams ni gang nas lhags/ de bzhin gshegs pa ni gang zhig gi zhabs kyi drung nas phyin pa yongs su brtags pa dang / yongs su dpyad pa gyis shig/ de nas byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i mig gis kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad shin tu rnam par phye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi gzhi rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba dag la mnyam par gzhag go/ de ltar de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu la byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang mnyam par bzhag ste/ kun gyis byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan dang / gzhan sha stag la snyoms par bzhag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag kyang ma mthong / de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi zhabs kyi drung na byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa de dag kyang ma mthong nas/ ting nge 'dzin de dag las langs te/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ bdag cag byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu la mnyam par bzhag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag kyang ma mthong / byang chub sems dpa' de dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang gi zhabs kyi drung na tshangs par spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos yang byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ da dung du byang chub sems dpa' de dag 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa gang nas lhags pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig gi zhabs kyi drung nas lhags pa brtags par gyis shig/ dpyad par gyis shig /'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag ni mthong bar dka'o/ / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang gi zhabs kyi drung na byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang / de bas kyang shin tu mthong bar dka'o/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag las byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la mnyam par bzhag go/ de ltar mnyam par bzhag kyang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag kyang ma mthong / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang gi zhabs kyi drung na/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag ting nge 'dzin de dag las langs te/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ bdag cag byang chub sems dpa' re res byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la mnyam par bzhag kyang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo/ / gang gi zhabs kyi drung na byang chub sems dpa' de dag tshangs pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang ma mthong ngo/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po stan de las nam mkha'i dbyings su 'phags te; bcom ldan 'das la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku chags pa mi mnga' ba'i rgyan dang ldan pa dus gsum mtshungs par mnyam pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad kun tu khyab pa chos kyi dbyings kyi khongs su chud pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa 'di la ltos shig dang / de la 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan du gyur par snang ngo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byams klas pa thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan du gyur bar snang ngo/ / byang chub sems dpa' 'byams klas pa thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan du gyur par snang ngo/ / sems can gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan du gyur par snang ngo/ / lam gyi rgyud 'byams klas pa thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan du gyur bar snang ngo/ / kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de bas na khyed kyis rang gi lus kun tu lta ba'i mig dang ldan par byin gyis rlobs la/ shes rab kyi mig nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas par byin gyis rlob ste/ ye shes yangs pa'i mig dmigs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba khong du chud par gyis la/ phyogs 'byams klas pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byin gyis rlobs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thams cad du mi gnas pa 'di la gnas pa thams cad yongs su bsal ba'i lta bas ltos shig mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa dang / srid pa thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / shin tu phra ba'i tshul gyis stobs bcu'i stobs yongs su non pa dang / dmigs pa chung ngu la rgya chen por 'jug pa'i lta bas ltos shig /de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po'i gdams ngag bzhin du thal mo sbyar te/ bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas sems shing rtog pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi mthil gnyis kyi 'khor lo rtsibs stong yod pa la 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba yod pa mthong bar gyur te/ 'jig rten gyi khams de na de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu snang ba mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs byin pa ri a.e na ya'i byin pa lta bu gnyis la 'jig rten gyi khams chags pa med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od rgya mtsho chags pa med cing dri ma med pa'i snying po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' zab mo'i chos mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs pus mo gnyis kyi lha nga la 'jig rten gyi khams sa la [*le?] sbram yod pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa gser 'bar ba dam pa zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi gzi brjid mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i dul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das kyi sku sta zur gyi dkyil 'khor la 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba sna tshogs kyi snying po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa'i sprin sgra zab mo rnam pa tha dad pa'i mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das kyi sku lte ba'i dkyil 'khor na 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad gzi brjid kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje mi phyed pa'i gtsug gi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ka na 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi 'od zer snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa dpal gyi be'u rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to; ; de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' ngag gi lam mi g.yo bar kun tu 'gro ba'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid kyi mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das kyi sku phrag pa'i lhun gnyis la 'jig rten gyi khams gsar yod pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa gser 'bar ba'i snying po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to; ; de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' grags pa snyan par kun tu rnam par grags pa'i 'od kyi gzi brjid mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyis snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi zhal gyi gsung gi dbyangs la 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna tshogs zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer dpag tu med pa'i gzi brjid kyis rab tu brgyan pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas/ byang chub sems dpa' ri'i rgyal po mi g.yo ba'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems gshegs pa ye shes dus gsum du mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' kun nas blta ba'i gzugs rnam par dmigs pa'i 'od zer gyi rgyal po snang ba'i gzi brjid mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi dbu la 'jig rten gyi khams gzhi spyi'u tshugs kyi lhun yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na de bzhin gshegs pa rin po che'i me tog brtsegs pa zhes bya ba bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ / chos ston to/ / de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas byang chub sems dpa' stobs bcu rnam par dag pa thub pa med pa'i 'od zer snang ba'i gzi brjid mdzod kyi snying pos byung ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bskor cing mdun du byas te 'ongs nas/ seng ge'i khri chags pa med pa'i rgyan gyi snying po can la 'dug go/ de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mthong bar gyur nas; byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad las byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thob par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang gzungs chos thams cad kyi sa la sogs pa gzungs sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thob par gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdul dang bral ba'i snying po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thob par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad las byang chub sems dpa' re res kyang stobs kyi glog la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi glog sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thob par gyur to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ chos kyi sgo 'di dag ni bsam pa rdo rje dam pa lta bur byas te yongs su chub par bya'o/ / rim gro chen po dang ldan pa'i bsam pas yongs su bsrung bar bya'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ chos kyi sgo 'di dag ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams ma gtogs par gzhan gyi rna lam du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag yid dga' ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos smras pa la mngon par dga'o/ /
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ kun tu bzang pos bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste/ sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o// //
[33. ting nge 'dzin bcu'i le'u]
BOOK TWENTY-SEVEN. The Ten Concentrations
bam po lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa/

bcom ldan 'das thog ma mngon par sangs rgyas pa pho brang 'od thams cad kyi snying po can na de bzhin du mnyam par bzhag par bcom ldan 'das bsam gtan khrag khrig brgya'i ting nge 'dzin dang / thams cad kyis mi phyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas thob pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku shin tu dag pa dang / gnas med pa la rten pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / mi gnyis pa'i zhi gnas dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / tshad med par khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid dang / mi gnas pa'i bsam gtan gyi rgyud dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyis rnam par dmigs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lta ba dang / dus la bab pa'i sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / skad cig gcig gis byung ba'i mtshan nyid med pa la spyod pas bzhugs te/

AT THAT TIME the World Honored One was at the site of enlightenment in a forest in the country of Magadha, having just attained perfect enlightenment; in the hall of universal light he entered the buddhas’ concentration on the absolute instant, and by the inherent spiritual power of universal knowledge manifested the body of a realized buddha, pure and untrammeled, not relying on anything, with no clinging to objects, abiding in the ultimate tranquillity of cessation, endowed with great power, without any attachments, able to cause all beholders to gain awakening, appearing as appropriate, in accord with the time, always abiding in one form, which is no form.

byang chub sems dpa'i dbang bskur ba byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa la rab tu gnas pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu lta ba rab tu thob pa/ 'gro ba thams cad bde bar byed pa'i snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa/ bdud kyi dpung thams cad rab tu 'joms pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrubs pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du rab tu zhi bar gnas pas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa mi gnas pa la gnas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang thabs gcig ste/

He was with as many great enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, all of whom were of the rank of coronation, had fulfilled enlightening practices as measureless and boundless as the cosmos, and had attained the enlightening beings’ concentration state of universal vision. With great compassion they brought peace and calm to all sentient beings. Their powers and mastery were the same as those of buddhas. By their wisdom they profoundly penetrated and expounded the truth and were endowed with universal knowledge. They had conquered all demons, and though they entered into the world their minds were always calm; they dwelled in the nondwelling liberation of enlightening beings.

'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i gtsug dang / gzhal du med pa'i blo gros dang / zhi ba'i blo gros dang / gtong ba'i blo gros dang / klu'i blo gros dang / thob pa'i blo gros dang / spyin pa'i blo gros dang / stobs kyi blo gros dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i blo gros dang / chags pa med pa'i blo gros dang / mchog gi blo gros dang / lha'i blo gros dang / mchod sbyin byas pa'i blo gros dang / mthu'i blo gros dang / don gyi blo gros dang / chos la dbang po'i blo gros dang / chos kyi blo gros dang / zhi ba'i blo gros dang / nam mkha'i blo gros dang / skad cig gcig gi blo gros dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang / sdom pa'i blo gros dang / nam mkha'i blo gros dang / stobs kyi blo gros dang / glang po'i blo gros dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu'i blo gros dang / don rnam par dmigs pa'i blo gros dang / dam pa'i blo gros dang / ye shes snang ba'i blo gros dang / 'phags pa'i blo gros dang / dran pa'i rgyan dang / dngos po med pa'i mthar phyin pa dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyan dang / yul zab mo dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / klu'i 'od dang / snang ba 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rim gro la brtson pa dang / sems kyi rgyal po dang / spyod pa gcig pa dang / mngon par shes pa ma nyams pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / yon tan 'byung gnas dang / chos kyi sgron ma dang / 'gro ba'i bdag po dang / 'gro ba 'dzin pa dang / bde ba byed pa dang / mchog tu gyur pa dang / bla na med pa dang / mnyam pa med pa dang / 'dra ba med pa dang / 'od thogs pa med pa dang / 'od rab tu snang ba dang / grags pa'i 'od dang / shin tu rnam par snang ba dang / legs pa brtan pa dang / chos kyi char pa dang / thig le dam pa dang / ye shes kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / shes rab kyi sprin dang / sa'i rgyal po dang / smon lam khyad par du thogs pa med pas 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi snying po dang / bsam pa'i rgyal po dang / nang gi blo gros yang dag par grub pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i spyod yul dang / sa'i stabs kyis rnam par gnon pa dang / sa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa 'dzin pa dang / zla ba bzang po dang / ri bo chen po'i dpal dang / rin po che chen po'i dpal dang / bar snang gi rgyud dang / khams chen po'i rgyal po dang / dkyil 'khor mnyam pa khong du chud pa dang / gzi brjid gzhan gyis mi pham pa dang; klu chen po'i lta ba'i dpal dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ngang tshul dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor lo yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dpal dang; dran pa'i yul nyams pa med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i blo gros kyis rnam par rtogs pa dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i blos rnam par rol pa dang / mdzod zad mi shes pa dang / ye shes nyi ma'i dpal dang / chos kyi nyi ma dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa'i snying po dang / blo dam pa'i char 'bebs pa dang / kun tu blta ba dang / blta na don yod pa dang / rdo rje'i mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes rdo rje'i blo gros dang / kun tu mig gi dpal dang / sangs rgyas kyi don gyi nyi ma dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdo rje yang dag par gzung ba'i bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mig gi yul kun tu ye shes kyi rgyan dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang / sngon bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la grogs su gyur pa sha stag dang thabs gcig go/

Their names were Indestructible Knowedge, Peerless Knowledge, Knowledge of Meanings and Expressions, Supreme Knowledge, Eternally Equanimous Knowledge, Dragon Knowledge, Consummate Knowledge, Well-Tuned Knowledge, Immensely Powerful Knowledge, Inconceivable Knowledge, Unhindered Knowledge, Masterful Knowledge, Knowledge of Universal Service, Rational Knowledge, Adaptable Knowledge, Knowledge Mastering All Teachings, Knowledge of Truth, Dispassionate Knowledge, Spacelike Knowledge, Knowledge of Unity, Good Knowledge, Knowledge of Illusoriness, Vast Knowledge, Forceful Knowledge, Worldly Knowledge, Knowledge of Buddhahood, True Knowledge, Holy Knowledge, Illuminate Knowledge, Boundless Knowledge, Adorned with Mindfulness, Arrived at the Limit of Space, Natural Adornments, Most Profound Realm, Comprehending What Is So and What Is Not, Great Light, Eternal Light, Understanding the Seed of Buddhahood, Mind King, One Practice, Always Manifesting Spiritual Powers, Sprouts of Wisdom, Abode of Virtues, Lamp of Truth, Illumining the World, Sustaining the World, Most Serene, Supreme, Unexcelled, Incomparable, Peerless, Unhindered Action, Flames of Light, Moonlight, One Atom, Steadfast Practice, Showering the Rain of True Teaching, Supreme Banner, Universal Adornment, Eye of Wisdom, Objective Eye, Cloud of Wisdom, Spellbinding King, Nondwelling Vows, Mine of Knowledge, Mind King, Inner Awareness, Abiding in Enlightened Knowledge, Forceful Power of Spells, Earth-Sustaining Power, Beautiful Moon, Peak of the Polar Mountain, Jewel Summit, Universal Illumination, Charismatic King, Wheel of Knowledge, Great Power, Dragonlike, Straightforward Action, Nonregressive, Holding the Banner of the Teaching, Unforgetting, Caring for All Beings, Inconceivable Certain Knowledge, Freely Unbounded Knowledge, Inexhaustible Treasury of Wonderful Teachings, Sun of Knowledge, Sun of Truth, Treasury of Knowledge, Luster of Knowledge, Universal Vision, True Vision, Diamond Insight, Diamond Knowledge, Diamond Flame, Diamond Wisdom, Universal Eye, Sun of Buddhahood, Holding the Indestructible Secret Meaning of the Buddha, Adornments of Knowledge of the Sphere of the Universal Eye, and so on; there were as many such enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, who had all cultivated the same practices of roots of goodness of enlightening beings with Vairocana Buddha in the past.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig de'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi mthus stan las langs te/ bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g.yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te/ bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mos btud de/ bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ / gal te bdag gis zhus nas zhus pa'i lung bstan par bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs dbye bar gnang na/ bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyogs gcig cig zhu'o/ / de skad ces gsol ba dang /
bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu mig la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ / kun tu mig khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas dris pa de dang de'i lung bstan pas khyod kyi sems tshim par bya'o/ /de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang /
byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das/ ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa du dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i sgo dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam du ldan pa rnams ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang ba lags/ ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyi gnas 'thob pa lags/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par ldang ba la mkhas pa rgyun mi 'chad pa 'thob pa lags/ ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu dang rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa lags/ de skad ces gsol ba dang /

Then the great enlightening being Universal Eye, imbued with the spiritual power of the Buddha, rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt with his right knee on the ground, joined his palms in respect, and said to the Buddha, “World Honored One, I want to ask the Completely Enlightened One about something — please permit me to do so.”
The Buddha said, “You may ask whatever you want; I will explain for you and gladden you.” Universal Eye said, “How many concentrations and liberations have the enlightening being Universally Good and the enlightening beings who live by the vows and practices of Universal Good attained, that they may enter and exit and abide at rest in the great concentrations of enlightening beings and, by skillfully entering and emerging from the inconceivable vast state of concentration of enlightening beings, are able to command all concentrations, with ceaseless mystical powers?”

bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ / kun tu mig khyod kyis de ltar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'dri bar bsams pa legs so/ / legs so/ / kun tu mig/ de bas na byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu bsgrub par dka' ba dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa tshad med pas mngon par byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa la shin tu bslabs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam sgrub par dka' bas rnam par sbyangs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i phyir mi ldog pa dang ldan pa/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul mtha' yas pas rnam par sbyangs pa/ gzungs 'thob par bya ba mu med pa dang ldan pa/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa zad mi shes pas thogs pa med par rnam par dag pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la skyo ba med pa thob pa'i snying rje chen pos phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i smon lam dang ldan pa 'di 'khor 'dir 'dus te/ 'dug pa yin gyi/ de la dris shig dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'phrul pa ston to/ /

The Buddha said, “Very good, Universal Eye; you are asking this for the benefit of the enlightening beings of past, future, and present. The enlightening being Universally Good is now here, already capable of freely accomplishing inconceivable spiritual effects, beyond those of all enlightening beings, rarely encountered, born of immeasurable enlightening practices. He has purified the great vows of enlightening beings and is unregressing in all the practices he carries out; he has already attained innumerable aspects of transcendence, unhindered access to memory, and inexhaustible powers of elucidation, thoroughly pure and uninhibited. He compassionately aids all beings, through the power of his fundamental vows, forever unwearying. You should ask him — he will explain to you those concentrations, powers, and liberations.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ming thos ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa mngon du gyur to/ /chags pa med pa'i sems rnam par phye bas kyang byin gyis brlabs par gyur to/ /ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab par 'jug par bya ba la'ang rab tu gzhol bar gyur to/ /ye shes mi 'phrogs pa'i spyod yul yang rab tu byung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa mthong zhing rnam par dmigs pa yang mngon du gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs tshad med pa yang khong du chud par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig pa yang rjes su rtogs par gyur to/ /dus gsum mtha' yas pa la 'jug pa yang khong du chud par gyur to/ /bsod nams zad mi shes pa'i byin kyang thob par gyur to/ /rnam par 'phrul pa bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'ang khong du chud par gyur nas/ de dag thams cad kyis rim gro dang bcas shing rjes dang bcas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du lta bar gyur na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i rdzu 'phrul gyi khyu mchog gi mthus byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po yang ma mthong / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lus kyang ma mthong / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po gang na gnas pa'i stan yang ma mthong ngo/ /

Then the enlightening beings in the assembly, hearing the name of Universally Good, immediately attained inconceivably infinite concentration, their minds unobstructed, silent, and unstirring; their knowledge became immeasurably vast, their realm of experience most profound, without compare. They saw countless buddhas before them, attained the power of the enlightened, and, of the same nature as the enlightened, they clearly perceived all the past, future, and present. Their blessings and virtues were inexhaustible, and they were endowed with all spiritual powers. Those enlightening beings conceived respect for Universally Good and urgently wished to behold him—they looked all over the assembled masses but ultimately did not see him, nor did they see the seat on which he sat. This was because of the support of the awesome power of the Enlightened, and also Universally Good’s command of mystic power caused it to be so.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ / bcom ldan 'das/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po da ltar ga la mchis/ bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa/ kun tu mig /'khor 'di nyid na nga'i zhabs kyi drung na 'jug go /nga'i zhabs kyi drung na spyod do/ /nga'i zhabs kyi drung nas ma g.yos so; ; de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad kyis yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la rnam par bltas nas/ bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ / bcom ldan 'das/ bdag cag gis kun tu bzang po de ma mthong ngo/ / de'i lus kyang ma mthong ngo/ /de'i stan yang ma mthong ngo/ /

Then the enlightening being Universal Eye said to the Buddha, “Where is the enlightening being Universally Good now?” The Buddha replied, “The enlightening being Universally Good is in the Assembly at this enlightenment site, near me — he has never moved.” At that Universal Eye and the enlightening beings again searched throughout the assembly, and then said to the Buddha, “We still cannot find Universally Good.”

bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa/ rigs kyi bu dag /khyed kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lus ma mthong zhing / stan ma mthong ba ni de de bzhin te yus so/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po de ni brjod du med cing zab pa la gnas pa ste/ 'di ltar ye shes kyi dbyings mtha' yas par 'jug pa la zhugs pa'o/ / seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul bla na med pa rab tu thob pa'o/ / chags pa med pa'i mthas rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus grub pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings dam pa'i las dang ldan pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs la gnas pa'o/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang / ye shes tha mi dad pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa'o/ / 'di lta ste; byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po 'di ni/ sems skad cig gi mtha'i rjes su 'brang ba'o/ /

The Buddha said, “That is so. Why can you not see him? Because the dwelling place of the enlightening being Universally Good is most profound and inexplicable. Universally Good has attained boundless aspects of knowledge, entered the ‘lion emergence’ concentration, attained unexcelled freedom of action, entered pure nonobstruction, and developed the ten powers of the enlightened: his body is the matrix of the cosmos, on which all enlightened ones concentrate together. In an instant he can thoroughly realize and enter the unfragmented knowledge of the buddhas of all times. This is why you cannot see him.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis de bzhin gshegs pa las kun tu bzang po'i yon tan rnam par dag pa thos ma thag tu/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu la mnyam par bzhag ste/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po mngon par 'dod cing / mthong bar bya ba dang / gsol ba gdab pa'i bsam pas tshol lo/ /yongs su tshol lo/ /rab tu rtog go/ shin tu zhib cing brtags par rnam par dpyod do/ /rjes su rtog go /rnam par blta'o/ /'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ma mthong ngo/ / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad kyis kyang mthong par ma gyur to/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig ting nge 'dzin de las langs te/ bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ /
bcom ldan 'das/ ting nge 'dzin grangs ma mchis pa stong phrag bcu la mnyam par bzhag ste; rnam par bltas kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ma mthong ngo/ / de'i lus kyi las kyang ma mthong ngo/ / de'i ngag dang ngag gi las kyang ma thos so/ / de'i yid dang yid kyi las kyang ma mthong ngo/ / de'i stan yang ma mthong ngo/ / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po de gang na mchis pa dang / spyod pa'i phyogs de yang ma mthong ngo/ /

Then Universal Eye, hearing the Buddha speak of the pure qualities of Universally Good, attained ten thousand infinities of concentrations. With the power of concentration he again looked all over, eager to see Universally Good, but still could not see him. The other enlightening beings could not see him either. Then Universal Eye rose from concentration and said to the Buddha, “I have entered ten thousand infinities of concentrations and sought to behold Universal Good but after all have not succeeded. I do not see his body or physical actions, his speech or conversation, his mind or mental activity, his seat or his place — none of them is visible.”

bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa/ kun tu mig /de ni de bzhin te/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po de mi mthong ngo/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la shin tu bslabs pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'o/ / kun tu mig /de la ji snyam du sems/ sgyu ma'i gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs mang po sgyu ma'i sngags kyi yi ge gang la gnas pa dmigs par nus sam/

The Buddha said, “So it is, so it is. Know that this is all because of the enlightening being Universally Good’s power of abiding in inconceivable liberation. Universal Eye, what do you think — can anyone explain the dwelling place of various illusory forms in magical writings?”
btsun pa bcom ldan 'das/ ma lags so/ /
Universal Eye said, “No.”

bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa/ kun tu mig/ sgyu ma'i sngags kyi gzugs kyi rnam pa de dag kyang dmigs shing bstan par mi nus na/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lus kyi spyod yul gsang ba dang / ngag gi spyod yul gsang ba dang / yid kyi spyod yul gsang ba la 'jug par mi nus pa dang / mthong bar mi nus pa lta smos kyang ci dgos/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni zab cing bsam gyis mi khyab par rnam par spyod pa'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni tshad med cing tshad las 'das pa ste/ ye shes rdo rje'i blo dang ldan pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la yang dag par gnas pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gnas med par spyod cing / sems can thams cad kyi lus dang gzugs kyi rjes su zhugs pa'o/ /blang ba med pa'i chos kyi tshul dang ldan pa'o/ / mi zad cing tha mi dad pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / khyu mchog gi mthu la lhun gyis grub par gnas pa'i mthar phyin pa'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pa dang ldan pa'o/ /de ltar/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni blta na don yod pa'o/ /mnyan pa don yod pa'o/ /bsnyen bkur byed pa don yod pa'o/ /bsam pa don yod pa'o/ /rjes su dran pa don yod pa'o/ /de la dad par byas pa don yod pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po de ni mthong ba don yod pa'o/ /thos pa don yod pa'o/ /bsnyen bkur ba don yod pa'o/ /bsam pa don yod pa'o/ /rjes su dran par byas pa don yod pa'o/ /de la mos par byas pa don yod pa'o/ /blta ba don yod pa'o/ /brtags pa don yod pa'o/ /btsal ba don yod pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni rjes su smon lam gdab pa don yod pa'o/ /

The Buddha said, “Universal Eye, if illusory forms in illusions cannot be explained, how much less can one enter or see the esoteric physical realm, the esoteric verbal realm, or the esoteric mental realm of the enlightening being Universally Good. Why? Because the realm of Universally Good is extremely profound, inconceivable, without measure, beyond measure. To sum it up, the enlightening being Universally Good, by means of adamantine wisdom, pervades the cosmos of realities, yet does not course in any world or dwell anywhere—he knows that the bodies of all beings are not bodies, and have no coming or going. He has attained inexhaustible, undivided, free spiritual powers, independent, uncontrived, inactive, reaching the ultimate bounds of the cosmos. If any can get to see the enlightening being Universally Good, or get to attend him, or get to hear his name, or think about him, or remember him, or believe in him, or strive to observe him, or orient themselves toward him, or properly seek him, or initiate vows, continuing uninterrupted, all will gain benefit—none of this is in vain.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po mthong bar 'dod cing thal mo sbyar te/ bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la phyag 'tshal zhing tshig 'di skad brjod do/ / sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la phyag 'tshal lo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad la btud de phyag 'tshal lo/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la btud de phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Then Universal Eye and all the other enlightening beings, their hearts conceiving longing to behold the enlightening being Universally Good, spoke these words: “Honor to all the buddhas; honor to the enlightening being Universally Good.” Saying this three times, they bowed in respect.

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor chen po de dag la bka' stsal pa/ rigs kyi bu dag/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la phyag 'tshol la gsol ba thob cig/ phyogs thams cad du mngon du gyis la kun tu mig gi lus su byin gyis rlob ste/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la dmigs pa gyis la chos kyi dbyings thams cad mngon du bya ba'i sems kyis byin gyis brlabs par gyis te/ chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral bar khong du chud par gyis la/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po dang / smon lam gcig par byung ste/ gnyis su med pa la mnyam par zhog la/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad lus las mngon par byung bar byin gyis rlob ste/ dbang po tha mi dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bar gyis la kun tu bzang po'i smon lam kun tu 'gro ba yongs su sbyang bar gyis shig dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po mthong bar 'gyur ro/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de skad thos nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag dang bcas pas spyi bos gtugs te phyag 'tshal nas/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la gsol ba btab bo/ / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis gsol ba btab ma thag tu/

At that point the Buddha said to the enlightening being Universal Eye and the others in the assembly, “Offspring of the buddhas, you should bow to Universally Good again and earnestly entreat him; and you should look upon the ten directions with utmost single-mindedness and visualize the body of Universally Good before you. Thinking thus, that Universally Good is omnipresent throughout the cosmos, believe deeply, detach from everything, vow to practice the same undertaking as Universally Good, and enter nondual true reality; the body of Universally Good appears everywhere in all worlds, with comprehensive knowledge of the differences in faculties of all beings, assembling the path of Universally Good in all places. If you can initiate such a great vow, then you will be able to see the enlightening being Universally Good.” Now Universal Eye and the other enlightening beings, hearing the Buddha say this, bowed their heads to the ground and sought to get to see the great being Universally Good.

de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i rnam par thar pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba gang gis/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung na gnas shing / pad+mo'i stan la 'dug par mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / 'khor de'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lus las kyang 'byung bar snang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa dag nas kyang 'ong bar snang ba dang / sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'phrin las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rab tu brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rab tu ston pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi lam snang bar byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba thams cad yang dag par brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med pa'i dus gsum rab tu ston pa de lta bu'i rnam par thar pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu bstan to/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good, by the power of liberated spiritual faculties, manifested physical bodies in accord with their needs, causing all those enlightening beings to see Universally Good near the Buddha, sitting on a lotus seat in the midst of this assembly of all the enlightening beings; they also saw him with all the buddhas in all other worlds, continuously coming from there; they also saw him with all those buddhas, expounding all practices of enlightening beings, revealing the path of omniscience, explaining all enlightening beings’ spiritual powers, distinguishing all enlightening beings’ charismatic virtues, and showing the buddhas of past, present, and future.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mthong nas dga' zhing mgu ste/ yi rangs nas rab tu dga' zhing bde ba dang / yid dga' ba skyes nas/ dmigs pa thams cad kyis btud pa'i rjes su byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la phyag 'tshal to/ /

At this point, Universal Eye and all the other enlightening beings, witnessing this miracle, were overjoyed and all bowed to the enlightening being Universally Good with respect, as if they were seeing all the buddhas of the ten directions.

de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi mos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas sprin gyi char stong phrag bcu mngon par bab par gyur pa 'di lta ste/ me tog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / phreng ba sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / spos sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / spos kyi phye ma sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / gdugs sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / na bza' sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / rin po che sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / spos sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / snam bu rin po che'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa rnam pa drug tu g.yos so/ / rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba thams cad kyi sgra mang po byung ngo/ / lha'i nga ro snyan pa mang po rab tu byung ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snang ba chen pos khyab par snang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sems can rnams rnam par dag par gyur to/ / ngan song gi lam gyi rgyud gsum rnam par zhi bar gyur to/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam par dag par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la zhugs par gyur to/ byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la yongs su grub par gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byas nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur to/ /

Then, by the great spiritual power of the Buddha as well as the power of faith of the enlightening beings and the power of the original vow of Universally Good, there spontaneously rained ten thousand kinds of clouds, such as clouds of various flowers, clouds of various garlands, clouds of various fragrances, clouds of various aromatic powders, clouds of various canopies, clouds of various robes, clouds of various ornaments, clouds of various jewels, clouds of various burning incenses, and clouds of various streamers; unspeakably many worlds quaked, celestial music played and was heard afar throughout unspeakably many worlds, great light radiated and illuminated unspeakably many worlds, causing the states of misery to become extinct, adorning unspeakably many worlds, causing unspeakably many enlightening beings to enter into the practice of Universally Good, and causing unspeakably many enlightening beings to thoroughly fulfill the vows of practice of universal good and attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to/ / bcom ldan 'das/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni bdag nyid che ba la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / mtshungs pa ma mchis pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / yongs su mi chod pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / slar mi ldog pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / mnyam pa nyid rjes su rtogs pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / gzhan gyis mi zlog pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / chos thams cad tha mi dad pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / chos thams cad dang ma 'dres par rnam par spyod pa'o/ / sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi byin gyis rlabs mkhas pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / bcom ldan 'das/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni chos thams cad kyi dbang dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa la rnam par spyod pa'o/ /
bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa/ kun tu mig /de khyod kyis ji skad du smras pa de bzhin te/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni yon tan grangs med pas rnam par dag pa'o/ / yon tan mtshungs pa med pas rnam par brgyan pa'o/ / yon tan tshad med pas rin po che dang ldan pa'o/ / yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'byung gnas rgya mtsho'o/ / yon tan dpag tu med pa'i mtshan nyid do/ / yon tan mu med pa'i sprin to/ / yon tan sa mtshams med pas bsngags shing bstod pa'o/ / chos rin po che zad mi shes pa'o; ; byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yon tan brjod cing bsngags pa mi zad pa'o/ /

Then the enlightening being Universal Eye said to the Buddha, “World Honored One, the enlightening being Universally Good is one who abides in great power, in incomparability, in unsurpassability, in nonregression, in equanimity, in indestructibility, in all differentiated things, in all undifferentiated things, in the abode of the skillful mind of all beings, in absorption in liberation, free in all things.”
The Buddha said, “It is so; it is as you say. The enlightening being Universally Good has innumerable pure qualities—the qualities of peerless adornment, the qualities of innumerable jewels, the qualities of inconceivable oceans, the qualities of infinite forms, the qualities of boundless clouds, infinite incomparable qualities, the qualities of inexhaustible truths, untold qualities, the qualities of all buddhas, qualities that cannot ever be exhaustively extolled.”

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ / kun tu bzang po khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor thams cad la/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin shin tu bstan pa gang gis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bcu shin tu bstan pa la mkhas pas/ ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po bcu shin tu bstan pa spobs par gyis shig/

Then the Buddha said to the enlightening being Universally Good, “You should explain the ten concentrations for Universal Eye and the enlightening beings in this assembly, so that they may be able to enter them and fulfill the practical vows of universal good. Because the great enlightening beings expound these ten concentrations, they enable the enlightening beings of the past, present, and future to attain emancipation.

bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa rab tu thob pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba snang ba zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste; byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po rab tu thob pa yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ zhing 'byams klas pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rjes su song ba dang / 'di lta ste/ lhag pa'i bsam pa gtsang mas spyod pa zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ 'das pa'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ ye shes rnam par snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rnam par bkod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan ces bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi lus tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ sems can gyi khams la dbang ba zhes bya ba dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa rab tu thob pa bcu pa chags pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po 'di bcu ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs so/ / gsung ngo/ / gsung bar 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis ting nge 'dzin bcu po 'di dag la bsten cing bsgoms te/ mang du byas pa dang / dngos por byas pa dang / shes par byas pa dang / mngon du byas pa dang / mdun du byas pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / shin tu brtsams pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bcu po 'di dag dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' yin yang sangs rgyas zhes bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o/ /stobs bcu pa zhes bya'o/ /'dren pa zhes bya'o/ /rnam par 'dren pa zhes bya'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o/ /thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya'o/ /chags pa med pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o/ /bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul can zhes bya'o/ /chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug ces bya'o/ /

What are the ten concentrations? One, the great concentration of universal light; two, the great concentration of subtle light; three, the great concentration of successive journeying to the buddha-lands; four, the great concentration of the action of the pure profound mind; five, the great concentration of knowledge of the stores of adornments of the past; six, the great concentration of the treasury of light of knowledge; seven, the great concentration of knowledge of the adornments of the buddhas of all worlds; eight, the great concentration of the differentiated bodies of sentient beings; nine, the great concentration of freedom in the elemental cosmos; ten, the great concentration of the unimpeded wheel.
“These ten great concentrations the great enlightening beings can skillfully enter; all the buddhas of past, future, and present have expounded, will expound, and are expounding them. If enlightening beings gladly and respectfully cultivate and practice them without slacking, they will be able to accomplish them; such people are called buddhas, they are called those who have arrived at Thusness, and they are called people who have attained the ten powers, and they are called guides, and they are called great leaders, and they are called omniscient, and they are called all-seers, and they are called those who abide in nonobstruction, and they are called those who have comprehended all objects, and they are called masters of all spiritual truths.

byang chub sems dpa' gang gis ting nge 'dzin'di dag thob pa de ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rjes su song ba yang yin la/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas phyir log pa yang yin/ sems can thams cad kyi khams su rab tu song ba'ang yin la/ sems can med pa'i mtha' yang khong du chud pa yin/ chags pa med pa'i lus kyi snying po'i rjes su song ba'ang yin la/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang 'jug par spyod pa yin no/ / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pas kyang rnam par dag la/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yang rjes su 'brang ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos rnam par mthong ba yang yin la/ spyod pa thams cad kyi yang rjes su song ba yin/ dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / yi ge la rab tu spobs shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas rnam par dag pa'ang yin la; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par phye ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la'ang rab tu gnas pa yin/ rtag par dus gsum skad cig tu zhugs pa'ang yin la/ dus gsum thams cad yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par gzhol ba'ang yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos ston pa'ang yin la/ thabs kyis chos thams cad kyi 'khor lo bskor ba las phyir mi ldog pa'i lus dang yang ldan pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i tshul la yang rab tu zhugs la/ sangs rgyas gcig mngon par sangs rgyas pas sangs rgyas thams cad du'ang shin tu ston pa yin te/ 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi rnam pa'i tshul lo/ / 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes rnam par sbyang ba'i tshul lo/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyal mtshan gzhan gyis mi pham pa'i tshul lo/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi tshul lo/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa rnon po dang 'grogs pa'i tshul lo/ / gzungs dang spobs pa thams cad kyi tshul lo/ / dus gsum tha mi dad pa'i tshul lo; ; 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul lo/ / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu dgod pa'i tshul lo/ / 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu bstan pa'i tshul lo/ /

These enlightening beings enter into all worlds without being attached to anything in any world; they enter the realms of all beings without grasping beings; they enter all bodies without being hindered by bodies; they enter all elemental realms and know the cosmos is boundless. They draw near all the buddhas of all times and clearly see all the buddhas’ teachings; they skillfully explain all words and comprehend all provisional names. They accomplish the pure path of all enlightening beings and are firm in all the different practices of enlightening beings. In a single instant they attain all knowledge of past, present, and future, and know all things in all times. They expound all the buddhas’ teachings and turn all the irreversible wheels. In each age, past, future, and present, they realize all paths to enlightenment, and in each enlightenment comprehend what all the buddhas say. These are the gates of the characteristics of the principles of enlightening beings; these are the gates of the knowledge and awareness of enlightening beings; these are the gates of the invincible knowledge of all means of liberation; these are the gates of the practices vowed by the Universally Good enlightening being; these are the gates of the undertakings of penetrating spiritual powers; these are the gates of all mnemonic command and powers of elucidation; these are the gates to the differentiations of all things of past, present, and future; these are the gates of manifestations of all buddhas; these are the gates to stabilizing all beings by universal knowledge; these are the gates to beautifying and purifying all worlds by means of spiritual powers of buddhas.

byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin'di dag thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthu mi zad pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs thob pa yin/ 'pho ba med pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings ltar tshad med pa yin/ chos kyi rgyal srid la 'gro ba dbang bskur ba'i phyir dbang mtha' yas par bsgyur ba yin/ stobs bcu shin tu yangs pa'i tshul thob pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad du tshad med pa'i ye shes thob pa yin/ rab tu zhi ba'i mtha' la zhugs pas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems rab tu bsgoms pa yin/ shugs dang ldan pa'i rtsal ba dog pas snying rje chen po'i seng ge yin/ yon tan dang bsngags pa thams cad dang ldan pas chos kyi sgron ma la yang dag par gzhol zhing mi zad pa yin/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ chos shes shing khong du chud pas gnas kyi mthar phyin pa yin/ spyod pa dang / rnam par gdags pa dang / brda thams cad la sna tshogs su shin tu bstan pa byed par mkhas pa yin/ chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mkhas pa la zhugs pas mtshan ma med pa la mos pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnga' chen pos rnam par dag pas rigs dang rgyud rnam par dag pa yin/ gzhi med pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi gzhi rab tu dbye ba'i snying po'i rjes su song ba yin/ chos yongs su gtong ba la brtson pas dus thams cad du mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin/ shes par bya ba thams cad khong du chud pas/ sems can gyi nang na mkhas pa yin/ skye dgu thams cad shin tu dag par byed pas mtha' yas pa rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnam par sangs rgyas pa dang / 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i spyod pa yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor gyi thabs la mkhas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zad mi shes pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la mkhas pas cho 'phrul chen po ston pa yin gyi/ de bas na kun tu bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bcu bo 'di dag rgya cher spros te bshad pas bstan par gyis shig /byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'di dag thams cad nyan par 'dod do/ /

“If enlightening beings enter these concentrations, they attain cosmic power that has no end; they are enabled to travel through space without hindrance; they attain the rank of spiritual sovereignty, with immeasurable independence and command, like being coronated and enthroned in the world; they attain boundless knowledge comprehending all; they attain vast powers, ten kinds perfectly fulfilled; they develop noncontentious hearts and enter dispassionate tranquillity; they are compassionate and fearless as lions; they are heroes of knowledge and wisdom and light the bright lamp of truth. All their merits and virtues cannot be fully told of—no hearers of self-enlightened ones can conceive of them. They attain knowledge of the realm of reality and abide in infinity, yet are able to discourse in various ways according to worldly conventions; they abide in formlessness, yet can easily penetrate the characteristics of things. They attain the treasury of inherent purity and are born in the pure house of the enlightened. They skillfully open up various different gates of teaching, yet by means of wisdom they know that nothing exists. They are expert at knowing proper timing and always carry out the giving of teaching to enlighten everyone. They care for all beings and purify them all. By knowledge of expedient means they demonstrate the attainment of buddhahood, yet they always carry out the practices of enlightening beings without end. Entering the realm of means of universal knowledge, they manifest various great spiritual powers. Therefore, Universally Good, you should now analyze and expound the ten great concentrations of all enlightening beings. All in this assembly want to hear about this.”
[1. byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa rab tu thob pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba snang ba]
1. The great enlightening beings’ concentration of universal light

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis kyang gsol ba btab par shes nas/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ bcu bo 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma lus par mthar thug pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas skye ba khong du chud pa'i ye shes dang / sems can dri ma med pa mngon par bsgrubs par bya ba'i ye shes dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mig yor lta bur shes pa'i ye shes dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i ye shes dang / byang chub sems dpa' rab tu gzung ba la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i thabs yongs su gnon pa'i ye shes dang / don thams cad dang ldan pa'i chos kyi lhag mthong la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi mthu'i rjes su song ba'i ye shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shes pa'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam dang byin gyi rlabs kyi ye shes te/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma lus par mthar thug pa'o/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good, receiving the directive of the Enlightened One, looked at Universal Eye and the other enlightening beings and said to them, “Offspring of Buddha, what is the great enlightening beings’ concentration of universal light? Here the enlightening beings have ten kinds of inexhaustible qualities: inexhaustible knowledge of the buddhas’ emergence in the world; inexhaustible knowledge of the metamorphoses of beings; inexhaustible knowledge of the world’s being like a reflection; inexhaustible knowledge penetrating deeply into the realm of reality; inexhaustible knowledge skillfully dealing with enlightening beings; inexhaustible knowledge of the nonregression of enlightening beings; inexhaustible knowledge observing the meanings of all principles; inexhaustible knowledge of skillful maintenance of mental power; inexhaustible knowledge abiding in the vast spirit of enlightenment; inexhaustible knowledge abiding by all enlightened teachings and the willpower of omniscience. These are called the ten inexhaustible qualities of great enlightening beings.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sems can thams cad nye bar gzung ba dang / yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste / sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur zhing mchod pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bar bya ba'i mig tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung dang / dbyangs dang / bka' yang dag par gzung zhing nyams pa med par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i bye brag tha dad pa rnam par dbye ba la mkhas par khong du chud pa bskyed pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i stobs la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pas shin tu phra bar dmigs shing yongs su mnan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rab tu bstan pa'i phyir sems ba skyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab cing / 'byams klas pa la 'jug pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mngon du bya bar lhag pa'i bsam pa yang dag par gtang zhing / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par blang ba'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug cing lus sna tshogs kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /

“These great enlightening beings awaken ten kinds of boundless will: they awaken the boundless will to liberate all sentient beings, the boundless will to attend all buddhas, the boundless will to provide for all buddhas, the boundless will to see all buddhas, the boundless will to receive and hold all Buddha teachings without forgetting any, the boundless will to manifest the infinite spiritual metamorphoses of all buddhas, the boundless will not to abandon any enlightening practices to attain enlightened power, the boundless will to enter into the subtle realm of all-knowledge and explain all Buddha teachings, the boundless will to enter into the inconceivable vast realm of buddhahood, the boundless will to develop profound aspiration for the buddhas’ powers of elucidation and receive all Buddha teachings, the boundless will to manifest all kinds of free bodies and enter the circles of all enlightened ones.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po 'di rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag la 'jug pa'i ye shes te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar shar phyogs su snyoms par zhugs te/ nub phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba dang / nub phyogs su snyoms par zhugs te/ shar phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba dang / shar dang byang gi mtshams su snyoms par zhugs te/ lho dang nub kyi mtshams nas rnam par ldang ba dang / lho dang nub kyi mtshams su snyoms par zhugs te/ shar dang byang gi mtshams nas rnam par ldang ba dang / lho phyogs su snyoms par zhugs te; byang phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba dang / byang phyogs su snyoms par zhugs te/ lho phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba dang / nub dang byang gi mtshams su snyoms par zhugs te/ shar dang lho'i mtshams nas rnam par ldang ba dang / shar dang lho'i mtshams su snyoms par bzhugs te/ nub dang byang gi mtshams nas rnam par ldang ba dang / 'og gi phyogs su snyoms par zhugs te/ steng gi phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba dang / steng gi phyogs su snyoms par zhugs shing / 'og gi phyogs nas rnam par ldang ba ste/

“These enlightening beings have ten kinds of knowledge of differentiation of entry into concentration: entering into concentration in the east and emerging in the west, entering in the west and emerging in the east, entering in the south and emerging in the north, entering in the north and emerging in the south, entering in the northeast and emerging in the southwest, entering in the southwest and emerging in the northwest, entering in the southwest and emerging in the northeast, entering in the northwest and emerging in the southeast, entering in the southeast and emerging in the northwest, entering in the nadir and emerging in the zenith, entering in the zenith and emerging in the nadir.

“These enlightening beings have ten kinds of knowledge of skills in entry into great concentration: they make a billion-world universe a single lotus blossom and appear sitting cross-legged on this lotus blossom, covering it entirely, and in the body manifest another billion-world universe, wherein there are ten billion quadruplex earths, in each of which they manifest ten billion bodies, each body entering into one hundred sextillion billion-world universes, in each of the quadruplex worlds of which they manifest one hundred sextillion enlightening beings engaged in practice, the practice of each enlightening being producing one hundred sextillion certain understandings, each certain understanding causing one hundred sextillion potentials to be fulfilled, each potential developing into the nonregressive work of one hundred sextillion enlightening ways: yet the physical manifestations are neither one nor many, and not mixed up in entry into concentration or emergence from concentration. It is like the case of the titan king Rahula, whose original body is seven hundred leagues tall, while his transformed body is 168,000 leagues tall; the half of his body emerging from the ocean is just level with the polar mountain Sumeru. Though that titan king transforms his body into a colossus, that does not destroy his original form — all the psychophysical elements are the same, his mind is not disturbed, he does not think of his transformed body as other or of his original body as not himself. The body he was born with is always blissful, and his transformed body is always manifesting all kinds of miraculous powers. The titan king has greed, ill-will, and delusion, and is full of pride and conceit, and yet is able to transform his body in this way — how much the more so the enlightening beings who profoundly realize that mental states are like illusions, that all beings are like dreams, that the appearance in the world of all buddhas is like reflected images, that all worlds are like magical productions, that all speech is like echoes: they see reality as is and have reality as their body, knowing all things are inherently pure, realizing that the body and mind have no real substance; their bodies are omnipresent in infinite realms and by the great light of buddha-knowledge purify and practice all the deeds of enlightening beings.

de ting nge 'dzin chen po de la gnas pas cung zad du 'khrul pa'ang med na/ blong zhing rmongs par 'gyur ba med pa lta ci smos/ de lus kyi stod lha'i 'jig rten du 'phags par byin gyis rlob cing lus kyi smad 'dod pa'i khams na 'dug par byin gyis rlob kyang shin tu mnyam par bzhag pas rab tu sbyar ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor chen po des/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan de yang rang gi lus kyi nang du rlag pa des lus chen po ston cing spyoms pa'i skye ba dang / rdzu 'phrul thams cad kyang lus kyi nang du rlag par byin gyis rlob bo/ /
“Enlightening beings in this concentration transcend the world and are detached from the world; nothing can disturb them or overpower them.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi sdug pa bsgoms pa la gnas pa'i dge slong ni mi sdug pa'i mtshan mar rnam par lta zhing; nang gi lus la rtog pa la mngon par brtson pa yin/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang lus su 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad chud par bya ba'i phyir/ chos kyi lus la brtag par mngon par brtson pa yin te/ lus de la 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten gyi chos mthong yang 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pas lus la 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis chags pa med do/ /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i ye shes rjes su 'gro ba snang ba zhes bya'o; ;

Just as when a monk contemplates inside the body and dwells in the view of impurity, seeing the body as impure, so do enlightening beings in this concentration observe the reality body, seeing all worlds enter the body, therein seeing all mundane realms and phenomena without any attachment to them. This is called the great enlightening beings’ practical knowledge of the first great concentration, of universal light.
[2. byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po rab tu thob pa yid du 'ong ba]
“What is the great enlightening beings’ concentration of subtle light?
