entering in the air element of all seas, they emerge in all four gross elements; entering in all four gross elements, they emerge in the truth of nonorigination; entering in the truth of nonorigination, they emerge on the polar mountain;

ri rab la snyoms par zhugs shing; rin po che'i ri bdun las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rin po che'i ri bdun la snyoms par zhugs shing / rin po che'i rgyan bdun las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rin po che rgyan bdun la snyoms par zhugs shing / sa bon dang / lo tog dang / sa dang / shing dang / ri nag po sna tshogs las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sa bon dang / lo tog dang / sa dang / shing dang / ri nag po sna tshogs la snyoms par zhugs shing / me tog bzang po dang / dri zhim po dang / rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i ri las rnam par ldang 'o/ / me tog bzang po dang; dri zhim po dang / rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i ri la snyoms par zhugs shing / gling bzhi par gtogs pa'i bla dang / 'og thams cad dang / sems can rnam par phye ba thams cad kyi skye gnas las rnam par ldang ngo/ / gling bzhi par gtogs pa'i bla dang / 'og thams cad dang / sems rnam par phye ba thams cad kyi skye gnas la snyoms par zhugs shing / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig phrag brgyar gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo; ; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams khrag khrig phrag brgyar gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / bye ba brgya phrag stong du gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya phrag stong du gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mu med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mu med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag gis mi lang bar gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag gis mi lang bar gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par gtogs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par gtogs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam par byang ba'i sems can las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rnam par byang ba'i sems can la snyoms par zhugs shing / mig gi skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / mig gi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / rna ba'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rna ba'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / sna'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sna'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / lce'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / lce'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / lus kyi skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / lus kyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / reg gi skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / reg gi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / ro'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / ro'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / dri'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / dri'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / sgra'i skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sgra'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing; gzugs kyi skye mched las rnam par ldang ngo/ / gzugs kyi skye mched la snyoms par zhugs shing / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la snyoms par zhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba rnam par phye ba las rnam par ldang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba rnam par phye ba la snyoms par zhugs shing / nyan thos las rnam par ldang ngo/ / nyan thos la snyoms par zhugs shing / rang sangs rgyas las rnam par ldang ngo; ; rang sangs rgyas la snyoms par zhugs shing / rang gi lus las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rang gi lus la snyoms par zhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi sku las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi sku la snyoms par zhugs shing / sems kyi skad cig gcig las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sems kyi skad cig gcig la snyoms par zhugs shing / bskal pa bye ba las rnam par ldang ngo/ / bskal pa bye ba la snyoms par zhugs shing / sngon gyi mtha' las rnam par ldang ngo/ / sngon gyi mtha' la snyoms par zhugs shing / phyi ma'i mtha' las rnam par ldang ngo/ / phyi ma'i mtha' la snyoms par zhugs shing / da ltar byung ba'i mtha' las rnam par ldang ngo/ / da ltar byung ba'i mtha' la snyoms par zhugs shing / dus gsum las rnam par ldang ngo/ / dus gsum la snyoms par zhugs shing / skad cig gi mtha' las rnam par ldang ngo/ / skad cig gi mtha' la snyoms par zhugs shing / dus gsum las rnam par ldang ngo/ / dus gsum la snyoms par zhugs shing / phyogs bcu nas rnam par ldang ngo/ / phyogs bcur snyoms par zhugs shing / ngag gi lam las rnam par ldang ngo/ / ngag gi lam la snyoms par zhugs shing / phyogs bcu nas rnam par ldang ngo/ /

entering on the polar mountain, they emerge on the mountain of seven precious substances; entering on the mountain of seven precious substances, they emerge on the black mountain of various crops and forests of all soils; entering on the black mountain of various crops and forests of all soils, they emerge in precious arrays of all flowers of sublime fragrances; entering in precious arrays of all flowers of sublime fragrances, they emerge in the incarnations of all beings of the four quarters, the zenith and nadir; entering in the incarnations of all beings of the four quarters, the zenith and nadir, they emerge in the beings of the solar system; entering in the beings of the solar system, they emerge in beings of the galaxy; entering in the beings of the galaxy, they emerge in the beings of the universe; entering in the beings of the universe, they emerge in the beings of a hundred thousand hundred billion universes; entering in the beings of a hundred thousand hundred billion universes, they emerge in the beings of countless worlds; entering in the beings of countless worlds, they emerge in the beings of measureless worlds; entering in the beings of measureless worlds, they emerge in the beings of boundless buddha-lands; entering in the beings of boundless buddha-lands, they emerge in the beings of incomparable buddha-lands; entering in the beings of incomparable buddha-lands, they emerge in the beings of innumerable worlds; entering in the beings of innumerable worlds, they emerge in the beings of incalculable worlds; entering in the beings of incalculable worlds, they emerge in the beings of unthinkable worlds; entering in the beings of unthinkable worlds, they emerge in the beings of immeasurable worlds; entering in the beings of immeasurable worlds, they emerge in the beings of unspeakable worlds; entering in the beings of unspeakable worlds, they emerge in the beings of unspeakably unspeakable numbers of worlds; entering in the beings of unspeakably unspeakable numbers of worlds, they emerge in impure beings; entering in impure beings, they emerge in pure beings; entering in pure beings, they emerge in impure beings; entering in the eye, they emerge in the ear; entering in the ear, they emerge in the eye; entering in the nose, they emerge in the tongue; entering in the tongue, they emerge in the nose; entering in the body, they emerge in the mind; entering in the mind, they emerge in the body; entering in their own senses, they emerge in others’ senses; entering in others’ senses, they emerge in their own senses; entering in a single atom, they emerge in the atoms of countless worlds; entering in the atoms of countless worlds, they emerge in one atom; entering in hearers of Buddha’s voice, they emerge in self-enlightened ones; entering in self-enlightened ones, they emerge in hearers; entering in their own bodies, they emerge in the body of Buddha; entering in the body of Buddha, they emerge in their own bodies; entering in a single instant, they emerge in a hundred million eons; entering in a hundred million eons, they emerge in an instant; entering in the same instant, they emerge in different times; entering in different times, they emerge in the same instant; entering in the past, they emerge in the future; entering in the future, they emerge in the past; entering in past, present, and future, they emerge in a moment; entering in a moment, they emerge in past, present, and future; entering in True Thusness, they emerge in verbalization; entering in verbalization, they emerge in True Thusness.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'byung po'i gnod sbyin phyis non pa'i mi ni gnod sbyin gyi dbang gis lus de dang der gyur cing 'phyan te/ rang la dbang med do/ / 'byung po'i gnod sbyin de yang gzhan gyi lus kyi dbang gis 'gro ste/ bdag gi lus mi ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang nang du snyoms par zhugs shing / phyi rol las rnam par ldang ngo; ; phyi rol du snyoms par zhugs shing / nang nas rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“It is as when a man is possessed by a demon, his body trembles and he cannot relax — the demon does not show its body; it causes the body of another to be that way. In the same way, great enlightening beings in this concentration enter concentration in their own bodies and emerge in others’ bodies, enter concentration in others’ bodies and emerge in their own bodies.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ shi ba'i ro sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ni 'gro zhing rgyu'o/ / gang gi phyir yongs su bslang ba de la yang ci dga' thob par byed de/ shi ba'i ro de dang / sngags su yang gcig pa ma yin no/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dmigs pa skal ba mnyam par snyoms par zhugs shing / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i dmigs pa las rnam par ldang ngo/ / skal ba mi mnyam pa'i dmigs pa la snyoms par zhugs shing / skal ba mnyam pa'i dmigs pa las rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“It is like a corpse able to get up and act effectively through the power of a magic spell; though the corpse and the spell are distinct, yet they can join together and accomplish things. In the same way, a great enlightening being in this concentration enters concentration in the same object and emerges in a different object, enters concentration in a different object and emerges in the same object.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dge slong dbang thob pa ni gcig tu gyur cing mang por 'gyur ro/ / mang por gyur cing gcig tu 'gyur ro/ / lus gcig nas shi 'phos te/ de'i tshe lus mang po de dag tu skyes pa'ang ma yin/ lus mang po de dag las shi 'phos te/ de'i tshe lus gcig tu skyes pa yang ma yin no/ / gcig tu gyur pa las shi 'phos te/ mang por skyes pa yang ma yin/ mang por gyur pa las shi 'phos te/ gcig tu gyur pa yang ma yin no/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang lus gcig tu snyoms par zhugs shing / lus mang po las rnam par ldang ngo/ / lus mang por snyoms par zhugs shing / lus gcig las rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“It is as a monk who has attained freedom of mind may make many bodies of one body or one body of many bodies, yet it is not that one body vanishes and many bodies are born, or that many bodies vanish and one body is born. In the same way, a great enlightening being in this concentration enters concentration in one body and emerges in many bodies, enters concentration in many bodies and emerges in one body.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa gcig gi ro ni rnam pa gcig pa ste/ lo tog mang po dang / 'byung ba mang po sna tshogs su rang gi ro kun tu gtong yang / sa'i ro dus dus su rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa yang / rnam pa gcig la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam pa mang po las rnam par ldang ngo/ / rnam pa mang po la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam pa gcig las rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“Just as the flavor of soil is one while the flavors of the crops it produces are variously different, the flavors having difference even though the soil has no difference, in the same way a great enlightening being in this concentration, though free from discrimination, may enter concentration in one element and emerge in many elements, or enter concentration in many elements and emerge in one.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sems can rnams kyi khams tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ste brgyad pa'o/ /

de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rab tu bsngags pa'i chos bcus rab tu bsngags pa yin/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin nyid la mnyam par bzhag pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad khong du chud par rtogs pas sangs rgyas zhes bya/ 'jig rten thams cad la rab tu ston pas ston pa zhes bya/ chos thams cad shes par gyur pas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur pas mgon zhes bya/ chos thams cad kyi tshul rjes su rtogs pas 'dren pa zhes bya/ sems can thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kun tu phyin par byed pas rnam par 'dren pa zhes bya/ 'gro ba thams cad du snang ba'i sgron mar gyur pas snang ba zhes bya/ don grub ste bya ba byas la chos thams cad rab tu phye ba shes shing tshogs pa med pa la spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas stobs bcu mnga' ba zhes bya; chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad la dbang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya ste/

“Great enlightening beings in this concentration are lauded for ten praise-worthy qualities: they enter into True Thusness, and so are called Tathagata, those who have arrived at Thusness; they are aware of all truths, and so are called buddha, enlightened; they are praised by all worlds, and so are called teachers of truth; they know all things, and so are called omniscient; they are resorted to by all worlds, and so are called refuge; they have mastered all teaching methods, and so are called guides; they lead all beings into universal knowledge, and so are called great leaders; they are lamps for all worlds, and so are called light; their aspirations are fulfilled, they have accomplished salvation, they have done their tasks, they abide in unobstructed knowledge and individually know all things, so they are called adepts of the ten powers; they thoroughly comprehend all cycles of the Teaching, so they are called all-seers.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' de ni rab tu bsngags pa'i chos 'di bcus rab tu bsngags pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' de ni snang ba bcus snang bar byas pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snang ba dang / sems can gyi khams yang dag par blangs te rnam par brgyan cing byin gyis brlabs pa'i snang ba dang / gdul zhing byin gyis brlabs pa'i snang bas sems can thams cad kyi snang ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du ston pas mi 'jigs pa tshad med pa'i snang ba dang / chos thams cad la tha dad par byed pa med pas tha dad par byed pa med pa'i snang ba dang / chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral bar khong du chud pas tshul la 'jug pa'i snang ba dang / chos thams cad 'dod chags dang bral ba mnyam pa nyid kyis tha dad par bya ba med pa la 'jug pa'i snang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rgyun mi 'chad pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi skyabs su rnam par 'phrul pa'i snang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas mun pa shin tu bsal ba'i snang ba dang / thams cad la gnas par shin tu bstan pa la mkhas shing gzhol bas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi snang ba ste/ snang ba 'di bcus byang chub sems dpa' de snang bar byas pa yin/

“Great enlightening beings in this concentration also acquire ten kinds of illumination: they acquire the light of all buddhas because they are equal to them; they acquire the light of all worlds because they can beautify them all; they acquire the light of all beings because they go to pacify them all; they acquire the light of immeasurable expertise because they preach on the stage of the cosmos of realities; they acquire undifferentiated light because they know that phenomena have no differentiation in essence; they acquire the light of expedient means because they have realized freedom from desire for anything; they acquire the light of truth because their minds are equanimous in the realm of desirelessness; they acquire the light of mystic transfigurations pervading all worlds because they are ceaselessly empowered by the Buddha; they acquire the light of proper meditation because they reach the other shore of freedom of all buddhas; they acquire the light of True Thusness of all things because they can explain everything in a single point.

byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad du mngon par 'du bya ba med pa bcus shin tu bslabs pa yin/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i lus kyi las dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i ngag gi las dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i yid kyi las dang / dngos po med pa la gnas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / ma nyams shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i chos nyid dang / tha mi dad pa'i ye shes dang / ma skyes pa'i ye shes dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid dang / bstan pa'i tshig rab tu shes pa dang / don nyams pa med pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' de thams cad du mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i tshig bcu po 'di dag gis shin tu bslabs pa yin/

“Great enlightening beings in this concentration also attain ten kinds of nondoing: the nondoing of physical acts; the nondoing of verbal acts; the nondoing of mental acts; the nondoing of spiritual powers; the nondoing of comprehension of the essencelessness of phenomena; the nondoing of knowledge of the nondissolution of the force of actions; the nondoing of nondiscriminatory knowledge; the nondoing of knowledge of nonorigination; the nondoing of knowing things have no destruction; the nondoing of following the letter without destroying the meaning.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar na de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam pa tha dad pa'i dmigs pa rnams kyis gcig dang / mang po la snyoms par 'jug cing / rnam par ldang ba dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / skal ba mi mnyam pa dang / yangs pa dang / phra ba dang; phra ba dang / yangs pa dang / chung ba dang / che ba dang / che ba dang / chung ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / rnam par phye ba dang / rnam par phye ba dang / rjes su 'gro ba dang / lus med pa dang / lus dang bcas pa dang / lus dang bcas pa dang / lus med pa dang / rnam par ldang ba dang / snyoms par zhugs pa dang / snyoms par ma zhugs pa dang / rnam par ldang ba dang / rnam par dmigs pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam par dmigs pas ting nge 'dzin 'di ni cho 'phrul thams cad kyi yul lo; ;

“When great enlightening beings are in this concentration, the innumerable realms are variously different — entering in one, arising in many, entering in many, arising in one, entering in the same one, arising in different ones, entering in different ones, arising in the same one, entering in the subtle, arising in the gross, entering in the gross, arising in the subtle, entering in the great, arising in the small, entering in the small, arising in the great, entering in the congenial, arising in the adverse, entering in the adverse, arising in the congenial, entering incorporeally, arising corporeally, entering corporeally, arising incorporeally, entering in the formless, arising in forms, entering in forms, arising in the formless, entering in arising, arising in entering — these are all realms of freedom of this concentration.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ rig sngags can chen po'i rig sngags kyis bsgrub pa ni gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i 'byung gnas su rab tu grub par 'gyur yang / sngags de yang gzhan la/ sgyu ma'i gzugs kyi rnam par snang ba dag kyang gzhan no/ / de ltar yin yang sgyu ma'i rnam pa de dag ni sngags kyi sgra'i mthar thug pa yin te/ mig gi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i gzugs kyi rnam pa dang / sgyu ma dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i sgra dang / sgyu ma dang; sna'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i dri dang / sgyu ma dang / lce'i rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i ro dang / sgyu ma dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i reg bya dang / sgyu ma dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i sgyu ma'i rnam pa dang / sprul pa mang pos cho 'phrul zhing rnam par 'gyur pa dag kyang de bzhin no/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang skal ba mnyam par snyoms par zhugs shing / skal ba mi mnyam pa las rnam par ldang bar ston to/ / skal ba mi mnyam pa la snyoms par zhugs shing / skal ba mnyam pa las rnam par ldang bar ston to/ /

“It is as when a magician keeps repeating a spell, he can become able to cause various different forms to appear—the spell and the illusions are distinct, yet the spell can create illusions; though the spell is just a sound, yet it can produce various illusory perceptions, various forms perceived by the eye-consciousness, various sounds perceived by the ear-consciousness, various smells perceived by the nose-consciousness, various tastes perceived by the tongue-consciousness, various feelings perceived by the body-consciousness, various objects perceived by the mind-consciousness. In the same way, the enlightening being in this concentration also enters concentration in sameness and arises from concentration in difference, enters concentration in difference and arises from concentration in sameness.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha dang lha ma yin g.yul du lhags pa'i tshe/ lha rnams rgyal zhing lha ma yin pham par gyur na/ de'i tshe lha'i dbang po dpag tshad brgya'i lus mig stong dang ldan pa dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhis yongs su bskor cing / lha ma yin rnam par 'thor te/ de'i tshe lha ma yin gyi dbang po de lha ma yin gyi sgyu la shin tu mkhas pas/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i sde kun tu 'byer ba dang; rdzing bde ba 'byung ba'i drung gi khung nas lha ma yin shing rta dang / bzhon pa dang / dpung du bcas pa mang po 'byung bar ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes la gnas pa yongs su grub pa'i phyir/ tha mi dad pa'i chos la snyoms par zhugs shing / tha dad pa'i chos las rnam par ldang ba ston to/ /

“It is as when the gods of the thirty-three-fold heaven battled with the titans and the gods prevailed and the titans retreated in defeat. The king of titans was seven hundred leagues tall and was accompanied by several tens of millions of cohorts, yet by magic he led his army all at once into a hole in a lotus root. In the same way, the great enlightening being has already achieved the stage of knowledge of illusions: knowledge of illusion is the enlightening being, the enlightening being is knowledge of illusion—therefore the enlightening being can enter concentration in the undifferentiated and emerge in the differentiated, can enter concentration in the differentiated and emerge in the undifferentiated.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa bon mang po dang / 'byung ba mang po dag las sa bon sa la btab na sa bon ni 'og tu 'gro /'bras bu ni steng du 'byung ba yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud kyi tshul gcig par snyoms par zhugs shing tshul gyi rnam pa tha dad pa las rnam par ldang ba ston to/ /

“Just as when a farmer plants seeds in the fields, the seeds are below yet the fruits grow above, so also does an enlightening being in this concentration enter concentration in one and emerge in many, enter concentration in many and emerge in one.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ bud med skyes pa dang phrad par gyur ba'i khrag rdus pa las bur 'gyur te/ rdus pa de ma'i khong na gnas shing rim gyis skyes pa dang / zla ba bcu la las yongs su dag pa ni/ yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan pa dbang po tshang zhing rnam par dag par skye yang khrag rdus pa de yang gzhan/ dbang po drug rnams kyang gzhan no/ khrag rdus pa de la yang dbang po drug phra ba'i tshul du med pa ma yin te/ srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid dang ldan la las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas bskyed cing rlung dang ldan na las kyi rnam par smin pa ji lta ba bzhin du yan lag ma nyams par skye'o/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i dngos po'i tshul du snyoms par zhugs shing / dngos po med pa'i tshul las rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“It is as when the sperm and ovum unite and there is a living being conceived, at which time it is called an embryo; after this it lives in the womb for nine months, and by the power of proper actions all its limbs and organs achieve completion and its consciousness is clear. That life energy and the organs and physical form are distinct, yet by the power of action that energy can make them gradually develop and experience various consequences of similar and different types. In the same way, the great enlightening being in this concentration, from the stage of emyonic omniscience, gradually grows in faith, understanding, resolution, and power, the mind broad, effortlessly and freely entering concentration in nonbeing and emerging in being, entering concentration in being and emerging in nonbeing.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu'i gnas ni sa la rten mod kyi/ bar snang gnas la sprin kyang skyed la bar snang gnas la/ klu'i gnas dang / khyim med kyang sprin gyi char 'dod pa'i mi rnams gyen du lta zhing klu'i sprul pa bar snang gi gnas la yod pa la lta ste/ gnas 'og na 'dug kyang sprin bla na lding bar snang ngo/ / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang mtshan nyid med pa la snyoms par zhugs shing / mtshan nyid las rnam par ldang ngo/ /

“It is like the case of the palaces of water spirits, built on the earth and not in the sky; the water spirits also live in the palaces and not in the sky, yet they can create clouds spreading through the sky. The palaces that people may see when they look up you may be sure are mirages, not water-spirit palaces. Though water spirits dwell below, the clouds are spread above—in the same way, the great enlightening being in this concentration enters in formlessness and emerges amid forms, enters in forms and emerges in formlessness.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ tshangs pa yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba'i tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang chen po rnam dag phul zhes bya ba yod de/ gzhal med khang chen po de la stong gi 'jig rten thams cad snang ngo/ / stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten thams cad snang ngo/ / stong phrag brgya'i 'jig rten thams cad snang ngo/ / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lha'i gnas dang bcas pa/ klu'i gnas dang bcas pa/ gnod sbyin gyi gnas dang bcas pa/ dri za'i gnas dang bcas pa/ lha ma yin gyi gnas dang bcas pa/ nam mkha' lding gi gnas dang bcas pa/ mi'am ci'i gnas dang bcas pa/ lto 'phye chen po'i gnas dang bcas pa/ mi'i 'jig rten dang bcas pa/ ngan song gi rgyud gsum dang bcas pa/ ri rab dang bcas pa/ khor yug dang bcas pa/ rin po che'i ri dang bcas pa/ btang bzung dang bcas pa/ rgya mtsho dang bcas pa/ gling bzhi ma 'dres pa 'khor dang bcas pa/ grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / pho brang 'khor dang / rgyal po'i gnas dang bcas pa/ ri dang / brag dang / shing mang po sna tshogs dang bcas pa/ rin po che'i rgyan dang bcas pa/ sman dang / nags tshal dang / rdzing dang / lu ma'i rgyun dang / chu klung dang / chu klung chen po dang / khor yug chen po'i mthar thug pa thams cad snang ste/ de yang de tsam du zad kyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir gtogs pa las chung ngu na rdul shin tu phra ba'i gzegs ma par snang gnas la 'phyo ba lta bur phra ba dang / ra ba dang / chu klung yongs pa de dag thams cad kyang / tshangs pa'i gzhal med khang 'gro ba thams cad na phul du gyur cing / rnam par dag pa'i lhun la gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang zhing rnam par dmigs la mthong bar gyur kyang / de dag la thags thogs gang yang med do/ / de yang 'di ltar /dper na; me long gi dkyil 'khor la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gyi snang ba bzhin du gzhal med khang chen po de la thams cad kyang snang / thams cad kyang gsal/ thams cad kyang dmigs te/ thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan dmigs par yod do/ /

“It is like the case of the palace where the great Brahma-king-god of subtle light lives; called ‘pure treasury supreme of all worlds,’ in this great palace can be seen all the abodes of all the various creatures in all lands in the galaxy, as well as the natural and man-made features of those lands—even down to minute particles of dust floating in the air, all can be seen reflected in this brahma palace, like seeing one’s face in a mirror.

de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems kyi khams tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis zhing gi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so/ / sangs rgyas kyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so/ / sems can gyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi rgyud kyang rab tu shes so/ / spyod pa'i rgyud kyang rab tu sgrub bo/ / mos pa'i rgyud kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyud la yang rnam par 'phrul par byed do/ / rnam par ldang ba'i rgyud kyang yongs su ston to/ / ye shes kyi rgyud kyang rab tu 'thob bo/ / skad cig gi mtha'i rgyud la rab tu gnas so/ /

The great enlightening beings in this great concentration of the different bodies of all sentient beings know all kinds of lands, see all kinds of buddhas, liberate all kinds of beings, realize all kinds of truths, accomplish all kinds of spiritual practices, fulfill all kinds of understandings, enter all kinds of trances, produce all kinds of psychic powers, attain all kinds of knowledge, and live through all kinds of moments.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' de ni rnam par 'phrul pa bcus kyang mchog tu gyur pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa tha dad pa med pa'i mthar thug pa tha mi dad pa'i dbang dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa de bzhin nyid la zhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par 'phrul pa dmigs pa thams cad don yod cing rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu snang bar bya ba'i byin gyi rlabs can dang / sems can thams cad rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i las rnam par smin pa sgyu ma lta bu la 'jug pa dang / ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa yangs pa dang phra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma dang / ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba shes pa dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khong du chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug cing 'byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ston pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas sprul pa dang / sangs rgyas su byin gyis brlabs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo sprul pa dang / 'dul ba byin gyis brlab pa byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang rgyud du skye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra grag par bya ba rab tu sgrub pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa sems ltar mgyogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas brjod pa med pa'i bstan pa dang / ldem po dag rab tu shes te/ chos kyi sgo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par 'phrul pa dag ston par byed do/ / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyin zhag gi grangs dang / yud du yan man dang / zla ba'i grangs dang / lo dang / bskal pa'i grangs rab tu shes te/ skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi dus gsum mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par ston te/ byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa rnam par 'phrul pa bcu po 'di dag la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa yin te/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /

“Such great enlightening beings reach ten kinds of other shores of spiritual powers: they reach the other shore of spiritual powers of the buddha that extend throughout space and are present everywhere in the cosmos; they reach the other shore of enlightening beings’ ultimately nondiscriminatory free spiritual powers; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers of buddha-work able to initiate the far-reaching practical commitments of enlightening beings and enter the gate of realization of Thusness; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to shake all objects in all worlds and purify them all; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to freely know that the inconceivable results of actions of all sentient beings are all like illusory productions; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to freely know the different characteristics — crude and subtle, those in entry and emergence — of all concentrations; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to boldly enter the realm of the enlightened and therein produce great vows; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to cause buddhas to appear and teach, taming beings, causing them to be born in the family of buddhas, causing them to enter the vehicle of buddhahood and swiftly attain fulfillment; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to comprehend all the countless esoteric statements and teach in such a way as to clarify countless aspects of truth; they reach the other shore of spiritual powers able to cause the past, present, and future to appear in a single instant without depending on the numbers of days, nights, months, years, or epochs.
'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i ye shes sems can gyi khams tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ste brgyad pa'o/ /
“This is called the technical knowledge of the great enlightening beings’ eighth great concentration, the concentration of the differentiated bodies of all beings.
[9. sems can gyi khams la dbang ba]
What is great enlightening beings’ great concentration of freedom in the elemental cosmos?

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gi lus dang / mig gi skye mched nas/ yid kyi skye mched kyi mthar thug pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug ste/

“Here the great enlightening beings enter concentration in the medium of their own eyes, in the mediums of their other senses, including the medium of their own minds — this is called freedom in the elemental cosmos.

bdag gi ba spu'i khung bu re rer yang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba la snyoms par 'jug go /de'i rang bzhin gyi chos nyid kyang der byin gyis rlob ste/ de nyid nas 'jig rten yang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi chos kyang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa yang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs shing dag pas rnam par dag la 'od gsal shing rgyan bzang bo shin tu mang bas rnam pa du mar brgyan cing / rin po che bzang po sna tshogs kyis shin tu gang bar mthong ste/ de na bskal pa brgyar yang byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod cing gnas so; ; bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa khrag khrig dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong dang / bskal pa tshad med pa dang / bskal pa grangs med pa dang / bskal pa dpag tu med pa dang / bskal pa mu med pa dang / bskal pa bgrang du med pa dang / bskal pa mtha' yas pa dang / bskal pa mtshungs pa med pa dang / bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / bskal pa gzhal du med pa dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing gnas so/ /

“Enlightening beings enter this concentration in each pore of their bodies. They are spontaneously able to know all worldly beings, all worldly phenomena, and all worlds; they know ten quintillion worlds, they know incalculable numbers of worlds, they know as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-lands. They see in all worlds when buddhas emerge, congregations of enlightening beings filling them all, their radiant light clear, purely good, unalloyed, with great arrays of all kinds of treasures adorning them. Therein the enlightening beings ceaselessly cultivate enlightening practices, for an eon or a hundred eons, or a thousand eons, or a million eons, or a billion eons, or countless eons, or untold eons, or for as many eons as atoms in untold numbers of buddha-lands.

yongs su rgyun mi gcod do/ / de na de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de mnyam par bzhag pas snyoms par 'jug go /rnam par ldang ngo/ / de de ltar ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam par ldang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par bsgrub pa dag kyang rab tu spyod do/ / der yang sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par byed do/ / chos kyi dbyings khong du chud par byed do/ / dus shes par bya ba rab tu rtogs par byed do/ / chos bstan pa shin tu byin gyis rlob bo/ / chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i rgyud yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ /

“Also, they remain in this concentration through these immeasurable eons, also entering, also emerging, also perfecting worlds, also pacifying beings, also comprehending the elemental cosmos, also knowing all times, also expounding all truths, also manifesting all kinds of techniques of great spiritual powers, without attachment or obstruction.

chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang gis mig tha dad pa med pa'ang khong du chud pa yin/ rna ba tha dad pa med pa'i dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin/ sna tha dad pa med pa la mkhas par gyur pa yin/ lce tha dad pa med pa'i bslab pa yin/ lus tha dad pa med pa shin tu grub pa yin/ sems tha dad pa med pa'i rjes su song zhing khong du chud pa yin te/

“Because they have attained freedom in the elemental cosmos, they ably analyze the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and intellect — they ably analyze all manner of such distinctions, to their furthest extent.

de de lta bu'i ye shes dang ldan pas gzungs khrag khrig stong phrag bcu'i chos snang ba 'byung ngo/ / spyod pa yongs su dag pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su 'grub bo/ / dbang po thams cad mngon par shes pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu rab tu gnon to/ / mngon par shes pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / ting nge 'dzin khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su gnon to/ / rdzu 'phrul khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su 'grub bo/ / stobs khrag khrig stong phrag bcu rnam par 'phel lo/ / bsam pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / byin gyi rlabs khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yang dag par ston to/ / rnam par 'phrul pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu mngon sum du 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa med pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yang dag par 'grub bo/ / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs khrag khrig stong phrag bcus yongs su sbyor zhing kun tu 'gro'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrag khrig stong phrag bcus yongs su snang bar 'gyur ro/ / don khrag khrig stong phrag bcu shin tu ston to/ / smon lam khrag khrig stong phrag bcu dang yang dag par ldan no; ; yongs su bsngo ba khrag khrig stong phrag bcu shin tu ston to/ / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su dag par byed do/ / chos kyi sgo khrag khrig stong phrag bcu rab tu snang bar byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i bstan pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu rnam par dag par byed de;

“Once enlightening beings ably know and see in this way, they are able to produce illumination of principles in a trillion concentration formulae, accomplish a trillion purifying practices, acquire a trillion eyes, fulfill a trillion mystic powers, enter a trillion trances, perfect a trillion psychic forces, nurture a trillion powers, fulfill a trillion aspirations, operate a trillion empowerments, demonstrate a trillion mystic metamorphoses, acquire a trillion freedoms of enlightening beings, fulfill a trillion aids to the path of enlightening beings, accumulate a trillion treasuries of enlightening beings, illumine a trillion methods of enlightening beings, expound a trillion doctrines, accomplish a trillion vows, produce a trillion dedications, purify a trillion proper states of enlightening beings, comprehend a trillion teachings, reveal a trillion explanations, and cultivate a trillion purities of enlightening beings.

byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan gyi tshogs du ma dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs mtshungs pa med pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs gzhal du med pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs brjod du med pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs zad mi shes pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs kun tu mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa yin/ yon tan gyi tshogs de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' shin tu sbyangs pa yin/ yang dag par byang bar byas pa yin/ rab tu brgyan pa yin/ yongs su bzung ba yin/ yang dag par grub par byas pa yin/ yang dag par brjod pa yin/ nye bar brtan pa yin/ mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan par byas pa yin/

“These great enlightening beings also have innumerable virtues, measureless virtues, boundless virtues, incomparable virtues, uncountable virtues, incalculable virtues, unthinkable virtues, immeasurable virtues, unspeakable virtues, inexhaustible virtues. These enlightening beings have already prepared these virtues, accumulated them, arrayed them, purified them, clarified them, embodied them — they can produce them all, all are worthy of praise; they can make them endure, they have perfected them all.

byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni/ shar phyogs logs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan mthun pa'i mtshan gcig la yang rnam par brtag cing / rnam par dbye ba'i rnam pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mnga' zhing mtshan gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du mtshan re re las rnam par brtag cing / rnam par dbye ba'i rnam pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mnga' ba sha stag gis byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ /shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs dang; de bzhin du byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs dang / de bzhin du steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan rnam par dgod pa gcig tu mthun pa sha stag /byang chub sems dpa' de la byin gyis rlob pa mdzad cing zhal mngon par ston to/ /byang chub sems dpa' de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa yang byin gyis rlob pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras kyi thu bor brjod pa'i phyir lus tshad med pa yang rab tu brjod pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang rab tu bstan to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i snyan tshad med pa'ang shin tu brjod do// de bzhin gshegs pa'i shangs mi bsnyengs pa'i dgongs pa dang ldan pa yang rab tu bstan to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sras kyi thu bo'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yang yang dag par bstan to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul rjes su bsgrags pa yang rab tu bshad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub mtha' dang dbus med pa yang dag par sbyang ba mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dgongs pas rnam par dag pa'ang thob par mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo phyir mi ldog pa yang yang dag par ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor mtha' yas pa yang rnam par dmigs pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ldem po dag mtha' yas pa la'ang rab tu gzhug pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yang dag par brjod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnyam pa nyid la'ang yang dag par zhugs pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang rgyud dus kyi tshad dang mnyam pa yang rab tu brjod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa dang bye brag thams cad kyang shin tu bstan to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi byin gyi rlabs rnam par dmigs par bya ba'ang rab tu brjod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing bstan pa yang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung chos kyi sprin gyi char yang rab tu 'bebs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rnam par dmigs par bya ba yang yongs su bstan to/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yang rab tu brjod do/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor kun nas 'dus pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang rnam par dmigs pa mdzad do// sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang byin gyis brlab par mdzad do/ /chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyang yang dag par bstan to; ;chos thams cad mi 'pho zhing rgyun 'chad pa med pa yang khong du chud par mdzad do/ /chos kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba yang rab tu rdzogs par mdzad do; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan tshad med pa yang yongs su bstan to/ /ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad sbyang ba yang khong du chud par mdzad do/ /sems sgyu ma lta bu mthar thug pa med pa yang rab tu bsgrub pa mdzad do/ /

“When great enlightening beings dwell in this concentration, they are under the care of buddhas of the east, whose names are as numerous as atoms in ten thousand incalculable numbers of buddha-lands, each name also applying to as many other buddhas as there are atoms in ten thousand incalculable numbers of buddha-lands, each different—and the same is true of the buddhas of the south, west, north, the four intermediate directions, and the zenith and nadir. Those buddhas all appear before the enlightening beings and show them the pure lands of the buddhas, tell them about the infinite bodies of the buddhas, about the inconceivable eye of the buddhas, the infinite ear of the buddhas, the pure nose of the buddhas, the pure tongue of the buddhas, the nondwelling mind of the buddhas, and the unsurpassed spiritual powers of the buddhas, causing them to cultivate the unexcelled enlightenment of buddhas, to acquire the pure, clear voice of buddhas; they reveal the nonregressive teaching of the buddhas and the boundless congregations of the buddhas, causing them to enter the infinite mystery of the buddhas; they laud all the bases of goodness of the buddhas and cause them to realize the equality of all buddhas; they explain the lineage of buddhas of past, present, and future, display the boundless forms of buddhas, preach the teaching guarded by the buddhas, utter the buddhas’ subtle voice of truth, clearly discern the worlds of all buddhas, extol the meditation of all the buddhas, show the order of the assemblies of the buddhas’ audiences, preserve the buddhas’ inconceivable teaching, explain that all things are like magical productions, elucidate the inertness of the essence of all phenomena, teach the highest principles, praise the infinite virtues of the enlightened, and cause the enlightening beings to enter the clouds of all concentrations and know their minds are like illusions, like emanations, boundless and inexhaustible.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mtshan tha dad pa/ mtshan re re zhing yang rnam par dbye ba'i bye brag sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mnga' ba mtshan de dag re re'i rnam par dbye ba'i rnam grangs kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mnga' ba dag gis mtha' dang dbus med pa'i tshul du lus kyang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / chags pa med pa'i tshul du sems kyang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do; ; chos thams cad nyams pa med pa la gzhol bar dran pa'ang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / chos thams cad rtogs par khong du chud par blo gros kyang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / chos thams cad shin tu 'dzin par rig pa'ang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / chos thams cad yangs shing 'byams klas pa'i tshul du blo yang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / mngon par shes pa rnon pos chos tha mi dad pa mkhas pas khong du chud par dbang po tshad med pa'ang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / byin gyi rlabs kyis chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pa'i tshul du spyod yul thogs pa med pa yang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rnam par dag par ye shes la 'jug pa'ang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par ston par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'ang byin gyis brlab pa mdzad do/ /

“When great enlightening beings abide in this concentration of cosmic freedom, those buddhas by names as numerous as atoms in ten thousand incalculable numbers of buddha-lands from each of the ten directions, with as many buddhas as atoms in ten thousand incalculable numbers of buddha-lands in each name, simultaneously watch over the enlightening beings and enable them to acquire boundless bodies, enable them to attain unobstructed minds, enable them to attain unfailing recollection of all truths, enable them to attain certain comprehension of all truths, enable them to increase in intelligence and absorb all truths, enable them to clearly understand all truths, enable them to attain skill in spiritual capacities, with power and keenness of all faculties, cause their sphere to be boundless, extending through the cosmos unceasingly, enable them to attain unhindered knowledge, ultimately pure, and enable them to manifest attainment of buddhahood in all worlds by mystical power.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rgya mtsho'i sgo bcu la shin tu rtogs pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mthong bas rtogs pa yin/ sems can rgya mtsho ming gis khong du chud pa yin/ chos rgya mtsho ye shes kyis rab tu rtogs pa yin/ zhing rgya mtsho la dngos po med par gnas shing / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i bsam pas rjes su 'brang ba yin te/ yon tan rgya mtsho phun sum tshogs pas rab tu rtogs pa yin/ ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho rnam par dmigs pas khong du chud pa yin/ dbang po rgya mtsho rnam par phye ba la mkhas pa'i sa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa yin/ sems rgya mtsho sems can gyi ris thams cad kyi sems tha dad pa dang / sems yangs pa dang / sems tshad med pa yongs su shes pas khong du chud pa yin/ spyod pa rgya mtsho smon lam gyis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin/ smon lam rgya mtsho mtha' las brgal bar 'byung ba rnam par dag pas yongs su grub par byed pa yin te/ 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de rgya mtsho'i sgo bcu la shin tu rtogs pa rnams so/ /

“Enlightening beings in this concentration attain ten kinds of ocean: they attain the ocean of buddhas because they see them all; they attain the ocean of sentient beings because they pacify them all; they attain the ocean of truths because they can comprehend them all by wisdom; they attain the ocean of lands because they go to them all by psychic realization of essenceless, uncreated spiritual powers; they attain the ocean of virtues because they cultivate them all to perfection; they attain the ocean of spiritual powers because they are able to manifest them extensively to awaken enlightenment; they attain the ocean of faculties because they know all their various differences; they attain the ocean of minds because they know the infinite various different minds of sentient beings; they attain the ocean of practices because they can fulfill them all by willpower; they attain the ocean of vows because they cause them all to be fulfilled, eternally pure.

byang chub sems dpa' de ni mchog tu bya ba bcu 'thob pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi phul du bya ba 'thob pa yin/ lha thams cad kyi mchog tu bya ba 'thob pa yin/ tshangs pa khyu mchog thams cad kyi nang na chags pa med pa 'thob pa yin/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa 'thob pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis mi thub pa 'thob pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad dang tha mi dad pa 'thob pa yin/ lam gyi rgyud thams cad nas 'byung ba 'thob pa yin/ skye ba thams cad du dbang phyug 'thob pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dbang 'thob pa yin/ 'byung ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad la stobs dang shugs 'thob pa yin/ 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpas mchog tu bya ba bcu 'thob pa'o/ /

“Once great enlightening beings have attained to these ten oceans, they also attain ten kinds of excellence: they are foremost among all sentient beings; they are supremely outstanding among celestials; they are most powerful among Brahma-kings; they have no attachments in any world; no one in any world can overshadow them; no demons can disturb them; they can enter any state of being without hindrance; wherever they may be born, they know it is not permanent; they attain mastery of all Buddha teachings; they can manifest all spiritual powers.

byang chub sems dpa' de ni stobs bcus sems can gyi khams su nan tan byed pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i ded dpon du 'gyur ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs kyis phyir mi ldog pa dang / chags pa med pa'i stobs kyis dri ma med pa dang / zhi ba'i stobs kyis sgrib pa med pa dang / sems kyi rgyud yongs su bsgyur ba'i stobs kyis chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba dang / rang bzhin gyi chos kyi stobs kyis don gyi dbang dang / bsgribs pa med pa'i chos kyis shes rab che ba dang / mi 'jigs pa'i stobs kyis chos ston pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i stobs kyis byin gyis rlob pa'i chos nyid dang / rang byung gi stobs kyi mtha' yas pa'i ye shes rnam par ston pa ste/

“Once great enlightening beings have attained these ten kinds of excellence, they also attain ten kinds of power, cultivating practices in the realm of sentient beings: first is the power of courageous strength, because they tame worldlings; second is the power of energy, because they never backslide; third is the power of nonattachment, because they get rid of defiling obsessions; fourth is the power of silent calm, because they have no disputes about anything; fifth is the power to oppose or conform, because they are free in the midst of all things; sixth is the power of the nature of things, because they attain mastery of all truths; seventh is the power of nonobstruction, because their knowledge and wisdom is immensely vast; eighth is the power of fearlessness, because they can explain all truths; ninth is the power of intellect, because they can hold all truths; tenth is the power of revelation, because their knowledge and wisdom is boundless.

stobs chen po/ stobs 'phags pa/ stobs dpe med pa/ stobs tshad med pa/ stobs shin tu bsgrubs pa/ stobs mi g.yo ba/ stobs shin tu brtan pa/ stobs 'khrugs pa med pa/ stobs ye shes kyi blo gros can/ stobs legs par bsgrubs pa; stobs mnyam par bzhag pa/ stobs yongs su dag pa/ stobs chos kyi lus can/ stobs chos snang ba can/ stobs chos kyi sgron ma can/ stobs chos kyi tshul can/ stobs zil gyis mi non pa/ stobs shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa/ rtsal dam pa dang ldan pa'i stobs/ skyes bu dam pa'i stobs/ skyes bu dam pas bsten pa'i stobs/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs/ rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba la bsten pa'i stobs/ dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa la gnas pa'i stobs/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la zhugs pa'i stobs/ sems rtogs par bzhag pa'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba rnam par 'phel ba'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa rab tu bskyed pa'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa'i shugs shin tu 'phel bar byed pa'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi rgyu mthar phyin pa'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag par byed pa'i stobs/ byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su gnas pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i stobs/ chos la shin tu gzhol ba'i stobs/ lus la thogs pa med pa'i stobs/ thabs mkhas pa'i tshul la zhugs pa'i stobs/ chos thams cad 'od dang zhing rnam par snang ba'i stobs/ 'gro ba thams cad du g.yo ba med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs/ sems can thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs shing mi sgul ba'i stobs bcus sems can gyi khams su nan tan du byed pa ste/

“These ten kinds of power are immense powers, supreme powers, invincible powers, immeasurable powers, well-developed powers, immovable powers, enduring powers, powers of knowledge, powers of accomplishment, powers of supreme concentration, pure powers, extremely pure powers, powers of the body of reality, powers of the light of truth, powers of the lamp of the Teaching, powers of the methods of the Teaching, indestructible powers, powers of extreme strength, powers of great people, powers cultivated by good people, powers of attainment of true awareness, powers of roots of goodness accumulated in the past, powers stabilizing immeasurable roots of goodness, powers stabilizing the realization of Thusness, powers of meditation, powers enhancing the joy of enlightening beings, powers producing the pure faith of enlightening beings, powers increasing the heroism of enlightening beings, powers born of the aspiration for enlightenment, powers of enlightening beings’ pure resolve, powers of the enlightening beings’ supreme determination, powers of development of the roots of goodness of enlightening beings, powers of finding out the ultimate truth about all things, powers of the unobstructed body, powers of entry into the principles of skill in means of enlightenment, powers of the pure subtle truth, powers of stable force that cannot be upset, powers that all beings cannot overshadow.

byang chub sems dpa' de'i yon tan de ltar tshad med pa dang / chos kyi bsngags pa de ltar tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / mngon par snang bar 'gyur ro/ / 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / 'phel bar 'gyur ro/ / rab tu skyed par 'gyur ro/ / rab tu rton par 'gyur ro/ / yang dag par 'phel bar 'gyur ro; ; rnam par dag par 'gyur zhing yongs su dag par 'gyur te/

“These great enlightening beings can produce these virtuous qualities, can perfect them, fulfill them, illumine them, fully embody them, embody them everywhere, expand them, solidify them, enhance them, purify them, and purify them in all ways.

yon tan de dag la mtha' med do/ / bden pa shes pa la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i dka' ba spyod pa de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par grub pa de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba de dag la mtha' med do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i las la dbang bsgyur ba de dag gi mtha' ni bskal pa brjod du med pas kyang brjod par mi nus te/ de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' des 'thob bo/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' des 'grub bo/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' des gnon to/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de la mngon sum du dad par 'gyur ro/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de la rab tu snang ngo/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' des yongs su shes so/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i chos kyi tshul du 'byung ngo/ / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes su 'gro'o// //

“No one can tell the bounds of these enlightening beings’ virtues, knowledge, practice, teaching, freedom, austerities, accomplishments, purity, emancipation, or mastery of the Teaching. Even in unspeakably many eons no one could fully explain all the teachings that these enlightening beings have attained, have accomplished, have entered into, have actualized, have experienced, have contemplated, have realized, have purified, have comprehended, and have set up.
bam po lnga bcu brgyad pa;

ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa/ grangs med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ mu med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ dpag tu med pa; bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag la dmigs pa re re nas 'jug pas snyoms par 'jug go /rnam par ldang ngo; ;
ting nge 'dzin de dag dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin gzhal du med pa yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin shin tu yangs pa yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin la rnam par spyad pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin bstan pa yang rab tu shes so; ; ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'ang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin dben pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yang rab tu shes so/ / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'byung ba'ang rab tu shes so/ /

“Great enlightening beings in this concentration are able to thoroughly know all the infinite concentrations there are, and the sphere of each concentration, immeasurably vast, in each sphere clearly seeing entry, emergence, and abiding, with their characteristics, manifestations, realms of action, concurrent experiences, inherent natures, extinctions, and emancipations.

“They are like the palace of the great water spirit that negates the tormenting heat, from which flow four rivers that are free from turbidity and pollution and are clear as space itself. The lake there has on each of its four sides a mouth, from each of which flows a river. From the Elephant mouth flows the Ganges River; from the Lion mouth flows the Sita River; from the Ox mouth flows the Sindhu River; and from the Horse mouth flows the Vakshu River. When the four great rivers flow forth, from the mouth of the Ganges River flows silver sand; from the mouth of the Sita River flows diamond sand; from the mouth of the Sindhu River flows gold sand, and from the mouth of the Vakshu River flows lapis lazuli sand. The Ganges River mouth is silver color, the Sita River mouth is diamond color, the Sindhu River mouth is golden, and the Vakshu River mouth is the color of lapis lazuli. Each river mouth is a league wide. After emerging, each river circles the great lake seven times and then flows off in its own direction, racing like quicksilver flowing into the ocean. Between each turn of the rivers are red, blue, and white lotuses made of celestial jewels, of extraordinary fragrance and pure color, their petals, leaves, and calyxes all made of gems, spontaneously shining and reflecting each other and the Heatless Lake, fifty leagues around, its floor covered with beautiful jewel sands, adorned with all kinds of crystals, with innumerable exquisite jewels adorning its shores.

de'i dri ni tsan dan bzang po'i bsung lta bu ste/ me tog kha dog du ma can las bsung gi ngad rnam pa du ma langs pa dang ldan pa yin/ me tog ut+pa la dang / pad mo dang / ku mu da dang / puN+Da ri kas kun nas yogs pa/ rin po che'i shing me tog rab tu rgyas pas kun nas 'khor ba ste/ nam lha'i bu nyi ma 'char ba'i tshe nyi ma'i 'od zer de dag mtsho'i rin po che dang / gseg ma dang / me tog dang / chu klung gi rgyud gyi bye ma dang / dngo'i kha dang / chu klung gi g.yas phyogs su bskor ba'i mtsho dang / rin po che'i shing gi lhun dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog la bab par gyur na/ de'i tshe 'od zer re res phog kyang rin po che'i 'byung gnas sna tshogs kyi dbyings na gnas pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis kun nas yog pa lta bur snang ste/ thams cad kyang 'od kyi mdog dam pa des 'jam 'jam ltar 'dug pas mtsho chen po ma dros pa rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par snang ngo/ / mtsho chen po ma dros pa de'i 'khor na rin po che rgyan du 'khod pa/ yid du 'ong zhing chal par rgyas la rgya cher 'dal ba de dag thams cad kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bur gyur par snang ste/ rin po che dam pa sna tshogs shin tu phra ba thams cad dang / rin po che'i bye ma kun tu bdal ba dang / rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs shin tu phra ba dang / rin po che'i rdul shin tu phra ba dang / rin po che'i rdul shin tu phra ba'i bye ma de ltar phra ba dag la'ang phan tshun du gzugs brnyan snang na chung zhes dog pa'am/ che zhes yangs pa med par dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ma nor bar snang ngo/ /

The wonderful fragrance of sandalwood is everywhere; lotuses and other fine flowers fill the lake, and when the breeze stirs them, the breath of fragrance is carried afar, pervading everywhere. Flowery forests of jewel trees circle the lake, and when the sun comes out, they reflect everything in and outside the lake, joining the reflections and radiance into a network of light. Myriad things are like this — far and near, high and low, broad and narrow, coarse and fine, even down to the tiniest grain of sand and mote of dust, all being beautiful jewels, clearly mirroring lights, all reflected in the orb of the sun, and all reflecting and rereflecting each other; these reflections, neither increasing nor decreasing, neither merged nor separated, are clearly visible as though they were the original substance itself.

chu klung chen po de dag ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa las kha bzhi nas 'bab pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa bzhi'i chu klung chen po'i 'bab pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho la zhen par 'dong ngo/ /

“Just as the great lake Heatless pours forth four rivers from four mouths into the ocean, so also do great enlightening beings pour forth various practices from the four powers of understanding, ultimately to enter the ocean of omniscience.

ji ltar chu klung chen po gang+gA glang po'i kha dngul gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa nas dngul gyi bye ma 'dren cing 'bab pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' chos dkar po dag par byed pa'i sgo nas don tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul thams cad yongs su sbyong ba/ don gyi tshul thams cad shin tu dag par byed pa yang chos thams cad kyi snang ba rnam par gsal bar byed cing 'bab ste/ bsgribs pa med pa'i rgya mtsho'i mthar thug par 'gro'o/ /

Just as the great river Ganges streams silver sand from the silver Elephant mouth, so do great enlightening beings, by means of the power of understanding meanings, explain all the doctrines expounded by all the buddhas, producing all pure virtuous qualities, ultimately entering into the ocean of unobstructed knowledge.

ji ltar chu klung chen po si ta seng ge'i kha rdo rje'i kha dog tu 'dug pa nas rdo rje'i bye ma 'dren cing 'bab pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rdo rje'i tshig brjod pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la snang bar bya ba dang / ye shes kyi rdo rje'i tshig rab tu 'dren cing 'bab ste/ chags pa med pa'i rgya mtsho la zhen par 'gro'o/ /

Just as the great river Sita streams diamond sands from the diamond-colored Lion mouth, so do great enlightening beings, by means of the power of understanding doctrines, explain for all beings the adamantine sayings of the Buddha and elicit adamantine knowledge, ultimately flowing into the ocean of unobstructed knowledge.

ji ltar chu klung chen po sin+d+hu glang gi kha gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa nas gser gyi bye ma 'dren cing 'bab pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa'i tshig tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa/ sems can gyi tshogs thams cad khong du chud par byed cing 'gal ba med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa/ shin tu 'gro ba yang tshul rnam par dag pa'i yan lag gis yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul ba la rtag tu brtson par 'bab ste/ rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyi rgya mtsho la zhen par 'gro'o/ /

Just as the great river Sindhu streams forth gold sand from the golden Ox mouth, so do great enlightening beings, by means of the power of understanding of expressions, open up the understanding of beings by conditionally produced techniques in accord with the world, causing all to rejoice, taming and maturing them, to ultimately enter the ocean of conditionally originated means.

ji ltar chu klung chen po pak+Shu rta'i kha bai DUr+ya sngon po'i kha dog tu 'dug pa nas bai DUr+ya sngon po'i bye ma 'dren cing 'bab pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa yang chos brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu snang bar bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos kyi chu klung rgyun du 'bab par bya ba'i klung rab tu skyed par byed cing chos thams cad kyi rgya mtsho la gzhol bar 'bab ste/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos rgya mtsho la zhen par 'gro'o/ /

Just as the great river Vakshu streams forth lapis lazuli sands from the blue Horse mouth, so do great enlightening beings, by the power of understanding facilitating inexhaustible eloquence, shower countless teachings to refresh and enliven those who hear, ultimately to enter the ocean of the principles of buddhahood.

ji ltar chu klung chen po bzhi po de dag gis mtsho chen po ma dros pa la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ phyogs bzhi nas rgya mtsho la zhen par 'dong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang lus kyi las mthun pa dang ldan pa yin/ ngag gi las mthun pa dang ldan pa yin/ yid kyi las mthun pa dang ldan pa yin/ mthun pa'i ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang ldan pa yin/

“Just as the four great rivers enter the oceans in four directions after having circled Heatless Lake, so do great enlightening beings, accomplishing harmonious deeds, words, and thoughts, and accomplishing deeds, words, and thoughts guided by knowledge, flow in the four directions and ultimately enter the ocean of omniscience.

ji ltar de dag phyogs bzhi nas rgya mtsho chen po la zhen par 'dong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang phyogs bzhi nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho la zhen par 'gro ba yin te/ bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas rnam par dmigs pas sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba'i phyogs dang / 'di lta ste; lus kyi las nges pa dang / gzungs brjed pa med pas yongs su 'dzin pas chos thams cad snang ba'i phyogs dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas sems can thams cad dga' bar bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po'i phyogs so/ /

What is meant by the ‘four directions’ of enlightening beings? They are: seeing all buddhas and attaining enlightenment; hearing all enlightening teachings and absorbing and retaining them; fulfilling all the practices of the ways of transcendence; expounding the Teaching compassionately, satisfying sentient beings.

ji ltar chu klung chen po de dag gis lan bdun du bskor ba'i bar gyi gling rnams/ me tog ut+pa la dang / pad mo dang / ku mu da dang / puN+Da ri kas kun nas yog pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' bar ma dor 'dul bar ma gyur ba'i sems can rnams la btang snyoms su gzhog pa yang ting nge 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis kun tu khyab pa'o/ / sangs rgyas mthong bas rnam pa sna tshogs su brgyan pa'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag cing rdul med pas yid du 'ong ba'o/ /

Just as the four great rivers circle the great lake and therein blue, red, and white lotuses fill everywhere, in the same way great enlightening beings, in their determination for enlightenment, do not abandon sentient beings, but teach them in order to pacify them and enable them to fulfill incalculable concentrations and see the purity of arrays of the buddha-lands.

ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa rin po che'i shing gis yongs su 'khor ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba ston na/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gis kun nas 'khor cing brgyan pa yin/

“Just as the great lake Heatless is circled by jewel trees, so also do great enlightening beings cause the rings of adornments of the buddha-lands to appear, inspiring sentient beings to seek enlightenment.

ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa'i nang dpag tshad lnga bcu yod la dang zhing rnyog pa med pa dang gsal ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis yongs su rgyas pas dang zhing rnyog pa med la gsal ba dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa yin/

“Just as the great lake Heatless is fifty leagues in length and breadth and is clear and free from turbidity, so also is great enlightening beings’ determination for enlightenment infinite, boundless, filled with virtues, pure, clean, and without turbidity.

ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa rin po che'i pha gus brtsigs pas mtha' bskor cing / tsan dan dri zhim po'i bsung dang ldan pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sems kyang ye shes rin po che khrag khrig stong phrag bcus shin tu brgyan cing khyad par du 'phags pa'i smon lam gyi ye shes dang ldan la dge ba'i rtsa ba dri zhim po thams cad dang ldan pa'o; ;

“Just as the shores of the great lake Heatless are arrayed with countless treasures and sandalwood incense is scattered everywhere, so also are the shores of great vows of the determination for enlightenment of great enlightening beings adorned with countless treasures of the tenfold knowledge and sprinkled with the wonderful fragrance of all virtues.

ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa'i nang rin po che thams cad kyi gram bus yongs su brgyan cing / nor bu rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mdzes par gyur pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes phra bas khong du chud pa'i dran pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po ches rnam par brgyan cing / de ltar byung ba'i chos thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas la rnam par spyod pas tshul dang dus shes par bya ba thams cad la zhugs pa yin;

“Just as the floor of the great lake Heatless is spread with gold sand and arrayed with all kinds of pearls, similarly great enlightening beings’ subtle knowledge observing everywhere is arrayed with all kinds of metaphysical treasures of the inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings, attaining unobstructed illumination of all truths, abiding in the abode of all buddhas, entering into all the most profound liberative techniques of enlightening.

ji ltar klu'i rgyal po chen po ma dros pa gtse ba dang / mi bde ba thams cad las rnam par 'das pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi gtse ba dang; 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba yin te/ 'jig rten thams cad du snang bar gnas kyang 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi gos pa yin/

“Just as the chief water spirit Heatless is forever free from the torments of heat among the water spirits, in the same way great enlightening beings are forever free from the anxieties and vexations of all worlds—though they be born therein, they are not affected or attached.

ji ltar chu klung chen po bzhi po de dag gis 'dzam bu'i gling mngon par brlan cing yongs su brlan nas rgya mtsho chen po la zhen par 'dong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang ye shes kyi chu klung chen po bzhis lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa/ tshangs par bcas pa/ dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgur bcas pa mngon par brlan te/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes rgya mtsho stobs bcus rnam par brgyan pa la zhen par 'gro'o/ / bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ smon pa'i ye shes kyi chu klung 'gro ba thams cad bskyab pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad gdul ba'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro ba dang / 'di lta ste/ pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i chu klung byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pas rab tu dang ba/ sems can gyi khams thams cad la phan 'dogs shing / mi zad pa'i rgyun gyi mthar thug pas dus gsum gyi ye shes rgya mtsho la zhen par 'bab pa dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa med pa'i ye shes kyi chu klung ting nge 'dzin rin po che grangs med pas brgyan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad lta zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes rgya mtsho la zhen par 'bab pa dang / 'di lta ste/ snying rje chen po'i ye shes kyi chu klung byams pa chen po'i dbang du 'gyur ba 'gro ba thams cad nas phyir mi ldog cing 'gro ba thams cad nye bar gzung ba'i phyir/ thabs mkhas pa'i mtshams sbyor ba grangs med pas yongs su gdung ba zhi bar byed cing stobs bcu rgya mtsho la zhen par 'bab pa'o/ /

“Just as the four great rivers water the whole continent and then enter the ocean, likewise do great enlightening beings refresh celestial and human beings, ascetics and priests, with four rivers of knowledge, causing them to enter the great ocean of knowledge of unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment, adorned with four kinds of power. What are the four? First is the river of the knowledge of vows, rescuing and pacifying all sentient beings, never ceasing; second is the river of knowledge of transcendent ways, cultivating enlightening practices for the benefit of sentient beings, continuing past, future, and present, without end, ultimately entering the ocean of knowledge of the buddhas; third is the river of knowledge of concentrations of enlightening beings, arrayed with countless concentrations, perceiving all buddhas, entering the ocean of buddhas; fourth is the river of knowledge of great compassion, with great universal compassion, autonomous, saving sentient beings everywhere, caring for them by appropriate means, ceaselessly, cultivating the way of esoteric virtues, ultimately entering the ocean of the ten powers.

ji ltar chu klung chen po bzhi po de dag mtsho chen po ma dros pa nas mi zad pa'i rgya mtsho la zhen par 'dong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang khyad par du 'phags pa'i smon lam dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zad mi shes pa'i mthar thug par 'gro zhing rnam par 'tshang rgya bar rnam par rol pas rnam par 'tshang rgya ba yin/
