“Just as the four great rivers emerge from the lake Heatless, and having streamed forth are ultimately inexhaustible and enter the ocean, similarly great enlightening beings cultivate enlightening practice by the power of great vows, their independent knowledge and insight inexhaustible, ultimately entering the ocean of omniscience.

ji ltar chu klung chen po bzhi po de dag rgya mtsho chen po zhen par 'dong zhing phyir mi ldog pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gyi rgyun ma chad par byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam la rab tu brtson pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par bsgrub pa las phyir mi ldog cing / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa dang / chags pa med pa la gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho zhen par 'gro'o/ /

“Just as nothing can prevent the four great rivers from entering the ocean, similarly great enlightening beings always diligently carry out the practical vows of universal good, perfect the light of all knowledge and wisdom, abide in the way of enlightenment of all buddhas, and enter the knowledge of those who realize Thusness, without any hindrance.

ji ltar chu klung chen po bzhi po de dag bskal par gnas shing skyo ba dang / yongs su skyo ba med par rgya mtsho la zhen par 'dong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang phyi ma'i mtha' mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pas yongs su mi skyo bar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes rgya mtshor rgyun ma chad par rjes su gzhol zhing zhen par 'gro ba yin/

“Just as the four great rivers rush into the ocean, never tiring eon after eon, similarly enlightening beings carry out the deeds of enlightening beings forever by the practical vows of universal good, entering the ocean of realization of Thusness, never giving rise to weariness.

ji ltar mtsho chen po ma dros pa de rin po che sna tshogs kyi mdog ltar 'dug cing / dngul gyi bye ma'i mdog tu snang ba dang / gser gyi bye ma'i mdog tu snang ba dang / rdo rje'i bye ma'i mdog tu snang ba dang / bai DUr+ya'i bye ma'i mdog tu snang ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis phog na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i gzugs su mngon zhing snang ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer dang phrad na mtsho chen po ma dros pa de dmigs pa thams cad kyi gzugs su gyur par snang yang lus kyi gzugs su snang ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rnam pa snang bar gyur pa de dag gcig gis gcig bdo zhing phan tshun du gnod par 'gyur ba med do// de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pas rang gi lus kyi ba spu'i khung bu re rer yang de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu mthong ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang mthong ngo/ / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du'ang 'jug go /chos bstan pa'ang nyan to/ /de dag thams cad kyang mnyes par byed do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshad med pa la'ang yid ches shing / khong du chud par byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing / chos nyan pas kyang bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bye ba khrag khrig 'da' bar byed kyang yun ring po'i 'du shes kyang mi skye/ yun thung ngu'i 'du shes kyang mi skye'o/ / ba spu'i bu ga de dag tu'ang de'i lus la mi bde pa med cing / 'jig rten gyi khams de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa de dag dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag dang / sems can gyi khams sna tshogs 'khod pa de dag la'ang gnod pa med do/ /

“Just as when the sun comes out, the golden, silver, diamond, and lapis lazuli sands in Heatless Lake, as well as all the other jewels and treasures, are imbued with sunlight and reflect the golden sands and other treasures, each reflection also containing reflections of all the others, everything mutually reflecting and rereflecting ad infinitum without obstruction, so is the experience of enlightening beings in this concentration: in each pore of their own bodies they see as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and also see those buddhas’ lands, enlightenment sites, and audiences; they listen to the teaching of each buddha, absorb and retain it, believe and understand it, and pay honor for untold billions of eons each, without any notion of length or brevity of time; also, those audiences are not cramped therein.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa de/ sems shin tu phra bas mtha' dang dbus med pa/ las kyi rnam par smin pa/ dpe med pa'i tshul la 'jug pa/ ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul rtogs par gnas pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul rnam par sgrub pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa tshad med pa bsgrub par dka' ba/ bzod par dka' ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su 'dzin pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug pas skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro/ /

Why? Because with a subtle mind they enter into boundless realms of the cosmos, because they enter into peerless fruits of distinct actions, because they enter the sphere of inconceivable concentration, because they enter the sphere of inconceivable meditation, because they enter the sphere of fluidity of all buddhas, because they gain the protection of all buddhas, because they have acquired the great miraculous capacities of all buddhas, because they have attained the ten powers of enlightened ones, which are difficult to attain and difficult to know, because they have entered the realm of fulfillment of the practical undertakings of universally good enlightening beings, and because they have attained the indefatigable spiritual power of all buddhas.

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de sems skad cig la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam par ldang yang yun ring po yang 'jig par mi byed/ mngon par zhen par yang mi ltung / dmigs pa thams cad la'ang gnas pa med /de dngos po thams cad la yang mi gnas so/ / skad cig gi rgyud la yang rab tu 'jug go /sems can gyi don yang yang dag par sgrub bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba mthong bas kyang ngoms par mi byed do; ; chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar dbyung bas kyang sgyid lug par mi byed de/ de la gzhag par bya ba yang gang yang med do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrubs ba'i rjes su yang rab tu 'jug go /ye shes kyi sbrul pa yang byin gyis rlob bo/ / sems can gyi ris la 'jug par yang mtha' dang dbus med par 'jug go /'jug rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pas rab tu shes so/ / rtog pa'i sa thams cad las kyang yongs su 'da'o/ / mtshan ma sna tshogs yongs su shes pa yang mi spong ngo/ / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang thabs la mkhas pa yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / shin tu rnam par dag pa la'ang rtog par mi byed do/ / thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i sa yang rab tu 'thob par byed do/ /

“Though great enlightening beings can enter and leave concentration instantly, still they don’t give it up; even though remaining in concentration for a long time, they still have no attachment. Though they do not dwell on any object, yet they do not abandon all points of attention. Though they can enter into the realm of a single instant, yet to benefit all beings they manifest enlightening spiritual powers tirelessly. Though they enter equally into all phenomenal realms, they do not apprehend their boundaries; though they have no abode and no location, yet they are always proceeding into the path of all-knowledge. By the power of mystical projection they enter everywhere into countless groups of beings and fully adorn all worlds. Though they are free from the erroneous conceptions of the world and are beyond the realm of all discriminations, yet they do not abandon forms in all their variety. Though they are capable of fully equipping themselves with expedient skills, yet they are ultimately pure. Though they do not distinguish the various stages of enlightenment, yet they have already entered them all.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'ang yin la/ dngos po thams cad las kyang rnam par 'das pa'o/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'ang rgyu la/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las kyang rnam par 'das pa yin/ sems can gyi khams yongs su dgrol ba la'ang brtson la/ sems can gyi 'du shes thams cad kyang med pa yin/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyang ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur la/ chos thams cad kyis snyems pa'i sems kyang med pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad blta bas kyang mi ngoms la/ sangs rgyas thams cad la blta ba'i gnas kyang yongs su bsal ba yin/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad la mkhas par bya ba'ang khong du chud la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid khong du chud pas chags pa yang med pa yin/ chos kyi tshig rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa'i spobs pa dang yang ldan la/ tshig med cing yi ge med pa yang khong du chud pa yin/ brjod du med pa la yang shin tu spyod la/ dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa dang yang ldan pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi yang mthar phyin la/ gzugs sna tshogs kyis 'dul ba rnams kyang yul du byed pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mthar yang rab tu thug la/ snying rje chen pos sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su dgrol zhing gdul ba la yang rab tu brtson pa yin/ sems can gyi khams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa yang rab tu shes la/ chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab pa khong du chud pa las kyang mi g.yo ba yin/ 'gro ba thams cad gdul ba yang rgyun mi gcod la/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par khong du chud pa yin/ chos rnam pa sna tshogs la'ang rnam par mi rtog la/ bstan pa sna tshogs la 'jigs pa med pas chos bstan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo yang rgyun mi 'chad pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /

Just as space, though containing all things, is apart from existence and nonexistence, in the same way, great enlightening beings, though entering all worldly realms, are free from conceptions of the world. Though they strive to liberate all beings, yet they are free from conceptions of beings. Though they have profound knowledge of all phenomena, yet they are free from conceptions of phenomena. Though they enjoy seeing all buddhas, yet they are free from conceptions of buddhas. Though they skillfully enter various concentrations, yet they know all things are inherently thus, and have no attachment. Though they expound inexhaustible statements of the Teaching with boundless intelligence, yet their minds always dwell on the truth beyond words. Though they enjoy contemplating the wordless teaching, yet they always manifest pure voices. Though they abide in the realm of all things beyond words, yet they always manifest various forms. Though they teach beings, yet they know all things are ultimately inherently empty. Though they diligently cultivate universal compassion and liberate beings, they know the realm of sentient beings is inexhaustible and has no dissolution. Though they realize the realm of reality is everlasting and invariable, yet they ceaselessly guide beings by reading their minds and giving them appropriate instruction. Though they always rest in the abode of the enlightened, yet they always ceaselessly turn the wheel of the Teaching, analytically expounding all kinds of truths with purity of knowledge and unhesitating expertise.
'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i ye shes chos kyi dbyings la dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ste dgu pa'o/ /
“This is the technical knowledge of the great enlightening beings’ ninth great concentration, the concentration of freedom in the elemental cosmos.
[10. byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa rab tu thob pa bcu pa chags pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor]
What is the great enlightening beings’ unimpeded wheel concentration?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po la mkhas pa'i ye shes bcu pa gang zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chags pa med cing / dri ma med pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa ste/ ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe/ lus kyi las chags pa med par yang dag par gnas so/ / ngag gi las chags pa med par yang dag par gnas so/ / yid kyi las chags pa med par yang dag par gnas so/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mnyam pa nyid chags pa med par yang dag par gnas so/ / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ye shes chags pa med pa la yang dag par 'jug go /sems can 'dul ba'i ye shes chags pa med par yang dag par gnas so/ / 'od zer kun tu dgye ba chags pa med pa rab tu 'gyed do/ / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor chags pa med pa rab tu gtong ngo/ / sprul pa mang po chags pa med pa rab tu 'gyed do/ / chos kyi 'khor lo chags pa med pa rab tu bskor ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'ang rab tu 'thob par byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi stobs rnams la yang yang dag par 'jug go /sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyang rab tu 'thob par byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi bzhengs pas rnam par ldang ngo/ / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba snang bas nye bar spyod do/ /

“When great enlightening beings enter this concentration, they abide in unobstructed physical, verbal, and mental action, live in buddha-lands free from obstruction, attain unobstructed knowledge of how to develop and perfect beings, acquire unobstructed knowledge of how to tame beings, radiate unobstructed light, cause networks of unobstructed light beams to appear, demonstrate unobstructed miracles on a vast scale, turn the unobstructed wheel of the pure Teaching, and attain the unobstructed freedom of enlightening beings. They enter into the powers of buddhas, abide in the knowledges of buddhas, perform the deeds of buddhas, purify what buddhas purify, manifest the spiritual powers of buddhas, gladden the buddhas, carry out actions of buddhas, abide in the path of buddhas, associate with innumerable buddhas, perform the works of buddhas, and succeed to the lineage of buddhas.

byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i tshe/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu rtog go /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su blta'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid khong du chud par byed do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs par byed do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs par byed do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu lta'o; ; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rjes su blta'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam par lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i smon lam chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khong du chud pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs chen po dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyun chen po yongs su mi gcod do/ / ldog par mi byed do/ / skyo bar mi byed do/ / gtong bar mi byed do/ / 'gyed par mi byed do/ / sgyid lug par mi byed do/ / gzhog par mi byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyun mthar phyin par mi byed do/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos la smon lam chen pos rab tu grub pa dang / yang dag par 'jug pa'i 'byung gnas chen po dang / 'jigs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya mtsho chen po shin tu bslabs pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir ro/ / thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes snang ba la shin tu bslabs pa'i phyir ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro/ / sems can thams cad kyi gtso bos byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro/ / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs rje chen po'i rjes su snyegs pa'i phyir ro/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos 'gyur ba med pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Once great enlightening beings are in this concentration, they investigate omniscience, contemplating it in general and in particulars; they accord with omniscience, reveal omniscience, concentrate on omniscience, see omniscience, see omniscience as a whole, and see omniscience in particulars. They forever advance and constantly continue the great vow, great will, great practice, great aim, great experience, great light, great manifestation, great care, great miracle, and great path of the Universally Good enlightening being, without interruption, without retreating, without stopping, without changing, without wearying, without giving up, without distraction, without confusion.
Why? These great enlightening beings, in the midst of all things, accomplish great undertakings, activate the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, and enter into the ocean of enlightening techniques of the Buddha teaching; by means of extraordinary willpower they illumine the practices carried out by enlightening beings with their knowledge and wisdom, and achieve skill in all of them; they fully accomplish enlightening beings’ spiritual powers and miracles; they are able care for and guard living beings, as do all the buddhas of past, future, and present; they always arouse great compassion for all living beings, and they attain the unchanging truth of the realization of Thusness.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi la la zhig gis nor bu rin po che sna tshogs tshon gyis bsgyur pa'i gos kyi steng du bzhag na/ nor bu rin po che de yang khong nas tshon gyis gyur par snang ste/ nor bu rin po che'i rang bzhin ni 'gyur ba med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ting nge 'dzin rin po che thob pa'i ye shes kyi sgos thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yongs su lta zhing / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'ang rgyun mi gcod do/ / ji ltar nor bu rin po che de kha dog thams cad ston kyang nor bu'i rang bzhin yongs su mi spong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan can yongs su mi spong ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro/ / 'gro ba thams cad dgrol bar smon pa'i phyir ro/ / sangs rgyas thams cad mnyes par byed pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir ro/ / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par sbyong bas sgyid lug pa med pa'i phyir ro/ / 'gro ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad par spyod pas skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro/ / chos rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med cing tshad med pas yongs su yi 'chad pa med pa'i phyir ro/ / sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i dmigs pas rnam par 'phel ba thams cad ston pa'i las phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro/ / 'gro ba thams cad la rim gro bya bas snyoms pa med cing sgyid lug pa med pa'i phyir ro/ / 'gro ba thams cad snang bar bya bas skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro/ / chos kyi sgo mtha' yas pa la 'jug pa las phyir mi ldog cing yongs su skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Just as when someone puts a clear crystal on a colored robe, the crystal assumes the color of the robe without losing its own nature, in the same way great enlightening beings, perfecting knowledge and wisdom as the jewel of the mind, observe all-knowledge and all appears clearly, yet they do not abandon the practices of enlightening beings.
Why? Great enlightening beings undertake great vows to benefit all beings, to liberate all beings, to serve all buddhas, to purify all worlds, to comfort all beings; they enter deeply into the ocean of truth, and to purify the realm of sentient beings they manifest great mastery, provide for sentient beings, illumine the world, and enter the boundless gate of teaching by phanton emanations, without backsliding or growing wearied.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su 'dzin cing rten kyang ngal ba med cing dub pa med la nyam chung bar mi 'gyur zhing / rga bar mi 'gyur/ 'jig par mi 'gyur/ 'gyes par mi 'gyur/ byang bar mi 'gyur/ rnam pa tha dad par mi 'gyur/ rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur/ dngos po gzhan du mi 'gyur/ rang bzhin rnam par mi spong ngo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyang phyir ro/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang smon lam chen po rgya che zhing yangs la tshad med pa dang ldan pas/ sems can thams cad dgrol ba la nye bar gnas pa'i sgos skyo zhing dub pa'i sems mi skyed do/ /

“Just as space holds myriad worlds, be they in the process of becoming or subsisting, without aversion or weariness, without wearing out or perishing, without dissolving or breaking down, without changing or varying, without differentiation, not giving up its own nature, because the inherent nature of space is to be thus, in the same way, great enlightening beings establish infinite great vows to liberate all sentient beings, without their minds wearying.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ mya ngan las 'das pa ni dus gsum gyi sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa de snyed cig yongs su mya ngan las zlo yang bar 'ga' tsam yang skyo ba med cing sgyid lug pa med de/ yongs su yi chad pa med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi dben pa nyid de/ de bas na gang las kyang phyir nur bar bya ba med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad gdon pa'i phyir/ 'jig rten du skyes pas sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba la skyo ba'i sems mi skyed do/ /

“Just as infinite beings past, future, and present pass away into nirvana without its ever rejecting or wearying, because the essential purity of all phenomena is called nirvana, in the same way, great enlightening beings appear in the world because they want to liberate all beings and enable them to be emancipated — how could they become wearied in mind?

'di lta ste/ dper na/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' de snyed cig byang chub kyi don du gnas kyang skyo ba dub pa med de/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi mnga' bsgyur ba la bsgrubs so/ / sgrub bo/ / bsgrub par 'gyur ro/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni zad pa med pa'i chos nyid thob pa'i phyir te/ de las gzhan du 'gyur ba med cing / 'dul ba'i chos la mngon par chags pa med pas phyir nur ba med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mang po bdag gis thob par byed cing khong du chud par byed do/ /

“Just as universal knowledge, omniscience, can enable all enlightening beings of all times to be born in the family of buddhas, and eventually enable them to attain supreme enlightenment, without ever tiring, because omniscience is none other than the cosmos of realities and is not attached to anything at all, in the same way, great enlightening beings’ minds abide equanimously in universal knowledge — how could they have any weariness of mind?

de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de'i ting nge 'dzin de ni/ 'od phyogs thams cad kyi mthas klas par 'dal ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'od zer thogs pa med pa/ yon tan sna tshogs du ma'i snying po can gos brjod du med pa yongs su 'byung ba; rin po che brjod du med pa yongs su 'byung ba/ spos brjod du med pa yongs su 'byung ba/ rgyan dang lhab lhub du ma dang ldan pa/ gser gyi dra ba rgya chen pos kun nas yogs pa / dril bu'i dra ba'i sgra kun nas 'byung ba/ blta na bzang zhing yid du 'ong ba rin po che sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i mdzod dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs mang po ston pas dag cing bzang po spyod pa/ gnas shin tu bstan pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo ston pa'i yon tan can/ de bzhin gshegs pa mang pos byin gyis brlabs pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba dag pa thams cad kyis yang dag par byung bas rnam par snang ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpal gyi byin dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs las byung ba/ lus gcig tu gnas kyang phyogs bcu brjod du med cing / tshad med par byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i go 'phang dang / yon tan tshad med pa grangs med pa brgya stong rnam par dag pa/ phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mthun zhing gnas su gyur pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mthun zhing gnas su gyur pas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snang ba 'byung bar byed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi phyag bya zhing mdun du bya bar 'os pa/ chos nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i mthun pa'i 'bras bu sprul pa kun tu 'gyed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dpe dang dpe med pa'i yon tan can te/

“These great enlightening beings have a lotus blossom that is as vast as the whole extent of the ten directions, adorned with untold numbers of petals, jewels, and fragrances. Those untold numbers of jewels each also reflect all kinds of jewels, pure, exquisite, extremely fine, resting on the blossom, emanating light beams of many colors, illumining all worlds of the ten directions without obstruction. Webs of pure gold cover it, while jewel chimes gently swaying produce subtle tones that bespeak the elements of omniscience. This great lotus blossom incorporates the pure adornments of those who realize Thusness, produced by all foundations of goodness, with an auspicious sign as its emblem, manifested by spiritual power, with myriad infinities of pure qualities, perfected by the wondrous path of enlightening beings, flowing forth from the omniscient mind; the reflections of the buddhas of the ten directions appear in it, and the worlds gaze on it as on a monument of Buddha, and all beings who see it bow in respect. It is born of the true teaching of ability to comprehend illusion and is actually beyond any worldly comparison.

de la gnas pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' skyil mo krung gcig tu gnas shing / de'i bdag nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par byang chub sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gcig gis yongs su khyab par 'gyur te/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa ste de ltar gnas pa'i tshe ba spu'i khung bu gcig nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'od zer 'byung ste/ ba spu'i khung bu gcig nas ji lta ba de bzhin du ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas kyang 'od zer gyi sgo de snyed de snyed 'byung ngo/ / 'od zer gyi sgo de dag re re las kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i snying po can kha dog du mar snang ba/ rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ yon tan gyi rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i dra ba rgya chen pos kun nas khebs pa/ me tog gi dra ba rgya chen pos yongs su khebs pa/ spos rin po che khrag khrig brgya stong kun tu gtong ba/ rin po che'i rgyan yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs kyi snying po can/ rin po che'i gdugs bsam gyis mi khyab pas bkab pa 'byung ste/ rin po che de dag re re las kyang khang pa brtsegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / khang pa brtsegs pa de dag re re las kyang seng ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / seng ge'i khri pad+mo'i snying po can de dag re re las kyang 'od sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / 'od de dag re re las kyang kha dog sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / kha dog de dag re re las kyang snang ba'i dkyil 'khor sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / snang ba'i dkyil 'khor de dag re re las kyang nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba sna tshogs kyi me tog sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / me tog de dag re re las kyang rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / rgyan de dag re re las kyang khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung ngo/ / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de dag re re las kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi char rab tu 'bab bo/ / chos kyi tshig rnam par phye ba'i char de dag las kyang chos khong du chud par bya bar mdo'i tshul sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig rgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su brjod do/ / mdo'i tshul yongs su brjod pa de dag re re las kyang chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu ston to/ / chos kyi sgo rab tu bstan pa de dag re re zhing yang ye shes rdo rje lta bus gtan la phebs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo/ chos kyi rnam grangs sna tshogs dang ldan pa bstan pa rgya chen po can/ chos kyi tshig rnam pa tha dad pa dang ldan par 'khor ba/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu bskor ro// chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de dag re re zhing yang sems can gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su smin par byed do/ / sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya ba 'byams klas pa de dag re re zhing yang sems can gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed sangs rgyas kyi chos la 'dul te/

“When an enlightening being sits on this blossom, the size of the enlightening being’s body corresponds to the blossom. The miraculous empowerment of all buddhas causes each pore of the enlightening being’s body to emanate rays of light as numerous as atoms in untold billions of buddha-lands, each ray of light revealing jewels as numerous as atoms in untold billions of buddha-lands. Those jewels are all called treasuries of universal light and are adorned with various colors and characteristics, made of infinite virtues. Nets of jewels and flowers cover them above, scattering billions of superb fragrances. The arrays of innumerable various colors and forms also manifest ornamental canopies of inconceivable arrays of jewels. Each jewel reflects pavilions as numerous as atoms in untold billions of buddha-lands, and each pavilion reveals as many lion thrones, each lion throne manifesting as many light beams, each light beam showing as many colors, each color showing as many orbs of light, each orb of light showing as many radiant jewel flowers, each flower showing as many pedestals, on each pedestal there appearing as many buddhas, each buddha displaying as many miracles, each miracle purifying as many congregations, with as many freedoms of buddhahood appearing in each congregation, each freedom showing as many Buddha teachings, each Buddha teaching having as many scriptures, each scripture expounding as many doctrines, each doctrine having as many spheres of truth penetrated by adamantine knowledge, different words each explaining each sphere of truth, maturing as many realms of sentient beings as atoms in untold billions of buddha-lands, each realm having as many beings as atoms in untold billions of buddha-lands achieving peace in the Buddha teaching.

de ltar snyoms par zhugs shing rnam par 'phrul pa rgya chen po ston pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi yul zil gyis mi non pa sprul pa'i sgyu ma sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa med pa/ rang bzhin tshad med pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa/ brjod du med pa dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings rdul med pa'i rang bzhin can/ yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid can/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la spyod pa/ chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa/ gnas med pa/ len pa med pa/ rtsa ba med pa/ zab pa/ gting dpag dka' ba/ mngon sum du khong du chud pas rab tu rtog pa/ tshad med pa/ rmongs pa med pa/ gzhi med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas gzhi med pa dang ldan pa/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu can; sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rjes su snyegs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshe gcig pa'i mngon sum du gyur pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i mig rdul med pa dang ldan pa/ shes rab kyi mig kun tu spyod pa can/ sha'i mig rdul dang bral zhing rdul med par yang dag par skyes pa/ sangs rgyas kyi spyan kun tu snang ba can/ ye shes kyi mig ces bya ba'i don gyi yul dang / rnam pa rab tu ston pa can chos kyi sgo 'byed pa'i skyes bu dam pa yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems yongs su rdzogs pa/ yul la thogs pa med pa/ ye shes kyi rnam pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa/ 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa/ skye ba med pa yang dag par byung ba/ rnam par 'phrul pas skye ba kun tu ston pa/ byin gyi rlabs mi yul la mkhas pa/ yon tan mchog gis rnam par dag pa/ bsam pa 'od gsal ba'i snying po can/ mos pa shin tu dag pas ye shes nam mkha'i dbyings kun nas khebs pa dang ldan pa/ 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis blta bar 'os pa/ smon lam mngon du gyur pa/ 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs pa/ yon tan bsngags pa zad mi shes pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi lhag mthong gi mdzod du gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi 'byung gnas rgya mtshor gyur pa ye shes rin po che thams cad kyis shin tu brgyan pa/ ye shes kyi skyes bu puN+Da ri kar byung ba; sems can gyi don mtha' dang dbus med par rab tu sgrub pa/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mu med pa la zhugs pa'i 'od zer gyis snang bar gyur pa/ ye shes kyi 'od yongs su snang ba; chos rnam par dag pa snang bas kun tu spyod pa/ shin tu dben pa'i sgor gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la thogs pa med par dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi thabs dang ldan pa/ yon tan gyi spyod pa las byung ba/ skyes bu dam pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshul rab tu shes pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bcun spu la rab tu gnas pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par dgongs pas rab tu zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku'i byin dang / snying po can/ dran pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rtse gcig tu gyur pa/ dmigs pa med pa'i yul dang mtshan ma ston pa/ shin tu yangs pa las yang dag par byung ba'i rgyud can/ chags pa med pa'i spyod yul du khong du chud pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis byang chub tshad med pa nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs shing sa mtshams med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis 'jig rten thams cad du sems can gyi don byed pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rgyu mthun pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i yul rnam par non pa/ dag cing drag shul che ba'i ye shes kyis grub pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa dang yang dag par 'grogs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rigs dag par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad kyis kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshul shin tu phra ba'i thabs shes pa/ rtogs pa rdo rje lta bu'i stobs dang mthus byung ba/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rtogs par gyur pa/
sems can gyis thos par dka' ba/ mi gnyis pa'i sgor zhugs pa/ chos kyi tshul mtshan nyid med pa la gzhol ba/ mtshan ma'i rgyud kyis chos ston pa thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa/ sems can bsam pa bzhin du 'dul ba yang dag par ston pa/ dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba tshim par byed pa/ chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin can ye shes mi zad pa'i yul shin tu non pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen pos byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid thub pa med pa rab tu thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'i yon tan la 'jug pa thams cad kyi mtha'i rjes su 'gro ba rnam par phye ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ chos kyi rnam grangs yongs su ston pa/ zhing thams cad rnam par dmigs par bya ba la rab tu gzhol ba/ zhing dag par bya par dgang ba thams cad kyi rgyan du gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba thams cad yang dag par ston pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas kyis byung ba/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang; da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rab tu brjod pa/ 'jig rten thams cad la rnam par lta ba/ dge ba mtha' dang mu med pas yang dag par byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi rtsom pa thams cad las rnam par 'das pa/ sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa shin tu byung ba/ mtshungs pa med pa dang 'dra ba med pa'i dbang gis shes par gyur pa; mkhas pas khong du chud pa/ skyes bu dam pas yang dag par bsu ba/ ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rgyud yongs su 'dzin pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byung ba/ lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas 'bras bu yongs su grub pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pa che ba nyid la gnas pa rab tu thob pa/ mnyam pa dang bstan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thob par bya ba rab tu thob pa/ chos thams cad la chags pa med par gnas pa'i mtha'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa/ g.yo ba med par kun tu spyod pa; rlom sems thams cad rnam par 'jig pa/ g.yo ba thams cad las yang dag par langs pa/ chos la gnas pas ye shes rnam par snang ba dang ldan pa/ mun pa med pa la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la yang dag par zhugs pas snang ba thob pa/ 'gags pa med par srid pa thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa/ srid pa thams cad khong du chud pa/ 'dus byas thams cad yul du gyur pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa dang ldan pa/ mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo nyid can/ lus kyi las mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa/ ngag gis las mu med pa dang ldan pa/ yid kyi las mtha' dang dbus med pa dang ldan pa/

“Great enlightening beings in this concentration, causing infinite emanations of such miraculous scenes to appear, know they are all like mirages and are not obsessed by them or attached to them. They abide in the unimpeded realm of extremelessness, the unspeakable reality, inherent purity, the realm of reality, the true form, the nature of realization of thusness, which has no coming or going, which is not before or after, is infinitely profound, is realized by direct experience and spontaneously entered by knowledge and not understood from another. Their minds are free from confusion and discriminatory conceptualization; they are lauded by all buddhas; they flow forth from the power of the buddhas and enter into the realm of all buddhas; they directly witness essential nature as it really is with pure eyes, and see everywhere with the eye of wisdom; they develop the enlightened eye and become bright lamps for the world; they course in the realm known to the eye of knowledge and are able to widely expound subtle truths. They develop the will for enlightenment and head for the highest humanity. They are not obstructed by any objects. They enter the seed nature of knowledge and produce all kinds of knowledge. They are detached from worldly things, yet they appear to live in the world, transforming beings through spiritual powers and taming them by appropriate means. They are skilled in all such matters. Their virtues, understanding, and will are all thoroughly pure, extremely refined and thoroughly developed. Their knowledge and wisdom are vast as space, and they are adept at observing the realms of the sages. Their faith, practice, and willpower are firm and steadfast, immovable. Their virtues are inexhaustible, admired by the world. In the ocean of omniscience, the place of great enlightenment, the treasury watched by all buddhas, they collect myriad sublime jewels and become great sages. Just like lotus blossoms, they are inherently pure and clean, a delight and benefit to all who see them. The light of their knowledge illumines everywhere, and they see infinite buddhas and clarify all truths. Their actions are dispassionate and calm, and they are ultimately without impediment in realization of the teaching of buddhas. By means of appropriate techniques they always live by the virtuous action of enlightenment, in which they are born. They embody the knowledge of enlightening beings and are leaders of enlightening beings, protected by all the buddhas together. They attain the spiritual force of buddhas and develop the spiritual body of buddhas. Their mental powers are inconceivable; they are one-pointed on the objective realm, yet objectless. Their activity is far-reaching, signless, unimpeded, infinite as the cosmos. The enlightenment they realize is like space, boundless, without binding attachment. They work for the universal weal of all in the world, flowing from the foundations of goodness of the ocean of omniscience. They are able to comprehend infinite objective realms. They have perfected the practice of pure generosity, live by the heart of enlightening, purify the seed of enlightening beings, and are able accordingly to give birth to the enlightenment of the buddhas. They are well versed in all the Buddha teachings and can employ them skillfully; they embody their subtle practices and achieve stable, enduring power.
“The autonomous spiritual powers of all buddhas, which sentient beings can hardly hear of, the enlightening beings know entirely; they enter the gate of nonduality, abide in the formless truth, and though they have forever relinquished all forms, they are able to explain extensively all kinds of things according to the mentalities, inclinations, and understandings of sentient beings, pacifying and satisfying them. The cosmos is their body; they are free from discriminatory thinking; the sphere of their knowledge is inexhaustible. Their will is always powerful; their mind is always equanimous. They see the extent of the virtues of all buddhas. They know the differences and order of all ages.
“They expose all truths, live peacefully in all lands, beautify all buddha-lands, manifest the light of all true principles, and expound the teachings of all buddhas of past, future, and present. They point out the dwelling places of the enlightening beings, serve as lamps illumining the world, produce all roots of goodness, eternally detach from the world, and are forever born where the buddhas are. They acquire the knowledge and wisdom of buddhas, which is supreme: they are in the care of all the buddhas and have already entered the ranks of buddhas of the future. They grow from association with good companions, and whatever they set their wills on bears fruit. They have great power and abide in lofty determination and are able to explain whatever they hear.
“Also, to show the roots of goodness of hearing the Teaching, they abide in the sphere of reality, their minds unobstructed in the midst of all things; they do not abandon their practices, but divorce discriminatory thought. Their minds have no stirring thoughts in the midst of all things; they acquire the illumination of knowledge and wisdom, and destroy the darkness of ignorance. They are able to clearly reflect all Buddha teachings. Not destroying the various realms of existence, they are born therein, and comprehend that all realms of existence fundamentally are inert. Their physical, verbal, and mental activities are all without extremes.

tha snyad dang yi ge'i rgyud brjod du med pa dang ldan pa; sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad khong du chud pas chags pa med cing bcings pa med pa/ 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i yul la shin tu bsgoms pa/ chos kyi dbyings gzugs med pa/ nam mkha'i rang bzhin lta bus yang dag par byung ba/ chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur rnam par bsgoms pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ chos kyi dbyings bstan pa la ye shes dbang du gyur pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul ma 'dres pa'i sgo mngon par sgrub pa stobs bcu'i sar shes par bya ba shin tu bslabs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi stegs dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad la lhag mthong gi ye shes dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos de dang de dag rnam par dgod pa'i don khong du chud par bya ba la ye shes kyi mig gis zhi gnas kyis yang dag par non cing / ye shes chen po bsgom pas rnam par snang bar gyur pa'i khyad par can gyi smon lam dang ldan pa rab tu ston pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu tha dad pa med pa ston pa ste/ de nyid chags pa med pa'i sgo'i tshul lo/ / de nyid byang chub sems dpa' mang po'i 'byung ba'o/ / de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i mthus thams cad mkhyen pa'i brtson 'grus la 'jug pa ste/ chags pa med pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhing rnams kyi zhing ngo/ / sems can med pa'i mtha' la gnas par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can gyi khams rnams 'dul ba'o/ / dmigs pa thams cad mi dmigs par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu ston pa'o/ / rtog pa thams cad las rab tu dben par bya ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa shin tu ston pa'o/ / gnyis su med pa'i don du mngon par 'du bya ba med pa thams cad kyi mngon par 'du byed pa rab tu brjod pa'o/ / gzugs su dmigs pa med kyang gzugs kyi grangs su bstan pa dang / tshor ba'i yul med kyang tshor ba'i yul du brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid ched du brjod pa'o/ / phyin ci log thams cad kyang byang la/ 'du shes kyi gnas thams cad kyang yongs su ston pa'o/ / mngon par 'du bya ba med par yang ston la/ 'du byed thams cad kyang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / 'du byed thams cad kyang rnam par mi dmigs la/ chos thams cad rnam par shes par yang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos kyi 'khor lo yang byin gyis rlob la/ chos thams cad brjod du med par yang rab tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad la'ang rgyu ba med la/ chos kyi 'khor lo yang shin tu bskor ba'o/ / chos thams cad la'ang rnam pa tha dad pa med la/ rnam par dbye ba yang yongs su ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad la skye ba med par yang ston la/ gzugs rnams 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du'ang brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad shin tu phra bar yang khong du chud la/ phra ba rnams shin tu yangs par yang ston pa'o/ / bla na med pa'i chos kyang sbyin par byed la/ gong ma'i go 'phang shes par bya ba'ang rab tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad brjod du med par yang brjod pa/ brjod pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i rgyan rnam par dag pa yang rab tu ston pa'o/ / phyi dang nang gi chos med par bstan pa la'ang shin tu mkhas la/ chos thams cad sems med cing btags pa'i rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du'ang rab tu ston pa'o/ / yongs su 'grub pa tshad med pas 'byung ba yang khong du chud la/ byang ba'i mthar phyin pas chos thams cad zag pa zad par yang rab tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad la nyon mongs pa med par yang khong du chud la/ rang 'byung gi 'du shes kyang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad la slob dpon med par yang shin tu ston la/ bla ma la brten cing sten par yang rab tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par yang shes la/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi spyod yul yang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad rgyu ba med par yang brjod la/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'ang shin tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad 'byung ba med par yang rab tu shes la/ rgyu las 'byung ba'ang yongs su mi gtong ba'o/ / chos thams cad thog ma med par yang rab tu brjod la/ sngon gyi mtha'i mu yang rab tu sbyong ba'o/ / chos thams cad 'ong ba med par yang khong du chud la/ 'ong ba'i mtha' yang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba med par yang rab tu gcig par bstan pa yang rab tu ston to/ / chos thams cad la brjod pa med par yang khong du chud la/ chos thams cad yongs su brjod pa'ang rab tu ston to/ / chos thams cad bltar med par yang ston la/ lta ba'ang rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad la mtha' med par yang ston la/ chos bstan pa'i rnam pas kyang rab tu brjod pa'o// chos thams cad la yul med kyang ye shes kyi yul du rab tu brjod pa'o/ / chos thams cad kun tu khyab pa yin yang mdos yongs su brjod pa shin tu ston pa'o/ / chos thams cad la snang ba med kyang snang ba yongs su brjod pa'i phyir rnam par snang bar byed pa ste/ de ltar rgya chub sems dpa'i mthar thug pa ni 'di tsam zhig go /sprul pa'i byin gyis rlabs ni 'di tsam zhig go /mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa ni 'di snyed cig go /ye shes ni 'di tsam zhig go /nges par rtogs par bya ba ni 'di tsam zhig go /rjes su snyegs pa ni 'di tsam zhig go /'jug par bya ba ni 'di tsam zhig go /byang chub sems dpa'i yul ni 'di tsam zhig go snyam du sems pa med do// //

“Though they say all kinds of things by way of explanation in accord with local usage, they never destroy the truth which is beyond words. They enter deeply into the ocean of the enlightened, know that all things only have names, and have no bonds or attachments to objects. They understand that all things are empty, without existence; the practices they cultivate are born from the realm of reality. Like space, they are signless and formless; entering deeply into the realm of reality, they explain everything, producing universal knowledge through a single object.
“They contemplate the stage of the ten powers and cultivate it by knowledge. Knowledge is their bridge to omniscience; by the eye of knowledge they see things without obstruction and ably enter the various stages of enlightening. They know all kinds of principles, attain clear understanding of each and every facet of doctrine, and accomplish all their great undertakings.
“By this, great enlightening beings reveal the undifferentiated essence of all enlightened ones. This is the gate of unimpeded skill in means. This can produce all groups of enlightening beings. This state is only in the realm of concentration. This is able to plunge into omniscience, this is able to reveal all ways of access to concentration, this can enter unimpeded into all lands, this can tame all sentient beings, this can abide in the realm of no beings, this can show all Buddha teachings, this does not apprehend any objects.
“Though they teach and explain at all times they are always free from arbitrary conceptions and discriminatory thought; though they know all things are inert, yet they are able to demonstrate all actions; though they know the buddhas have no duality, yet they are able to reveal the buddhas; though they know there are no forms, yet they explain all forms; though they know there is no sensation, yet they explain all sensations; though they know there is no perception, yet they explain all perceptions; though they know there is no disposition, yet they explain all dispositions; though they know there is no consciousness, yet they explain all consciousnesses; they always reveal everything by means of the wheel of the Teaching. Though they know phenomena have no difference, yet they explain their aspects of differentiation; though they know phenomena have no origin or annihilation, yet they explain all characteristics of origination and annihilation; though they know phenomena have no coarseness or subtlety, yet they explain the coarse and subtle aspects of phenomena; though they know all phenomena have no superiority, mediocrity, or inferiority, yet they can explain what is best; though they know phenomena cannot be explained in words, yet they can speak pure words; though they know phenomena have no inside or outside, yet they explain all internal and external phenomena; though they know phenomena cannot be comprehensively cognized, yet they explain various kinds of knowledge and contemplation; though they know phenomena have no true reality, yet they expound a real path of emancipation; though they know phenomena are ultimately inexhaustible, yet they can expound the exhausting of all taints; though they know phenomena have no differences and no contradiction, yet they do not deny the differences among one another; though they know things ultimately have no teacher, yet they always respect all teachers and those of experience; though they know true understanding of things does not come from another, yet they always respect skillful guides; though they know things are inoperative, yet they turn the wheel of the Teaching; though they know things have no origination, yet they point out causes and conditions; though they know things have no precedent, yet they extensively explain the past; though they know things have no aftermath, yet they extensively explain the future; though they know things have no duration, yet they extensively explain the present; though they know things have no creator, yet they explain the acts that form them; though they know things have no causality, yet they explain the conglomerated causes; though they know things have no comparison, yet they explain the ways of equality and inequality; though they know things have no verbal explanation, yet they definitively explain the things of past, present, and future; though they know things have no basis of support, yet they expound attainment of emancipation based on what is good; though they know things have no body, yet they extensively explain the body of reality; though they know the buddhas of past, present, and future are boundless, yet they can explain how there is only one Buddha; though they know things have no form, yet they can manifest various forms; though they know things have no vision, yet they can expound many views; though they know things have no specific marks, yet they can explain all kinds of specific marks; though they know things have no objective sphere, yet they can extensively expound the spheres of knowledge; though they know things have no differentiation, yet they explain the various differences in fruits of action; though they know things have no escape, yet they explain pure practices for emancipation; though they know things are fundamentally permanent, yet they explain all things in flux; though they know things have no illumination, yet they always extensively explain means of illumination.
“When great enlightening beings enter the circle of knowledge of this immensely powerful concentration, they are then able to witness the truth of all Buddha teachings, able to proceed into the Buddha teachings, able to accomplish them, able to fulfill them, able to build them up, able to clarify them, able to live by them, able to comprehend them, in harmony with the inherent nature of all things. And yet these great enlightening beings do not entertain the idea that there are so many enlightening beings, so many principles of enlightening beings, so many ultimate ends of enlightening beings, so many illusory ultimate ends, so many fabricated ultimate ends, so many attainments of spiritual powers, so many attainments of knowledge, so many meditations, so many realizations, so many aims, so many realms.
bam po lnga bcu dgu pa/

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni rnam pa de lta bu ste; de ltar tshad med pa'i phyir ro/ / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams ni de lta bu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro/ /
de dag ni gzhan dang gzhan gyis bskyed pa/ gzhan dang gzhan du byin gyis brlabs pa/ gzhan dang gzhan du rgyu ba/ chos rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo can ye shes kyi sgo brjod du med pa/ blos rnam par brtag cing rnam pa dbye bas khyad par gyi mtha' med pa nges par rtogs pa grangs med pas khong du chud pa/ ye shes bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pas rgya che ba/ sangs rgyas mthong ba sna tshogs kyi mdzod du gyur pas/ mtha' dang dbus med pa mos pas rnam par dag pa/ dbang po shin tu yangs pa/ mngon par shes pa rab tu rno ba/ bsags pa med pa'i spyod yul can/ kun tu lta bas rab tu thob pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad lta bas grub pa/ kun tu bzang po'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsgrubs pa/ ye shes kyi rgyal po'i sku las byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i ye shes tshad med pa rnam par 'phrul ba'i rnam par phye ba mtha' dang dbus med pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes zad mi shes pa las gol ba med pa'i sgo can; sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ye shes kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung bas rnam par spyang ba/ sgo thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu skyes pas dpe med par brjod pa/ dmigs pa shin tu phra bas chos kyi dbyings thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad ma lus par dmigs pa shin tu phra bar byin gyis rlob pa/ 'phags par gsung ba'i thams cad mkhyen pas shin tu snang bar byas pa/ dbang gi dmigs pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa; chos kyi sgo thams cad kyi mthar phyin pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa can/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'i ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pa/ thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam gyis grub pa/ ting nge 'dzin thams cad mkhas par khong du chud pa/ sems sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag ste/ sems skad cig re re la byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la gnas te/ ting nge 'dzin brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba phrag brgya la snyoms par zhugs kyang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin dang yul gyi rgyan gyi snang bas yongs su snang bar bya ba rnams kyis mtha' dmigs par mi rung ngo/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ chos thams cad ni byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa ste/ thams cad kyang khong du chud par bya'o/ / zhing rnams ni mu med pa ste/ thams cad kyang khong du chud par bya'o/ / sems can gyi khams thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ de dag ni rdo rje'i tshig khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / de dag gis khyad par thams cad kyang khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / sngon gyi mtha' ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste/ de dag kyang thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / phyi ma'i mtha' ni mu med pa ste/ de dag kyang lhag ma ma lus par khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / da ltar byung ba'i dus ni mtha' dang dbus med pa ste/ nam mkha' dbyings kyis klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa ste/ de yang ma lus par khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul te/ de dag kyang thams cad khong du chud par bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ni grangs med pa ste/ de dag kyang thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / sangs rgyas kyis thugs su chud pa dang dgongs pa ni yul mtha' yas pa/ yul brjod du med pa ste/ de dag kyang thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'o/ / chos su dmigs pa thams cad ni/ sems kyi rang bzhin mthar phyin pa med pa ste/ de dag kyang thams cad lhag ma med par khong du chud par bya'o/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste / dper na/ yid bzhin gyi nor bu las ni ji bsam pa thams cad 'byung yang de snyed du mngon par 'du byed pas stongs par mi 'gyur zhing / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur yang rgyun chad pa med do/ / zad par 'gyur ba med do/ / yid bzhin gyi nor bu de yang rgyun gcod par sems pa med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems sgyu ma lta bu la zhugs pas/ chos kyi dmigs pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub kyang mthar phyin pa'i sems mi skyed de/ ting nge 'dzin de dang de dag gi rgyun yongs su mi gcod do; ;

Why? Because the concentration of enlightening beings is thus in essence, is thus without bounds, is thus transcendent.
“This concentration has various spheres, various powers, various deep entries. That is to say, it enters untold gates of knowledge, it enters arrangements beyond discriminatory thought, it enters boundless excellent ways of transcendence, it enters countless meditation states, it enters untold hundreds of thousands of millions of far-reaching cognitions, it enters vision of boundless exalted treasuries of buddhas, it enters objective worlds ceaselessly, it enters into pure application of the aids to the path of enlightenment, it enters into great psychic powers of strong and keen faculties, it enters into objective worlds without hindrance to the mind, it enters into the eye that sees the equality of all buddhas, it enters into the development of the high-minded practices of Universal Good, it enters into the state of the celestial body of subtle knowledge, it enters into explanation of the knowledge and wisdom of the enlightened, it enters into production of incalculable mystical projections, it enters into production of ways into the inexhaustible knowledge of all buddhas, it enters into clarification of the autonomous knowledge of the Universally Good enlightening being, it enters into revelation of incomparable all-sided knowledge, it enters into universal awareness of all subtle realms in the cosmos, it enters into the light of all higher knowledge, it enters into universal revelation of all subtle realms in the cosmos, it enters into the reaches of all magical powers, it enters into the sphere of teachings of all intellectual powers, it enters into the body of knowledge omnipresent throughout the cosmos, it enters into accomplishment of the path of action extending everywhere, it enters into ability to remain in all different concentrations, and it enters into knowledge of the mind of all buddhas.
“These great enlightening beings abide in the practice of Universal Good and enter untold billions of concentrations in every successive instant, yet they do not see anything prior to the concentration of Universal Good and the adornments of the realm of buddhahood.
Why? Because they know all things are ultimately inexhaustible, because they know all buddha-lands are boundless, because they know all realms of sentient beings are inconceivable, because they know the past has no beginning, because they know the future has no end, because they know the present is boundless, comprehending all space and the whole cosmos, because they know the realm of all buddhas is inconceivable, because they know the practices of enlightening beings are countless, because they know the realms explained by the intellectual powers of all buddhas are unspeakably boundless, and because they know illusory mental objects are infinite.
“Just as a wishing jewel grants all wishes, satisfying endless seekers without losing its power, in the same way a great enlightening being, entering this concentration, knows the mind is like an illusion and produces all objects everywhere inexhaustibly.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma'i dkyil 'khor yangs shing rgya che ba tshad med pa la zhugs pas/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa don yod pa / nges par rtogs pa la gnas pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa khong du chud pa'i ye shes kyi sgo dang ldan pas de la rgyas par 'gyur ba'am/ 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni/ sems kyi sgo mu med pa ste/ de dag gi sems ni ma skyes/ mi skye/ skye bar mi 'gyur ba yin yang de dag gi sems skye ba dang / skye bar 'gyur ba'am/ skyes pa mtha' med pa ste/ thug pa med pa'o/ / zad par mi 'gyur ba'o/ / sems kyi rgyud yongs su rgyun chad pa med de/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa sgyu ma'i sgo mang po kun dang ldan pa/ 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs pa la'ang mur thug pa med do// tshad kyis gcal ba med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos de snyed du tshad med pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi sgo khong du chud pa'i phyir ro/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / dga' bo dang / bsnyen dga' bo dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po de ma yin pa dag gis char phab na/ char pa'i thigs pa re re zhing / ba ru ra'i 'bras bu tsam gyi rgyun du phab kyang char pa de la zad ces bya ba med do/ / sngar bab pa de nyid phyir 'bab ces bya ba med do/ / sprin gyi mngon par 'du bya ba la zad ces bya ba med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / ye shes kyi sgo dang / chos kyi sgo dang / sangs rgyas lta ba'i sgo dang; phyogs su 'gro ba'i sgo dang / sems kyi dbang gi rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi sgo dang / cho 'phrul gyi sgo dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i sgo dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul gyi sgo dang / chos kyi tshul gyi sgo dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sgo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i drung du 'gro ba'i sgo dang / dbang po'i dra ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud tha dad pa'i bye brag brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sems kyi tshad kyis khong du chud par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sgo dang / sems can gyi 'du shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / rjes su bsnyegs pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sgo dang / dus rnam pa tha dad cing bskal pa mi mthun pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / bstan pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas khong du chud pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing spyi'u tshugs brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / snrel zhir rgyu ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag tu sems kyi skad cig gcig gis byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i sgo la mtha' med do; ; zad pa med do/ / sa mtshams med do/ / mu med do/ / skyo ba med do/ / yongs su yi 'chad pa med do/ / thug pa med do/ / rgyun 'chad pa med do/ / phyir ldog pa med do/ / chud za ba med do/ / 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi sgos thug pa med par mi 'gyur ro/ / nges par rtogs par bya bas yongs su yi 'chad par 'gyur ba med do; ; thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo zad par 'gyur ba med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar bya ba las phyir ldog pa med do/ / chos kyi 'khor lo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rab tu bskor ba la btang snyoms su byed pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa yongs su dri ba la zad par 'gyur ba med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub blta ba la mthar thug pa med do/ / sems can gyi khams thams cad 'dul bar bya ba yongs su gtong ba med do/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis 'byung ba rgyun chad par 'gyur ba med do/ / kha dog mtha' yas pa'i lus tshad med pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su bstan pas sa mtshams su 'gyur ba med do/ /

Why? The great enlightening being accomplishes the knowledge of unimpeded action of Universal Good and observes infinite extensive illusory realms, seeing them as like reflected images, without increase or decrease.
“Just as ordinary people individually give rise to mental states, past, present, and future, without bound, without cease, without end, the continuous flow and change of their mental states going on unbroken, inconceivably, in the same way, great enlightening beings entering this concentration of access to universal illusion have no bounds and are unfathomable.
Why? Because of the infinite phenomena in the Universally Good enlightening being’s door of access to universal illusion.
“Just as when the water spirits shower rain, the raindrops are like wheel hubs, without bound, the clouds are not exhausted, though they shower so much rain, this being the realm of nonstriving of the water spirits, in the same way great enlightening beings in this concentration enter the Universally Good enlightening being’s door of concentration, door of knowledge, door of teaching, door of perception of Buddha, door of traveling everywhere, door of mental freedom, door of empowerment, door of mystical projection, door of spiritual powers, door of phantom emanations, door of the illusory quality of all things, door filled with untold numbers of enlightening beings, door of approach to buddhas as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands, door of entry into the unspeakably vast network of illusions, door of knowledge of untold numbers of immense different buddha-lands, door of knowledge of untold numbers of worlds with substantial nature and without substantial nature, door of knowledge of the thoughts of untold numbers of sentient beings, door of knowledge of untold numbers of distinctions in time, door of knowledge of the becoming and disintegration of untold numbers of worlds, and door of knowledge of untold numbers of inverted and upright buddha-lands. They know all these as they really are in a single instant. When they enter in this way there are no bounds, there is no end; they are not tired, not wearied, they do not stop, do not rest, do not withdraw, do not slip. In all things they do not dwell on untruth; constantly meditating rightly, they do not become either oblivious or excited.
“They seek omniscience without ever retreating or giving up. They become lamps to light up the world in all buddha-lands. They operate untold numbers of cycles of the Teaching. With sublime intelligence they question the enlightened, never reaching a point of exhaustion. They demonstrate the attainment of the Buddha Way without bound. They pacify sentient beings, never giving up. They always diligently practice the undertakings of Universal Good, never ceasing. They manifest bodies of infinite forms, without end.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me ni ji srid du shing yod pa de srid du 'bar te/ me 'bar ba la mthar thug pa med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du sems can gyi khams la rnam par dpyod pa dang / ji tsam du chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa dang / ji tsam du 'jig rten gyi khams su rgyu ba dang / ji tsam du nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi tshad mi dmigs pa dang / ji tsam du sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba dang / ji tsam du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag gi /chos kyi bye brag rnam par phye ba la 'jug pa dang / ji tsam du sems can gyi khams kyi rgyud brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzhog cing nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa dang / nye bar rton pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag par byed pa dang / ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dam pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yang dag par mthong zhing / smon lam gcig tu nges pa med pa kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam la nges par bya ba dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod yul gyi ye shes kyi sgo la gzhog pa dang / ji tsam du dus gsum la 'jug pa'i rgyud brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'byams klas pa dang / snyoms shing rnam par rtog pa'i dus la 'jug pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'i tshul du 'jug pa dang / ji tsam du 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang; 'jig pa dang / gnas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa kun tu rgyu ba 'byung zhing rgyun mi 'chad pa de tsam du ye shes kyi dmigs pa/ snying rje chen po las byung ba/ smon lam chen pos sprul pa/ 'gro ba thams cad ma lus par 'dul ba la brtson pa yang mthar thug ces bya ba med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar de ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i khyad par ye shes kyis bsgrubs pas/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol bar bya ba la brtson pa'i phyir ro/ / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dang / de lta bu'i yul de ltar rgya che ba dang / de ltar yangs pa dang / de ltar tshad med pa dang / de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / de ltar 'od kun tu mtha' yas pa dang / de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad mngon du gyur pa dang / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis yongs su grub pa dang / de ltar mi 'khrugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa la mngon par brtson par bya'o/ / yongs su yi 'chad pa med pas brtan par bya'o/ / skyo ba med pa'i sems kyis bsgrub par bya'o/ / bsam pa phyir mi ldog pa bskyed par bya'o/ / gdon mi za bar 'byung bas sbyar bar bya'o/ / rtsom pa'i nan tan gyis mthun par spyad par bya'o// bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes yongs su gnon par bya'o/ / sgyu'i sa la mngon par zhen pa med par bya'o/ / 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad la mi gnas par bya'o/ / chos thams cad la chags pa med par bya'o/ / rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bsal bar bya'o/ / dngos po thams cad la chags pa med par bya'o/ / dmigs pa thams cad la rtog pa med par bya'o/ / chos khong du chud par bya ba la tshod 'dzin pa med par bya'o/ / chos kyi ye shes rtogs par khong du chud par bya'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i gdan la sangs rgyas su byang chub pas rmongs pa med par bya'o/ / chos kyi snang ba yongs su bsgrub par bya'o/ / 'gro ba thams cad dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bsdu par bya'o/ / bdud kyi yul las sems can yongs su bskyod par bya'o/ / chos kyi yul la sems can rab tu dgod par bya'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi yul la rab tu gzud par bya'o/ / smon lam gyi yul las phyir ldog pa med par bya'o/ / 'byung ba'i yul la rtogs pas gzhag par bya'o/ / rnam par dag pa'i yul la rab tu zhen par bya'o/ / pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul khong du chud par bya'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad la shin tu mos par bya'o/ / chos thams cad la dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du yang dag par 'jug par bya'o// chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa khong du chud par bya'o/ / 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin snang bar bya'o/ / chos kyi 'thad pa rab tu brjod par bya'o/ / ye shes kyi rang bzhin yang dag par bstan par bya'o/ / go cha'i dam pa bgos pa yongs su mi spang bar bya'o/ / skal ba mnyam par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas par bya'o/ / sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pa la sems lhod pa med par bya'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par bya'o/ / chos kyi dbyings tha dad pa med pa la bdag rab tu sbyar bar bya'o/ / sems sgyu ma lta bur rab tu shes par bya'o/ / 'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad rmi lam lta bur khong du chud par bya'o/ / smon lam dang sangs rgyas blta bar bya ba thams cad mig yor lta bur shes par bya'o/ / slob pa med pa'i chos 'byams klas pa thams cad sprul pa lta bur shes par bya'o/ / tshig gi lam thams cad sgra brnyan lta bur khong du chud par bya'o// chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rtogs par bya'o/ / shi 'pho dang / skye ba thams cad 'khrul 'khor lta bur shes par bya'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba thams cad lus med par khong du chud par bya'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi chos dri bas yongs su skyo ba med par bya'o/ / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad 'jig par bstan pa'i sa dang / gdams ngag dang / man ngag tu bya ba la btang snyoms med par bya'o/ / gdul bar bya ba dus la bab pa'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la nan tan du byed pa dang / de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su sgrub pa dang / de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba la rab tu brtson pa dang / de ltar 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / de ltar chos nyid 'khrugs pa med par rnam par 'byed pa dang / de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mos par byed pa dang / de ltar sangs rgyas kyi stobs 'byams klas pa khong du chud par byed pa dang / de ltar chags pa med pa'i sems kyis rab tu 'byed pa dang / phyogs mtshams med pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam pa tha dad pa dag tu skal ba mnyam par rnam par dgod pa la 'gro ba rnams rab tu dgod pa'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa dang bcas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad ma lus pa de dag gi phyogs gcig gi de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan tha dad pa dang / mtshan gcig pa thams cad dang / phyogs gcig nas ji lta ba bzhin du phyogs bcu'i phyogs 'byams klas pa'i rgyud thams cad nas kyang de bzhin te/ phyogs 'byams klas pa'i rgyud gcig nas ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad nas kyang de bzhin te/ phyogs re re nas kyang mtshan re re'i sgos/ de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis zhal mngon par bstan to/ / de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas klas pa'i phyogs bcu ma lus par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis zhal mngon par bstan te/ byang chub sems dpa' de ye shes chen po'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa kun tu bzang po'i spyod yul la yang dag par gnas pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la rmongs pa med cing / chos thams cad la rab tu gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i blo gros nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par gzhol zhing chos rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi don khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir blo gros nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / chags pa med pa la rtogs par gzhog pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir/ rig pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / ye shes 'byams klas pas khong du chud par bya ba dang / blo gros rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi yul gyi mthas klas pa thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi byang chub nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi snang ba dang / 'od thams cad kyis mun pa med pa'i ye shes 'byams klas pa las phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir shes rab nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de thabs mkhas pa 'jig rten thams cad las 'phags pas sems can 'dul ba la bsgribs pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ ye shes nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi rgyud mtha' yas pa brjod pa la zad mi shes pa tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir spobs pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de 'gro ba thams cad du lus brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rgyud dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa rnam pa tha dad pa rnam par ston par bya ba'i phyir/ sprul pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de sems can sna tshogs thams cad la dbyangs kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i sgra dbyangs dang skad sna tshogs ston par bya ba'i phyir/ lce yangs pa nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de mthong ma thag tu ston pa dang / thos par byed pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la rmongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ rmongs pa med par nye bar bsgrub pa mdzad do/ / des byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la yongs su grub pa yin/ yongs su grub nas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo yongs su rdzogs par bya bas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la 'jug go /'byung ba'i sgo yongs su dag par byed do/ / chags pa med pa'i sgos yongs su 'byung bar byed do/ / sems can thams cad 'byung ba'i sgo yongs su rtsom zhing byin gyis rlob bo/ / chos thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i sgo yang dag par ston to/ / cho 'phrul gyi sgo chos med pas sems can 'dul ba la rab tu 'jug go /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i rnam pa la rab tu mkhas par sbyong ngo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba la byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas yang dag par 'byung ngo/ / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par phye ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i mthar thug pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du rlob bo/ /

Why? Just as fire burns unceasingly whenever the appropriate conditions are present, in the same way, great enlightening beings see the realms of sentient beings, the realms of reality, and the realms of worlds as boundless as space—in a single instant they are able to go visit as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands, in the company of each buddha enter untold different aspects of omniscience, cause untold beings to give up attachments for the sake of the Way and cultivate virtue and be ultimately purified, cause untold enlightening beings who have not yet attained certainty about the practice of the vows of Universal Good to attain certainty and to abide securely in the way of knowledge of Universal Good, by innumerable means enter untold different ages—becoming, subsisting, disintegrating—of past, present, and future, and in the different realms of those untold eons of becoming, subsistence, and disintegration, produce as many great vows of great compassion and pacify all sentient beings. What is the reason?
