These great enlightening beings, for the purpose of liberating all sentient beings, cultivate the practice of Universal Good, develop the knowledge of Universal Good, and fulfill the undertakings of Universal Good.
“Therefore, enlightening beings should diligently cultivate practice in such types of action, such perspectives, such powers, such greatness, such infinity, such inconceivability, such all-sided illumination, such presence with all buddhas, such protection by all buddhas, such consummation of past roots of goodness, such imperturbable concentration wherein the mind is unimpeded, getting rid of all burning afflictions, without wearying or backsliding, with steadfast will and courage, following the realm of concentration into the stage of inconceivable knowledge, not depending on words, not clinging to the world, not grasping phenomena, not producing discriminatory thoughts, not becoming attached to worldly things, not thinking about objects.
“In terms of knowledge of the teachings, they should just abide by them and not try to measure them. This refers to associating with the omniscient and understanding the enlightenment of the buddhas, attaining the light of truth and shedding it on the foundations of goodness of all sentient beings, pulling sentient beings out of the realm of demons and enabling them to enter the realm of the Buddha teachings, causing them not to give up great aspirations, to earnestly examine the Path of emancipation, to expand the sphere of purity, to accomplish the means of transcendence, to develop profound faith in all buddhas. They should always look into the nature of all things without quitting even for a moment; they should know that their own bodies and the nature of things are universally equal; they should clearly understand the doings of the world and point out wisdom and means that accord with truth; they should always be energetic, without lapsing; they should observe the paucity of roots of goodness in themselves and should strive to increase roots of goodness in others; they should themselves cultivate the Path of universal knowledge; they should strive to expand the sphere of enlightening beings; they should gladly approach expert teachers; they should associate with fellow practitioners; they should not discriminate among buddhas; they should not give up detachment from thought; they should always abide in the impartial realm of reality; they should know all states of mind and consciousness are illusory; they should know all events in the world are like dreams; they should know the appearance of the willpower of the buddhas is like reflected images; they should know all great actions are like emanations; they should observe all phenomena as like magic tricks; they should know all things that are born and perish are like echoes; they should know all the buddha-lands they go to have no substantial nature; they should never tire of asking buddhas for teaching; they should diligently carry on education to enlighten all beings, never abandoning them; they should unremittingly expound the teachings in a timely fashion in order to pacify all sentient beings.
“Great enlightening beings thus practice the deeds of Universal Good, thus fulfill the sphere of action of enlightening beings, thus master the way of emancipation, thus absorb and hold the teachings of the buddhas of past, present, and future, thus investigate all aspects of knowledge, thus reflect on the unchanging truth, thus purify powerful determination, thus believe in all enlightened ones, thus know the immense power of buddhas, thus make certain the unimpeded mind, thus take care of all living beings.
“When great enlightening beings enter this concentration of great knowledge and wisdom, wherein the Universally Good enlightening being abides, there appear before them as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands from untold numbers of lands in the ten directions, each buddha having as many names as atoms in untold lands, each name also including untold numbers of buddhas: these buddhas give the enlightening beings the memory power of the enlightened, so they do not forget the realm of buddhahood; they give them ultimate knowledge of all things, so they may enter omniscience; they give them definitive wisdom cognizant of the various meanings of all teachings, enabling them to absorb and hold all Buddha teachings and enter into them without impediment; they give them unexcelled enlightenment, so they can enter universal knowledge and open up their awareness of the cosmos of reality; they give them the ultimate wisdom of enlightening beings, enabling them to attain the light of all truths, to be free from darkness; they give them nonreceding knowledge, so that they know appropriate and inappropriate timing and guide sentient beings with skill in means; they give them the unobstructed intellectual powers of enlightening beings, enabling them to understand boundless truths and explain them inexhaustibly; they give them the power of spiritual capacities and production of mystical projections, enabling them to manifest untold numbers of different bodies, with boundless forms and appearances, all variously different, to awaken sentient beings; they give them universal speech, enabling them to manifest untold numbers of different sounds and various languages to enlighten sentient beings; they give them power that is not wasted, to enable all sentient beings who see them or hear their teaching to achieve development and not waste the experience.
“Because great enlightening beings fulfill Universally Good practice in this way, they acquire the power of the enlightened, purify the path of emancipation, are imbued with universal knowledge, and by means of unimpeded intellectual powers, spiritual faculties, and mystical emanations, ultimately harmonize and pacify all sentient beings. Full of the spiritual force of enlightenment, they purify Universally Good practice, abide in the path of Universal Good, and operate the subtle cycles of teaching of all buddhas for ever and ever, to pacify all living beings.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni smon lam gyi khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pas yongs su grub bam/ ma grub na 'jig rten thams cad kyi slob dpon du 'gyur ba yin/ chos kyi nyi ma 'jig rten du shar ba yin/ ye shes kyi zla ba 'jig rten thams cad du snang bar byung ba yin/ ye shes dam pa'i ri rab mi g.yo pa 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa yin/ ye shes kyi rgya mtsho tshad med pa 'jig rten thams cad du yang dag par gnas pa yin/ bsgrub pa rgyun mi 'chad pas 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi nan tan byed pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams sa mtshams med pa thams cad du rab tu snang ba yin/ rnam par dag pa yangs shing mtha' yas pa 'gro ba thams cad brjod pa yin/ sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams kyi rgyud dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i smon lam chen po la rab tu brtson par gzhog pa yin/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i brtson 'grus yangs pa rgya chen po'i smon lam chen po la rab tu gzhog pa yin/ spyod pa chen po dang ting nge 'dzin yangs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la sems can gyi khams yang dag par gzhog cing rab tu sbyor ro/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu'i ngang tshul can/ de lta bu'i ye shes can/ de lta bu'i chos thob par gyur pa/ de lta bu'i chos kyi snang bar gyur pa/ de lta bu'i chos la gnas pa/ chos de lta bu mthong bar gyur pa/ mngon par shes pa de lta bu'i yid dang ldan pa/ cho 'phrul dam pa de lta bu dang ldan pa/ cho 'phrul mchog tu bya ba/ phul du byung ba de lta bus yang dag par grub pa/ rtag tu brtson pa'i snying rje chen pos mngon par 'phags pa/ chos kyi don bzang po la rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par brtson pa/ bde ba'i lam yang dag par ston pa/ bsod nams chen po dang / ye shes yangs pa'i 'od zer gyi rgyal mtshan du gyur pa/ rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa shin tu thob pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul la don yod par rjes su song ba/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa/ rnam par thar pa'i tshul shin tu phra ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu bsgoms pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyud dang / tshul rmongs pa med par khong du chud pa kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la rnam par rtse zhing spyod pa/ seng ge bsgyings pa'i ye shes kyi grub pa la shin tu gnas pa/ sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa la chags pa med pa rnams kyi chos kyi bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu yangs pa chen po bcu 'byung ngo/ / bcu gang zhe na/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad rjes su dran pas gnas pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid tshad med pas gnas pa yin/ sems can thams cad gdul ba'i snying rje chen pos gnas pa yin/ zhing rnam par dag pa'i gnas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir gnas pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos pa rnam par dag pas gnas pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub tha dad par mi byed pas gnas pa yin/ chags pa med pa'i mtha' bsgribs pa med pas chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin mtshan nyid med pas gnas pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas gnas pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i 'phrin las dang; gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las 'das pa dang / ma byung ba dang / da ltar byung ba chags pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings shin tu ston pa'i ye shes sngon du 'gro bas gnas pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad kyi skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dus gsum mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa skad cig gcig gis mthar 'jug pas gnas pa yin te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa de dag ni tshad med pa/ shin tu yangs pa/ bgrang du med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ zad mi shes pa/ brjod par dka' ba/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ brjod du med pa/ bzod par dka' ba/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa dag ste/ chos thams cad kyi ye shes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' de lhag pa'i bsam pa de lta bus gnas so/ / de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa yin te/ chos rnam par dag pa yang rab tu thob bo/ / bsam pa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ / sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yang yang dag par ston to/ / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mi khom pa khom par byed pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do// shin tu 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su grub pa yang rab tu 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi gzungs kyis 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin to/ / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar sems can gyi khams thams cad la yang dag par lta'o/ / tshig gi lam gyi rgyud kyis sems can thams cad 'dul ba yongs su ston to/ /

“Why? When these great enlightening beings accomplish the practices of enlightening beings guided by such lofty, great vows, they become teachers of all worlds, sums of truth for all worlds, moons of knowledge for all worlds; they become lofty polar mountains for all worlds, majestically standing out high, steadfast, immutable; they become shoreless oceans of knowledge for all worlds, they become bright lamps of right teaching for all worlds, illumining everywhere, boundlessly, continuously, uninterrupted; they reveal boundless pure virtues for all sentient beings, inducing them to live steadily based on virtuous qualities and foundations of goodness; they act in accord with universal knowledge, and their great vows are impartial; they cultivate the far-reaching practice of Universal Good and are always able to inspire countless beings; persisting in untold numbers of concentrations of great efficacy, they manifest great freedom.
“These enlightening beings attain such knowledge, verify such principles, thoroughly abide by and clearly see such truths, acquire such spiritual powers, sojourn in such realms, manifest such mystical projections, produce such spiritual communications, always abide in great compassion, always help sentient beings, show sentient beings the true path of peace and serenity, set up the great banner of light of virtue and knowledge, experience inconceivable liberation, abide in the liberation of universal knowledge, reach the other shore of liberation of buddhas, have learned and mastered the aspects of expedient means of inconceivable liberation, enter the doors of differentiation of the cosmos without confusion, freely roam in the untold numbers of concentrations of Universal Good, and abide in rapidly expanding knowledge, their minds and intellects unimpeded.
“Their minds always abide in ten great metaphysical treasuries: remembering all buddhas; remembering all Buddha teachings; great compassion to pacify all beings; knowledge to reveal inconceivable pure lands; certain understanding entering deeply into the realm of buddhahood; enlightenment equal in all features in all buddhas, past, present, and future; nonimpediment and nonattachment; the signlessness of all things; the equal roots of goodness of all buddhas, past, present, and future; the guiding knowledge of the cosmic, nondiscriminatory physical, verbal, and mental action of all buddhas of past, present, and future; contemplation of all buddhas of all times being born, leaving home, going to the site of enlightenment, attaining true awakening, turning the wheel of the Teaching, and finally passing utterly away, all in the space of an instant. These ten great metaphysical treasuries are immensely vast, without measure, incalculable, unthinkable, inexplicable; they are inexhaustible, difficult to bear, impossible for any and all worldly knowledge to expound.
“These great enlightening beings have already reached the transcendental consummation of the practices of Universal Good and have witnessed the pure truth. Their willpower is immense. They teach sentient beings innumerable roots of goodness and increase all the powers of enlightening beings. In every succeeding moment they fulfill all the virtues of enlightening beings, accomplish all practices of enlightening beings, attain the methods of mental command of all buddhas, and absorb and hold the teachings of all buddhas. Though they always abide in the reality of True Thusness, yet they adapt to all conventional terms to show the ways to pacify and harmonize all sentient beings.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po de lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos nyid de/ des byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'byams klas pa thams cad la mchog tu bya ba rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir chos 'byams klas pa thams cad ston pa la mkhas pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dam pa 'jigs pa med par rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ye shes rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshul thams cad la mkhas pa'i dam pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir tshul thams cad kyi rgyan rab tu 'thob bo/ / de'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad du chos kyi dbugs phyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro/ / de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dus dang dus ma yin pa rab tu shes so/ / de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar bya ba rab tu shes so/ / de'i phyir sems can thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ / de'i phyir don thams cad bsgrub par yon tan thams cad la yan lag rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro/ / de'i phyir theg pa'i dam pa rab tu brtson par byas te/ sems can thams cad la mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par dag pa rab tu brjod do/ /

Why? Because when great enlightening beings are in this concentration, they are naturally like this.
“By means of this concentration great enlightening beings acquire the vast knowledge of all buddhas; they gain the free intellectual powers to skillfully explain all great teachings; they attain the unhesitating expertise that is most excellent and pure in the world; they gain entry into knowledge of all concentrations; they master all enlightening beings’ skillful techniques; they find the door of illumination of all truths; they reach the final consummation of the way to comfort all worldly beings; they know what is timely and what is not for all sentient beings; they illumine everywhere in the worlds of the ten directions; they enable all living beings to attain higher knowledge; they are unexcelled teachers of all worlds; they persist in all virtues; they reveal pure concentration to all sentient beings and enable them to enter supreme knowledge.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don la gnas pa/ snying rje chen po de lta bu rnam par 'phel bar byed pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bsten par 'dod pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar 'dod pa/ chos thams cad snang bar bya bar 'dod pa; zhing thams cad du 'gro bar 'dod pa/ phyogs thams cad du rgyu bar 'dod pa/ dus gsum mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par 'dod pa/ chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa/ sangs rgyas mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas par 'dod pa/ ye shes mnyam pa nyid la 'dug par 'dod pas chos 'di dag la las de lta bur brtson zhing las gzhan med pa dang / ngoms mi shes pa dang / sems ma 'khrugs pa dang / yid rtse gcig tu gyur pa dang / de ltar gnas pa la brtson pa dang / de ltar khong du chud pa'i yid dang / de ltar mnyam pa'i sems dang / de lta bu'i yid bde ba dang / de ltar las su rung ba dang / de ltar brtson pa dang / de ltar mthar 'byin pa dang / de ltar rnam par spyod pas nan tan du bya zhing mngon par bsgrub par bya'o/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni log par smra ba ma yin/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan du smra ba ma yin te/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa'o/ /

“Why? When great enlightening beings cultivate practice in this way, they benefit living beings, so they increase great compassion, so they draw near to worthy associates, so they see all buddhas, so they comprehend all truths, so they go to all lands, so they enter all regions, so they enter all worlds, so they realize the equality of all things, so they know the equality of the buddhas, so they abide in the equanimity of universal knowledge.
“In this practice they carry out this kind of action, no other: they abide in the mind that is not complacent; they abide in the mind that is not distracted or confused; they abide in the mind that can concentrate on one point; they abide in the mind that diligently cultivates enlightenment; they abide in the certain mind; they abide in the nonchanging mind. In this manner do they think, act, and reach the ultimate end.
“Great enlightening beings have no different speech or action—they speak and act thus.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni gcig tu mi rung bar brjod pa ste/ mi tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang chos 'di dag las brjod pa ste/ 'di lta bu'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ gser ni kha dog shin tu bzang bar brjod pa ste/ gser gyi kha dog bzang po rnam par dag pa yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos kyis brjod pa ste/ de ltar dge zhing bzang ba'i chos la gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha'i bu nyi ma ni snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis brjod pa ste/ snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad du snang bas brjod pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni rin po che bzhi'i phung pos rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags par brjod pa ste/ rgya mtsho las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten thams cad las dge ba'i rtsa bas shin tu 'phags par brjod pa ste/ 'jig rten thams cad las shin tu 'phags pa yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa chen po ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su rton par brjod pa ste/ rton pa'i rang bzhin yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'grel bar brjod pa ste/ snying rje chen po yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po ni rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste/ rgya mtsho'i chu yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su brjod pa ste/ sems can thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i smon lam yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'phong gi slob dpon ni mda' gzhu dang 'phong la zo bdog bde bas ji srid du mda' gzhu dang ldan zhing mda' gzhu la brtson pas brjod par bya ba ste/ 'phong gi tshul du bya ba yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang; yul gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu la mngon par brtson zhing yongs su sgrub pa de tsam du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis snang bar 'gyur ba yin/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po ni ji tsam du tshe ring ba de tsam du bde ba myong ba yin/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ / shin tu rnam par dag pa yang rab tu 'thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ ji tsam du sa bon btab pa de tsam du rnam par 'phel lo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la brtson pa de tsam du sems can gyi khams rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sprin chen po ni ji tsam du char 'bebs pa de tsam du dbyar gyi dus la sa bon rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang ji tsam du chos kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs shing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / rnam pa 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin chen po la snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du sems can rnams shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur te/ shin tu mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu bde ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / mchog tu bya ba shin tu 'thob pa dang / shin tu pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa dang / skye dgu thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad la the tshom shin tu gcod pa dang / sbyin bsreg yongs su bzung zhing sbyin pa yongs su sbyong bas bsod nams rmad du byung ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la rab tu gzhog pa'i phyir/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du skal pa shin tu mnyam par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad khams gsum las bsgral ba'i phyir/ ye shes shin tu rnam par dag par byed pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sems can rnams dgod pa'i phyir/ chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba dam par 'gyur ba yin/
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyi mchos kyi dbyings rnam par phye ba ste/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o/ / tshad med pa'o/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'o/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir ye shes sbyong ba'o/ / yongs su 'dul bas sems can sbyong ba'o/ / yongs su bsngo bas zhi ba sbyong ba'o/ / rab tu gzhog pas chos sbyong ba'o/ / zhum pa med pas mi 'jigs pa sbyong ba'o/ / rab tu bstan pas tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa sbyong ba'o/ / shin tu bstan pa mchos sbyong ba'o/ / chos thams cad las phyir mi ldog par gzungs sbyong ba'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi 'byung ba thams cad kyi don du sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa sbyong ba'o/ /
de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa ni yon tan 'di dag dang / gzhan yang yongs su dag pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong rab tu 'thob bo/ / ting nge 'dzin chen po'i dkyil 'khor 'di dag gi dbang dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i stobs dang / ye shes kyi sa'i sgrol ba'i mthu dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi nye bar bstan pa'i stobs dang / bdud kyi las thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i mthu dang / dge ba'i las skal ba mnyam pa rnams kyi gzhung gcig pa'i mthu dang / smon lam rnams kyi dag pa'i stobs dang / ji ltar bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su grub pa'i stobs dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams thub pa med cing zad mi shes pa'i mthus de ltar snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa ni yon tan mtshungs pa mnyam pa bcus sangs rgyas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na / 'di ltar gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kyis byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ 'od dang 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sprul pa sems can 'dul ba'i tshul bzhin du ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ lus tshad med pa dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa dang / dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa byin gyis rlob cing sems can gyi las dang spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ sems can thams cad kyi tha snyad gzungs dam pas 'dzin pa'i mthu dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i mthar thug par gnas pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pas sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad shes pas ston cing / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ mi 'jigs pas bag tsha ba med pa seng+ge nga ro sgrog cing / chos dang mthun par sems can thams cad khong du chud par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ dus gsum gyi tshig gi lam la 'jug pa skad cig gi mthar 'jug par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi stobs dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul rnam par phye ba sems can rnams la yang dag par ston pas byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin/

Why? Just as, for example, adamant is unbreakable and gets its name from that, never being apart from unbreakability, in the same way, great enlightening beings get their name from their various practical principles and are never apart from them.
“Just as gold gets its name from its beautiful color and is never apart from its beautiful color, so do great enlightening beings get their name from their virtuous acts and are never apart from good deeds.
“Just as the sun gets its name from its orb of light and is never apart from the orb of light, so do great enlightening beings get their name from the light of wisdom and are never apart from the light of wisdom.
“Just as the polar mountain Wonderfully High gets its name from its four jewel peaks rising high over the ocean, never leaving its four peaks, in the same way, great enlightening beings get their name from their roots of goodness standing out loftily in the world, never giving up roots of goodness.
“Just as the ground gets its name from sustaining everything, never giving up its supportive ability, so do great enlightening beings get their name from liberating all, never leaving great compassion.
“Just as the ocean gets its name from taking in myriad waters, never rejecting water, so do great enlightening beings get their name from their great vows, never for a moment giving up the vow to liberate sentient beings.
“Just as a military leader gets his name from ability to learn and practice methods of battle, never abandoning this ability, so do great enlightening beings get their name from being able to learn and practice such concentration, until they accomplish omniscience, never abandoning this practice.
“Just as a world ruler commands the continents, always diligently protecting all living beings so they will always be happy and will not suffer unnatural death, so do great enlightening beings, entering such great concentrations, always strive to transform and liberate all sentient beings, until they effect their ultimate purification.
“Just as seeds planted in the ground can eventually grow stalks and leaves, so great enlightening beings cultivating the practice of Universal Good can cause all sentient beings’ good qualities to grow.
“Just as great clouds shower rain during the hot months of summer and cause all seeds to grow, similarly great enlightening beings, entering such great concentrations, cultivating enlightening practice, shower the rain of the great Teaching, which can cause all sentient beings to be ultimately purified, ultimately serene, ultimately peaceful, ultimately transcendent, ultimately happy, ultimately free from doubt. They are the ultimate field of blessings for sentient beings, enabling their actions to become purified, enabling them all to abide in the path of nonregression, enabling them alike to attain omniscience, enabling them to attain emancipation from the world, enabling them all to attain ultimate knowledge, enabling them all to attain the ultimate truth of the enlightened ones, placing all sentient beings in the realm of universal knowledge.
“Why? When enlightening beings accomplish this teaching, their knowledge and wisdom are clear and comprehensive; they enter the door to the cosmos of reality and are able to purify the inconceivably infinite practices of enlightening beings. That is to say, they are able to purify all knowledge because they seek omniscience; they are able to purify sentient beings because they cause them to be pacified; they are able to purify lands because of constant dedication; they are able to purify things because of perfect knowledge; they are able to purify fearlessness because they have no timidity; they are able to purify unhindered intellect because they teach skillfully; they are able to purify mental command because they have mastered all the teachings; they are able to purify the practice of association because they see all buddhas appearing in the world.
“Great enlightening beings in this concentration attain untold myriads of such pure qualities because they gain mastery of such realms of concentration, because they are empowered by all buddhas, because they are borne along by the power of their own roots of goodness, because they enter the great magnificent force of the stage of knowledge and wisdom, because of the strength of guidance of worthy associates, because of crushing the power of all demons, because of the pure power of roots of goodness in proportion, because of the power of great vows, because of the power of the full development of the roots of goodness they have planted, and because of the unopposed power of inexhaustible virtue transcending all worlds.
“Great enlightening beings in this concentration attain ten things that are the same as in all buddhas, past, future, and present; they acquire the same variegated arrays of marks and refinements as all buddhas; they are able to emanate networks of pure light, the same as all buddhas; they perform miracles and displays of spiritual power to attune and pacify sentient beings, the same as all buddhas; their boundless physical bodies and universal voices are the same as those of all buddhas; they manifest pure buddha-lands according to the actions of sentient beings, the same as all buddhas; they are able to remember the speech of all sentient beings, the same as all buddhas; with inexhaustible intellectual powers they teach in accord with the mentalities of sentient beings, developing wisdom in them, the same as all buddhas; their lion’s roar is fearless as they enlighten living beings by innumerable teachings, the same as all buddhas; by great spiritual power they enter past, present, and future in a single instant, the same as all buddhas; they are able to show all sentient beings the adornments of the buddhas, the powers of the buddhas, and the states of the buddhas, the same as all buddhas.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' de rnam pa de lta bu de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin na/ ci'i phyir sangs rgyas ma yin/ ci'i phyir stobs bcu ma yin/ ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir kun tu gzigs pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la bsgribs pa mi mnga' ba gzigs pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang mi gnyis par spyod pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir gnas pa'i mthar gyur pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rgyun gcod pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa ma yin/ ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud nye bar len pa btang snyoms su mi gzhog /

Then the enlightening being Universal Eye said to the enlightening being Universally Good, “If great enlightening beings attain such things the same as the buddhas, why are they not called Buddha? Why are they not called Ten-Powered? Why are they not called Omniscient? Why are they not called Those Enlightened in All Things? Why can they not be called Universal Eye? Why are they not called Unhindered Seers in All Realms? Why are they not called Aware of All Things? Why are they not called Those Who Abide in the State of Nonduality with the Buddhas of Past, Present, and Future? Why are they not called Those Who Dwell in Absolute Reality? Why do they still carry out the practical undertakings of Universal Good without rest? Why can they not find the ultimate end of the cosmos and give up the path of enlightening beings?”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mig la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod de skad du gal te byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mtshungs pa mnyam pa yin na/ ci'i phyir sangs rgyas ma yin ces zer ba de ji skad smras pa de bzhin te/ legs so/ / legs so/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ nam byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i smon lam tha mi dad par zhugs pas yang dag par skyes pa'i yul thob par gyur pa de'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i don du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rgyun ma bcad pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs bcu la zhugs par gyur pa de'i tshe stobs bcu zhes bya'o/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bsgrub cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam ched du bya ba med par chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pa thams cad rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o/ / chos kyi dbyings thams cad shin tu bstan pa tha dad pa la 'jug pa rig par spyod cing mkhas par bya ba las phyir mi ldog pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos thams cad mi gnyis par yang dag par spyod pa yongs su shes par gyur pa de'i tshe/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de chos thams cad gnyis pa dang / gnyis ma yin pa la mkhas pas rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud la 'jug cing chos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mkhas pa la gnas pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul ye shes kyi sgos khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe kun tu gzigs pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de kun tu gzigs pa'i yul mngon par sgrub cing sems dang ye shes sems skad cig tu rnam par 'phel bas yongs su skyo bar mi byed pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos snang ba'i sgo thams cad kyis snang bar byed cing / mun pa med pa'i sa la gnas pa de'i tshe bsgribs pa med par gzigs pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes ston pa'i don du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshul mngon par khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe/ chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi tshul mngon par sangs rgyas pa la spyod cing rtog la khong du chud pas de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas la spyod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mi gnyis par gyur pa de'i tshe/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang mi gnyis pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag yongs su sbyong zhing rnam par sgom pas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de 'gro ba thams cad du gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' khong du chud par gyur pa de'i tshe/ yang dag pa'i mtha' mkhyen pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de gnas pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha' la rtogs par gzhog cing yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed cing / chos thams cad rab tu dbye ba'i rgyud la btang snyoms rab tu thob pa yang ma yin pas/ de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de len pa med cing 'dor pa med la/ rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med par gyur pa de'i tshe smon lam yongs su btang ba zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing shin tu yangs par byed pa dang / rnam par spyong ba dang / phyir mi ldog par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rgyun ma bcad pa zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings snang bar bya ba'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing mtshan nyid gcig gis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes par gyur pa de'i tshe/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya'o/ / nam byang chub sems dpa' de phyir mi ldog / pa'i btang snyoms dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud nye bar len pa la btang snyoms pa zhes bya'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' de chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rab tu shes pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu shes shing / chos thams cad mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i tshul gyis mtshan nyid sna tshogs rab tu shes la/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par skyo ba med cing yongs su yi 'chad pa med de/ 'gro ba thams cad snying rje chen pos yongs su bskyab pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad yongs su 'grel cing 'dul bas de'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po zhes bya'o/ /

Universally Good said to Universal Eye, “Very good, offspring of Buddha! As you say, if these great enlightening beings are the same as all buddhas, why are they not called Buddha and so on, and why can they not give up the path of enlightening beings?
“These great enlightening beings, having already ably practiced the various activities and undertakings of all enlightening beings of past, future, and present worlds, and entered the realm of knowledge, are then called Buddha; unceasingly cultivating the enlightening practices cultivated by the buddhas, they are called enlightening beings. Having completely entered the powers of the enlightened, they are called Ten-Powered; ceaselessly carrying out the activities of Universal Good after having attained the ten powers, they are called enlightening beings. Knowing all truths and being able to explain them, they are called Omniscient; though able to expound all truths, yet never ceasing to think about each truth with versatility, they are called enlightening beings. Knowing all things are nondual, they are called Enlightened in All Things; skillfully examining the path of differentiation of all things, dual and nondual, ceaselessly developing further and further, they are called enlightening beings. Able to clearly see the realm of the Universal Eye, they are called Universal Eye; though able to witness the realm of the Universal Eye, ceaselessly developing in every moment, they are called enlightening beings. Able to clearly perceive all things without any obscurity or barrier, they are called Unimpeded Seers; always diligently remembering the unimpeded seers, they are called enlightening beings. Having attained the eye of knowledge of all buddhas, they are called Aware of All Things; observing the buddhas’ correctly awakened eye of knowledge without slacking, they are called enlightening beings. Abiding in the abode of buddhas, not other than buddhas, they are called Those Who Abide in a State of Nonduality with the Buddhas; cultivating various knowledges in the care of the buddhas, they are called enlightening beings. Always observing the limit of reality of all worlds, they are called Those Who Dwell in Absolute Reality; though always observing absolute reality of all things, yet neither entering it experientally by extinction nor abandoning it, they are called enlightening beings. Not coming, not going, without sameness or difference, all such distinctions having ceased forever—such are called Those Who Have Set Their Undertakings to Rest; extensively cultivating fulfillment without turning back, they are called Those Who Have Not Ceased the Undertakings of Universal Good. Perfectly knowing the cosmos has no bounds and all things are one form, which is formless, this is called reaching the ultimate end of the cosmos and giving up the way of enlightening beings; though knowing the cosmos has no bounds, yet knowing all various different forms, evolving a mind of great compassion and liberating beings for ever and ever without wearying, this is called the Universally Good enlightening being.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni/ ri gser gyi logs zhes bya ba'i rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi lung pa rin po che'i ra ba bdun gyis bskor ba/ rin po che'i shing thags kyi dra ba bdun gyis bskor ba/ rin po che'i dra bas kun nas yog pa na gnas te; glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa de yang thams cad du dkar ba gangs kyi mdog ltar 'dug pa/ gser gyi rgyal mtshan can/ gser gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gser gyi phyang phrul gyis klubs pa; gser gyi dra bas bkab pa/ dril bu'i dra ba brgyus pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi dra bas sna kun nas bkab pa/ rin po che'i dril bu'i phreng ba kun nas brgyus pa/ yan lag bdun shin tu gnas pa; mche ba drug dang ldan pa/ yid du 'ong ba/ gzugs dang kha dog mi mthun pa med pa/ blta na skyo mi shes bar sdug pa/ rnam par dag pa/ rigs dang ldan pa/ cang shes pa/ yid bzhin du byed pa ste/

“It is like the case of the king of elephants, who lives in a jewel cave in a gold mountain; the cave has jewel railings all around, jewel trees in rows, gold nets covering above. The elephant’s body is pure white, like jade or snow, and sports gold banners; it is ornamented with gold, and a jewel net covers its trunk, with jewel bells hanging down. Its limbs are fully developed, and it has six tusks; it is dignified and handsome, pleasing to all who see it. It is well trained and docile.

de ni lha'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bdag po brgya byin gyis bsgo na/ gser gyi logs kyi ri lung pa nas mi snang bar gyur te/ sum cu rtsa gsum du lha'i rgyal po brgya byin la rim gro bya ba'i phyir 'ong ngo/ /
de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa la zhon par gyur pa na/ de'i tshe glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa de/ rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa sna tshogs ston te/ mgo sum cu rtsa gsum mngon par sprul pa byed do/ / mgo re re la yang mche ba drug drug mngon par sprul pa byed do/ / so re re la yang rdzing bu bdun bdun mngon par sprul pa byed do/ / rdzing bu re re zhing yang pad+mo bdun bdun mngon par sprul pa byed do/ / pad+mo re re la yang lha'i bu mo brgya phrag bdun bdun mngon par sprul pa byed do/ / lha'i bu mo de dag thams cad kyang lha rdzas kyi rol mo stong phrag du ma'i sgra 'byin pas lha'i dbang po brgya byin la rim gror byed do/ / lha'i dbang po brgya byin yang shugs dang ldan pa'i rim gro dang / sprul pa la longs spyod pa'i phyir chu klung phyogs mtshams zhes bya ba'i ngogs nas puN+Da ri ka gcig gis khebs pa zhes bya ba'i bza' shing gi ra bar 'gro'o/ / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin puN+Da ri ka gcig gis khebs pa'i bza' shing gi ra bar phyin nas glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa las babs te/ khang pa rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan dang / snying po can na gnas shing lha'i bu mo mtha' yas pa dang rtse'o/ / de nas glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pas lus sna tshogs kyi rdzu 'phrul brtul te/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang puN+Da ri ka gcig gis khebs pa'i bza' shing gi ra ba de na/ lha mo rnams dang lhan cig rtse dga' zhing dga' bar spyod do/ / de ltar glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa rtse dga' zhing dga' bar spyod pa'i tshe/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dang lus mtshungs par gnas pas/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dang / glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa'i lus zhes lus kyi khyad par med do/ / gzugs zhes gzugs kyi khyad par med do/ / kha dog ces kha dog gi khyad par med do/ / gzi brjid ces gzi brjid kyi khyad par med do/ / 'od dang / rgyan dang / gos dang / rtsed mo dang / longs spyod dang / blta ba dang / tshul gyis kyang khyad par gang yang med do/ / glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams su 'di dag ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'o/ / 'di dag ni glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par brtag tu med do/ / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan par 'dra'o/ / glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams su 'dra'o; ;

If the emperor of gods wants to go somewhere, the elephant immediately knows his intention and disappears from the jewel cave to appear in heaven before the emperor of gods. By magical powers it transforms its appearance in various ways, causing its body to have thirty-three heads, magically producing seven tusks on each head, magically producing seven lakes on each tusk, with seven lotus blossoms in each lake, with seven nymphs on each blossom, simultaneously playing a hundred thousand celestial melodies.
At this point the emperor of gods mounts this bejeweled elephant and proceeds from the unsurpassable palace to the flower garden, which is filled with white lotuses. When the emperor of gods gets to the flower garden, he dismounts from the elephant and enters a palace arrayed with all jewels. Attended by countless nymphs, he enjoys their singing and playing. At that point the elephant king again magically conceals his elephant form and appears as a god, having a good time in the lotus garden along with the other gods and the nymphs, his physical features, aura, clothing, comportment, speech, and looks being just like the other gods’, indistinguishable from them, so that it is impossible to tell whether it is the elephant or a god, so similar are they.

kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa/ gser gyi logs kyi ri rin po che bdun gyi rang bzhin gyi lung pa nas dga' ba sna tshogs mngon par sprul pa byas te/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i nang du lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi longs spyod kyi don du 'ongs nas/ lha'i dbang po brgya byin la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang / bkur sti bya ba dang / phu dud bya ba'i phyir sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha dang tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis lha'i dga' ba la spyod pa de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / / smon lam la brtson pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan/ byang chub kyi yan lag bdun shin tu gnas pa/ 'od zer kun tu 'gyed pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dril gyi sgra kun tu sgrog pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa/ chos kyi rgyal mtshan rab tu bsgreng ba'i rgyal mtshan can/ snying rje'i lung pa'i gnas na 'dug pa mthu bo che'i stobs kyi lus kyi khyad par can/ theg pa chen po'i smon lam gyi mche ba dang ldan pa/ drag shul gyi seng+ges bag tsha ba med pa/ ye shes kyi rgyud kyi chos kyi cod pa na btags pa/ gsang ba'i gnas thams cad nas rab tu byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis skyo ba med pa'i byang chub kyi shing drung na mos shing spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi rgyun mi gcod pa/ byang chub kyi shing drung du 'dug cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rdzing bu tha dad pa med par mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mngon sum du gyur pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rgya chen po rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / blo rnam par sangs rgyas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam mngon par sgrub cing rgyun mi gcod pa/ lhod par mi byed pa/ phyir ldog par mi byed pa/ snying rje chen po mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam par 'phel bar byed pa/ smon lam chen po'i theg pas sems can thams cad kyi ris na kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la mngon par gnas shing / brtson 'grus yongs su mi gtong ba/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su bsal ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lam yongs su chad par mi byed kyang / byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang mi rgya ste/ rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sgo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / bsgom pa'i bsam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / zhing 'byams klas pa sna tshogs kyi gnas su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sgo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs 'byams klas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag tu skye bar snang ngo; ; byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyad pa spyod par snang ngo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par sangs rgyas pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas kun nas bskor ba dag gi zhabs kyi drung du 'gro bar snang ngo/ / phyogs 'byams klas pa dang / phyogs mtshams 'byams klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po rgya mtsho dag tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ skad cig gcig lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas yud tsam zhig lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas dus gzhan du gyur pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas nyi ma gcig lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas zla ba phyed lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas lo gcig lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas lo grangs med pa lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa gcig lon pa dang / mngon par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed lon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi zhabs kyi drung du nye bar 'gro'o/ / de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gro byed do/ / mchod pa byed do/ / phyag 'tshal lo/ / rab tu 'dud do/ / sangs rgyas rnams la zhu ba byed do/ /

“That elephant king, in its jewel cave in the gold mountain, without any transformation, goes to heaven to make offerings to the emperor of gods, produces various enjoyable things, and experiences celestial pleasures no different from the gods. Similarly, for great enlightening beings, cultivation of the practice of the vows and concentrations of the Universally Good enlightening being are their ornaments of jewels; the seven limbs of enlightenment are the enlightening beings’ bodies; the lights they emanate are nets; they set up the banner of the great Teaching, ring the bells of the great Teaching. Great compassion is their cave, steadfast great vows are their tusks. Knowing and wise, fearless as lions, their heads are wrapped with the turban of truth. They reveal mysteries and reach the other shore of the practice of vows of enlightening beings. Wanting to sit on the seat of enlightenment, achieve universal knowledge, and attain perfect enlightenment, they develop and expand the great undertakings of Universal Good without retreating, without resting, without stopping, without giving up great compassion, energetically liberating suffering sentient beings for ever and ever, not giving up the path of Universal Good, actualizing perfect enlightenment. They manifest untold numbers of doors to attainment of true awareness, reveal untold cycles of teaching, manifest untold doors of profound determination, and in untold vast lands show the door of manifestation of nirvana. They appear to live in untold different worlds cultivating the practice of Universal Good; they manifest untold buddhas attaining perfect enlightenment under enlightenment trees in untold lands, with untold congregations of enlightening beings drawing near and encircling them, sometimes attaining true enlightenment after cultivating Universally Good practice for an instant, or for a moment, or for an hour, or for a day, or for a fortnight, or for a month, or for a year, or for countless years, or for an eon, and so on, up to attaining true enlightenment after untold eons of cultivating Universally Good practice. Also they are leaders in all buddha-lands, approaching the buddhas, paying respects to them and presenting offerings to them and soliciting teaching.

rnam par 'phel ba'i sgyu ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi zhing yongs su sbyong zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa mtha' yas pa dang / ye shes brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes yangs pa sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par bsgrub pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu mtha' dang dbus med pa sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa la rnam par rtse ba sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos snang ba rnam par dag pa'i tshul sna tshogs kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis thams cad du spyod par snang ngo/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i rdzu 'phrul dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i tshul gyis sngon gyi mtha' yang 'jig par mi byed de/ 'khor ba'i 'khor lo rgyun bcad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi rgyud kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul rjes su dran par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgra dang / chos thams cad kyi rgyu phyogs kyi rgyud dang / chos kyi lus thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yang dag par gzung ba'i rgyud khong du chud cing yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / kun tu bzang po'i rgyud kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / khyu mchog gi mthu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam par dag par byed do/ /
kye/ rgyal ba'i sras dag /ltos dang / de ltar kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su chad pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snang ba nyams pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad yongs su blta ba'i phyir/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa rgya chen po 'byung zhing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung pa myong bar byed pa ngo mtshar mi che'am/
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /glang po'i rgyal po'i shugs dang ldan pa de ni glang po'i gnas nas kyang 'pho ba med la/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi skye ba'i skye mched du yang rab tu skye'o/ / bzhon pa'i dngos por yang rnam par spyod do/ / lha'i rtse ba la yang yongs su spyod do/ / rim gro bya ba'i tshul yang yongs su mi spong ngo/ / lha'i bu mo rnams dang yang kun tu rtse'o/ / lha rnams dang yang mtshungs shing mnyam ste/ rnam pa tha dad pa med do/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa theg pa chen po yang yongs su mi gtong zhing shi 'pho ba yang med la/ sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba la yang rab tu spyod do/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang rnam par rtse'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa yang rab tu shes so/ / chags pa med pa nyid kyang mngon par sgrub bo/ / chags pa med cing bsgribs pa med pa yang rnam par dag par byed do/ / zhing rnams la yang gnas pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang rlom sems med cing mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go /chos thams cad kyang mnyam pa nyid du byed do/ / mi gnyis pa dang yang 'gal bar mi byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su mi spong ste/ de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' de 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang yang mtshungs shing mnyam la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod pa yin/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /glang po'i rgyal po shugs dang ldan pa de glang po'i yul na yang snang la/ lha'i yul na yang spyod do/ /

They examine the realm of illusion and purify enlightening beings’ infinite practices, infinite knowledges, various miracles, various powers, various kinds of wisdom, various states, various psychic faculties, various freedoms, various liberations, various understandings, and various methods of teaching and training.
“The great enlightening beings’ original bodies do not perish or vanish, but by the power of action and will they appear transfigured in these ways. Why? Because they want to pacify all sentient beings by the free spiritual powers of universal good; to enable untold numbers of sentient beings to attain purity; to cause them to forever cut off the cycle of birth and death; to purify and magnify the worlds; always to see all buddhas; to enter deeply into the stream of all Buddha teachings; to remember the lineage of buddhas of past, present, and future; to remember the teachings and the reality of all buddhas of the ten directions; to cultivate all practices of enlightening beings to fulfillment; to enter the stream of Universal Good and be able to realize omniscience independently.
“You should observe these great enlightening beings not giving up the practice of Universal Good, not stopping the path of enlightening beings, seeing all buddhas, realizing all knowledge, freely employing the elements of omniscience.
Just as the elephant king goes to heaven without leaving its elephant body, is ridden by a god, experiences celestial bliss, romps in celestial play, serves the lord of the gods, and sports with the celestial nymphs the same as the gods, no different,
in the same way, great enlightening beings, not giving up the practices of the Great Vehicle of Universal Goodness, not retreating from their vows, attain the freedom of Buddha, one imbued with universal knowledge, experience the liberation of buddhas, achieve thorough purity without hindrance or obstruction, have no attachments to any worlds, have no discriminatory concepts about the Buddha teaching; though they know all things are equal and nondual, yet they always clearly see all buddha-lands, though they are already equal to the buddhas of past, present, and future, yet they continue to cultivate the conduct of enlightening beings.

de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos rgya chen po dang ldan pa yang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag bas yang dag par gnas pa yin/
“Great enlightening beings live by this great principle of the undertaking of Universal Good: know that these people’s minds are pure.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor rgya chen po/ tshad med pa/ byang chub sems dpa' nye bar spyod pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pas rab tu thob pa/ ye shes chen po la zhugs pa bcu pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /
“This is the great knowledge of the superior mind of the great concentration of the unimpeded wheel, the tenth concentration of great enlightening beings.
'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ting nge 'dzin rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor bcu rnams so/ /
“These are the ten great spheres of concentration practiced by the Universally Good enlightening being, in which great enlightening beings abide.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ ting nge 'dzin bcu'i le'u ste/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'o// //
[34. mngon par shes pa'i le'u]
BOOK TWENTY-EIGHT. The Ten Superknowledges
bam po drug cu tham pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag; bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mngon par shes pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sems can ji snyed skyes pa de dag thams cad kyi sems dang bsam pa'i rgyud rab tu shes so/ / sems bskyed pa rab tu shes so/ / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / rgya chen po dang / rgya chung ngu dang / 'khor ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'khor ba las ldog pa dang / yid bsal ba dang / nyan thos kyi sems dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang / nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dang / mi khom par skye ba rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa yang rab tu shes te/ sems can gyi ris sna tshogs dang / sems can gyi ris du ma rnam par dbye ba dang / rnam par gdags pa 'byams klas pa mang po dag gi sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sems kyis rab tu shes so/ / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong nas/ gzhung de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du skyes pa'i sems can de dag gi bsam pa sems kyis rab tu shes te/

THEN THE GREAT ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good said to the enlightening beings, “Offspring of Buddha, great enlightening beings have ten kinds of superknowledge. What are the ten? By means of knowledge of others’ minds, great enlightening beings know the differences of the minds of living beings in a world system: good minds, bad minds, broad minds, narrow minds, big minds, small minds, minds that go along with birth and death, minds that turn away from birth and death, minds of learners, minds of self-enlightened ones, minds of enlightening beings, celestial minds, water-spirit minds, yaksha minds, titan minds, garuda minds, kinnara minds, mahoraga minds, human minds, nonhuman minds, hellish minds, bestial minds, netherworld minds, hungry-ghost minds, minds of beings in difficult situations. They know distinctly such countless different sentient beings: as in one world, so in a hundred worlds, a thousand worlds, a hundred thousand worlds, a billion worlds, as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-lands—they know distinctly the minds of all beings therein.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la mkhas shing shes pa zhes bya ba ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa dang po'o/ /
This is called great enlightening beings’ first superknowledge, the spiritual power of accurate knowledge of others’ minds.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bar dag na/ sems can shi 'pho ba dang / skye bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste/ bde ba'i lam dang / ngan song dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par ma byang ba dang / de ltar sems can gyi rigs du ma dang / lha'i ris dang / klu'i ris dang / gnod sbyin gyi ris dang / dri za'i ris dang; lha ma yin gyi ris dang / nam mkha' lding gi ris dang / mi'am ci'i ris dang / lto 'phye chen po'i ris dang / mi'i ris dang / mi ma yin pa'i ris dang / dog pa'i ris dang; yangs pa'i ris dang / chung ba'i ris dang / che ba'i ris dang / rnam par dgod pa sna tshogs kyi ris kyi skye ba dang shi 'pho rab tu shes te/ de lha'i mig thogs pa med cing dag la rnam par dag pas sems can rnams las ji ltar bsags pa'i tshul bzhin du yang dag par mthong ste/ bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnam pa ji lta bu myong ba dang / las ji lta bur bsags pa dang / las kyi mngon par 'du bya ba rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / bsam pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu yin pa dang / rtog pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / lta ba ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / spobs pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / rgyu ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / las ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / dmigs pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa ji lta bus rgyu ba de dag thams cad kyang rab tu mthong ngo/ /

“By means of the superknowledge of the unobstructed pure celestial eye great enlightening beings see sentient beings in worlds as many as atoms in untold buddha-lands, dying in one place, being born in another, their good and bad tendencies and courses of action, their virtuous and sinful characteristics, whether they are beautiful or ugly, defiled or pure: they see innumerable sentient beings of such kinds—celestial beings, water spirits, demons, hobgoblins, titans, demigods, serpents, humans, nonhumans, microscopic creatures, gigantic creatures, small groups, and large groups. They clearly see various sentient beings with unobstructed eyes, unerringly seeing whatever deeds they have accumulated, whatever suffering and happiness they experience, whatever mentalities, thoughts, and views they have, whatever languages they speak, whatever their motives and acts, whatever their concerns and productions.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lha'i mig ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa gnyis pa'o/ /
This is called great enlightening beings’ superknowledge of the celestial eye.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas bdag dang / sems can gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bar dag tu gtags pa rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes te/ bdag gi sngon gyi gnas kyang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rjes su dran no/ / sems can gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas kyang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ / bdag ni sngon che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste/ ming ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rus ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rigs ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / kha zas ni 'di za za'o/ / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong bar gyur to/ / zhes bya bar bdag gi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ / sems can 'di ni sngon che ge mo zhig na 'dug 'dug ste/ ming ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rus ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rigs ni 'di zhes bya'o/ kha zas ni 'di za'o/ / bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong bar gyur to/ / zhes bya bar sems can gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bar dag tu gtogs pa rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ / sems can de dag re re zhing yang tshe'i rgyud gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i srid pa'i rgyud rgyu dang bcas/ rkyen dang bcas pa dang / tshe'i rgyud du gnas shing 'dug 'dug pa'i rnam pa sngon gyi mtha' rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas gnas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud dang / byung ba'i rgyud gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang / mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i lus rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs thams cad las rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs bsags pas skye ba'i sgo sna tshogs kyi skye gnas su gyur pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / las dang lta ba sna tshogs kyis sems rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs bskyed pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs gzhan gyis 'byung ba rnam pa tha dad pa'i las kyis rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud gcig gi sems can rnams kyi las ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas na 'dug cing spyod spyod ba rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ / sngon gyi mtha'i bskal pa de dang de dag gi 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ba rnams mtshan ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / byung ni 'di ltar byung ngo/ / 'khor gyi rnam pa ni 'di lta bu'o/ / yab dang yum gyi mtshan ni 'di skad ces bya'o/ / zham 'bring ba'i ming ni 'di skad ces bya'o/ / nyan thos mchog gi zung dang bzang po'i zung gi ming ni 'di skad ces bya'o; ; rigs ni 'di zhes bya'o/ / rgyal po'i pho brang ni ming 'di zhes bya ba nas mngon par byung ste/ byang chub kyi shing ming 'di zhes bya ba'i drung du brten nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas te/ gnas kyi ming 'di zhes bya ba dag na bzhugs shing mdo 'di snyed cig yang dag par bstan to/ / sems can 'di snyed cig gi don mdzad do/ / sku tshe'i tshad 'di tsam zhig gis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yang dag par bstan te/ phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so/ / mya ngan las 'das nas kyang de dag gi chos ni 'di srid cig tu gnas par gyur to/ / zhes mtshan rnam par dgod pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / mtshan de dag re re'i rnam pa yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag byang chub tu thugs bskyed ba dang bcas/ smon lam dang bcas/ spyod pa dang bcas/ 'byung ba dang bcas/ sangs rgyas mchod pa dang bcas/ sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang bcas/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas/ chos kyi 'khor lo dang bcas/ dus gang du byung ba dang bcas/ sku tshe ji srid pa dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba yang dag par bstan pa dang bcas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang bcas/ chos 'bar bar gnas pa dang bcas/ mchod rten rnam par phye ba'i rgyan dang bcas/ sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang bcas par rjes su dran zhing rab tu shes so/ /

“By means of the superknowledge of instant recall of past lives, great enlightening beings are able to know the events of past lives of themselves as well as of the beings in countless worlds over countless eons — where they were born, their names, their castes, their races, their diets, their pains and pleasures. The beginningless development of continuous cycles in the various states of existence through causes and conditions, various classes, various lands, various forms of life, various physical characteristics, various activities, various bonds and compulsions, various mentalities and thoughts, various differences in circumstances of birth — they know all such things as these.
“Also they remember the names, manner of emergence, congregations, parents, attendants, disciples, and foremost two disciples of as many buddhas as atoms in so many buddha-lands in worlds as many as atoms in so many buddha-lands, as many eons ago as atoms in so many buddha-lands, and the cities where they lived, how they left home, the enlightenment trees under which they attained true awakening, where they sat, what scriptures they preached, how they benefited so many beings, how long they lived, what buddha-works they performed, how they passed away into the realm of ultimate nirvana without residue, how long their teachings lasted after their demise—all this they can recall.
“Also they remember as many buddha-names as atoms in untold numbers of buddha-lands, there being to each name as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands, from their first determination establishing their vows, cultivating practices, honoring buddhas, taming sentient beings, their congregations, their teachings, their life spans, their spiritual powers and miracles, and so on, including their entry into nirvana without residue, how long their teaching lasted after their complete nirvana, the setting up of monuments to them, their various adornments, causing sentient beings to plant roots of goodness—all these they are able to know.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ye shes kyi mngon par shes pas sngon gyi mtha'i mur gyur pa'i bskal pa la 'jug pa ste/ gsum pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ third superknowledge, the spiritual faculty of knowing past lives.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma'i mtha'i mur gyur pa'i bskal pa la 'jug ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams re re zhing yang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la rab tu 'jug go ;bskal pa grangs med pa de dang de dag la sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud ji snyed byung ba dang / sems can shi 'pho bar gyur pa ji snyed pa dang / sems can skye ba ji snyed pa dang / sems can gyi srid pa'i rgyud gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ji snyed pa dang / sems can gyi las ji snyed pa dang / rnam par smin pa ji snyed pa dang / dge ba'am/ mi dge ba'am/ 'byung ba'am/ mi 'byung ba'am/ nges pa'am/ ma nges pa'am/ log par nges pa'am/ yang dag par nges pa'am/ bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa'i dge pa'i rtsa ba'am/ bag la nyal ba med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ phun sum tshogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ rgud par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ dge bas yongs su bzung ba'am/ mi dge bas yongs su bzung ba'am/ yang dag par blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ yang dag par ma blangs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'am/ mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sdig pa'i chos sam/ mngon par ma bsgrubs pa'i sdig pa'i chos kyang rung ste/ de dag thams cad rab tu shes so/ / de dag re re la yang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par 'jug go /'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dag re re zhing yang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la rab tu 'jug go /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mtshan 'di zhes bya ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / zhes bya ba nas mtshan rnam par phye ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang po thugs bskyed pa dang bcas/ smon lam dang bcas/ spyod pa dang bcas/ 'byung ba dang bcas; sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gro mdzad pa dang bcas/ sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang bcas/ chos kyi 'khor lo dang bcas/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas/ dus ji lta ba dang bcas/ sku tshe'i tshad ji lta ba dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba yang dag par bstan pa dang bcas; yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang bcas/ chos 'bar bar gnas pa dang bcas/ mchod rten rnam par phye ba'i rgyan dang bcas/ sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang bcas par rjes su dran zhing khong du chud do/ /

“Great enlightening beings, by superknowledge of the eons of the entire future, know the ages in worlds as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands, the deaths and births of all the beings in each age, the continuity of existences, their actions, the results and consequences of their deeds—whether good or not, whether emancipated or not, whether certain or not, whether wrongly focused or rightly focused, whether their basic virtues are together with compulsions or not, whether they have fully embodied basic virtues or not, whether they absorb basic virtues or not, whether they accumulate basic virtues or not, whether they accumulate criminal qualities or not. All of these the enlightening beings are able to know.
“Also they know the whole future of worlds as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands, with as many eons, each eon with as many buddha-names, each name with as many buddhas; they are able to know all such things as the first inspiration and determination of each buddha, their practices, their service to buddhas, their education of beings, their congregations, their teachings, their life spans, their spiritual powers and miracles, and so on, up to their entry into nirvana without remainder, how long their teachings remain in the world after their ultimate nirvana, and the building of their monuments, with various adornments, causing sentient beings to plant roots of goodness.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i mur gyur pa'i bskal pa shes pa la 'jug pa ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bzhi pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ fourth superknowledge, the power of knowing the ages of the entire future.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i rna ba rnam par dag pa mngon par sgrub cing rnam par sbyong / yongs su sbyong / yongs su rdzogs par byed/ yangs par byed/ tshad med par byed/ 'thob par byed/ mngon du byed/ 'od gsal bar byed/ bsgribs pa med par byed/ khong du chud par byed de/ de chags pa med pa'i rna ba mngon par bsgrub pa dang ldan pas/ sgra ji snyed mnyan par 'dod pa de dag rab tu nyan to/ / gang mi 'dod pa de dag ni mi nyan to/ / de shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis bshad pa de dag rab tu nyan to/ / shar phyogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ston pa dang / gsung ba dang / 'chad pa dang / brjod pa dang / rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa dang / ji snyed du smin par mdzad pa dang / ji snyed du 'dul ba dang / ji snyed du dran par bskul pa dang / ji snyed du chos ston pa zab cing yangs la rnam par phye ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa thabs kyi tshul mtha' yas shing rnam par dag la/ tshad med pa la mkhas pa dang ldan pa de dag thams cad rab tu 'dzin to/ / don bzang po dang / yi ge bzang po 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nges pa'i tshig dang bcas pa ji ltar shes par byas pa/ ji ltar khong du chud par byas pa/ ji ltar 'dul bar gyur pa/ ji ltar dmigs par gyur ba/ ji ltar brten par gyur pa/ ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad rab tu 'dzin to/ / yang dag par 'dzin to/ / chud zos par mi byed do/ / zhig par mi byed do/ / thogs par mi byed do;
