; ldog par mi byed do/ / 'phrul par mi byed do/ / rmongs par mi byed do/ / gzhan la rab tu ston cing gzhan gyis khong du chud par byed kyang de la tshig gcig gam/ yi ge gcig kyang 'khrul par mi byed do/ / de de ltar yi ge dang / tshig yan chad du chags pa med pa'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pas 'dzin te/ ji ltar shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi legs par gsungs pa de dag nyan pa de bzhin du/ lho phyogs dang / de bzhin du nub phyogs dang / de bzhin du byang phyogs dang / de bzhin du byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs dang / de bzhin du steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing yang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis gsungs pa rab tu nyan to/ /

“Great enlightening beings develop the unobstructed celestial ear, fully matured, far-reaching, penetratingly sensitive, free from blockage, perceiving without hindrance, thoroughly developed, able to hear or not hear all sounds at will.
“In the east there are as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands; the great enlightening beings are able to receive and hold the pure teachings explained, revealed, exposed, expounded, set up, taught, tuned, recollected, and analyzed by those buddhas, deep and vast, with various differences, their infinite means and skills. Also they are able to remember the meanings and expressions therein, addressed to one person or to many, according to their language, according to their wisdom, according to what they comprehend, according to what is shown, according to what is to be subdued, according to their realms, according to their bases, according to their paths of emancipation; the enlightening beings remember all this without forgetting, without halting, without retreating, without delusion, without confusion, explaining it to others to enable them to attain understanding, ultimately never missing a single point. As in the east, the same is also true of the south, west, and north, the four intermediate directions, and the zenith and nadir.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi thogs pa med pa'i rna ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa lnga pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ fifth superknowledge, that of the unobstructed pure celestial ear.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos po med pa la gnas shing / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa yin te/ mtshan nyid thob pa yin/ mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin/ rgya chen po thob pa yin/ tshad med pa thob pa yin/ mi gnas pa thob pa yin/ sems ltar mgyogs pa thob pa yin/ thub pa med pa thob pa yin/ ldog pa med pa thob pa yin/ mi g.yo ba thob pa yin/ rnam par 'phel ba thob pa yin/ rjes su 'gro ba thob pa yin/ de 'jig rten gyi khams ji srid du ring yang rung ste/ de dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi gsung thos te/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mtshungs pa med pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med pa na bzhugs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed na bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyi gsung nyan to/ / thos nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams der bdag nyid phyin par byed de/ de yang gang na sangs rgyas skye ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i phyogs bcu'i rgyud phyogs rnam pa tha dad par gnas pa dang / phyogs ci 'dra ba'i 'khor sna tshogs spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba'i phyogs kyi tshul dang / smrel zhir rgyu ba'i phyogs kyi tshul dang / phyogs rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi phyogs la 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / phyogs kyi mtshan nyid tha dad par rjes su 'brang bar bya bar sangs rgyas mu med pa skye ba dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa tha dad pa yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas skye ba dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan gzhan dang gzhan yod pa yon tan bye ba sna tshogs kyis rnam par sbyangs pa/ yon tan tshad med pas yongs su rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dag tu rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan yongs su rjod pa byed cing / de dag tu bdag phyin par byed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug kyang 'di nas kyang g.yos pa med do/ / der song ba'ang med la / der yang bdag phyin par rab tu ston cing / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi zhal blta'o/ / de dag la phyag 'tshal lo/ / de dag la 'dud pa byed do/ / de dag la mchod pa byed do/ / de dag la rim gro byed do/ / de dag la bsnyen bkur byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyang yongs su 'dri'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la yang rab tu 'jug go /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyis mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so/ / chos bstan pa'i mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi mtshan ma yang rab tu shes so/ / de dag la mngon par chags pa yang med de/ de dag la yang pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu thob pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing la dmigs pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis 'gro yang 'gro ba dang; sangs rgyas blta ba'i rnam par dmigs pa mthar thug pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las phyir ldog pa med do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal blta ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs par byed pa med do/ / shugs la nyams pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dri ba'i rgyun gcod pa med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bas yongs su yi 'chad pa med do/ / smon lam gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyi yongs su rdzogs par bya ba sangs rgyas kyi rigs 'byams klas pa tshad med pa'i don du zhugs pa las phyir ldog pa med do/ / phyogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de bzhin gshegs pas thugs su chud pa dag tu 'gro zhing yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba la thogs pa med do/ /

“Great enlightening beings abide in superknowledge of insubstantiality, effortless superknowledge, superknowledge of equality, far-reaching superknowledge, measureless superknowledge, independent superknowledge, superknowledge manifesting forms at will, creative superknowledge, superknowledge of nonorigination, undiminishing superknowledge, uninterrupted superknowledge, indestructible superknowledge, enriching superknowledge, superknowledge going anywhere.
“These great enlightening beings, hearing the names of buddhas in all worlds extremely distant—names of buddhas in countless worlds, measureless worlds, worlds as many as atoms in unspeakably many buddha-lands—immediately see themselves where those buddhas are. Some of those worlds are upright, some inverted; they have various forms, locations, differentiations, boundless, unobstructed, various lands, times, eons, infinite qualities, in different arrays; those buddhas appear therein, manifest miracles, and make known their names, infinitely countless, each different: as soon as the enlightening beings hear those buddhas’ names, without moving from where they are they see themselves where those buddhas are, paying respects to and attending those buddhas, asking about the principles of enlightening, entering buddha-knowledge; they are able to apprehend the buddhas’ lands, enlightenment sites, congregations, and teachings, up to the ultimate end, without any attachment.
“In this way they pass as many eons as atoms in untold buddha-lands, reaching everywhere in the ten directions without going anywhere, yet traveling to the lands, seeing the buddhas, hearing the teachings, inquiring after the Way, without stopping or giving up, without rest, without weariness, cultivating the practice of enlightening beings, accomplishing their great undertakings, causing them all to be fulfilled, without regressing, to cause the immense family of buddhas not to come to an end.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi dngos po med pa la gnas shing mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa ste drug pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ sixth superknowledge, that of going to all buddha-lands while dwelling in insubstantiality, without motion or action.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad sna tshogs rab tu shes te/ 'phags pa'i skad shes so/ / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skad shes so/ / lha'i skad shes so/ / klu'i skad shes so/ / gnod sbyin gyi skad shes so/ / lha ma yin gyi skad shes so/ / nam mkha' lding gi skad shes so/ / mi'am ci'i skad shes so/ / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes so/ / mi'i skad shes so/ / mi ma yin pa'i skad shes pa nas/ sems can gyi ris brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can gyi skad rnam pa sna tshogs shes pa dang / sgra dang / tshig dang / brda rnams rab tu shes te / rnam par dgod pa'i mkhas pa thams cad la rab tu 'jug go /brda la 'jug pa thams cad rab tu shes so/ / spyod pa rnam par dgod pa thams cad rab tu shes so/ / skad rnam par dbye ba thams cad rab tu shes so; ; skad rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho thams cad la rab tu 'jug ste/ de ji lta ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug go /ji lta ji ltar sems can gyi khams la 'jug pa de lta de ltar skad rnam par phye ba thams cad khong du chud par byed de/ de la sems can gzhan gyi skad kyis rmongs par 'gyur ba med do// 'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha'i bu nyi ma ni shar ma thag tu gzugs rnam par phye ba'i rgyud thams cad snang bar byed do/ / de nas mig dang ldan pa rnams gzugs de dang de dag mthong pas mtshan ma yongs su 'dzin to/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang skad kyi sprin rnam par phye ba thams cad la 'jug ste/ skad thams cad mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyis skad dang dbyangs kyi tshul mkhas pa la 'jug cing / khong du chud par byed do/ /

“By the superknowledge that skillfully understands the speech of all living beings, the great enlightening beings know the various verbal expressions of beings in as many worlds as atoms in untold numbers of buddha-lands: the words of sages, the words of those who are not sages, celestial words, the words of water spirits, goblins, cherubim, titans, birds, hobgoblins, serpents, humans, nonhumans, and untold numbers of beings—all their words and speech, their individual expressions and various distinctions, the great enlightening beings can know completely.
“Whatever world these enlightening beings enter, they are able to know the natures and inclinations of all the beings therein, and speak to them in accord with their natures and inclinations so that they can understand completely without doubt or confusion. Just as the sunlight when it appears illumines all forms so that all with eyes can see them clearly, in the same way do great enlightening beings with knowledge understanding all speech enter into the masses of all verbal expressions and cause the intelligent to gain thorough understanding of all verbalization.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skad kyi tshul thams cad la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bdun pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ seventh superknowledge, the power of understanding all language.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dang / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po; chos thams cad kha dog dang bral bar rab tu shes te/ tha mi dad pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa med pa'i kha dog dang / bye brag med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dbye ba med pa'i kha dog dang / sngon po med pa'i kha dog dang / ser po med pa'i kha dog dang / dkar po med pa'i kha dog dang / nag po med pa'i kha dog dang / dmar po med pa yang rab tu shes te/ de de bas kyang chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par byed pa'i tshe/ rang gi lus kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan par byin gyis rlob ste/ mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / tshad med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam par dag pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / dpe med pa'i kha dog dang / kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang / yid du 'ong ba'i kha dog dang / mi sdug pa med pa'i kha dog dang / zad mi shes pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu gsal ba'i kha dog dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i kha dog dang / mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / thub par dka' ba'i kha dog dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu mdzes pa'i kha dog dang / dpag tu med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsrungs pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu bsags pa'i kha dog dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i kha dog dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / thogs pa med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu dang ba'i kha dog dang / rnyog pa med pa'i kha dog dang / rab tu gsal ba'i kha dog dang / mdangs dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad zil du brlag pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad zil du rlog par byed pa'i kha dog dang / rab rib med pa'i kha dog dang / mun pa med pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i kha dog dang / sems bde ba'i kha dog dang / mtshan sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / che ba nyid dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / spyod yul dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i kha dog dang / mchog tu byung zhing rgya che ba'i kha dog dang / thub pa med pa'i kha dog dang / gnas pa med pa'i kha dog dang / kun tu mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med par rab tu 'dal ba'i kha dog dang / rnam par 'phel ba'i kha dog dang / snying po bzung ba'i kha dog dang / yon tan mchog dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / yid bzhin gyi kha dog dang / mos pa rnam par sbyong ba'i kha dog dang / tshogs shin tu bsags pa'i kha dog dang / chos bsgribs pa med par shin tu rtogs pa'i kha dog dang / nam mkha' ltar 'od dang ba'i kha dog dang / rnam par dag pas brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / dri ma med pa'i kha dog dang / rdul dang bral ba'i kha dog dang / rdul med pa'i kha dog dang / dri ma med pa'i kha dog dang / mtshungs pa med pa'i kha dog dang / blta na bzang ba'i kha dog dang / kun nas blta ba'i kha dog dang / dus bzhin du yang dag par ston pa'i kha dog dang / rab tu zhi ba'i kha dog dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i kha dog dang / 'od shin tu gsal ba'i kha dog dang / bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa'i kha dog dang / bde bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / 'jigs pa med par byed pa'i kha dog dang / gti mug med par spyod pa'i kha dog dang / ye shes kyis rnam par gnon pa'i kha dog dang / chags pa med pa'i lus kyi kha dog dang / lus kyi rgyan kun tu mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / don yod pa'i kha dog dang / byams pa chen pos yang dag par 'phags pa'i kha dog dang / snying rje chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i kha dog dang / tshul mthun par 'byung ba'i kha dog dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / rjes su dran par bya ba'i kha dog dang / rin po che na mtha' yas pa'i kha dog dang / rin po che'i dam pa rnam par snang ba'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad dad par byed pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon du gyur pa'i kha dog dang / bzhin 'dzum pa'i kha dog dang / rin po che'i rgyan gyi dam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / sems mi gnas pa'i kha dog dang / gnas med pa'i kha dog dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i kha dog dang / rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du mas khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i kha dog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par byung ba'i kha dog dang / 'dri ba med pa'i kha dog dang / chos kyi dbyings su 'dal ba'i kha dog dang / 'khor ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i kha dog dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi kha dog dang / shin tu grub pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu sbyangs pas rab tu byung ba'i kha dog dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du spyod pa lam ston pa'i kha dog dang / blta na mi ngoms pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa sna tshogs su 'od gsal ba'i kha dog dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba grangs med pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i kha dog dang / 'od sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i kha dog dang / dri zhim po dang 'od bsam gyis mi khyab pas khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba'i kha dog dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'i 'od zer gyis tshad med par snang ba'i kha dog dang / 'khor lo dpe med pa'i gzugs byin gyis rlob pa'i kha dog dang / me tog gi sprin yid du 'ong ba mtha' yas pa rab tu 'thor pa'i kha dog dang / phreng ba'i sprin gyi pad+mo sna tshogs su bsgrubs pas yang dag par brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i kha dog dang / spos zhim po thams cad kyi gsung 'byung bas spos 'phro ba 'gyed pa'i kha dog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzod spu nas byung ba'i kha dog dang / sgra dbyangs brjod du med pas chos thams cad bstan pa yang dag par ston pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i kun tu bzang po'i kha dog tu bdag gi lus byin gyis rlob ste/ kye ; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni kha dog med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pas mthong bas 'dul ba dang / rjes su dran pas 'dul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor los 'dul ba dang / dus kyis 'dul ba dang / skad cig gis 'dul ba dang / bsnyen bkur bas 'dul ba dang / khong du chud par bya bas 'dul ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dul ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis 'dul ba dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pas 'dul ba rnams la rnam pa de lta bu'i kha dog tu rang gi lus byin gyis rlob bo/ /

“Great enlightening beings, by the superknowledge of production of arrays of infinite physical forms, know that all phenomena are apart from physical forms, have no signs of distinction, have no signs of variety, have no signs of infinity, have no signs of discrimination, have no signs of color. Enlightening beings thus entering the realm of reality can manifest their bodies in various forms: that is, for example, boundless forms, infinite forms, pure forms, adorned forms, all-pervasive forms, incomparable forms, all-illumining forms, predominating forms, non-antagonistic forms, forms with various characteristics, forms free from all that is bad, majestic forms, honorable forms, inexhaustible forms, forms with myriad interwoven subtleties, extremely beautiful forms, immeasurable forms, well-guarded forms, forms able to bring about maturation, forms changing according to those who are taught, uninhibited forms, very clear forms, unsullied forms, extremely pure forms, forms of great strength, forms with inconceivable skills, incorruptible forms, flawless forms, unclouded forms, well-settled forms, superbly arrayed forms, forms with handsome features, forms with various minor refinements, forms of great nobility, forms of marvelous realms, well-polished forms, forms with pure determination, forms of blazing refulgence, forms of supreme grandeur, uninterrupted forms, independent forms, peerless forms, forms filling unspeakably many buddha-lands, increasing forms, steadfast, receptive forms, forms of supreme qualities, forms that accord with inclinations, forms of pure understanding, forms of accumulated splendors, forms of skillful ascertainment, forms without solidity, forms of spacious clarity, pure delightful forms, untainted forms, incalculable forms, forms wondrous to behold, forms seen everywhere, forms appearing according to the time, tranquil forms, dispassionate forms, forms of fields of blessings, forms able to create peace, forms removing all fear, forms free from foolish actions, forms of wisdom and courage, forms with physical characteristics free from resistance, forms traveling everywhere, forms with minds not relying on anything, forms created by great kindness, forms manifested by great compassion, impartially emancipating forms, forms replete with blessed qualities, forms according to thoughts in the mind, forms of boundless jewels, forms of the lights within jewels, forms trusted by sentient beings, forms in which omniscience appears, forms with happy eyes, forms of the foremost arrays of jewels, forms without location, forms freely manifested at will, forms of various spiritual powers, forms of those born in the family of buddhas, forms beyond all comparisons or metaphors, forms pervading the cosmos, forms to which the masses flock, various forms, forms of perfection, forms of emancipation, forms adapted to those to be taught, forms of dignified conduct, forms that one never tires of seeing, varied clear, pure forms, forms able to emanate countless webs of light, forms of untold various differentiations of light, forms of inconceivable fragrances and light beyond the world, forms of radiance of light of innumerable suns, forms showing incomparable lunar bodies, forms of clouds of innumerable pleasant flowers, forms producing arrays of clouds of garlands of all kinds of lotus blossoms, forms of fragrant flames beyond all worlds perfuming everywhere, forms producing all embryos of enlightenment, forms with untold voices revealing and expounding all truths, forms fulfilling all the practices of Universal Good.
“Great enlightening beings entering deeply into this formless cosmos of reality are able to manifest such various form bodies, to cause those to be taught to see, to cause those to be taught to remember, to operate the cycles of the Teaching for those to be taught in accord with proper timing for those to be taught, in accord with the characteristics of those to be taught, to cause those to be taught to draw near, to cause those to be taught to awaken, producing various miracles for those to be taught, manifesting various powers for those to be taught, doing whatever they can for those to be taught.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi kha dog grangs med pa'i lus mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyan ces bya ba/ mngon par shes pa'i ye shes 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'grel ba la brtson pa ste brgyad pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ eighth superknowledge, of countless form bodies, diligently cultivated and perfected for the purpose of liberating all living beings.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad bdag med par rab tu shes so; / chos thams cad rigs med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'ong ba med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'bral ba med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad bye brag med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad tha dad pa med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad gnyis su byar med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mi gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad bdag nyid med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'dra ba med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'gro ba med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad ma skyes par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad ma 'gags par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'pho ba med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'jig pa med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad bden pa med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rdzun pa med par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad yod pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad med pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad chos kyang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad spyod pa la gzhol ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad spyod pa la mi gzhol ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad las kyang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad las ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med par yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad brda yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad brda ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad don dam pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad don dam pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mi 'byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'byin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad mi 'byin pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad tshad med par yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad tshad med pa ma yin par yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'jig rten pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rgyu las byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rgyu las ma byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad kha dog nges pa med par yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad kha dog nges pa med pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad kha dog yongs su grub pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad kha dog yongs su ma grub pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad byung ba'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad byung ba ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rnam par brtags pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad rnam par ma brtags pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad tshul yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad tshul ma yin pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / de ni spyod pa la mngon par chags pa med do/ / don dam pa la gnas pa med do/ / chos la rab tu rtog pa med do/ / yi ge yongs su sgrub pa med do/ / zhi ba'i rjes su shin tu 'brang ngo/ / smon lam yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / don gyi tshul la rnam par lta'o/ / chos kyi tshul la rab tu 'jug go /chos kyi sprin kun nas slong ngo/ / chos yongs su 'bab pa'i yi ge'i char mngon par 'phebs[ \[*]'bebs?] so/ / tshul brjod du med pa la 'jug go /tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa zad mi shes pa don gyi tshul rab tu brjod cing / chos kyi tshul mngon par ston pas chos thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pa dang / chos thams cad spobs pas thabs mkhas pa'i tshul brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la rab tu 'jug go /byams pa chen po rnam par dag pa dang ldan zhing / snying rje chen po rab tu thob pa yi ga med pa'i yul dang ldan pa yi ges mngon par bsgrubs pa'i don la brtson zhing / 'gal ba med pa rang bzhin gyis chos la brtson pa chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par byung par ston pas gos pa med pa/ brjod pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i spobs pa dang ldan pa/ de chos thams cad zad mi shes pa'i spobs pas ston to/ / brjod do/ / rnam par 'god do/ / yang dag par ston to/ / 'grel to/ / rnam par 'byed do/ / 'byin to/ / khong du chud par byed do/ / rab tu ston to/ / rtogs par byed do/ / rab tu sgrub bo/ / rnam par sbyong ngo/ / the tshom sel to/ / dogs pa gcod do/ / de kho na ston to/ / rang bzhin brjod do/ / 'gro ba la phan 'dogs so; ; chos nyid las mi nyams so/ / mi gnyis pa la 'jug go /chags pa med pa'i sgo ston to/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag thams cad yang dag par bsgrubs pas rab tu 'joms pa'i sgras sgra'i char yang bsam pa ji lta ba'i dus las yol bar mi byed par mngon par 'bebs so/ /

“By superknowledge of phenomena, enlightening beings know all phenomena are nameless, without essence, neither come nor go, are neither different nor not different, neither various nor not various, neither dual nor nondual, have no identity, have no compare, are not born, do not perish, do not shift, do not disintegrate, have no reality, have no falsehood, are of one form which is formless, are not nonexistent, are not existent, are not phenomenal, are not nonphenomenal, are not in conformity with conventions, are not not in conformity with conventions, are not actions, are not not actions, are not consequences, are not not consequences, are not compounded, are not uncompounded, are not absolute, are not nonabsolute, are not the path of enlightenment, are not not the path of enlightenment, are not emancipation, are not not emancipation, are not a certain measure, are not measureless, are not mundane, are not not mundane, are not born from cause, are not not born from causes, are not definite, are not indefinite, are not complete, are not incomplete, are not emerging, are not not emerging, are not distinguished, are not indistinguishable, are not logical, are not illogical.
“These great enlightening beings do not grasp conventional truth, do not dwell in absolute truth, do not discriminate phenomena, do not set up words; they accord with the essence of extinction, yet they do not give up their undertakings. Seeing what is true and knowing the principles thereof, they spread clouds of teaching and shower rains of teaching. Though they know the character of reality cannot be verbally expressed, yet by expedient means and endless intellectual power they teach in an orderly fashion according to principles and according to meanings. Because they have mastered the skills of verbal explanation of phenomena and principles, their great kindness and compassion purified, they produce words for all things that are actually beyond words, according to their principles and meanings, without contradiction, explaining that all things arise from conditions. Though they do use words to explain, yet they are not attached to them at all. They explain all things, with endless intellectual power, analyzing, defining, revealing, guiding, causing the nature of all things to be fully revealed, cutting through the web of doubts, causing all to be clarified. Even while they take care of sentient beings, they do not abandon true reality. They do not regress from nonduality, and they are always able to expound the reality of nonobstruction. By means of myriad subtle nuances they adapt to the minds of sentient beings, showering the rain of truth on all according to proper timing.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad shes pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa ste dgu pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ ninth superknowledge, knowledge of all phenomena.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems skad cig re re zhing chos thams cad 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rgyud mi gcod do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i las kyang thogs par mi byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po las kyang rnam par mi 'dra'o/ / snying rje chen po las kyang phyir mi ldog go /pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang rgyun mi gcod do/ / zhing thams cad rab tu dbye zhing mkhas par bya bas kyang skyo bar mi byed do/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i smon lam yang rgyun mi gcod do/ / chos kyi 'khor lo yang thogs par mi byed do/ / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dul bar bya ba yang ring du mi spong ngo/ / sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gro bya ba'ang rgyun mi gcod do/ / chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i sgo las kyang phyir mi ldog go /sangs rgyas mthong ba'i skal pa med par yang mi 'gyur ro/ / chos thams cad yongs su dri ba las kyang phyir mi ldog go /mnyam pa nyid dang bstod pa yang rab tu shes so/ / bsgribs pa med pa yang mngon par sgrub bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la khyad par gyi smon lam mnyam pa nyid kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / zhing thams cad kyi gzhi dang dbyings tha dad pa'i rjes su'ang rab tu 'jug ste; sangs rgyas kyi rigs thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang thob pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud de dang / de dag tu chos thams cad sprul pa lta bur bslab pa'ang shin tu bslabs pa yin/ chos thams cad mtshan ma med par zhugs pas/ chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang ldan pa yin/ chos thams cad lus med pa'i tshul dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul dang / spyod pa'i tshul khong du chud pa dang yang ldan pa yin/ chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba la mi gnas pa yin/ chos kyi tshul thams cad rab tu rtogs shing bsam pa dang / dbang po ji lta ba'ang rab tu rtogs pa yin/ de 'dod na bskal pa dang / bskal pa gcig dang / bskal pa brgya dang / bskal pa stong dang / bskal pa khrag khrig dang / bskal pa khrag khrig brgya dang / bskal pa khrag khrig stong dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig stong dang / bskal pa tshad med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / kun tu mtha' yas pa dang / mu med pa dang / sa mtshams med pa dang / bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par chos thams cad 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gcig la snyoms par zhugs kyang de'i lus 'jig par mi 'gyur ro/ / nyam chung par mi 'gyur ro/ / skal ba zhan par mi 'gyur ro; ; chud mi za'o/ / rnam par chud mi za'o/ / zhum par mi 'gyur ro/ / rnam par zhum par mi 'gyur ro/ / zad par mi 'gyur ro/ / dngos po yod pa dang med par mi 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyang brjod do/ / sems can gyi dus kyang yongs su mi spong ngo/ / sems can 'dul ba'i dus la bab pa yang thogs par mi byed do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid kyang rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sems can thams cad kyi don kyang yongs su mi gtong ngo/ / sprul pa'i rgyud kyang rgyun mi gcod do/ / mi g.yar lta bu'i chos kyi tshul las kyang ldog par mi byed do/ / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sa las kyang mi g.yo'o/ /

“By the superknowledge of concentration on the extinction of all things, great enlightening beings enter into concentration on the extinction of all things in every moment; yet they do not retire from the Path of enlightening beings, they do not give up the tasks of enlightening beings, they do not abandon the heart of great kindness and compassion. They cultivate the transcendent ways unceasingly and investigate all buddha-lands tirelessly. They do not give up the vow to liberate sentient beings, do not stop the work of turning the wheel of the Teaching, do not abandon the activity of civilizing sentient beings, do not give up the practice of honoring and serving the buddhas, do not abandon the door of mastery of all teachings, do not give up seeing all buddhas, do not abandon always listening to all their teachings. They know all things are equal and do not hinder one another. They freely accomplish all Buddha teachings, and attain fulfillment of all their excellent vows. They know the differentiations of all lands. They enter the family of buddhas and reach the other shore. They are able to study all things in each world and comprehend that all things are signless; they know all things come from conditions and have no intrinsic being of their own, nevertheless they explain them expediently according to conventional usage. Though their minds do not dwell on anything, yet in accord with sentient beings’ faculties and dispositions they expediently explain all kinds of things.
“When these enlightening beings are in concentration, they may remain in concentration for an eon, a hundred eons, a thousand eons, a million eons, a billion eons, a trillion eons, or any number of eons, if they wish. When the enlightening beings enter this concentration on the extinction of all things, no matter how many eons they pass in this concentration, their bodies do not disintegrate, waste away, or change. They are neither visible nor invisible. They do not pass away, decay, or tire out—it is inexhaustible. Though they do nothing at all in respect to existence or nonexistence, yet they are able to accomplish the tasks of enlightening beings: that is to say, they never abandon sentient beings, teaching and harmonizing them according to proper timing, causing them to increase in all enlightened qualities; they attain fulfillment of all practices of enlightening beings, and for the sake of aiding and benefiting all sentient beings they ceaselessly work miracles. Like rays of light, they appear everywhere while remaining silent and unmoving in concentration.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad 'gog pa zhes bya ba ste/ ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bcu pa'o/ /
“This is called great enlightening beings’ tenth superknowledge, of concentration on the extinction of all things.

de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni/ lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ nyan thos thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ lus kyi las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ ngag gi las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ yid kyi las bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin/ ye shes kyi spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag bstan par mdzad cing bshad pa dang / gnas de dag dgod par mdzad de khong du chud par mdzad pa dang / mngon par shes pa de lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa dang / brjod pa dang / bshad pa dang / rab tu bkod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / brjod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bkral ba dang / rab tu bstan pa dang / yongs su brjod pa ni gtogs so/ /

“Great enlightening beings abiding in these ten kinds of superknowledge are inconceivable to any celestial or human beings, to any sentient beings, to any Buddhist disciples, individual illuminates, or even to other enlightening beings. The physical, verbal, and mental actions of these great enlightening beings are inconceivable; their freedom in concentration and the realms of their knowledge, too, are inconceivable. Only the buddhas and the enlightening beings who also have attained these superknowledges are able to tell of the virtues and sing the praises of these people.

kye; rgyal pa'i sras dag /bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon par shes pa ste/ de dag la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni/ dus gsum thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa bsgribs pa med pa rab tu 'thob bo/ /
“These are the ten superknowledges of great enlightening beings. If great enlightening beings abide in these superknowledges, they will completely attain superknowledge unhindered in all times.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ mngon par shes pa'i le'u ste/ sum cu rtsa bzhi pa'o// //
[35. bzod pa'i le'u]
BOOK TWENTY-NINE. The Ten Acceptances
bam po drug cu rtsa gcig pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos/ yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bzod pa thob pa ste/ bzod pa thob pa de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ bzod pa thams cad kyis bsgribs pa med pa thob pas sangs rgyas kyi chos zad mi shes pa/ bsgribs pa med pa thams cad thob par 'gyur pa dag go / bcu gang zhe na; 'di lta ste/ sgra khong du chud pa'i bzod pa dang / mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i bzod pa dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bzod pa dang / rmi lam lta bu'i bzod pa dang / sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa dang / sprul pa lta bu'i bzod pa dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i bzod pa'o/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po de rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod pa thob pa ste/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so/ / gsung ngo/ / gsung bar 'gyur ro/ /

THEN THE GREAT ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good said to the enlightening beings, “Offspring of Buddha, great enlightening beings have ten kinds of acceptance. If you acquire these acceptances, you will manage to arrive at the stage of unhindered acceptance.
What are the ten? They are acceptance of the voice of the Teaching; conformative acceptance; acceptance of the nonorigination of all things; acceptance of illusoriness; acceptance of being miragelike; acceptance of being dreamlike; acceptance of being echolike; acceptance of being like a reflection; acceptance of being phantomlike; acceptance of being spacelike. These ten acceptances have been expounded, are being expounded, and will be expounded by the buddhas of past, present, and future.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de la bzod pa dang po sgra khong du chud pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of the voice of the Teaching?

'di lta ste/ chos de dag thos nas mi 'jigs/ mi skrag /skrag par mi 'gyur zhing / dad pa dang / yid ches pa dang / mos pa dang / spro ba dang / 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'brang ba dang; de'i rang bzhin du gnas shing khong du chud par byed pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sgra khong du chud pa'i bzod pa thob pa ste dang po'o/ /

“It means when they hear the teachings expounded by the buddhas, they are not startled or frightened or overawed; they believe deeply, understand, appreciate, aim for, concentrate on, remember, practice, and abide by them. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of the voice of the Teaching.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa gnyis pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ conformative acceptance?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos 'di dag ni mthun pa zhes bya bar rtog go /dpyod do/ / mnyam par byed do/ / mi 'gal bar byed do/ / chos de dag la ji ltar mthun par 'jug par bya ba de ltar rnam par sgom mo/ / bsam pa rnam par dag par byed do/ / mnyam par byed do/ / brtson par byed do/ / rtogs par byed do/ / rab tu sgrub bo/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa ste gnyis pa'o/ /

“It means they contemplate the Teaching, investigate it, impartially conform to it without opposition, comprehend it, purify their minds, live correctly by the Teaching, apply it, enter into it, and fulfill it. This is called great enlightening beings’ second acceptance, that of conforming to the Teaching.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa gsum pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of the nonorigination of things?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdul tsam gyi chos kyang gang yang skyes par mthong ba med do/ / chos gang yang 'gag par mthong ba med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o/ / gang ma 'gags pa de ni mi zad pa'o/ / gang mi zad pa de ni rdul med pa'o/ / gang rdul med pa de ni tha mi dad pa'o/ / gang tha mi dad pa de ni gzhi med pa'o/ / gang gzhi med pa de ni zhi ba'i sa'o/ / gang zhi ba'i sa yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o/ / gang 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'o// gang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa de ni smon pa med pa'o/ / gang smon pa med pa de ni gnas pa med cing len pa med pa ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa ste gsum pa'o/ /

“These great enlightening beings do not see that there is anything at all that originates and do not see that there is anything at all that perishes. Why? If there is no origination, there is no perishing; if there is no perishing, there is no extinction; if there is no extinction, they are free from defilements; if they are free from defilements, there is no differentiation; if there is no differentiation, there is no location; if there is no location, there is quiescence; if there is quiescence, there is detachment from desire; if there is detachment from desire, there is no doing; if there is no doing, there is no wish; if there is no wish, there is no dwelling; if there is no dwelling, there is no coming and no going. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of the nonorigination of things.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sgyu ma lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa bzhi pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of illusoriness?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyi sgyu ma lta bur 'jug ste/ chos kyi rnam pa gcig la rnam pa mang por mos par byed do/ / chos rnam pa mang po la chos kyi rnam pa gcig tu mos par byed do/ / de ni chos de dag la sgyu ma'i tshul gyis zhing du yang sgom par byed do/ / sems can du'ang khong du chud par byed do/ / chos kyi dbyings su'ang rtogs par byed do/ / 'jig rten gyi khams su'ang mnyam par byed do/ / sangs rgyas skye bar yang mtshungs par byed do/ / 'jug tu med pa'i tshul gyis kyang rjes su 'jug go /byin gyi rlabs kyi tshul gyis kyang mngon par sgrub bo/ /

“These great enlightening beings know all things are like illusions and arise from causes and conditions. In one thing they understand many things, and in many things they understand one thing. These enlightening beings, knowing the illusoriness of things, comprehend lands, comprehend sentient beings, comprehend the cosmos, comprehend the equality of worlds, comprehend the equality of appearances of buddhas, comprehend the equality of past, present, and future, and accomplish various spiritual powers and mystic transformations.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma ni glang po'i lus la yang mi gnas so/ / rta'i lus la'ang mi gnas so/ / shing rta'i lus la'ang mi gnas so/ / rkang thang gi lus la'ang mi gnas so/ / bud med la'ang mi gnas so/ / skyes pa la'ang mi gnas so/ / rogs po la'ang mi gnas so/ / bu mo la'ang mi gnas so/ / shing la'ang mi gnas so/ / lo ma la'ang mi gnas so/ / me tog la'ang mi gnas so/ / 'bras bu la'ang mi gnas so/ / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung la'ang mi gnas so/ / nyin zhag dang / yud du yan man dang; zla ba dang / lo la'ang mi gnas so/ / lo brgya la'ang mi gnas so/ / zla ba dang nyi ma la'ang mi gnas so/ / bskal pa la'ang mi gnas so/ / zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba la'ang mi gnas so/ / sna tshogs dang rnam pa sna tshogs la'ang mi gnas so/ / gcig pa dang tha dad pa la'ang mi gnas so/ / yangs pa dang dog pa la'ang mi gnas so/ / rgya chen po dang rgya chung ngu la'ang mi gnas so/ / tshad yod pa dang tshad med pa la'ang mi gnas so/ phra ba dang rigs pa la'ang mi gnas so/ / 'khor sna tshogs la'ang mi gnas so/ / 'khor kyang sgyu ma la mi gnas so/ / sgyu ma'ang 'khor la mi gnas te/ sgyu ma kun tu bstan pa dang / sna tshogs kyi sgyu ma rnam pa tha dad pa bstan pa'i grangs su bgrang ba yang yod do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten thams cad la sgyu ma lta bur 'jug cing las kyi 'jig rten dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten dang / zhing gi 'jig rten dang / chos kyi 'jig rten dang / dus kyi 'jig rten dang / rgyud kyi 'jig rten dang / ldan pa'i 'jig rten dang / mi ldan pa'i 'jig rten dang; 'jug pa'i 'jig rten dang / mngon par 'du bya ba'i 'jig rten la 'jug pa'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad la sgyu ma'i rnam par 'jug pas sems can rnams skye bar mi byed do/ / 'jig par mi byed do/ / zhing rnams skye bar mi byed do/ / 'jig par mi byed do/ / chos rnams skye bar mi byed do/ / 'jig par mi byed do/ / 'das pa la mi rtog go /'das pa la rnam par mi rtog go /ma 'ongs pa la mngon par 'du mi byed do/ / ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar mi byed do/ / da ltar byung ba la gnas pa med do/ / da ltar byung ba la chags pa med do/ / byang chub la spyod pa med do/ / byang chub la yongs su rtogs pa med do/ / sangs rgyas 'byung bar mi byed do/ / sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi byed do/ / smon lam la gnas par mi byed do/ / skyon med pa la chags par mi byed do/ / mnyam pa nyid mi len to/ / chags pa med pa mi 'dor ro/ / zhing la chags pa med do/ / tha dad pa med par yang khong du chud do/ / sems can gyi khams kyang mngon par sgrub ste/ sems can gyi khams tha dad pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / chos kyi dbyings kyang khong du chud de/ gnas pa'i chos nyid las kyang mi g.yo'o/ / dus mnyam pa nyid la'ang rab tu 'jug ste/ dus la rnam par rtog pas kyang 'gal bar mi byed do; ; phung po dang skye mched rnams kyang mngon par sgrub ste/ gnas yang dag par gzhom pa yang khong du chud par byed do/ / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par mi byed de; chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid tha dad pa med par yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad brjod du med cing yi ge med par yang rab tu shes te/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pas kyang thogs pa med do/ / sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i don du 'dod pa la'ang chags par mi byed do/ / snying rje chen pos kyang 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro/ / sems can la lta ba'i phyir snying rje chen po yang byin gyis rlob ste/ snying rje chen po'i phyogs la'ang sems can thams cad yongs su 'grel to/ / sngon gyi rgyu'ang rab tu brjod do/ / rgyu 'pho ba med pa'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sgyu ma lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste bzhi pa'o/ /

“Just as illusions are not elephants, not horses, not chariots, not walking, not men, not women, not boys, not girls, not trees, not leaves, not flowers, not fruits, not earth, not water, not fire, not wind, not day, not night, not a day, not a month, not a fortnight, not a year, not a hundred years, not an eon, not many eons, not stable, not confused, not pure, not alloyed, not one, not variegated, not broad, not narrow, not many, not few, not finite, not infinite, not gross, not subtle, not any things at all—variety is not illusion, illusion is not various, yet by illusion are manifested all kinds of different things—in the same way do great enlightening beings look upon all worlds as illusory; that is, the worlds of action, the worlds of affliction, the worlds of lands, the worlds of phenomena, the worlds of time, the worlds of dispositions, the worlds of becoming, the worlds of decay, the worlds of movement, the worlds of creativity. When great enlightening beings see all worlds as like illusions, they do not see beings born or dying, they do not see countries born or perishing, they do not see phenomena born or perishing, they do not see a past that can be differentiated, they do not see a future that has a beginning, they do not see a present that remains for even a moment; they do not examine enlightenment, do not discriminate enlightenment, do not see buddhas emerging, do not see buddhas passing away into nirvana, do not see abiding by great vows, do not see entry into the absolute, do not go out of the essence of equality.
“Though these enlightening beings develop buddha-lands, they know lands have no differentiation; though they develop sentient beings, they know sentient beings have no differentiation; though they examine the cosmos, yet they abide peacefully in the essence of reality, silent and unmoving; though they realize past, present, and future are equal, yet they do not oppose the distinction of past, present, and future phenomena; though they are fully complete in physical, mental, and sense elements, they do not rely on anything; though they liberate sentient beings, yet they know the cosmos is impartial and makes no distinctions, though they know all things are beyond words and cannot be verbally explained, yet they always explain things with inexhaustible powers of analysis, though they are not attached to the work of teaching beings, yet they do not give up great compassion, turning the wheel of Teaching to liberate all; though they reveal to them past causes and conditions, yet they know that conditionality has no movement. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of illusoriness.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi smig rgyu lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa lnga pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being miragelike?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad smig rgyu lta bur rab tu shes te/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ smig rgyu ni yul na'ang mi gnas/ phyogs na'ang mi gnas so/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang yul na yang mi gnas/ phyogs na'ang mi gnas pa'i chos nyid rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten nang na yang mi gnas/ phyi rol na yang mi gnas pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin/ med pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin/ chad pa yang ma yin par rnam par rig par gyur pa rab tu shes so/ / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so/ / nang zhes bya ba nang na gnas pa ma yin pa dang / nang zhes bya ba phyi rol na gnas pa ma yin pa dang / kha dog gcig pa ma yin pa dang / kha dog tha dad pa ma yin pa yang rab tu shes so/ / chos thams cad kha dog med pa'i sa thob par bya ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pa rnams kyi smig rgyu lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste lnga pa'o/ /

“These great enlightening beings know that all worlds are like mirages. Just as mirages have no location, are not inside or outside, not existent or nonexistent, not finite or eternal, not uniform or multiform or formless, but just expressed in conventional terms, in the same way do enlightening beings truly see and know all things, actually realizing this of all things, attaining complete acceptance. This is called enlightening beings’ acceptance of being miragelike.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rmi lam lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa drug pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being dreamlike?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad rmi lam lta bur rab tu shes te/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ rmi lam ni 'jig rten las byung ba yang ma yin/ 'jig rten las 'das pa yang ma yin/ rmi lam ni 'dod pa'i khams kyang ma yin/ gzugs kyi khams kyang ma yin/ gzugs med pa'i khams kyang ma yin no/ / rmi lam ni shi 'pho ba yang ma yin/ skye ba yang ma yin no/ / rmi lam ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang ma yin/ rnam par byang ba'ang ma yin no/ / rmi lam ni lta ba'ang ma yin/ rnam par dag pa'ang ma yin te/ rmi lam snang ba yang med pa'ang ma yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten thams cad 'khrug pa med pa'i tshul gyis rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / tshul dang / rmi lam la mngon par chags pa dang / rmi lam rab tu dben pa dang / rmi lam gyi rang bzhin dang / rmi lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / rmi lam tha mi dad pa dang / rmi lam gyi 'du shes dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rmi lam gyi 'jig rten khong du chud pa lta bur rab tu shes te/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rmi lam lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste drug pa'o/ /

“Here great enlightening beings know all worlds are like dreams. Just as dreams are neither of the world nor apart from the world, not of the realm of desire, not of the realm of form, not of the formless realm, not arising, not disappearing, not defiled, not pure, and yet obviously manifest, in the same way do enlightening beings know all worlds to be like dreams, unchanging, because of being free like dreams, because of clinging like dreams, because of being inherently unconnected like dreams, because of being like the basic nature of dreams, because of being like visions in dreams, because of being undifferentiated like dreams, because of being like thoughts in dreams, because of being as when awakening from a dream. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being dreamlike.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa bdun pa gang zhe na /
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being echolike?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos nyid mngon par bsgrub pa'i bslab pa la shin tu bslabs pa yin te/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgra brnyan ni sgra sna tshogs grags par byed kyang 'pho ba med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung nang na brjod pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung phyi rol na brjod pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so; ; de ltar shes pa de yang nang nas shes pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / phyi rol nas shes pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / phyi nang nas shes pa'ang ma yin par rab tu shes te/ 'on kyang bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pas 'jug pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / tshig kyang rab tu shes so/ / sgra brnyan lta bur rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bas grag par gyur ba'i chos nyid kyang 'khrug par mi byed de/ sgro 'dogs par yang mi byed la/ dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam pa tha dad pa la 'jug cing bslab pa la'ang shin tu bslabs pa yin/

“Here the great enlightening beings, hearing buddhas explain the truth, seeing into the nature of things, applying this practically, achieving realization and reaching the other shore, know that all sounds are the same as echoes, with no coming or going, appearing in this way. The great enlightening beings observe the voice of the buddhas as emerging without emerging from inside or outside or both. Though they understand that this voice does not emerge from inside, outside, or both, yet it is possible to produce skillful expressions to accomplish explanation. Like echoes in a valley, it is produced by conditions and is not at variance with the nature of things. It enables sentient beings each to understand according to kind and to be able to practice this learning.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis lha'i bud med 'grogs ma'i kha'i dbugs kyis lan gcig bus pas; kha'i dbugs yan lag stong dang ldan pa 'byung ngo/ / kha'i dbugs la rnam par rtog pa med kyang dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam pa stong du sgrog go /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rnam par mi rtog pa dang ldan pa'i dbyings la 'jug pa'i tshe/ dbyangs kyi yan lag mtha' yas pa rnam par bsgom pa la mkhas pas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med par 'gro ba thams cad la phyir mi ldog pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la rab tu 'jug cing 'khor rnams la'ang rgya cher yang dag par ston to/ / lce shin tu yangs pa yang byin gyis rlob ste/ dbyangs chags pa med pa yang rab tu brjod do/ / zhing thams cad du 'gengs pa'i dbyangs kyang byin gyis rlob bo/ / sems can rnams kyis mtha' yas par khong du chud par yang byin gyis rlob bo/ / chos rnam par phye ba 'byams klas pa yang rab tu snang bar byed do; ; dbyangs thams cad la 'jug pa med pa yang rab tu shes so/ / sgra rnam par dmigs pa yang rnam par dmigs pa med par rab tu shes so/ / dbyangs sna tshogs kyang rnam par 'god do/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag gi dkyil 'khor khong du chud pas kyang rab tu spyod de/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste bdun pa'o/ /

“Just as the wife of the emperor of gods can produce a thousand tones in one sound without consciously trying to do so, so also do great enlightening beings enter the realm of nondiscrimination, develop a voice that skillfully adapts to different types, and forever turn the wheel of the Teaching in boundless worlds. These enlightening beings skillfully observe all beings and preach to them with a universal tongue, their voices pervading all lands in the ten directions unhindered, causing all to hear the Teaching differently according to their needs. Though they know sound has no origin, they manifest the sound of their voice everywhere; though they know there is nothing to say, they extensively explain all things. Their wondrous voice is impartial, all understand it according to species and type, while the enlightening beings comprehend this all by means of their knowledge. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being echolike.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa brgyad pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being like a reflection?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten nas shi 'pho ba med do/ / 'jig rten du skye ba med do/ / 'jig rten gyi nang na mi gnas so/ / 'jig rten gyi phyi rol na mi gnas so/ / 'jig rten du rgyu ba med do/ / 'jig rten du rgyun chad pa med do/ / 'jig rten dang 'dres pa med do/ / 'jig rten dang tha dad pa med do/ / 'jig rten du 'gro ba med de/ / 'jig rten las grol bar 'gro ba med do/ / 'jig rten du gzhol bar 'gro ba med do/ / 'jig rten las ldog pa med do/ / byang chub sems dpa' de nyid kyang 'jig rten ma yin te/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin no/ / byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod pa'ang ma yin te/ smon lam chen po rgyun gcod pa'ang ma yin no/ / mang ba yang ma yin/ nyung ba yang ma yin te/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par 'thob par bya ba la'ang don yod pa spyod do/ / 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba'ang ma yin no/ / chos kyi rgyud thogs par byed pa'ang ma yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ gzugs brnyan ni nyi ma'am/ zla ba'am/ bud med dam/ skyes pa'am/ shing ngam/ ri'am/ gnas sam/ rtsig pa'am/ sa'am/ chu klung gi rgyud dam/ dngos po sna tshogs mtha' yas pa tshad med pa rnams kyi gzugs gang dang gang yod pa de dag thams cad rnam par dmigs par byed de/ chu'am/ til mar ram/ nor bu'am/ mching bu'am/ me long ngam/ gzhan yang yo byad kha dog dang ba/ mdog gsal ba gang yang rung ste/ de dag shin tu dang ba'i phyir de dag tu gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs par byed kyang gzugs brnyan ni shin tu dang ba'i dbyings de dang 'dres pa yang med do/ / gzugs brnyan de de las gud na 'dug pa yang ma yin no/ / gzugs brnyan de de ltar rnam par dmigs pa dang yang 'grogs ba med do/ / dang pa'i dngos po de yang gzugs brnyan gyis dang 'grogs pa med do/ / gzugs brnyan de chu klung gi rgyun gyis kyang khyer bar mi nus so/ / gzugs brnyan de chu bo'i rgya mtshor 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur ro/ / dang ba sna tshogs de dag gis kyang gzugs brnyan de la gos par mi 'gyur te/ de dag tu gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa'ang yod cing / de dag gis gzung ba 'dra yang gzugs brnyan gang du dmigs par gyur pa des de'i tshe gzung ba med do/ / gzugs brnyan de ni ring bar yang snang nye bar yang snang ste/ de ltar ring ba dang nye bar yang med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang rang gi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gzhan gyi rgyud kyi yul du snang bar byed kyang / 'di ni gzhan gyi rgyud do/ / 'di ni bdag gi ye shes kyi rgyud do/ / 'di ni bdag gi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor to zhes gnyis su mi byed do/ / bdag gi yul dang gzhan gyi yul rnam par dbye ba'ang rab tu shes so/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa bon du gyur pa ni shin tu 'phel zhing skye ba yin te/ chu ba dang / lo ma dang / sbu gu'i gnas su gyur nas rnam par dbye ba'ang yod do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos nyid mi gnyis pa la gnyis kyis mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ye shes la chags pa med pa'i mtha'i tshul gyis rab tu 'jug go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi gzugs brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste brgyad pa'o/ /
bzod pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag tu 'gro ba yang med la/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa dag tu'ang snang ngo/ / 'jig rten gyi khams gang nas kyang g.yo ba med cing / 'jig rten gyi khams gang du'ang 'gro ba med la/ lus kyi dkyil 'khor gzugs brnyan du gyur pa yang kun tu rnam par dmigs par byed de/ rjes su song ba'i lus kyang 'jig rten thams cad du phyin par byed do/ / lus rnam par phye ba chags pa med pas spyod pa'ang rab tu shes so/ / gang yang 'jig rten na 'jig rten gyi mtshan ma dang / 'jig rten dong skom yod pa de dag 'dres pa'ang ma yin/ tha dad pa yang ma yin par rab tu shes so/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par dag pa yang rab tu 'thob bo/ / kha dog mtha' yas pa'i lus thams cad rnam par dag pa yang rab tu thob bo/ /

“These great enlightening beings are not born in the world, do not die in the world; they are not in the world, not outside the world; they do not act in the world, yet are not inactive in the world; they are not the same as the world, yet are not different from the world; they do not go to the world, nor do they not go to it; they do not dwell in the world, nor do they not dwell in the world; they are not worldly or unworldly. They are not cultivating the practices of enlightening beings, yet they do not give up their great vow; they are neither real nor unreal. Though they always carry out all Buddha teachings, yet they are able to manage all mundane affairs; they do not follow the mundane stream, nor dwell in the religious stream.
“Just as the sun, moon, men, women, houses, mountains, rivers, springs, and so on, are reflected in anything clear—in oil, water, a jewel, a mirror, and so on—and the reflections are neither one with nor different from the oil, water, jewel, or mirror, are neither separated nor united, not flowing along in river currents, not sinking in lakes or wells, appearing therein without being affected, and people know that such and such a reflection is in such and such a place and not elsewhere, and, though things far and near cast their reflections, there is no corresponding distance of the images from one another, similarly great enlightening beings know their own bodies and others’ bodies are all spheres of cognition and do not understand them dualistically as self and others, and simultaneously appear in their own lands and other lands. Just as there are no roots, sprouts, stalks, nodes, branches, or leaves in a seed, yet it can produce these things, so also do great enlightening beings distinguish duality in that which is nondual, their skill in means completely fluid and all-encompassing, without blockage. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being like a reflection.
“When great enlightening beings achieve this acceptance, though they do not travel to the lands of the ten directions, yet they can appear in all buddha-lands, neither leaving here nor going there. They are like reflections appearing everywhere, unhindered wherever they go, causing sentient beings to see different bodies with the same appearance of solidity as the world. However, these differentiations are not differentiation—difference and nondifference do not obstruct one another. These great enlightening beings are born from the lineage of the buddhas—their bodies, speech, and minds are pure and unimpeded, so they are able to acquire pure bodies of boundless forms.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sprul pa lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being phantomlike?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten thams cad sprul pa lta bur rab tu 'jug ste/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pas sprul pa dang / bsams te sprul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mngon par 'du byed pas sprul pa dang / rnam par rtog pas sprul pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad kyi phyin ci log gis sprul pa dang / sgro btags pas sprul pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad med pas sprul pa dang / tshig gi lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sprul pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi yongs su rtog pas sprul pa dang / 'du shes kyis sprul pa dang / 'di lta ste/ 'dul ba rnam par byang bar bya ba dang / rnam par dag par bya ba'i yongs su rtog pas sprul pa dang / 'di lta ste/ dus gsum du phyir mi ldog pas sprul pa mnyam pa nyid kyis byung ba med pa dang / 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyis sprul pa spyod pas yangs par byas pa dang / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen pos sprul pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la bstabs par rnam par bkod pa dang / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi 'khor lo dang / thabs mkhas pa'i ye shes kyis sprul pa mi 'jig pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i ye shes kyis 'jug par rab tu shes te/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sprul pa rab tu shes par byed do/ / khong du chud par byed do/ / rtogs par byed do/ / yangs par byed do/ / mtha' dang dbus dang / mu med par ji ltar bskyed pa bzhin du thob par byed do/ / grub par byed do/ / dbang du byed do/ / de kho na nyid du shes so/ / yang dag pa nyid las mi g.yo bar byed do/ / yang dag par lta'o/ / ji ltar spyod pa bzhin du chud mi za bar byed do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sprul pa ni sems las mi 'byung ste/ sems kyi chos las ma byung / las kyis bsgrubs pa ma yin /rnam par smin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin/ 'jig rten du skyes pa ma yin/ 'jig rten du 'gag pa ma yin/ chos kyi rjes su snyegs pa ma yin ;chos thob par byed pa ma yin/ ring du gnas pa ma yin/ yud tsam du gnas pa ma yin/ 'jig rten na spyod pa ma yin/ 'jig rten las 'das pa ma yin/ phyogs su 'gro ba ma yin/ phyogs la gzhol ba ma yin/ tshad yod pa ma yin/ tshad med pa ma yin/ skyo ba ma yin/ skyo ba med pa ma yin/ rgyun chad pa ma yin/ rgyun mi 'chad pa ma yin/ 'phags pa ma yin/ so so'i skye bo ma yin/ kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin/ rnam par byang ba ma yin/ shi 'phos pa ma yin/ skyes pa ma yin/ shes pa ma yin/ mi shes pa ma yin/ snang ba ma yin/ 'jig pa ma yin/ 'jig rten la gnas pa ma yin/ chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba ma yin / mkhas pa ma yin/ shes rab 'chal pa can ma yin/ nye bar len pa ma yin/ nye bar mi len pa ma yin/ 'khor ba ma yin/ mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin/ yod pa ma yin/ med pa ma yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'phrul pa'i byin gyis rlabs la mkhas pas/ 'jig rten na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod de/ 'jig rten gyi chos la lta zhing / bdag mngon par sprul pa byed kyang 'jig rten gyi sprul pa la mngon par chags pa med do/ / bdag gi sprul pa mngon par chags pa med do/ / bdag dang 'jig rten gyi mngon par sprul pa la yongs su rtog pa med do/ / 'jig rten la gnas pa med do/ / 'jig rten rgyun gcod pa med do/ / chos la gnas pa med do/ / chos kyi dbang du 'gro ba ma yin no/ / sems can gyi khams kyang rdul tsam yang 'dul ba med do/ / sems can gyi khams smon lam las yongs su spong ba med do/ / chos de dag la rtog pa med do/ / rnam par rtog pa med do/ / chos de dag la len pa med do/ / chos de dag la 'dor ba med do/ / sangs rgyas kyi chos yod pa ma yin pa de dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed de/ chos de dag kyang yod pa'ang ma yin/ med pa yang ma yin no/ / ji ltar sprul pa de yod pa yang ma yin/ med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang sprul pa lta bu'i bzod pa la gnas shing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyang yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / sems can gyi don kyang rab tu byed do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sprul pa lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste dgu pa'o/ /
bzod pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la mi gnas pa yin te/ ji ltar sprul pa de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la mi gnas par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la dub pa med par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de phyin ci log med cing lus su dmigs pa thams cad la lus med par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de byin gyi rlabs kyis gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi gzugs la mi gnas par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de rang bzhin snang ba'i tshul du yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de chos thams cad la rnam par grol ba'i chos gnas med par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de gnas med pa'i rang bzhin dang / chos thams cad kyi tshul gyi rnam par byang ba la spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor du/ cho 'phrul gyis nye bar 'gro zhing 'gro ba med par spyod pa dang / ji ltar sprul pa de khor yug dang / ri rab thams cad la snang ba bzhin no/ /

“These great enlightening beings know all worlds are like phantoms—that is, all sentient beings are phantoms of mentalization, being created by consciousness and thought; all worldly realms are phantoms of acts and conditioning, being created by discrimination; all pain and pleasure are phantoms of delusion, being produced by arbitrary clinging; all worlds are phantoms of unreal phenomena, being made apparent by verbalization; all afflictions are phantoms of discrimination, being created by thoughts. There is also the phantom of pure pacification, being manifested by nondiscrimination; the phantom of not changing through time, because of the equality of the uncreate; the phantom of enlightening beings’ willpower, because of their extensive practices; the phantom of buddhas’ great compassion, based on expedient demonstrations; the phantoms of means of teaching, being expounded by wisdom, expertise, and intellectual powers.
“Thus do enlightening beings know mundane and transmundane phantoms; they know them by direct experience, with extensive knowledge, boundless knowledge, factual knowledge, independent knowledge, true knowledge, incapable of being overturned by false views, going along with the events of the world without loss or corruption.
“Just as a phantom does not arise from the mind or from mental states, does not arise from action, does not experience consequences, is not born in the world, does not die in the world, cannot be pursued, cannot be grasped or touched, is not long-lasting, is not momentary, is not acting in the world, is not apart from the world, is not bound to one location, is not ubiquitous, is not finite, is not infinite, does not weary or rest, is not unwearying or unceasing, not ordinary, not holy, not defiled, not pure, not born, not dead, not wise, not foolish, not seen, not unseen, not based in the world, not entering the reality realm, not clever, not dull, not grasping, not nongrasping, not birth and death, not nirvana, not existent, not nonexistent, in the same way do enlightening beings course through the world by skill in means, cultivating the path of enlightening beings, knowing worldly phenomena, multiplying their bodies for phantomlike travel, not clinging to the world, not attached to their own bodies, not conceptualizing anything in the world or themselves, not dwelling in the world, not leaving the world, not dwelling on things, not aloof from things. Because of their fundamental vow they do not abandon a single sentient being, they do not guide only a few sentient beings, they do not discriminate things yet are not indiscriminate. They know the nature of things has no coming or going, and though they have no existence, they fulfill the Buddha teachings, knowing everything is like a phantom, neither existent nor nonexistent.
“When great enlightening beings thus abide in acceptance of being phantomlike, they are able to fulfill the path of enlightenment of all buddhas and benefit living beings. This is called enlightening beings’ acceptance of being phantomlike: when great enlightening beings achieve this acceptance, like magicians, everything they do is phantomlike. They do not dwell on anything in any buddha-land, do not cling to the world, tirelessly proceed toward enlightenment without producing false ideas about the Buddha teachings, cultivate the practices of enlightening beings, and get rid of delusion. Though they have no body, yet they manifest all bodies; though they have no abode, yet they abide in myriad buddha-lands; though they have no form, yet they manifest myriad forms; though they do not cling to ultimate truth, yet they clearly perceive the essential nature of things, impartially and completely.
“These great enlightening beings, not relying on anything, are called liberated; having shed all errors, they are called disciplined; entering the congregations of all buddhas everywhere without moving, they are called masters of spiritual power; well versed in the truth of nonorigination, they are called unregressing; imbued with all powers, which even mountains cannot impede, they are called unobstructed.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi nam mkha' lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa bcu gang zhe na/
What is great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being spacelike?

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar zhing thams cad bsgrub pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar 'jug pa med pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar rnam par dbye ba med pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar tha dad pa med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs thams cad la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis bsam gtan thams cad la rab tu 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar brjod du med pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad yang dag par bstan pa la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar chags pa med cing bsgribs pa med pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku la 'jug go /nam mkha' ji lta ba de ltar nam mkha'i dbyings kyi tshul gyis chos thams cad bsal ba med pa la 'jug go /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' lta bu'i chos thams cad la de lta bu'i bzod pa las byung ba'i ye shes kyis 'jug pa'i tshe/ lus nam mkha' lta bur rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i lus kyi las rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i ngag rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i ngag gi las rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i yid rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i yid kyi las rab tu 'thob bo/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni chos thams cad dang ldan te/ 'chi 'pho ba yang med do/ / skye ba yang med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad kyi lus dang ldan te/ 'chi 'pho ba yang med do/ / skye ba yang med do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni gzhi med do; ; tha dad pa med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad shes pas gzhi med do/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs rnams dang / tha mi dad do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi gzhi ste/ rang bzhin med pa dang / yul med pas gzhi'ang ma yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin te/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pas gzhi'ang ma yin no/ / 'di lta ste /dper na; nam mkha' ni skye ba med cing / 'gag pa med kyang 'jig rten thams cad kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa 'dzin to/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jug pa yang med/ yongs su rdzogs pa yang med de/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa yang rab tu ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni phyogs kyang ma yin/ phyogs mtshams kyang ma yin te/ phyogs rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa la'ang yang dag
