par gzhol lo/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang las kyang ma yin/ rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te/ las dang rnam par smin pa rgya mtsho yang yongs su ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni ldang ba med cing 'dug pa med de/ rnam par phye ba mtha' yas pa'ang yongs su ston to/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang / spyod pa yang med/ gnas pa yang med de/ spyod pa rnam par phye ba yang yongs su ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni kha dog kyang ma yin/ kha dog med pa yang ma yin te/ kha dog gi rnam pa'ang yongs su ston to/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten gyi kha dog kyang ma yin/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i kha dog kyang ma yin te/ kha dog mtha' yas pa'ang yongs su ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni ring du gnas pa'ang ma yin/ yud tsam gcig tu gnas pa yang ma yin te/ gnas pa dang yongs su gnas pa'ang rab tu ston to/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang ring du gnas pa yang ma yin/ yud tsam gcig tu gnas pa yang ma yin te /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa dang / yongs su gnas pa yang rab tu ston to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par gyur pa'ang med la/ rnam par byang bas rnam par byang bar gyur pa'ang med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'jig rten la 'jug pas bsgribs pa yang med/ rnam par dag cing gsal bar gyur pa'ang med do/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi mngon sum du gyur pa yin te/ 'jig rten thams cad ni nam mkha'i mngon sum du gyur pa ma yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos thams cad la mngon sum du gyur pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad kyi mngon du gyur pa ma yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni gnas thams cad la rab tu gzhol ba yin te/ nam mkha'i mtha' ni yod pa ma yin no/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang chos kyi gnas thams cad la gnas te/ byang chub kyi sems ni mtha' yod pa ma yin no/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni bdag nyid nam mkha' dang mnyam par byas te yongs su bsgoms pa dang / rnam par sbyangs pa dang / shin tu bsgrubs pa dang / mnyam pa nyid du byas pa dang / rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu byas pa dang / ro gcig tu byas pa dang / tshad gcig tu byas pa dang / nam mkha' lta bur dag pa'i kha dog tu byas pa dang / thams cad du 'gro bar byas pa'i phyir ro/ / chos thams cad la yang dag par sems pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa dang / chos thams cad tha mi dad pa rab tu 'thob par byed pa dang; zhing thams cad du 'gro bar bsgrub pa dang / lus thams cad la gnas pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyogs thams cad la rmongs pa med pa khong du chud par byed pa dang / stobs thams cad tha mi dad par sgrub pa dang / yon tan thams cad yul mtha' yas par yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi 'byung gnas rab tu thob par byed pa dang / dpag tu med pa thob par byed pa dang / rdo rje ltar brtan pa la rab tu gzhol ba dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag tshad med pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du phyin cing chos kyi 'khor lo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro/ /
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi nam mkha' lta bu'i bzod pa thob pa ste bcu pa'o/ /

“These great enlightening beings understand that all phenomena are like space because they are signless; all worlds are like space because they have no origin; all things are like space because they are nondual; all actions of sentient beings are like space because they have no course; all buddhas are like space because they have no discrimination; all buddhas’ powers are like space because they have no distinctions; all meditation concentrations are like space because of equality of past, present, and future; all the principles the buddhas teach are like space because they cannot be explained in words; all buddha-bodies are like space because they have no attachment and no obstruction. In this way enlightening beings, by means of the device of being spacelike, comprehend that all things have no existence.
“When great enlightening beings comprehend all things by the knowledge that recognizes and accepts their spacelike nature, they acquire spacelike bodies, spacelike physical action, spacelike speech, spacelike minds, and spacelike mental action. Just as space, the harbor of all things, is not born and does not perish, so also are all the bodies of realities of great enlightening beings unborn and imperishable. Just as space is indestructible, similarly are the powers of knowledge of great enlightening beings indestructible; just as all worlds rest in space while space rests on nothing, similarly all true teachings rest on great enlightening beings while they rest on nothing. Just as space, without any origin or destruction, can hold the origin and destruction of all worlds, similarly great enlightening beings, without aim or attainment, can show aim and attainment, causing all worldlings to cultivate purity. Just as space, without direction or angles, can manifest innumerable directions and angles, similarly great enlightening beings, without actions or consequences, are able to show all kinds of actions and consequences. Just as space is not walking or standing yet can reveal all kinds of postures and movements, similarly great enlightening beings are not walking or standing yet can differentiate all movements. Just as space is not form and not not form, yet can reveal all kinds of forms, similarly great enlightening beings are not mundane corporeality or transmundane corporeality, yet can manifest all forms. Just as space is not old or new, yet can perdure, revealing all things, similarly great enlightening beings are not ancient or recent, but can perdure, revealing the practices carried out by enlightening beings. Just as space is not clean or dirty, yet is not apart from cleanness and pollution, similarly great enlightening beings are not obstructed or unobstructed, yet are not apart from obstruction and nonobstruction. Just as all worlds appear to space while space does not appear to all worlds, similarly all things appear to great enlightening beings while great enlightening beings do not appear to all things. Just as space penetrates everywhere, without boundaries, similarly great enlightening beings penetrate all things, yet their minds have no boundaries.
“Why is this? Because enlightening beings’ doings are like space. That is to say, all their practices, all their purifications, and all their accomplishments are all impartial, of one substance, one flavor, one essence, of the same measure as space, pure and all-pervasive. Thus do they witness and know all things without fabricated notions of things, purify all buddha-lands, perfect all supporting bodies, comprehend all realms without confusion, embody all powers, which are indestructible, fulfill all virtues, which are boundless, arrive at the realm of all profound truths, master the paths of all ways of transcendence, sit on all adamantine seats of enlightenment everywhere, utter all voices adapting to all species, and operate the cycles of the Teaching for all worlds according to proper timing. This is called great enlightening beings’ acceptance of being spacelike.

bzod pa de dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni/ 'gro ba med pa'i tshul du 'gro ba med pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul du skye ba med pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / 'jig pa med pa'i tshul du 'pho ba med pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / ji ltar mthong ba ma yin pa'i tshul du bden pa med pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / mtshan nyid med pa'i tshul du mtshan nyid gcig pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / sangs rgyas kyi stobs tshad med pa'i tshul du tshad med pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul du mnyam pa nyid kyi lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid khong du chud cing bzod pa'i tshul du tha mi dad pa'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / mnyam pa nyid kyi mig rnam par dag pas bsgribs pa med pa'i tshul du thams cad du 'gro ba'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / chos thams cad ldan pa dang mi ldan pa med pa'i tshul du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'i lus rab tu 'thob bo/ / bsod nams zad mi shes pa'i tshul du nam mkha' ltar mtha' dang mu med pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyis mtshan nyid gcig pa'i tshul du chos nyid mnyam pa nyid thob pas zad mi shes shing thogs pa med pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' ltar thogs pa med pa'i tshul du dbyangs mtha' yas shing tshad med pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' ltar thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i tshul du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la mkhas pa yongs su rdzogs shing rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' ltar rgyun chad pa med pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya mtsho gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa tshad med pa thams cad rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' ltar tshad med cing mthar thug pa med pa'i tshul du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad tshad med pa'i zhing du byin gyis rlob pa rab tu 'thob bo/ / nam mkha' rgya mtsho'i tshul du chos thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rgyun mi 'chad par yang dag par ston pa yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / nam mkha' ltar 'jig rten thams cad 'dzin pa'i tshul du lus thams cad 'jig pa med cing shin tu brten pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ / 'jig rten gyi gdung ba thams cad kyis nam mkha' 'tshig par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul du rdo rje ltar sra zhing brtan la rno ba'i dbang po yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ / nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi tshul du 'jig rten thams cad rab tu 'dzin pa'i stobs la yang dag par 'byung ngo/ /

“When great enlightening beings attain these acceptances, they acquire a body that does not come from anywhere because it does not go anywhere; they acquire a birthless body, having no extinction; they acquire a motionless body, having no disintegration; they acquire an insubstantial body, being beyond falsehood; they acquire a uniform body, being formless; they acquire an infinite body, the power of buddhahood being infinite; they acquire an impartial body, being the same characteristic of Thusness; they acquire an undifferentiated body, seeing past, present, and future as equal; they acquire a body that reaches everywhere, their pure eye perceiving equally, without obstruction; they acquire a body free from the realm of desire, knowing that all phenomena neither form nor dissolve; they acquire a body as boundless as space, their store of virtue being as inexhaustible as space; they acquire a body of endless knowledge of the equality of the nature of things, knowing the forms of all things are one form and their nature is natureless, like space; they acquire a body of infinite, unobstructed sound, being unopposed and unobstructed like space; they acquire a body of pure action of enlightening beings endowed with all skills, being unhindered in all places, like space; they acquire a body of continuity of succession of the oceans of all Buddha teachings, because like space they cannot be brought to an end; they acquire a body manifesting infinite buddha-lands within all buddha-lands, being free from greed and attachment, unbounded as space; they acquire a body ceaselessly manifesting all aspects of miraculous power, being boundless as the sky and ocean; they acquire a body of indestructible durable strength, sustaining all worlds like space; they acquire a body with all senses clear and sharp, indestructible as adamant, because like space they cannot be burned by the fires that end an eon; they acquire a body of power to hold all worlds, their power of knowledge being like space.
kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi bzod pa thob pa bcu'o/ /
“These are called the ten acceptances of enlightening beings.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos don 'di nyid de bas kyang gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the great enlightening being Universally Good, in order to restate this teaching, spoke these verses:

ji ltar skyes bu la la zhig / rin chen 'byung gnas thos gyur nas/ / nor tshogs chen po bsags don du/ / rab tu dga' ba skye ba yin/ /
de bzhin shes rab che ldan pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' rgyal sras rnams/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mtshan/ / zab cing zhi ba rab tu nyan/ /
zab pa'i chos ni thos gyur cing / / de dag yid ni 'jigs mi 'gyur/ / de dag sems la sdang ba med/ / skrag pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro/ /
rgya chen dbyangs ni thos gyur nas/ / bzod pa'i dbyangs kyis byang chub tu/ / shes rab chen po yang dag 'jug / de la the tshom skye ba med/ /
bdag ni thams cad mkhyen par bya/ / bdag ni mi yi mgon du bya/ / chos rab shin tu zab pa rnams/ / bdag gis sgra yi sgo nas thos/ /
sgra yi rjes su 'brang bas ni/ / dga' ba'i dam pa mi 'thob ces/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos don du/ / de yi mos pa brtan pa skye/ /
bsam pa byang chub sems rab kyis/ / 'dus shing yongs su sgom pa byed/ / chos rnams 'khrug par mi byed de/ / de yi dad pa rnam par 'phel; /
des ni sgra rjes 'gro ba yi/ / bzod pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur/ / spyod la shin tu brtson byed cing; ; dbyangs kyi bzod la rab tu gnas/ /
chos kyi 'byung gnas yin pas na/ / shin tu brtson pa rab tu tshol/ / brtson 'grus ldog par mi byed de/ / sangs rgyas byang chub sgrub pa byed; ;
dbyangs tsam gyis ni gnas byed pas/ / byang chub sems dpa' bag tsha med/ / dbyangs kyis mos pa rab tu 'thob/ / des ni rgyal ba mnyes par byed/ /
skyes bu la la bsod nams rgyas gyur pas/ / gser gyi 'byung gnas chen po rnyed gyur nas/ / brgyan pa'i gnas kyi rgyan du rab sbyangs nas/ / de dag lus dang mthun pa'i rgyan du byed/ /
de bzhin mkhas pas chos kyi phul thos na/ / sems dang blo yangs rgya mtshor bsgyur byas shing / / ji ltar sngon thos chos rnams rtog par byed/ / mi mthun tshul du chos la tshol mi byed/ /
de dag rtogs nas shin tu mthun par spyod/ / rnam par mi sgom chos ni gang yang med/ / de dag chos rnams ji bzhin mthun byed cing / / de bzhin de ni chos rnams khong du chud par byed/ /

Just as people of the world Hearing of a mine of jewels Become glad at heart Because they can obtain them, So enlightening beings, Endowed with great wisdom, Hearing the buddhas’ teaching, The most profound character of nullity, Become calm at heart When they hear this teaching.
They are not startled or frightened, Nor are they overawed; Great beings seeking enlightenment, Hearing this grandiose message, Minds pure, able to accept, Have no doubt about it.
Thinking to themselves that by hearing this Exceedingly profound and subtle teaching They will become omniscient Guides of heaven and earth, Enlightening beings, hearing this message, Are very glad at heart.
Producing steadfast determination, Vowing to seek the buddhas’ truths, Because they incline to enlightenment Their minds are gradually tamed.
It causes their faith to grow, Not repudiating truth — Therefore, hearing this message, Their minds are able to accept it.
Immutable, stable, They cultivate enlightening practice; In their quest for enlightenment, They proceed wholeheartedly toward that path. Diligent, vigorous, never turning back, They do not cast off the yoke of virtues.
Because they seek enlightenment, Their minds are without fear; Hearing the truth, they become yet braver And serve the buddhas, gaining rapport with them.
As someone of great fortune Who has found a treasure of gold Makes whatever ornaments Are suitable to wear, So do enlightening beings, Hearing this most profound doctrine, Think and increase the ocean of knowledge, Thereby cultivating conformity to the teaching.
The existence of things they know accordingly, The nonexistence of things they also know accordingly; As the truth of the teaching is thus, Thus do they know all things.

mkhas pa'i sems ni rnam dag skyer 'gyur te/ / dga' ba'i sems yid rnam dag gsal ba skye/ / chos kyi yid la bdag nyid che ba brtson/ / rten cing 'brel 'byung chos la rab tu 'jug /
chos rnams mnyam pa nyid la de brtson te/ / dngos po rnam par bsgom la mngon par brtson/ / rgyal ba'i mdzod dang 'gal bar mi byed de/ / chos rnams mi mnyam med par rab tu shes/ /
de ni bsam pa mthar thug rab brtan pas/ / rgyal ba'i byang chub ji bzhin rab tu spyod/ / ri rab bzhin du mi g.yo brtan pa yis/ / de yi bsam pa byang chub mchog la rten/ /
mnyam gzhag sems dang ldan pas de brtson te/ / brtson 'grus ldan pa'i yid kyis rab tu spyod/ / bskal pa stong du spyad pa spyod byed kyang / / de yi brtson 'grus 'jig par mi 'gyur ro/ /
'di dag chos la yang dag de 'jug ste/ / rgyal ba'i rtogs bya'i gting yang rab tu rnyed/ / chos nyid zhi ba rab tu thob gyur pas/ / de la 'jums pa'i yid byed gang yang med/ /
dpe zla med pas ji skad gsungs pa ltar/ / de ni chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du byed/ / mi mnyam tshul du bzod pa mi skyed de/ / ye shes mnyam nyid yongs su rdzogs par sgrub/ /
bde bar gshegs pas mthun par gang gsungs pa/ / de dag bzod pa'i sgo nas rab tu 'grub/ / chos rnams 'jig dang ldan pa ma yin te/ / chos nyid ji bzhin de 'dra rab tu shes/ /
lha gnas 'di lha'i bu rnams 'dir 'dus dang / / sum cu rtsa gsum gnas su lha rnams skyes gyur pa/ / de dag zil mngar sna tshogs rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan/ / de dag 'khor ba'i snad gcig mngon spyod zad gyur na/ /
zil mngar zhim pa de dag 'ongs pa ma yin te/ / phyogs bcu kun nas zil mngar stobs pa med/ / las rnams ji lta ji bzhin lha rnams de ltar za/ / de la skye ba med de bza' ba med pa min/ /
de bzhin byang chub sems dpa'i sems rab mngon skyes kyang / / de la rdul cha'i chos kyang skyes par gyur pa med/ / ma skyes gang yin chos de nam yang 'gag pa med/ / dam pa'i chos kyi rkyen brten mkhas pa rab tu bzhugs/ /
ma 'gags gang yin mi zad chos rgyud de dang de/ / chos nyid 'di yi tshul la rab tu gnas pa yin/ / tha dad med pa'i chos dbyings 'di la rab tu 'jug / 'jig rten tha dad med pa'i rgyud kyi tshul yang shes/ /
de bzhin nyid mnyam 'jig rten zhi ba'i gzhir gyur pa/ / gzhi med tha dad med pa'i yang dag mtha' shes te/ smon lam rdo rje'i rang bzhin 'gro la phan phyir 'debs/ / rgyal sras de ni bde gshegs mkhyen la'ang mngon chags med/ /
de ni dben gzhol sangs rgyas chos rnams ston pa byed/ / chos kyi shugs las 'on kyang g.yo bar 'gyur ba med/ / brda dang grangs kyi tshul gyis mngon par 'du byed de/ / 'jig rten snying brtser smon lam dam pa rab tu 'debs/ /
smon lam 'debs la gnas kyang stobs bcu ldan pa ste/ / 'gro ba ma lus kun la de ni gnas pa med/ / mkhas pa'i ye shes yongs su len dang 'dor ba spangs/ / chos dang chos kyi man ngag rnam pa'i tshul la mkhas/ /

Achieving a pure mind, Thoroughly clear, full of joy, They know things arise from conditions And vigorously cultivate practice; They see all things impartially And comprehend their inherent nature.
Not straying from the Buddha’s teaching, They are aware of all things; Their determination is always firm As they purify enlightenment.
Immovable as mountains, Single-mindedly seeking true awakening, With a mind inspired to effort They also cultivate the path of concentration, Practicing diligently for countless eons, With never any regression or digression.
The principles enlightening beings enter Are the sphere of action of buddhas; Able to know them thoroughly, Their minds without aversion or sloth, As the Peerless One teaches, They look upon things impartially.
Without impartial acceptance None can attain equanimous knowledge; Following the Buddha’s teaching, They accomplish this facet of acceptance; They know things as they are Yet have no notion of things.
All the gods Of the thirty-three heavens Eat from the same vessel Yet their food is not the same: The various foods they eat Do not come from the ten directions — They spontaneously appear in the vessel According to the actions of the gods.
In the same way do enlightening beings Observe all phenomena As arising from conditions — Having no origin, they have no destruction; Having no destruction, they have no extinction; If there is no extinction, there is no defilement.
In the changing things of the world They know there is no change; There being no change, there is no location, And no location means nullity.
Their minds without attachment, They vow to liberate all the living, Thinking only of the Buddha Way, Never distracted or perturbed, Ever with compassionate will Acting expediently in the world.
Diligently seeking the ten powers, They are in the world without lingering; Without coming or going, They expediently teach the truth.

'di ni bzod pa'i dam pa ma skyes chos can te/ / des ni chos rnams zad med zad par mi 'gyur ro/ / mi skye'i tshul gyis yongs su gdams bya'i chos kyi dbyings/ / de bzhin nyid las brtan pa rnam par 'gyur ba med/ /
rgyal sras byang chub don du bzod pa'di gnas pa/ / de la phyogs kun sangs rgyas mtha' yas lung yang ston/ / rgyal sras de la sangs rgyas mkhyen pas dbang bskur mdzad/ / phyogs bcu kun nas rab tu snang bar mngon du gnas/ /
de dag chos kun rab zhi rtag tu zhi ba'i sems/ / mngon par sgrub cing dge ba kun la 'gro ba 'god/ / dus gsum chos rnams kun gyi mtshan nyid de 'dra bas/ / mtshan rnams yongs su dag byas sems can 'dul ba byed/ /
sgyu ma lta bu'i chos rnams nges par sus rtogs pa/ / de dag 'jig rten sna tshogs du ma rtogs byed cing / / 'jig rten sna tshogs sgyu tshul yang dag rtogs byas nas/ / las yangs shin tu bsags pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa/ /
sems las las kyi rnam pa du ma 'byung bar 'gyur/ / de bas 'jig rten sems de sgyu ma lta bur bstan/ / de dag rnam brtags sgyu ma 'dra bas nub par 'gyur/ / srid pa'i lam rgyud ma lus sgyu 'dra yang dag min/ /
ji ltar sgyu ma'i rnam pa byin rlabs byas pa'i gzugs/ / lam gyi bzhi mdor 'jig rten phal gyi nang bstan pa/ / 'gro bas mthong na de la kun kyang mos pa skyed/ / sgyu mas 'jig rten las ni gang yang 'grub mi 'gyur/ /
de bzhin 'gro ba ji snyed gang rnams yod pa dag / sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta bu ma skyes chos nyid de/ / dngos yod dngos med de bzhin yod dang med pa dang / / skal pa mi mnyam tshul gyis gro rgyud rab tu ston/ /
sgyu ma'i tshul rnams shes nas sems can yongs su 'grel/ / sgyu ma lta bu'i yin par sems can khong du chud/ / sems can sgyu 'dra de bzhin sgyu ma sems can 'dra/ / sems can med cing sgyu ma 'dra bar 'jig rten shes/ /
sems can zhing dang chos dang de bzhin dus gsum dang / / 'jig rten thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam par rab tu 'byed/ / sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur chos rnams rab rtogs pas/ / 'jig rten ma lus 'di dag sgyu ma'i rnam par shes/ /
skyes pa dag dang de bzhin bud med rogs pa dang / / bu mo de bzhin rnam par dul ba nye bar rton/ / glang po rta dang ba lang phyugs dang shing rnams dang / / me tog 'bras bu bzang dang ldan pa'i mtsho yang ston/ /
thabs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs mang bar sgyu ma'i sems/ / sna tshogs gnas la'ang sgyu ma yongs su gnas pa med/ / sgyu ma dben la gzhol zhing shin tu zhi ba yang / / 'jig rten rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs mang po ston/ /
de bzhin rgyal sras btsun pa rigs dang ldan pa rnams/ / 'jig rten sgyu ma sna tshogs ji bzhin ston par byed/ / sgom dang rnam par sgom pa'i dngos po'i sems kyang med/ / dngos po dngos med sgyu ma ji bzhin rab tu shes/ /
zhing dang sems can chos kyi rnam pa mang por bcas; ; las rnams sna tshogs rnam pas yongs su bsags pa la/ / gnas par mi byed mngon par chags pa de bzhin med/ / chags med mtha' yi sgyu ma'i tshul ni des shes so/ /
de ltar rgyal sras mkhas pa rnams/ / rab tu zhi la dga' zhing spros pa med pa ste/ / gnas med sa dang yang dag ldan/ / chos dbyings gnas la de dag rab tu zhugs/ /
de na chos nyid rtogs pa ste/ / brtan pa de dag rgyal ba'i sku skyes sras yin no/ / 'du shes rgyu la mkhas pa ste/ / 'gro ba thams cad 'du shes 'dra bar shes/ /
smig rgyu'i 'du shes 'dra ba ste/ / 'gro ba thams cad de ltar 'du shes phyin ci log / 'du shes rnam phye mkhas pa ste/ / de ni 'gro kun 'du shes spangs pa yin/ /
sems can sna tshogs khong du chud/ / 'jig rten kun gyi sna tshogs rnam pa kun dang bral/ / 'jig rten 'du shes rab tu shes so/ / 'jig rten 'du shes med min 'du shes ldan/ /
phyogs rnams 'du shes 'dra ba ste/ / sems can mtha' yas 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs yin/ / ma nor mig dang ldan pa rnams/ / 'jig rten sna tshogs 'du shes rab tu mthong; ;
'jig rten smig rgyu 'dra ba ste/ / 'du shes sna tshogs rnam pas 'jig rten rnam par bkod/ / 'jig rten 'du shes gnas pa ste/ / de dag phyin ci log gsum rnam par spangs/ /
ji ltar smig rgyu'i tshogs kyi rnams/ / 'gro ba rnams la chu yi rnam pa dmigs par snang / / de la chu ni yod min yang / / chu yi 'du shes rnam par rab tu bslu; ;
de bzhin 'jig rten thams cad kyang / khams gsum lam rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas te/ / 'du shes rnam pa smig rgyu bzhin/ / chags med yid ldan spyod yul mtha' yas so/ /
'du shes thams cad rnam par spangs/ / chags med ye shes ldan zhing spros pa med pa rnams/ / 'gro ba 'du shes chags gyur pa/ / 'du shes bslus las brten pa 'grel par byed/ /
nga rgyal rlom dang dregs pa spangs/ / 'du shes thams cad bsal cing 'jig rten 'dren pa byed/ / mi zad zad pa rtogs pa rnams/ / bden pa zad mi shes kyi tshul 'di yin/ /
'jig rten 'di dag thams cad rmi lam lta bur khong du chud/ / chos rnams thams cad rmi lam ngo bo nyid du rab tu rtogs/ / rmi lam de dag yul la mi gnas phyogs la'ang mi gnas te/ / rmi lam lta bur 'jig rten rab tu zhi la de dag gzhol/ /
rmi lam rang bzhin mkhas shing rnam par rtog med chos dang ldan/ / rmi lam rtogs pa'i yid ldan sems la 'gyur ba gang yang med/ / 'jig rten kun tu rmi lam lta bur shin tu rgyu zhing spyod/ / dus gsum ma lus thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul du rtogs/ /
rmi lam shi 'phor 'gyur ba med cing skye ba de bzhin med/ / rmi lam phyogs rnams kun na yod pa ma yin med pa min/ / khams gsum rmi lam lta bu 'di la rnam rtog med byas shing / / rmi lam shin tu rtogs mkhas de dag sems la bcings pa med/ /

These acceptances are supreme, Comprehending truth without end, Entering the cosmos of reality, Yet actually without entering anywhere.
Enlightening beings abiding in these acceptances See the buddhas everywhere Simultaneously giving them directions — This is called getting the joy of buddhahood.
They comprehend the nullity and purity Of all things of all times, Yet can influence sentient beings Into the path of virtue.
The various things of the world Are all illusory; If one can know this is so, One’s mind will be unshakable.
All acts are born from mind, Therefore it is said mind is like magic: If one gets rid of this false imagination, One extinguishes all paths of existence.
Just as a skillful magician Causes forms to appear, Causing the masses to crave them in vain, While they ultimately get nothing, So also is the world — All in it is illusion, Without essence or origin, Yet appearing variously.
Liberating living beings, Letting them know things are illusory, Living beings, too, are not other than illusion — On comprehending illusion, there are no “living beings.”
Living beings and lands, All things there are in all times, In the same way, without exception, Are all illusory.
Making illusory forms of men and women, Elephants, horses, cattle, and sheep, Houses, ponds, springs, and such, Gardens, groves, flowers, and fruits, Illusory things have no awareness And also have no abode; Ultimately of the character of nullity, They only appear according to imagination.
Enlightening beings are able to see Things of the world this way — All things, existent and nonexistent, They realize are illusions; Living beings and lands Are made by various acts.
Entering the realm of illusion, They have no attachment therein; Thus attaining skillfulness, They are tranquil, free from folly.
In the state of nonobstruction Manifesting great power everywhere, The courageous offspring of Buddha Accordingly enter the sublime Teaching, Accurately perceiving all conceptions As wrapping up the world in their mesh, The conceptions like mirages Causing beings to misunderstand.
Enlightening beings, knowing conceptions well, Get rid of all delusions.
Living beings, each different, Are not the same in form and type; Enlightening beings understand these are all conceptions, All without true reality.
All beings in the ten directions Are shrouded by conceptions; If they would give up erroneous views, They would end their conceptions of the world.
The world is like a mirage, Differentiated because of conceptions; Knowing the world is an ideation, One is freed from delusion of thought, view, and mind.
Just as a mirage in the heat People think is water, Yet the water does not exist And the wise should not seek it, The same is true of sentient beings: Worldly states are all nonexistent, Like mirages, existing in the perception — This is the realm of the unobstructed mind.
If one detaches from conceptions One will get rid of false descriptions, Liberating all the ignorant Who are attached to ideas.
Avoiding pride and conceit, Eliminating conceptions of the world, Dwelling on the point of extinction and infinity, This is enlightening beings’ method.
Enlightening beings realize things of the world Are all like dreams, Neither having nor lacking location, Eternally null in essence.
All things have no discrimination; Like dreams, they are not different from mind — The worlds of past, present, and future Are all like this.
The substance of dreams has no birth or destruction And also has no location.
The three worlds are all like this — Those who see this are freed in mind.

'gro ba rmi lam rang bzhin 'dra la de dag mi gnas te/ / 'jig rten 'gro ba rnam par dben la de dag brten pa med/ / 'jig rten rnam la mi rtog de bzhin rnam pa rtog pa med/ / rmi lam rtogs shing mkhas pa'i bzod pa'i sa ni 'di yin no; ;
rmi lam 'gro ba rnams ni rnam pa sna tshogs du ma snang / / tha dad rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan du bye brag rnam pa mang / / de bzhin ye shes zla bas 'gro ba thams cad rnam par mthong / / rmi lam sgra dang 'dra bar de dag rnam par rtog pa med/ /
rmi lam lta bu'i tshul gyis rnam pa brtan pas rab tu rtogs/ / de dag rmi lam mtshan nyid rnam 'das skal pa mnyam pa min/ / rmi lam de dag gcig pa ma yin nam yang mang pa min/ / rmi lam rnam bkod rnam par 'gro ba thams cad rab tu shes/ /
de dag sems can thams cad rmi lam 'dra ba'i chos can dang / / zhing rnams thams cad rmi 'dra de bzhin chos rnams rmi 'dra kun/ / ji ltar nyon mongs de bzhin rnam par byang ba rab tu shes/ / 'jig rten rmi 'dra de la rnam par rtog pa gang yang med/ /
rmi lam lta bu'i spyod pas yang dag grub par gyur pa rnams/ / rmi lam lta bu'i smon lam rnam pas gnas pa med pa dag / rmi lam lta bu'i chos rnams kun la gnas 'cha' mi byed de/ / 'jig rten rmi lam 'dra la khyab par byed pa gang yang med/ /
'jig rten 'di dag rmi lam lta bur byung bar shes shing dag / rmi lam tshul rtogs 'gro ba kun tu mi 'jigs chos dang ldan/ / rmi lam bzhin spyod ldan pas 'jig rten kun tu chud mi za/ / ring thung kun kyang rmi lam brgyud bzhin de dag rab tu shes/ /
'di ni rmi lam lta bu'i yid ldan rnams kyi bzod pa ste/ / rmi lam lta bus 'jig rten sems can rab tu 'dren par byed/ / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rtogs byas chags med ye shes can/ / sems la bcings med 'gro ba khrag khrig yongs su 'grel ba byed/ /
de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya che mtha' yas pa/ / chos rnams mngon rab bsgrub pa yangs pa khong du chud byed/ / chos kyi chos nyid du ma'i tshul rnams khong du des chud; ; chos tshul rnam pa tha dad kun la chags pa'i sems med/ /
'gro kun dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam pa ji snyed yod pa/ / de dag sgra dbyangs sgra snyan bzhin du khong du des chud/ / sgrar brjod de dag nang na med par rab tu shes te/ / sgra rnams thams cad phyi nang med par rab tu de shes/ /
sgra brnyan ji ltar rnam pa sna tshogs sgra tshul grag ste/ / rnam rtog dbyangs dang 'dra yang rnam rtog med pa'i sgra yin/ / sgra rnams rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad de bzhin rab shes/ / sgra la mngon par chags med de bzhin rlom pa'i sems med/ /
sems can kun gyi gtso bo thams cad de mthong gyur cing / / 'jig rten mgon po chos rnams gsung zhing dbyangs sgrog mdzad pas/ / mdo mang brjod du med pa rab tu gsung zhing ston kyang / / rgyal ba'i gsung dbyangs de la de ni gnas par mi byed/ /
sgra brnyan de dag ji ltar sgra yi rnam par grag kyang / / sgra brnyan rnam pa dag la sgra rnams gang yang yod min/ / de ltar dbyangs kyi bye brag rjes 'brang chos kyi rnam pa/ / chos nyid 'jig med ldan pa rnam phye chos la rab mkhas/ /
de dag sgra dbyangs thams cad rnam par rab tu sgom ste/ / sgra rnams rnam par dbye la mkhas pas sgra rnams sel byed/ / 'gro ba kun dbyangs dbyangs tshul min par rab tu shes te/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag dag pa de dag dbyangs kun rab shes/ /
chos rnams de dag kun la sgra med sgrar 'jug byed de/ / brjod pa khrag khrig sna tshogs rnams kyi rjes su zhugs shing / / 'gro ba thams cad sgra brnyan bzhin du mngon par ston byed/ / 'gro ba ma lus kun gyi sgra yang de bzhin rab shes/ /
de dag tshig tshul rjes su 'gro ba'i shes bya rtogs ldan/ / 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad sgra brnyan yan lag 'drar shes/ / dbyangs kyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pas khong du chud de/ / sgra yi mtshan nyid ji bzhin 'jig rten de bzhin shes so/ /
ji ltar sgra rnams chos rnams du ma rnam par ston byed/ / sgra yi rnam rtog sna tshogs dbyangs kyi yan lag kun ldan/ / 'jig rten ma lus kun dbyangs mtshan nyid ci 'dra de bzhin/ / 'gro ba kun gyi mtshan nyid rgyal ba'i sras kyis rab shes/ /

Dreams are not in the world, Nor are they unworldly: Not discriminating these two, One enters the stage of acceptance.
Just like seeing in dreams Various different forms, So also is the world No different from a dream.
Those in dream-concentration Realize all in the world is like a dream, Not the same and not different, Not one and not various.
The acts of beings and lands, Polluted and pure, They understand all Are equal to dreams.
The practices of enlightening beings As well as their great vows They understand are all like dreams, No different from the world.
Realizing the world is empty, They do not destroy the things of the world, Like long, short, and such forms, As seen in a dream.
This is called acceptance of the dreamlike; Understanding things of the world by this, One swiftly attains unhindered wisdom To liberate sentient beings.
Cultivating such practice Produces broad understanding, Knowing well the nature of things, Without mental attachment to things.
All the various sounds and voices Of all realms of the world Are not internal or external: Realizing all are like echoes, Like hearing all kinds of echoes, The mind doesn’t discriminate.
When enlightening beings hear sounds Their minds are also like this; Looking to the buddhas And listening to the sound of their teachings, Their discourses without number, Though they hear, they are not attached.
As echoes come from nowhere, So do the voices they hear; Yet they can distinguish the principles And not violate or mistake them.
They understand utterances While not discriminating among voices; Knowing all voices are empty and null, They broadcast pure, clear sounds.
Understanding truth is not in words, They enter the wordless realm, Yet can explain in words, Like echoes filling the world.
They know the ways of speech And are vocally well equipped; While knowing the nature of sound is null, They speak the language of the world.
According to the voice of the world They show the same differentiations, Their voice pervading everywhere Awakening living beings.

bzod pa'di 'dra'i stobs kyis mkhas gyur dpa' bo de dag/ sgra dbyangs sna tshogs 'jig rten kun tu yongs su sbyong ste; ; dus gsum shes pa'i blo dang ldan pas sgra yi tshul shes/ / 'on kyang rnam rtog gnas la de dag gnas mi 'cha'o/ /
zhi ba'i yid ldan 'di ltar byang chub brtson/ / 'jig rten phan pa'i don du byang chub tshol/ / chos nyid rab tu zhi la rtag tu 'jug / brtan pa 'jig rten rnams la rtog mi byed/ /
mi sgul mthu can ye shes stobs ldan pas/ / chos nyid dngos med zhi ba ji bzhin du/ / 'jig rten thams cad ma lus de shes te/ / de la gzhol zhing phan par de spyod do/ /
'gro ba kun la nam yang mi gnas te/ / 'gro ba kun dang 'bral bar byed ma yin/ / 'gro ba kun la de ni gnas mi 'cha'/ / de la gnas pa gang yang yod pa min/ /
'gro ba chos nyid rang bzhin ldan par shes/ / rang bzhin de la'ang gnas par mi byed de/ / 'gro ba 'di la'ang de ni rten mi byed/ / 'gro ba'i gnas las yongs su grol ba yin/ /
'jig rten gnas pa ji snyed gang yang rung / / de dag rang bzhin tshul rnams kun shes te/ / gnyis med chos kyang brtan pas rab tu shes/ / gnyis med de la'ang de ni gnas mi 'cha'/ /
de ni 'jig rten rnams dang ldan gyur kyang / / 'jig rten lam la gnas pa'i sems med de/ / 'jig rten phyi rol spyad pa spyod pa min/ / chos kun ye shes rang bzhin yin par shes/ /
chu la gzugs brnyan ji ltar snang ba rnams/ / nang na mi 'dug phyi na mi gnas pa/ / de bzhin brtan pa byang chub don du spyod/ / 'jig rten rnam sgom 'jig rten yod pa min/ /
'jig rten skye med grol ba ma yin te/ / 'jig rten brjod par mi nus gyur pa min/ / 'jig rten phyi rol rgyu ba'ang ma yin te/ / 'gro ba 'di ni gzugs brnyan ji bzhin no/ /
de ltar zab pa'i tshul las byung bas na/ / dag cing 'od gsal dri med sems dang ldan/ / ye shes gzhol bas chos kyi sgron ma ste/ / smon lam kun las yongs kyang ldog pa med/ /
de ni 'jig rten gsog par mi byed de/ / ye shes mthar thug mtha' yang mi dmigs so/ / skye dgu mtha' yas kun la bde byed de/ / 'gro ba kun las chags pa rnam par bzlog /
dpe med rnams kyi zab pa nyid la ltos/ / 'gro ba kun gyi don du rab tu brtson/ / bzod pa'di ni ye shes gzhol ba ste/ / de la gnas shing spyad pa de 'dra spyod/ /
chos gnas rnam par dbyen la rab tu zhugs/ / sprul pa de 'dra kun dang ldan gyur cig / sprul pa'i dngos la spyod par rjes song bas/ / sprul pa'i dngos po nam yang gtong ba med/ /
de ni byang chub spyod pa'i sa mchog tu/ / sprul pa'i dngos ldan rjes su spyad pas na/ / sprul pa ci 'drar rnam pa kun zhi ba/ / sprul pa de 'dra'i tshul la rnam par gnas/ /
de bas 'gro kun sprul pa rab tu shes/ / skye dgu'i las kyi rnam pa mtha' yas pas/ / sprul pa'i dngos dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam/ / sprul pa'i mtha' rtogs shin tu rnam par dben/ /
mi yi mgon po thams cad sprul par shes/ / dus gsum sangs rgyas ji snyed gang bzhugs pa/ / smon lam gang btab spyod pa spyad pa'i rgyu/ / des ni mi gtso thams cad sprul pa yin/ /
gang gis sems can rnam dag sprul pa yis/ / byams dang snying rje chen po shin tu yangs/ / de ltar sprul pa rnam phye shes pa ni/ / de dag byin rlabs 'phrul snang byed pa'o/ /
de dag 'jig rten rnam par rtog pa med/ / sprul pa'i dngos tshul 'gro ba thams cad shes/ / 'gro ba'i las kyi rnam pa gang yod pa'i/ / 'jig rten de dag sprul pa'i sas bsgrubs pa'o/ /
sprul pa'i mdzod mang rnam par phye ba la/ / zhugs shing byang chub spyad pa spyod byas pa/ / de dag sna tshogs bye brag rnam pa mang / / 'jig rten las kyi rnam pas byas pa bzhin/ /
sprul pa rnam par rtog pa med pa ste/ / sprul pa nam yang yongs su rtog pa med/ / rtog dang rnam par rtog pas yid dben pa; ; sprul pa bzhin du de dag spyod pa yin/ /
sprul pa rgya mtsho shes pas khong du chud/ / sprul pa'i dngos pos 'jig rten rgyas kyang 'debs/ / sprul pa'i mi gnas 'gro ba med pa ste/ / sprul pa ji bzhin de bzhin ye shes so/ /

Enlightening beings, attaining this acceptance, Influence the world with a pure message, Skillfully explaining past, present, and future, Without attachment to the world.
Because they want to help the world, They single-mindedly seek enlightenment, While always entering the nature of things Without discriminatory thought therein.
They see all worlds To be null, devoid of intrinsic nature, Yet always cultivate practice intently In order to benefit beings.
Not dwelling in the world, Not leaving the world, They do not rely on anything in the world — Reliance cannot be found.
They know the nature of the world And are not attached to that nature; While they do not rely on beings, They teach beings to transcend.
They know the inherent nature Of everything in the world; Understanding things are not dual, They still have no attachment to nonduality.
Their minds are not apart from the world, Nor do they dwell on the world; It is not outside the world That they cultivate all-knowledge.
Just as reflections in water Are not inside or outside, Enlightening beings seeking enlightenment Know the world is not the world: They do not dwell in or leave the world, Because the world is inexplicable; And they are not inside or outside, Appearing in the world like reflections.
Entering this profound truth, They are thoroughly purified; Not giving up their original vow, They are radiant lamps of wisdom.
Worlds without bound Their knowledge enters, all equally; Edifying beings everywhere, They cause them to give up attachments.
Contemplating the most profound truth, Aiding living beings, Henceforth they enter into knowledge And cultivate all its ways.
Enlightening beings examine all things, Clearly realize all are like phantoms, And carry out phantomlike practice, Never giving it up.
Conforming to phantomlike nature, They practice the way of enlightenment; All things are like phantoms, And so is enlightening beings’ practice.
All worldly realms And infinite acts Are equally phantomlike, Ultimately resting in nullity.
The buddhas of all times Are all like phantoms too; Originally vowing to perform certain deeds, They metamorphose into buddhas.
Buddhas liberate phantom beings By great kindness and compassion; The liberation is also phantomlike; By phantom power they teach them.
Knowing the world is all phantomlike, They do not discriminate worldly realms; Phantom phenomena, various, different, All come from differences of action.
Cultivating enlightening practices, Adorning phantom treasuries, With arrays of infinite goodness They make the world according to deeds.
Phantomlike things are beyond conception, And they do not conceptualize things; Both things and concepts are null and void — Such is enlightening beings’ practice.
The sea of phantoms understood by knowledge, The phantom nature stamps the world; Phantoms are not things born and perishing — The same is true of knowledge.

de ni nam mkha' gnas med ji bzhin du/ / bzod pa bcu pa'i tshul la rab tu 'jug / de ni mkha' 'drar chos rnams kun byas shing / / sems can sems can med par nam mkha' shes/ /
de ni nam mkha' lta bu'i shes ldan te/ / de la chags pa gang yang yod pa min/ / ji ltar nam mkha' sna tshogs ma yin pa/ / de ltar 'jig rten chags med rab tu shes/ /
de ni bzod pa mkha' 'dra'i mthu ldan pas/ / mi zad nam mkha' bzhin du zad pa med/ / de ni mkha' 'dra'i spyod yul thob gyur kyang / / mkha' la rnam par rtog par mi byed do/ /
nam mkha' la ni ngo bo nyid med de/ / nam mkha'i sa mtshams nam yang chad pa med/ / mkha' la bye brag tha dad yod pa min/ / de ni mkha' 'dra'i blo yi stobs dang ldan/ /
mkha' la mthar thug rtsa ba med pa ste/ / nam mkha' la ni mtha' dbus yod pa min/ / mkha' la rnam pa tha dad de bzhin med/ / ye shes stobs kyang nam mkha' de dang 'dra/ /
brtan pas de 'dra'i chos nyid rab shes te/ / ji ltar nam mkha' skyes pa med pa dang / / ji ltar mkha' la 'gag pa med tshul du/ / de 'dra'i chos nyid dam pa des thob bo/ /
nam mkha' 'dra ba'i chos la de gnas shing / / phyogs rnams kun gyi 'gro ba kun ston to/ / bdud kyi dkrugs ma thams cad bcom byas shing / / mkha' 'dra'i bzod pa'i tshul la shin tu brtan/ /
des ni mkha' 'drar mtshan nyid med pa kun; ; 'jig rten ji snyed mtshan nyid tha dad pa/ / mtshan nyid mtshan 'das mtshan ma med tshul du/ / kun kyang yang dag mkha' dang 'dra bar byed/ /
gang la dus gsum thams cad gnas pa yin/ / chos nyid mkha' 'dra des ni shes byas shing / / de ni rnam par phye ba gcig tshul gyis/ / gro ba thams cad nam mkha'i tshul du shes/ /
de ni nam mkha' lta bu'i ye shes lus/ / de ni nam mkha' lta bu'i sgra dbyangs ldan/ / de ni nam mkha'i rang bzhin lus can te/ / ye shes nam mkha' lta bur zhi bas gnas/ /
rgyal ba'i sras kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ / bzod pa bcu po 'di dag de dag gi / bzod pa'i stobs la de dag rab gnas pa/ / 'jig rten phan pa'i don du bshad cing bstan/ /
'di yi tshul la brtan pa bslabs pa rnams/ / ye shes 'di la shin tu mthu che ste/ / chos kyi mthu dang ye shes mthur yang ldan/ / byang chub tshul rjes bsam pa'i sems dang ldan/ /
bzod pa'di yi tshul la zhugs pa ni/ / ye shes stobs kyis chags pa med la 'jug / 'jig rten lhar bcas de yi zil gyis mnon/ / 'jig rten dag tu 'khor lo bla med bskor/ /
de dag spyod tshul shin tu rgya che bas/ / de dag tshad ni 'jig rten kun na med/ / skyes bu 'dul ba dpe zla med pa yi/ / ye shes rgya mtsho'i tshul la de dag zhugs/ /
bdag med sems kyis 'jig rten spyod pa'i tshe/ / chos kyis rnam dag gyur pa'i yid ldan pas/ / bstan pa de dag 'di 'dra'i chos la 'jug / chos nyid des kyang 'jig rten tshim par byed/ /
'gro ba'i tshad ni thams cad shes par nus/ / sems can ma lus thams cad bgrang bar nus/ / rdul gcig rtse la ma lus zhing bgrang nus; ; mkhas pa'i yon tan de dag mtha' yas so/ /
sangs rgyas sras po skyes bu chen po la/ / bzod pa bcu po 'di dag yod pa ni/ / ye shes spyod yul sgor yang 'gro kun gyis; ; tshad du bgrang bar nus pa yod pa min/ /

The tenth acceptance clearly sees Sentient beings and phenomena Are null and void in essence, Like space, with no location.
Attaining this spacelike knowledge, One is forever free from grasping and clinging: Like space, it has no variation And is unobstructed in the world.
Achievement of acceptance of being like space Is, like space, inexhaustible: Objects are like space, Yet one does not think of them as space.
Space has no intrinsic nature, And yet it is not nothingness, But has no variation — The power of knowledge is also like this.
Space has no beginning, No middle, and no end; Its measure cannot be found — Enlightening beings’ knowledge is also thus.
Thus observing the nature of things, All like space, With no origin or destruction, Is the attainment of enlightening beings: Themselves abiding in the principle of being spacelike, They also explain it to others, Conquering all demons — This is the method of the acceptances.
The distinctions of features of the world Are empty, without any marks; Entering into signlessness, All signs are equal.
By one single means They enter all worlds: That is knowing that all things in all times Are in essence equal to space.
Knowledge and voice And the enlightening beings’ body Are in essence like space — All are quiescent and void.
These ten acceptances Are cultivated by offspring of buddhas; Their minds rest at peace, And they explain them to others.
Learning them well, They develop great power; The powers of truth and knowledge Become means to enlightenment.
Arriving at these acceptances, They achieve unobstructed knowledge Transcending the masses And turn the unexcelled wheel of the Teaching.
The great practices they carry out Are beyond measure — Only the ocean of knowledge of the Tamer Can know them in detail.
Giving up their egos to cultivate practice, They plunge into the profound nature of reality; Their minds always dwelling on pure truths, These they give to others.
The number of living beings And atoms in lands may be known, But no limit can be ascertained To the virtues of enlightening beings.
Enlightening beings are able to accomplish These ten acceptances; Their wisdom and their conduct No sentient beings can fathom.

de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyal pos 'di skad ces gsol to/ / bcom ldan 'das/ grangs ma mchis pa shin tu bstan pa zhes bgyi ba dang / grangs ma mchis pa'i grangs ma mchis pa zhes bgyi ba de/ bcom ldan 'das/ ji ltar na grangs ma mchis pa bstan pa lags/ tshad ma mchis pa dang / mu ma mchis pa dang / kun tu mtha' yas pa dang / bgrang du mi rung ba dang / mtshungs pa ma mchis pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du ma mchis pa dang / brjod du ma mchis pa'i yang brjod du ma mchis pa lags na ji ltar bstan par 'gyur/ de skad ces gsol pa dang /

AT THAT TIME the enlightening being Mind King said to the Buddha, “World Honored One, the buddhas speak of incalculable, measureless, boundless, incomparable, innumerable, unaccountable, unthinkable, immeasurable, unspeakable, untold numbers — what are these?”

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyal po la tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa/
Then the Buddha spoke these verses to the enlightening being Mind King:

brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa ni/ / brjod du med pas thams cad 'tshang bar 'gyur/ / brjod du med pa bskal par brjod byas kyang / / brjod du med la mthar thug gang yang med/ /
brjod du med pa'i sangs rgyas zhing gi rnams/ / thams cad bshig ste rdul du kun blags shing / / gcig rtse la'ang gcig po brjod med par/ / thams cad brjod du med par rab tu 'jug /
zhing rnams brjod du med pa'i brjod med pa/ / skad cig sems kyis kun kyang rab tu 'jig / skad cig re re 'jig pa brjod du med; ; 'jig pas bskal pa mang po zad par byed/ /
dbye ba'i bye brag dbye ba brjod du med/ / rdul la 'jug pa brjod du med pa ste/ / bgrang ba'i tshul gyis brjod du med pa yis/ / bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed/ /
rdul dang rdul la mtshan nyid brjod du med/ / brjod du med pa'i rdul rnams kun bzung ste/ / bskal par kun tu bzang po bstod byas kyang / / kun tu bzang po de bsngags mthar mi thug /
brjod du med pa'i kun tu bzang po rnams/ / skra rtse re re kun la yang dag 'jug / skra rtse gcig bzhin yul rnams kun la ste/ / chos dbyings ma lus ji snyed de bzhin no/ /
skra rtse re re zhing gi khams kyi rnams/ / brjod du med par yang dag 'dzud par byed/ / mkha' dbyings skra yi rtse mos gzhal du rung / / zhing rnams thams cad brjod du med pa'o/ /
skra rtse de las sangs rgyas zhing gi rnams/ / rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par phye ba mang / / bskal pa mi mthun zhing rnams brjod du med/ / bskal pa mthun pa'i zhing yang brjod du med/ /
skra rtse gcig po de la brjod med pa'i/ / zhing rnams dag pa brjod du med pa dang / / sna tshogs rgyan rnams brjod du med pa 'god/ / rnam pa du ma tha dad brjod du med/ /
ming gi tshogs kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / skra rtse gcig la thams cad rab tu gzhol/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rnams re rer yang / / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yin/ /
sangs rgyas re rer brjod du med pa yi/ / sku rnams ba spu'i khung bur byin gyis rlob/ / spu gcig nas kyang brjod du med pa yi/ / kha dog sna tshogs mang po rab tu 'byung / /

Untold unspeakables Fill all unspeakables; In unspeakable eons Explanation of the unspeakable cannot be finished.
If untold buddha-lands are reduced to atoms, In one atom are untold lands, And as in one, So in each.
The atoms to which these buddha-lands are reduced in an instant are unspeakable, And so are the atoms of continuous reduction moment to moment Going on for untold eons; These atoms contain lands unspeakably many, And the atoms in these lands are even harder to tell of Counting this way for unspeakable eons, Using unspeakable numbers, Counting eons by these atoms, One atom standing for ten myriad unspeakable numbers of eons, If you praise a single Universally Good for that many eons, It would still be impossible to exhaust the amount of virtue of Universal Good.
On a point the size of the tip of a single fine hair Are unspeakably many Universally Goods; The same is true of all points All throughout the cosmos.
The lands on a point the size of a hairtip Are measureless, unspeakable; So are the lands on every single point Throughout the whole of space.
The lands on those points Have innumerable different kinds of abode; There are untold lands of different kinds, Untold lands of the same kind.
On untold points of hairtip size Are untold pure lands, Their various arrays unspeakable, Their various wonders unspeakable: On each point in them Are recited untold buddha-names, There being to each and every name Untold numbers of buddhas.
On the body of each buddha Appear unspeakably many pores; In each of these pores They manifest unspeakably many forms.

spu gcig nas kyang brjod du med pa yi/ / 'od zer brjod du med pa rab tu 'gyed/ / 'od zer re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / pad mo brjod du med pa mang po 'byung / / pad mo re re la yang brjod med pa'i/ / lo ma brjod du med pa mang po 'byung / / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yi/ / lo ma kha dog brjod du med pa ste/ / kha dog re re de bzhin brjod du med/ / pad mo re re lo ma brjod du med/ / lo ma re re'i 'od zer brjod du med/ / kha dog tha dad rnam pa brjod du med/ / kha dog re re brjod med de dag las/ / 'od zer mang po brjod du med pa 'byung / / 'od zer kun las brjod med zla ba 'byung / / zla ba las kyang zla ba brjod du med/ / zla ba re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / kha dog mtha' yas ldan pa'i 'od mang 'byung / / kha dog re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / nyi ma kun tu snang ba brjod du med/ / nyi ma re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / kha dog brjod du med pa sna tshogs 'byung / / kha dog re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / 'od zer brjod du med pa rab tu 'byung / / 'od zer re re la yang brjod med pa'i/ / seng ge'i khri mang brjod med sna tshogs gnas/ / seng ge'i khri mang sna tshogs re re las/ / 'od gsal brjod du med pa'i brjod med 'byung / / kha dog sna tshogs brjod du med pa dang / / dag pa sna tshogs brjod du med pa 'byung / / 'od gsal re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / rnam par snang ba sna tshogs rab tu 'byung / / rnam par snang ba sna tshogs re re las; ; brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yi/ / brjod du med pa bsgres pa'i grangs snyed kyi/ / ri rab pad+mo'i mchog dang ldan pa 'byung / /
ri rab re re'i tshad kyang 'di tsam ste/ / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yi/ / zhing rnams brjod du med pa yod pa'i rnams/ / ri rab gcig gis yongs su rgyas pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yi; ; ri rab lhag ma rnams kyang de tsam mo/ /

de dag bshig ste rdul phran char blags na/ / yon tan legs pa brjod med de snyed ldan/ / de bzhin bye brag khyad par bzung byas kyang / / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa ste/ / brjod du med la bsgres pa yongs bzung zhing / / 'od zer brjod du med pa rab tu 'byung / / tshigs bcad brjod du med pa gsal ba'i rnams/ / rnam par dbye ba brjod du med pa 'byung / /
brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten khams su rgyu/ / de bzhin sangs rgyas brjod du med pa 'byung / / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa yi/ / skad cig re re bden pa brjod du med/ / phyi ma'i mtha' yi mu mthar bstod byas kyang / / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag mu med do/ /
sangs rgyas re re zhing yang brjod med pa/ / brjod du med la bsgres pa gsal dag pa'i/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag brjod med gsal dag par/ / 'khor lo brjod du med pa rab tu bskor/ /
'khor lo re re bskor bas brjod med pa'i/ / mdo sde brjod du med pa mang po 'byung / / mdo sde brjod du med pa re re las/ / chos kyi rnam grangs brjod du med pa 'byung / / chos rnams brjod du med pa re re las/ / shin tu bstan 'chos brjod du med pa 'byung / / shin tu bstan pa brjod med re re yang / / sems can brjod du med pa rnam par 'dul/ / de dag skra rtse gcig la 'jug pa ste/ / skra gcig ji bzhin de bzhin ma lus kun/ / brjod du med pa'i brjod du med pa ste/ / bskal pa brjod du med pa zad par byed/ /
chags med sems kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag sangs rgyas brjod du med sprul pa/ / sangs rgyas re re brjod du med pa las/ / bsgres pa'i tshul du sprul pa kun tu 'byung / / phyogs rnams brjod du med pa kun tu 'dong / /

Reducing one land to atoms, The forms in each atom are untold; All of the lands atomized, each atom’s forms Are unspeakably many, untold.
These various forms in atoms All produce untold lights; In each light appear untold buddhas.
Untold are each buddha’s discourses, In each discourse are untold sublime verses; Untold are those who gain understanding on hearing them.
Untold understandings in each mental instant Reveal unspeakably many truths.
They reveal all future buddhas, Externally expounding their teachings, Each buddha’s teachings unspeakably many, With untold purities of all sorts.
Uttering unspeakably many subtle voices, Turning untold cycles of true teaching, In each cycle of teaching Expounding unspeakably many scriptures, In each scripture Defining unspeakably many doctrines, In each of those doctrines Explaining unspeakably many principles, With each of those principles Taming untold sentient beings.
Then again, on a single point Buddhas may dwell for untold eons, And as on one point, so on all points, For the same number of eons, The nonobstruction of their minds unspeakable, Emanating unspeakably many buddhas, Each emanation buddha Also manifesting untold emanations.

de dag sku yang brjod du med pa ste/ / rnam par phye sku de bzhin brjod du med/ / kha dog sna tshogs rnam pa grangs med do/ /
sangs rgyas zhing tshad brjod du med par yang / / sems can brjod med rnam par ston par byed/ / rnam par bstan pa de dag re re zhing / / sems can brjod du med pa yongs su sbyong / / de dag rgyan bzang rnam phye brjod du med/ /
de dag rdzu 'phrul mang po'ang brjod du med/ / rnam dag dbang yang brjod du med pa ste/ / cho 'phrul rnams kyang brjod du med pa 'byung / / rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med pa ste/ / spyod yul rnams kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / de dag byin gyi rlabs kyang brjod du med de/ / 'jig rten brjod du med pa'i khams su 'byung / / chos tshul rnam dag brjod du med pa ste/ /
tshul gyi mdo yang brjod du med pa 'byung / / mdo sde re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / brjod du med chos yang dag rab tu 'byung / / chos rnams re re las kyang brjod med pa'i/ / shin tu bstan pa brjod du med pa 'byung / / bstan pa re re zhing yang brjod med pa'i/ / rtogs par shes pa brjod du med pa 'byung / / rtogs par shes pa re res brjod med pa'i/ / sems can brjod du med pa rnam par 'dul/ /
tshul mthun chos kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / tshul mthun sems kyang brjod du med pa 'byung / / mi mthun chos kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / mi mthun sems kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / dbang po mi mthun brjod du med pa ste/ / tshig gi rnam pa mi mthun brjod du med/ / de dag brjod du med pa rnam par 'dul/ /

The reality bodies of those buddhas are unspeakably many, The emanated bodies of those buddhas are unspeakably many, Their adornments are unspeakably measureless.
They travel infinitely through the ten directions, Coursing through untold lands, Observing untold sentient beings, Purifying untold sentient beings, Taming untold sentient beings.
Their embellishments are unspeakable, Their masteries are unspeakable, Their mystic transformations are unspeakable, Their spiritual powers are unspeakable, Their spheres are unspeakable, Their empowerments are unspeakable, The worlds they live in are unspeakable, Their pure characteristics of reality are unspeakable.
They deliver untold discourses, In each and every discourse Expounding untold doctrines, In each and every doctrine Explaining untold principles, Each and every principle Containing untold definitions, Each and every definition Conquering untold beings.
Unspeakable homogeneous principles, unspeakable homogeneous minds, Unspeakable heterogeneous principles, unspeakable heterogeneous minds, Unspeakable heterogeneous faculties, Unspeakable heterogeneous languages — In every mental moment, wherever they go, They tame unspeakable numbers of beings.

skad cig re rer spyod yul gyur pa la/ / brjod du med pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ston/ / de bas de dag brjod du med pa yin/ / de la dus kyang brjod du med pa ste/ /
bskal pa tha dad brjod du med pa 'byung / / bstan pa de dag brjod du med pa 'jug / grangs kyi tshul gyis de dag brjod du med/ / skra rtse gcig la brjod du med pa yi/ / yangs dang dog pa rnam pa mang po gnas/ / ngag dang nyon mongs brjod du med pa ste/ /
rgya che phra ba de bzhin brjod du med/ / zhing gcig la yang brjod du med pa yi/ / bye brag rnam par 'phro bas zhing mi mthun/ / tshad dang grangs su de dag brjod du med/ /
skra rtse re re la yang yang dag gzhol/ / sangs rgyas zhing rnams brjod du med gnas kyang / / skra rtse gcig tu dog par mi 'gyur te/ / de na gnod pa'i rnam pa gcig med pa/ /
brjod du med par yang dag rab tu gzhol/ / zhing rnams de dag 'dre bar mi 'gyur te/ / 'dre ba'i nyes pa de dag kun la med/ / gcig kyang brjod med shin tu yangs pa ste/ /
zhing gcig ji bzhin de bzhin thams cad zhing / / skra rtse gcig bzung brjod du med pa yis// mkhas pas mkha' dbyings gzhal du rung srid kyi/ / skra rtse gcig gi zhing rnams mang po dag /
shin tu bstan pas brjod du med pa yin/ / skra rtse gcig tu'ang de bzhin skra 'jug ste/ / brjod du med pa gcig nas gcig brgyud pa'i/ / skra rtse bzung ba brjod du med pa ste/ /
skra rtse de dag mthar thug gang yang mod/ / bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yi/ / yun ring brjod du med pa bzung byas shing / / tshul 'dir brjod du med pa 'dzud pa byed/ /
bskal pa kun kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / mtha' dang dbus med tshul 'di bzung byas shing / / bstan pa brjod du med pa'i spyod yul gyis/ / de dag brjod du med par rab tu 'jug / brjod du med pa'i 'jug tshul 'di yin no/ /
yid kyi dbang po brjod du med pa dang / / rnam par gnon pa brjod du med pa dang / / rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med pa yis/ / phyogs rnams brjod du med pa kun tu 'gro/ /
de dag sems kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / rgya che yangs pa brjod du med pas na/ / de dag dmigs pa brjod du med pa ste/ / des ni brjod med kun gyi mthar phyin byed/ /
de bzhin lus kyi las kyang brjod med de/ / ngag gi las kyang brjod du med pa yin/ / de bzhin sems kyang brjod du med pa 'byung / / mos pa dag pa dag kyang brjod du med/ /
de dag rnam shes dag pa brjod du med/ / de dag shes rab gsal ba brjod du med/ / brjod du med pa'i tshul rnams yongs su gnon/ / the tshom brjod du med pa rab tu gcod/ /

Their occult projections are unspeakable, Their miraculous displays are unspeakable; The times and ages therein are unspeakable, The differentiations therein are unspeakable.
Enlightening beings can explain them in particular, While mathematicians cannot comprehend them; The great and small lands on a point, Polluted, pure, gross, and subtle, All of them unspeakably many, Enlightening beings comprehend and can distinguish.
Reducing a land to atoms, Those atoms are measureless, untold; Boundless lands, as many as these atoms, Are gathered on a single hairtip.
These lands, unspeakable, Are together on a hairtip without crowding; Without causing the hairtip to expand, Those lands all gather there.
The lands therein Retain their original form, without mixup; Just as one land does not disorder the others, The same is true of all lands.
The realms in space, without bound, All are arrayed on a hairtip; These lands on a hairtip Enlightening beings can tell of in an instant.
Into a minute pore Untold lands enter in succession; The pore can admit those lands, But those lands cannot fill the pore.
The number of eons of their entry is unspeakable, The number of eons of their admission is unspeakable; The durations of their procession, array, and abiding Are all unspeakable eons.
Thus having taken in and settled these lands, Enlightening beings’ spheres are unspeakable; Their devices during entry are unspeakable, Their deeds after entry are unspeakable.
The clear comprehensions of their cognitive faculties are unspeakable, Their journeys in all directions are unspeakable, Their vigorous endeavors are unspeakable, Their autonomous mystic transfigurations are unspeakable.
Their meditations are unspeakable.
Their great vows are unspeakable, Their spheres of action are unspeakable, All their attainments are unspeakable.
The purities of their physical actions are unspeakable, The purities of their verbal actions are unspeakable, The purities of their mental actions are unspeakable, The purities of their resolutions are unspeakable.
The purities of their subtle knowledge are unspeakable, The purities of their sublime wisdom are unspeakable, Their perceptions of reality are unspeakable, Their cessations of doubts are unspeakable.

de dag 'byung ba brjod du med pa dang / / yongs su gnon pa brjod du med pa yis/ / de dag ting 'dzin brjod du med pa ste/ / des ni brjod med thams cad 'da' bar byed/ /
sems can thams cad brjod du med pa ste/ / zhing rnams kun kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / sems can lus rnams brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag bsam pa brjod du med pa yin/ /
de dag las kyi rnam smin brjod med de/ / de dag mos pa de bzhin brjod du med/ / khams kyi rnam pa tha dad brjod du med/ / de dag bye brag khyad par brjod du med/ /
de dag lus mang brjod du med pa ste/ / gang du 'byung ba de dag brjod du med/ / ji ltar 'byung ba'ang brjod du med pa ste/ / 'di las 'byung ba'ang brjod du med pa yin/ /
yang dag 'jug pa brjod du med pa shes/ / de dag tshul gyis lam yang brjod du med/ / de dag rab tu ston pa'ang brjod du med/ / dus rnams brjod du med par shin tu 'byung / /
bdag nyid che ba 'di 'dra'i snying rje can/ / brjod du med pa 'jig rten dag na rgyu/ / de dag lus rnams brjod du med pa yis/ / brjod du med pa rnams la yang dag 'jug /
sems can gtso bo brjod du med pa rnams/ / mthong zhing shes rab brjod du med pa yis/ / chos rnams brjod du med pa zhi bar byed/ / sangs rgyas de dag brjod du med pa ston/ /
de dag lus rnams brjod du med pa yis/ / de nas zhing rnams brjod du med par 'dod/ / rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med pa yis/ / zhing rnams brjod du med pa kun tu 'dong / /
de dag lus rnams brjod du med pa yis/ / skyes bu khyu mchog brjod du med pa la/ / rnam pa tha dad brjod du med pa yis/ / mchod pa brjod du med pa rab tu byed/ /
rin chen dag pa brjod du med pa dang / / me tog sna tshogs de bzhin brjod med dang / / spos dang phreng mchog brjod du med pa yis/ / rgyal ba brjod du med pa bsnyen bkur byed/ /
de dag dad pa brjod du med pa ste/ / mos pa dag pa'ang brjod du med pa yin/ / bsam pa de bzhin brjod du med pa yis/ / sangs rgyas brjod du med la phyag kyang 'tshal/ /

Their escapes from birth and death are unspeakable, Their ascents to the absolute state are unspeakable, Their deep concentrations are unspeakable, Their total comprehensions are unspeakable.
All sentient beings are unspeakable, All buddha-lands are unspeakable, Knowledge of sentient beings’ forms is unspeakable, Knowledge of their dispositions is unspeakable, Knowledge of their deeds and the results is unspeakable, Knowledge of their intellects is unspeakable, Knowledge of their embodiments is unspeakable, Knowledge of their types is unspeakable, Knowledge of their species is unspeakable, Knowledge of their birthplaces is unspeakable, Knowledge of when they are born is unspeakable, Knowledge of their having been born is unspeakable, Knowledge of their understandings is unspeakable, Knowledge of their tendencies is unspeakable, Knowledge of their languages is unspeakable, Knowledge of their works is unspeakable, Enlightening beings with great compassion Benefit all worldly beings, Manifesting untold bodies everywhere, Entering untold buddha-lands, Seeing untold enlightening beings, Developing untold knowledges, Seeking untold teachings, Broadcasting untold lessons of buddhas.
They manifest untold various bodies, Traveling to untold lands, Showing untold spiritual powers, Pervading untold regions, Emanating untold bodies in each place, Approaching untold buddhas, Making untold offerings Of untold infinite varieties, Untold pure clear jewels, Untold beautiful lotus blossoms, Untold garlands of the finest scent, Offering them to untold enlightened ones, Their pure faith untold, Supreme resolution untold, Powerful aspiration untold, Honoring untold buddhas.

sbyin zhing gtong ba brjod du med pa ste/ / mi dma'i sems kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / yongs su gtong ba brjod du med pa ste/ / thams cad gtong ba de bzhin brjod du med/ /
tshul khrims rnam par dag par brjod du med/ / yid gsal dad pa de bzhin brjod du med/ / rgyal ba bsngags shing bstod pa brjod med de/ / zhi ba'i sa yang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
de dag bzod pa brjod du med pa ste/ / mi skye'i chos kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / rab tu zhi ba'i brjod du med dang ldan/ / zhi ba'i sa yang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
brtson 'grus phung po brjod du med pa ste/ / zhum med sems kyang brjod du med pa yin/ / phyir mi ldog pa'ang brjod du med pa ste/ / mi sgul sems kyang brjod du med pa'o/ /
bsam gtan mdzod ni brjod du med pa ste/ / rtogs par gzhog chos de bzhin brjod du med/ / bsam gtan zhi yid brjod du med pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i bsam gtan rab tu shes/ /
de dag shes rab brjod du med la zhugs/ / de bas ting 'dzin brjod du med pa ste/ / rab tu dben chos brjod du med dang ldan/ / sangs rgyas brjod du med la mngon par 'jug /
spyod pa'i sgo ni brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag smon lam brjod du med pa yin/ / de dag spyod yul brjod du med pas na/ / chos sgo dag pa brjod du med pa yin; ;
de dag chos stobs brjod du med pa ste/ / chos la gnas pa'ang brjod du med pa yin/ / de dag chos kyi dran pa brjod du med/ / de dag chos kyi dbyings kyang brjod du med/ /
de dag ye shes brjod du med dang ldan/ / ye shes brjod du med la shin tu bslabs/ / de dag phung po khams kyang brjod du med/ / de dag brjod med ye shes mthar yang thug /
de dag chos kyi 'khor lo brjod du med/ / de dag chos kyi char 'bebs brjod du med/ / de dag chos kyi ye shes brjod du med/ / de dag chos kyi sprin kyang brjod du med/ /
de dag rdzu 'phrul rnam par brjod med de/ / tshul dbyings brjod du med pa khong du chud/ / dngos med ye shes brjod du med pa ste/ / sems kyi skad cig de dag brjod du med; ;
brjod med tshad du rnam pa tha dad pa/ / skad cig sems kyis brjod du med pa shes/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho brjod du med pa ste/ / bstan pa de dag brjod du med pa gnon/ /
zhing rnams rnam phye brjod du med pa ste/ / rgyan kyang de bzhin brjod du med pa yin/ / gzugs dang dbyibs kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / kha dog mdog kyang de bzhin brjod du med; ;
khyad par sna tshogs brjod du med pa ste/ / rnam pa tha dad de bzhin brjod du med/ / dge dang nyon mongs brjod du med pa ste/ / rnam pa mi mthun ye shes brjod du med/ /
sems can brjod du med pa rab tu shes/ / sems can khams kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag las kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / sems can de dag spyod pa'ang brjod du med/ /
dbang po dag kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag sems kyang brjod du med pa yin/ / khams kyi rnam pa de dag brjod du med/ / de dag mos pa'ang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
de dag rnam par spyod pa brjod med de/ / kun nas nyon mongs de bzhin brjod du med/ / rnam par byang ba'ang brjod du med pa ste/ / 'dul ba de bzhin brjod du med pa 'byung / /
lus kyi rnam pa brjod du med pa dag / brjod du med pa mngon par sprul byas shing / / brtan pa brjod du med pa'i nan tan byed/ / sems can brjod du med pa yongs su 'grel/ /
de dag rnam par 'phrul pa brjod du med/ / 'od rnams brjod du med pa rab tu 'gyed/ / kha dog sna tshogs de bzhin brjod du med/ / sems can brjod du med pa rnam par sbyong / /
'od zer dra ba de bzhin brjod du med/ / ba spu re re nas kyang brjod med pa'i/ / brjod du med pa mang po rab tu 'byung / / zhing rnams brjod du med pa snang bar byed/ /
yongs su gnon pa brjod du med pa dang / / de bzhin 'byung ba brjod du med pa dang / / rnam par gnon pa brjod du med pa yis/ / 'jig rten brjod du med pa rnam par 'dul/ /
de dag lus kyi las kyang brjod du med/ / rnam dag tshig kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ / mtha' yas yid kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / spyod pa'i khyad par de bzhin brjod du med/ /
ye shes brgyud kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / khams rnams brjod du med pa khong du chud/ / brtan pa gzungs rnams brjod du med pa la/ / shin tu bslab pa brjod med byas pa yin/ /

They practice untold generosity.
Their minds in the untold past Giving to all who seek, untold, Giving all, untold times.
The purities of their self-control are untold; The purities of their minds are untold; They eulogize untold buddhas, Delight in untold truths.
They accomplish untold forbearances, Their acceptance of nonorigination untold; They embody untold tranquillities, Dwelling in untold states of peace.
They exude untold energy, Their past determinations untold, Their irreversible aspiration untold, Their immutable wills untold.
Their treasuries of all concentrations are untold; They examine untold phenomena and principles, Stilled in untold concentrations, Mastering untold meditations.
Their attainments of wisdom are untold, Their freedoms in concentration are untold, Their comprehensions of things are untold, Their clear visions of buddhas are untold.
They cultivate measureless, untold practices, Undertake untold far-reaching vows; Their profound spheres are untold, Their pure means of teaching are untold.
The power of enlightening beings’ ways is unspeakable, The stations of enlightening beings’ ways are unspeakable, Their right recollection is unspeakable, Their realms of principle and fact are unspeakable.
They cultivate unspeakably many means of enlightenment, They study unspeakably many profound sciences; Their immeasurable wisdom is unspeakable, Their ultimate wisdom is unspeakable.
Their knowledge of things is unspeakable, Their pure cycles of teaching are unspeakable, Their great clouds of teachings are unspeakable, Their great rain of teaching is unspeakable.
Their spiritual powers are unspeakably many, Their techniques are unspeakably many, Their knowledge of empty quiescence is unspeakable, The continuity of mental instants is unspeakable.
Their measureless practices are unspeakable, Their constancy instant to instant is unspeakable; The oceans of buddha-lands are untold, They can go to them all, unspeakably.
The differences in the lands are untold, Their various purities are untold, Their different adornments are untold, Their boundless forms are untold.
Their various arrays are untold, Their various refinements are untold; Pure buddha-lands are unspeakably many, Polluted buddha-lands are unspeakably many.
Knowing sentient beings is unspeakable, Knowing their natures is unspeakable, Knowing their deeds and rewards is unspeakable, Knowing their mentalities is unspeakable.
Knowing beings’ characters is unspeakable, Knowing their understandings and inclinations is unspeakable; Their defilement and purity are unspeakable, Observing and civilizing them are unspeakable.
Transforming powers are unspeakable; Manifesting various bodies, untold, Cultivating untold energy, Enlightening beings liberate untold sentient beings.
They manifest untold mystic transfigurations, Emanate untold great beams of light, With untold various forms, And purify untold sentient beings.
Each of their pores, untold, Radiate webs of light, untold, The webs of light manifesting untold hues, Illumining untold buddha-lands.
Their courage and fearlessness are untold, Their technical skills are untold, Taming untold sentient beings, Emancipating them from birth and death.
Their pure deeds are untold, Their pure words are untold, Their boundless thoughts are untold, Their sublime practices are untold.
They develop untold jewels of knowledge, And enter untold realms of reality.
Enlightening beings’ mnemonic powers are unutterable, They are able to learn inexplicably.

sgra dbyangs brjod du med pa shes pa ste/ / rnam dag dbyangs kyang brjod du med pa yin/ / de dag bden pa dran pa brjod du med/ / 'gro ba brjod du med pa shes par byed/ /
de dag spyod lam brjod du med pa ste/ / nan tan rnam dag de bzhin brjod du med/ / bag tsha med pa brjod du med pa ste/ / 'jig rten brjod du med pa rab tu 'dul/ /
de bzhin gshegs sras brjod du med pa yi/ / rnam dag spyod pa brjod med 'di 'dra ste/ / de dag yon tan legs pa brjod du med/ / de dag zad pa med pa'ang brjod du med/ /
'jig rten mgon po brjod du med pa rnams/ / yon tan legs pa brjod du med pa gsung / / rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' brjod du med/ / yon tan rnam dag de bzhin brjod du med/ /
brtan pa gang la gnas pa brjod du med/ / gang gnas ye shes de yang brjod du med/ / bskal pa ji snyed zad 'gyur brjod du med/ / de dag mthar thug med pa brjod du med/ /
sangs rgyas shes byed yid 'ong brjod du med/ / yang dag 'jug pa'i ye shes brjod du med/ / de dag brjod du med pa'i chos la 'jug / de dag chags pa med pa'ang brjod du med/ /
dus gsum bsam pa brjod du med pa ste/ / de la tshad bzung brjod du med pa yin/ / 'byung ba'i ye shes brjod du med pa ste/ / mi gnas gnas pa'ang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
spyod pa'i khyad par brjod du med pa ste/ / smon lam khyad par de bzhin brjod du med/ / smon lam rnam dag brjod du med pa ste/ / byang chub sgrub pa'ang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
sangs rgyas byang chub brjod du med pa la/ / de dag ye shes brjod du med pas byung / / don rnams brjod du med pa shes par byed/ / thams cad mkhyen chos de bzhin brjod du med/ /
rnam dag zhing yang brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag spyod pa'i stobs kyang brjod du med/ / de dag brjod du med par bsgom byas nas/ / skad cig gcig tu brjod med mngon 'tshang rgya/ /
de dag brjod du med pa'i rnam 'phrul pa; ; sangs rgyas brjod du med pa rab tu ston/ / de dag cho 'phrul brjod du med pa yis/ / 'jig rten brjod du med pa rab tu ston/ /
brtan pa chos kyi 'khor lo brjod med pa/ / de dag brjod du med par rab tu skor/ / de dag ston pa'ang brjod du med pa ste/ / 'jig rten phan 'dogs brjod du med pa byed/ /
bskal pa brjod du med pa thams cad kyang / / zad par 'gyur gyi yon tan brjod du med/ / yon tan dang ni legs pa brjod med pas/ / zad par mi nus de bzhin brjod du med/ /
de dag mgon po brjod du med pa la/ / tshig dang dbang po brjod du med pa yis/ / bskal pa brjod du med par bstod byas kyang / / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mthar thug med/ /
phyogs bcu'i sems can ji snyed yod pa rnams/ / ma lus thams cad bde bar gshegs gyur te/ / sangs rgyas gcig la'ang brjod du med pa yi/ / sku mnga' thams cad brjod du med gyur la/ /
sku rnams re re brjod du med pa yis/ / brjod du med pa'i dbu rnams mngar gyur la/ / dbu rnams re re brjod du med pa yi/ / brjod du med pa'i ljags yangs mngar gyur la/ /
ljags yangs re re brjod du med pa yi/ / gsung zab brjod du med pa brjod mdzad de/ / dbyangs gcig gis kyang yon tan brjod med par/ / bskal pa brjod du med par bstod byas la/ /
sangs rgyas gcig bzhin sangs rgyas thams cad de/ / sku gcig ji bzhin de bzhin thams cad sku/ / dbu gcig ji bzhin de bzhin thams cad dbu/ / ljags gcig ji bzhin de bzhin thams cad ljags/ /
dbyangs kyi yan lag ldan pas legs brjod kyang / / bskal pa rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa'i/ / bskal pa mtha' yas mur thug zad par 'gyur/ / legs pa chags med de dag mthar thug mi 'gyur ro/ /

The voices of the wise are untold, The purity of their voices is unspeakable; Their accurate awareness of reality is untold, Their awakening of sentient beings is untold.
They embody untold dignified bearing; Their pure actions are untold.
They achieve untold expertise And educate untold worldlings.
The offspring of buddhas are unspeakably many And so are their pure, excellent acts.
They eulogize untold buddhas, Their praises inexhaustible, beyond telling.
The guides of the world are unspeakably many; So are their expositions and descriptions.
Those enlightening beings are unspeakably many, Their pure virtues untold.
Their spheres are unutterable, They can remain there indefinitely, Their knowledge therein untold; They live through all ages, which none can ever tell.
They are gladdened by untold buddhas, Their wisdom and equanimity are beyond speech; They penetrate untold truths, With untold freedom from obstruction amid phenomena.
Past, present, and future being like space, unspeakable, Their knowledge of all times is untold; Their comprehension of past, present, and future unutterable, They dwell in knowledge beyond speech.
Their superlative actions are untold, Their measureless vows are untold, Their pure great vows are untold, They accomplish ineffable enlightenment.
The enlightenment of the buddhas is inexpressible; They develop untold knowledge, Discern untold principles, Know all laws, Beautify untold buddha-lands, And cultivate untold powers.
They cultivate practice for an unutterably long time, And are ineffably enlightened in a single instant.
The buddhas’ freedoms are unspeakable, Their extensive explanations of truth cannot be recounted.
Their various spiritual powers are inexplicable, They appear in untold worlds; Their cycles of pure teaching are ineffable, Their courageous ability to teach unspeakable, Their various expositions unutterable, Their compassion for the world cannot be told.
Through all eons, unspeakably many, They praise untold merits and virtues; While unspeakable eons may end, Those untold virtues cannot be exhausted.
Untold enlightened ones With untold tongues Praise the untold virtues of buddhas, Impossible to exhaust in untold eons.
