The living beings in the ten directions All attain enlightenment at once; Therein one buddha can manifest to all Untold embodiments, Each of these untold bodies Manifesting untold heads, Each of these untold heads Manifesting untold tongues, Each of the untold tongues Manifesting untold voices, Each of the untold voices Remaining for untold eons.
As is one, so are all buddhas; As one body, so all bodies; As one head, so all heads; As one tongue, so all tongues; As one voice, so all voices, Ever praising the enlightened for untold eons; The untold eons may end, But praise of enlightened virtues cannot be exhausted.

rdul rtse gcig la brjod du med pa yi/ / pad mo'i dpal zhes bya ba brjod du med/ / de bzhin gshegs pa bzang po zhes bya ba'i/ / zhing rnams brjod du med la rab tu 'jug /
rdul rtse gcig la ji snyed yod pa yi/ / chos dbyings ji tsam thams cad ma lus par/ / rdul gyi zhing rnams brjod du med pa dag / 'byung bar 'gyur zhing gzhan yang 'jig par 'gyur/ /
rdul rtse gcig la mtha' dang dbus med pa'i; ; zhing rnams du mar bstan pa yang dag 'jug / phyogs rnams rnam par dbye ba brjod du med/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho de bzhin brjod du med/ /
zhing rnams re rer de bzhin gshegs pa rnams/ / brjod du med pa rnam par brtag byas te/ / zhing gcig ji bzhin de bzhin zhing kun tu/ / de dag brjod du med pa'i lus su 'byung / /
de dag spyod pa'i mthu ni brjod du med pa ste; ; khyad par 'phags chos de bzhin brjod du med/ / de dag rdzu 'phrul brjod du med pa ste/ / chags med nyid kyang de bzhin brjod du med/ /
skra la 'jug pa brjod du med pa ste/ / skra la brten pa de bzhin brjod du med/ / de dag stobs bcu brjod du med pa ste/ / byang chub 'tshang rgya de bzhin brjod du med/ /
rtogs pa dag la brjod du med pa ste/ / chos dbyings yongs su gnon pa brjod du med/ / de dag brjod shes brjod du med pa ste/ / de dag nyid kyang brjod du med pa yin/ /
tshad dang grangs kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / brtan pa de dag tshul bzhin rtogs par byed/ / mgon po'i tshul rnams brjod du med pa dag / rnam pa tshad med brtan pa yongs su gnon/ /
ting 'dzin tha dad rnam pa sna tshogs rnams/ / brjod du med pa de dag rab tu 'jug / spyod pa rnam dag brjod du med pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i rgyal ba mngon du 'gyur/ /
chags med sems kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i gnas kyang rnam par gnon/ / spyod pa mtha' yas brjod du med pa ste/ / rdzu 'phrul brjod du med pa'ang rab tu ston/ /
zhing rnams brjod du med pa shin tu shes/ / de phyir sangs rgyas brjod du med pa mthong / / spyod pa'i mthu ni brjod du med pa yis/ / ye shes brjod du med pa khong du chud/ /
de la 'gro ba med cing phyir ldog med pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i yul la'ang rab tu 'jug / brjod du med pa'i zhing du rnam par rgyu/ / brjod du med ba'i bskal pa zad par byed/ /
tshul gyi rnam ba brjod du med pa ste/ / brjod du med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang thob/ / ye shes brjod du med pa rab tu 'byung / / skad cig re rer brjod du med ba ston/ /
re re'i tshig gis brjod du med pa yi/ / sangs rgyas brjod du med pa rab tu shes/ / byang chub dus gcig mngon par sangs rgyas pa/ / tha dad dus su khong du chud par byed/ /
de dag skra rtser 'jug pa brjod du med/ / shin tu skra la 'jug pa'ang brjod du med; ; rab tu rgya che'i rgyud kyang brjod du med/ / sangs rgyas rnam par mthong ba'ang brjod du med/ /
sangs rgyas rigs la gang zhugs de dag gi / tshul gcig nyid kyang brjod du med pa ste/ / de bas zhing rgyud brjod du med pa la/ / rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i don du kun tu 'jug /
zhing dang sems can de bzhin gshegs pa rnams/ / tha dad khams bsgyur brjod du med pa dag / brtan pas shes pa brjod du med pa ste/ / dus gsum 'dzin pa brjod du med pa yin/ /

In a single atom there can be Untold lotus worlds; In each lotus world Are untold Chief of Goodness Buddhas, Pervading the entire cosmos And every atom therein.
Worlds, becoming, subsisting, and decaying, Are measureless, unspeakable in number; The point of a single atom is boundless, Containing measureless lands therein.
The differentiations of the ten directions are unutterable, The arrays of the oceans of worlds cannot be all told of; In each land are buddhas With life spans of unspeakable eons.
Those buddhas’ deeds cannot be recounted, Their profound teachings are unutterable, Their great spiritual powers are ineffable, Their unimpeded knowledge is inexpressible.
They enter into a point, The events at that point untold; They achieve the ten powers, unspeakable, And awaken to ineffable enlightenment.
Entering untold realms of pure principle, They gain untold treasuries of deep knowledge: Various numerical measurements, untold, They comprehend, all, as they are; Various physical measurements, untold, They completely master; Various concentrations, untold, They can pass eons in, each one.
In the presence of untold buddhas, The purifications they practice are untold; They attain unutterable mental freedoms And journey in all directions, beyond the power of speech.
The manifestations of their spiritual powers are untold, Their spheres of action are boundless, ineffable; They go to untold lands And understand untold buddhas.
Their vigor and courage are unspeakable, Their knowledge and comprehension unutterable.
They do not act on rules, nor do they not act on them, Their penetration of realms of objects is infinite.
For unreckonable vast eons They travel constantly through the ten directions, infinitely.
Their knowledge of enlightening means is infinite, Their knowledge of truth is infinite, Their knowledge of spiritual powers is infinite, Their miracles in each mental instant are infinite.
They comprehend infinitely each one Of the infinite buddhas’ teachings; They can realize enlightenment at once Or can enter realization at various times.
The buddha-lands on a hairtip are infinite, The buddha-lands in an atom are infinite; They can go to all these buddha-lands And see the infinite buddhas.
They realize one truth infinitely, And enter the infinite line of buddhas.
The buddhas’ lands are infinite— They can travel to all and attain enlightenment.
The lands, beings, and buddhas Have infinite distinctions in individuality; As such, past, present, and future worlds are boundless: Enlightening beings can see them all.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sems kyi rgyal pos dris nas grangs la 'jug pa bstan pa'i le'u ste/ sum cu rtsa drug pa'o// //
[37. tshe'i tshad kyi le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-ONE. Life Span

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyal pos byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /gang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa shAkya thub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di yi bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dpag tu med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba yod pa'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams bde ba yod pa'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rjes rab tu 'joms pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams ngur smrig rgyal mtshan gyi nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams ngur smrig rgyal mtshan gyi bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa sku pad mo shin tu rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo rab tu sgrog pa'i nyin zhag gcig go ;kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams 'khor lo rab tu sgrog pa'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal mtshan gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rdul med pa'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams rdul med pa'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa seng ge'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams sgron ma bzang po'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams sgron ma bzang po'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang ba'i snying po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams 'od bzang po'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams 'od bzang po'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'od zer gyis sku'i pad mo shin tu rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams 'da' bar dka' ba'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams 'da' bar dka' ba'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par mkhyen pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan dang ldan pa'i nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /'jig rten gyi khams rgyan dang ldan pa'i bskal pa ji tsam pa de ni/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thugs zla ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams me long gi dkyil 'khor mdog gi nyin zhag gcig go /kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar bskal pa bgrang ba la 'jug pa'i tshul 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu 'das pa ni/ de'i pha rol na/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dpal bzang po bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams pad mo'i dpal gyi nyin zhag gcig go /bgrang ba'i tshul 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang ldan pas yongs su gang ngo// //

THEN THE ENLIGHTENING BEING Mind King, in the congregation, said to all the enlightening beings, “Offspring of Buddha, one eon in this world Endurance, the field of Shakyamuni Buddha, is a day and a night in the world Bliss, the field of Amitabha Buddha; one eon in the world of Bliss is a day and night in the world Vestment Banner, the field of the Buddha Adamant; one eon in the world Vestment Banner is a day and night in the world Wheel of Speech Which Does Not Roll Back, the field of the Buddha Lotus Blossoms of Sublime Light Blooming; one eon in the world Wheel of Speech Which Does Not Roll Back is a day and night in the world Free from Defilement, the field of the Buddha Banner of Truth; an eon in the world Free from Defilement is a day and night in the world Good Lamp, the field of the Buddha Lion; an eon in the world Good Lamp is a day and night in the world Subtle Light, the field of the Buddha Treasury of Light; an eon in the world Subtle Light is a day and night in the world Hard to Surpass, the field of the Buddha Blooming Lotus of Light of Truth; an eon in the world Hard to Surpass is a day and night in the world Adorning Wisdom, the field of the Buddha Light of All Spiritual Powers; an eon in the world Adorning Wisdom is a day and night in the world Mirror Light, the field of the Buddha Moon Knowledge: this succession goes on past a million zillion worlds; an eon in the last of these worlds is a day and a night in the world Supreme Lotus, the field of the Buddha Supreme in Goodness, which is filled by the enlightening being Universally Good and the great enlightening beings engaged in the same practice.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo /sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las; tshe'i tshad kyi le'u zhes bya ba ste/ sum cu bdun no// //
[38. byang chub sems dpa'i gnas kyi le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-TWO. Dwelling Places of Enlightening Beings

de nas yang byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi rgyal pos yang byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /shar phyogs logs na sngon chad byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri drang srong 'byung ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje dpal zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sum brgya dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /lho phyogs logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri dpal gyi phung po zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi blo gros zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor lnga brgya dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /nub phyogs logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri rdo rje 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' seng ge'i 'gros su 'gro ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor sum brgya dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang phyogs logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri spos kyi phung po zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' spos kyi glang po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag gsum dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang phyogs logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri spong ri zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag bcu dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /byang dang shar gyi phyogs mtshams logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri rgya mtsho chen po bzhi'i gnas rdo rje'i ri zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya phrag bcu gnyis dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /shar dang lho'i phyogs mtshams logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri mchod rten zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' lha'i phung po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /lho dang nub kyi phyogs mtshams logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri skar ma'i 'od ces bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' bzang po'i dpal zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag gsum dang ldan pa chos ston to/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag ;nub dang byang gi phyogs mtshams logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i ri spos kyi ngad can zhes bya ba yod de/ de la byang chub sems dpa' spos kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor stong phrag lnga dang ldan pa chos ston to/ /

THEN THE GREAT ENLIGHTENING BEING Mind King said to the enlightening beings, “In the east there is a place called Wizard Mountain where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. At present there is an enlightening being named Best of Diamonds there with a group of followers, three hundred enlightening beings, always there expounding the Teaching. In the south there is a place called Outstanding Peak, where enlightening beings have dwelled since ancient times. Now there is an enlightening being named Spiritual Wisdom there with a group of followers, five hundred enlightening beings, always there expounding the Teaching. In the west there is a place called Diamond Flame Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. Now there is an enlightening being named Vigorous Fearless Action there with a following of three hundred enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the north there is a place called Mass of Fragrance Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being named Musky Elephant there with a following of three thousand enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the northeast there is a place called Clear, Cool Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being there named Manjushri, with a following of ten thousand enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the ocean there is a place called Diamond Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being named Born of Truth there with a following of twelve hundred enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the southeast there is a place called Monument Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being named Celestial Crown there with a following of a thousand enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the southwest there is a place called Mountain of Light, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being named Best of Sages there with a following of three thousand enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching. In the northwest there is a place called Fragrant Breeze Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times; now there is an enlightening being named Fragrant Light there with a following of five thousand enlightening beings, always expounding the Teaching.

kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas phug bzang po zhes bya ba yod do/ / kye; rgyal ba'i sras dag /yul shin tu yangs pa'i lho phyogs logs na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas rtsa ba shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba yod do/ / yul pa Ta la'i bu zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba gser gyi gling zhes bya ba yod do/ / yul ma thu ra na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas tshim par byed pa'i phug ces bya ba yod do/ / yul ril ba gtong ba zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas chos kyi stan zhes bya ba yod do/ / yul dge ba'i phul du phyin pa zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas btang bzung gi phug ces bya ba yod do/ / yul be'u ra zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas thub ces bya ba klus btsugs pa yod do/ / yul kam po tsa na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas byams pas 'phags pa zhes bya ba yod do/ / rgya'i gnas na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas mthu bo thu'i phug ces bya ba yod do/ / yul kha sha na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas pa lang gi mgo bo zhes bya ba yod do/ / kha che'i yul na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas shin tu ston pa zhes bya ba yod do/ / yul dga' ba 'phel ba zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas gnas brtan gyi phug ces bya ba yod do/ / yul chu 'dzin zhes bya ba na sngon byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas khyor bo ston pa zhes bya ba yod do/ / yul sa 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor na byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs bzhugs pa'i gnas brgyags kyi phug ces bya ba yod do/ /

“In the ocean there is also a dwelling place called Cave of Adornments, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. South of Vaishali there is a dwelling place called Stable Roots, where enlightening beings have stayed since ancient times. In the city of Mathura there is a dwelling place called Cave of Satisfaction, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In the city of Kuchana there is a dwelling place called Seat of the Law, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In the city Pure Other Shore there is a dwelling place called Mucilinda, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In the state of Maratha there is a dwelling place called Built by the Uninhibited Dragon King, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In Afghanistan there is a dwelling place called Producing Compassion, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In China there is a dwelling place called Cave of Original Man, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In Kashgar there is a dwelling place called Oxhead Mountain, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In Kashmir there is a dwelling place called Process, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In the city of Increasing Joy there is a dwelling place called Seeing a Hundred Million Treasuries of Light, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times. In the state of Gandhara there is a place called Shangrila Cavern, where enlightening beings have lived since ancient times.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ byang chub sems dpa'i gnas kyi le'u zhes bya ba ste/ sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'o// //
[39. sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-THREE. Inconceivable Qualities of Buddhas
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba/ bam po drug cu rtsa gsum pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de'i nang nas / byang chub sems dpa' kha cig 'di snyam du sems te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sngon gyi smon lam dang / 'byung ba rnam par dag pa ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi skye ba ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chags pa mi mnga' ba'i rnam par spyod pa ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa ni ji tsam zhig tu bsam gyis mi khyab snyam pa dang /

AT THAT TIME there were in the assembly enlightening beings who were thinking, “How are the buddhas’ lands inconceivable? How are the buddhas’ original vows inconceivable? How are the families of buddhas inconceivable? How are the manifestations of buddhas inconceivable? How are the bodies of buddhas inconceivable? How are the voices of buddhas inconceivable? How are the knowledge and wisdom of buddhas inconceivable? How are the freedoms of buddhas inconceivable? How is the nonobstruction of buddhas inconceivable? How is the liberation of buddhas inconceivable?”

de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag gi sems thugs kyis thugs su chud nas/ byang chub sems dpa' ut+pa la'i snying po/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi byin dang ldan par mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis snang bar mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid kyis yongs su rgyas par mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas kyi mi 'jigs pa la rab tu bzhag go /sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa khong du chud par mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rab tu rtogs par mdzad do/ /chags pa med pa'i rgyud 'byams klas pa la rab tu bzhag go /sangs rgyas thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rigs rab tu rtogs par mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas kyi tshul gyi gnas brjod du med pa la rab tu bzhag pa mdzad do/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' ut+pa la'i snying pos chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa rig cing khong du chud pas/ chags pa med pa'i dbyings su bsgrubs pa'i yid dang / chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang ldan pa'i yang dag par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i sangs rgyas blta ba dang / snying rje chen pos lta ba'i sems can thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i go cha chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam dang / spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyun chad pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mngon par sgrub pa skad cig gi cha shas la rnam par spyod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo mthong ba mi zad pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i rnam pa/ gzungs thams cad kyis snang bar byas pa dang ldan pas
sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' pad+mo'i snying po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni tshad med pa la rnam par spyod pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam par 'phrul pa chen po la rnam par spyod pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad la sku'i mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu brnyes pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang dgongs pas sbyar ba'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa bzhi ni brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa shin tu ston pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab par rnam par spyod pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung dang dbyangs ni tshad med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa ni brjod du med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba ni/ thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud cing bstan pa ni bsgribs pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'o/ /

The Buddha, knowing what the enlightening beings were thinking, used the support of spiritual power, the embrace of knowledge, the radiance of light, and the fulfillment of occult force to cause the enlightening being Blue Lotus Blossom Trove to abide in the nonhesitation of buddhas, enter the reality realm of buddhas, acquire the mystic power and psychic freedom of buddhas, attain the unimpeded, immensely broad insight of buddhas, know the succession of all lineages of buddhas, and abide by the untold means of buddhas’ teachings. Thereupon that enlightening being was able to commune with the unobstructed realm of reality, thus was able calmly to sustain profound practice free from impediments, thus was able to fulfill the great vow of universal good, thus was able to know and perceive all aspects of buddhahood. With great compassion he observed sentient beings, wishing to cause them to be pure and diligent in self-cultivation, to accept and apply all the principles of enlightening beings. In a single mental instant he produced enlightened knowledge and understood all the inexhaustible means of knowledge, his mnemonic command and intellectual powers complete.
By the power of Buddha he said to the enlightening being Lotus Blossom Calyx, “The buddhas, World Honored Ones, have innumerable abodes — the abode of eternity, the abode of great compassion, the abode of various bodies performing buddha-work, the abode of equanimously turning the wheel of the pure Teaching, the abode of explaining innumerable principles by means of analytic knowledge, the abode of the inconceivable qualities of all buddhas, the abode of the sound of purity pervading infinite lands, the abode of the inexpressibly profound realm of reality, the abode of manifesting all supreme spiritual powers — and are able to reveal the ultimate truth that has no barrier.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa bcu ste; bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gzugs kyi sku rnam par dag pa ni rnyog pa med par rgyud thams cad du byung bas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o// sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chags pa med pa'i spyan ni/ chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi spyan mngon par sangs rgyas pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chags pa med pa'i snyan ni/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgra bsgribs pa med par thugs su chud pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shangs kyi skye mched ni/ sangs rgyas kyi mnga' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ljags shin tu yangs pa ni/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du gsung gi dbyangs rjes su 'gro bas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku'i chos nyid ni/ sems can thams cad ma lus pa'i sems kyi rnam pa la de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba rnam par dmigs pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi 'phrin las ni/ chos kyi sku dang tha mi dad cing / dus gsum chags pa med par thugs su chud cing rnam par dag pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa mi mnga' ba la rnam par spyod pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang dang / rnam par 'phrul ba dang / cho 'phrul mi zad pa yang dag par ston pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rnam par dag pa ni/ brjod du med pa'i rgyan byin gyis brlabs pas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa yang dag par bstan te/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs par mdzad pas mtha' dang dbus med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i khyad par dang / smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ni/ rnam par rol ba'i ye shes kyi chos yongs su rdzogs te/ chos thams cad rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba la mtha' dang dbus med pa ste/

“The buddhas have ten things that pervade the infinite cosmos. What are these ten? All buddhas have unbounded bodies, with pure forms, entering into all states of being without defilement or attachment. All buddhas have unbounded, unobstructed eyes that can clearly see all things. All buddhas have unbounded, unobstructed ears that can understand all sounds and utterances. All buddhas have unbounded, unobstructed noses that can reach the other shore of freedom of the buddhas. All buddhas have universal tongues that utter sublime sounds pervading the cosmos. All buddhas have unbounded bodies that appear to sentient beings in accord with their minds. All buddhas have unbounded minds that dwell on the unobstructed impartial body of reality. All buddhas have unbounded, unobstructed liberation, manifesting inexhaustible great spiritual powers. All buddhas have unbounded pure worlds, manifesting buddha-lands according to the pleasures of sentient beings, replete with infinite adornments, yet without giving rise to any obsession or attachment to them. All buddhas have unbounded practical undertakings of enlightening beings, having complete knowledge, spiritual freedom, and ability to master all elements of buddhahood.
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so/ /
These are the ten phenomena of buddhahood that pervade the cosmos without bound, which are in the perfectly enlightened ones.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi skad cig gcig la ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa yang dag par bstan pa'o/ /bcu gang zhe na/ skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dga' ldan gyi gnas nas 'pho ba yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i tshe yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par 'byung ba yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs shing mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du dus la bab par shes pas sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur ba yongs su bstan pa dang; skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can ji ltar 'dul ba'i tshul bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa brjod du med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku sna tshogs rnam par dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyan sna tshogs dang / rgyan brjod du med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i mdzod yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par dag pa gcig ma yin pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad du dbang po dang / brtson 'grus rnam pa tha dad pa byung ba dang / mos pa dang / spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa byung ba la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyud du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su bstan pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi skad cig la ye shes mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par bstan pa'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten kinds of instantly creative knowledge. What are these ten? All buddhas can, in a single instant, appear to descend from heaven in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest birth as enlightening beings in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest renunciation of the mundane and study of the way to liberation in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest attainment of true enlightenment under enlightenment trees in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest turning the wheel of the Teaching in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest education of sentient beings and service of the enlightened in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest untold variety of buddha-bodies in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest all kinds of adornments in infinite worlds, innumerable adornments, the freedoms of the enlightened, and the treasury of omniscience. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest countless pure beings in infinite worlds. All buddhas can, in a single instant, manifest the buddhas of past, present, and future in infinite worlds, with various faculties and characters, various energies, and various practical understandings, attaining true enlightenment in the past, present, and future.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi dus las mi 'da' ba ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par 'tshang rgya ba ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par ma smin pa mnyam pa nyid ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lung bstan pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i rgyud du cho 'phrul yongs su bstan pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sems can mos pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin du sku yongs su bstan pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams btang snyoms su bzhugs pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yul dang grong dang grong rdal du gshegs pa ni/ de'i dus la mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dad pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can yongs su 'dzin pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan zhing gdul dka' ba la gzhan la ltos pa mi mnga' bar 'dul ba ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par 'phrul pa bstan pa ni/ de'i dus las mi 'da' bas dus la bab pa yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi dus las mi 'da' ba'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten kinds of proper timing. What are these ten? All buddhas develop and mature those with affinity at the appropriate time. All buddhas give enlightening beings instructions for the future at the proper time. All buddhas show spiritual powers in accord with sentient beings’ minds at the proper time. All buddhas show buddha-bodies in accord with sentient beings’ understandings at the proper time. All buddhas persist in great relinquishment at the proper time. All buddhas go into inhabited places at the appropriate time. All buddhas receive the pure and faithful at the proper time. All buddhas tame evil sentient beings at the appropriate time. All buddhas reveal the inconceivable occult powers of the enlightened at the proper time.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul dpe med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par skyil mo krung gcig gis rgyas par dgang ba dang / dus gcig tu sangs rgyas thams cad yongs su bstan pa dang / 'od zer gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad snang bar bya ba dang / sku gzugs gcig gis lus dang / gzugs thams cad yongs su bstan pa dang; gnas gcig na bzhugs kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par byon pa'i skur 'gyur ba dang / ye shes gcig rtogs pas chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med par 'gyur ba dang / thugs gcig bskyed pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad ma lus par rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / sangs rgyas kye che ba nyid tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i gshegs stabs gcig gis de kho na nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / dus gsum thams cad sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang gis rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang ma 'dres par bzhugs shing / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgyud kyi tshul gcig pa ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul dpe med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten peerless inconceivable realms. What are they? All buddhas, once sitting, pervade infinite worlds in the ten directions. All buddhas, uttering one logical statement, can express all Buddha teachings. All buddhas, emanating one light, can illumine all worlds. All buddhas, in one body, can manifest all bodies. All buddhas can show all worlds in one place. All buddhas can ascertain all things within one knowledge without any impediment. All buddhas can travel to all worlds in the ten directions in a single moment of thought. All buddhas can manifest the infinite spiritual powers of the enlightened in a single instant. All buddhas can focus on all the buddhas and sentient beings of past, present, and future in a single instant without confusion of mind. All buddhas are in one instant essentially the same as all buddhas of past, future, and present.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'jug pa med pa'i chos thams cad la 'jug pas smon lam mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / lus med pa la lus mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos thams cad mi gnyis pa la mngon par 'tshang rgya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / sems can gyi mthar thug par bdag med pa la sems can 'dul ba mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa la mtshan ma sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi yul ma skyes pa la 'jig rten gyi khams 'du ba dang / 'jig pa mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / yul thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos thams cad brjod du med pa la chos kyi dbyings su gsung mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas 'jug pa med pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa la skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes so/ /

“The buddhas can produce ten kinds of knowledge. What are they? All buddhas know all things have no aim, yet they can produce knowledge of dedicated undertaking. All buddhas know all things have no body, yet they can produce knowledge of pure bodies. All buddhas know all things are fundamentally nondual, yet they can produce knowledge capable of awareness and understanding. All buddhas know all things have no self and no being, yet they can produce knowledge to civilize beings. All buddhas know all things fundamentally have no marks, yet they can produce knowledge of all marks. All buddhas know all worlds have no becoming or decay, yet they can produce knowledge of becoming and decay. All buddhas know all things have no creation, yet they can produce knowledge of the effects of action. All buddhas know all things have no verbal explanation, yet they can produce knowledge of verbal explanation. All buddhas know all things have no defilement or purity, yet they can produce knowledge of defilement and purity. All buddhas know all things have no birth or extinction, yet they can produce knowledge of birth and extinction.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshad med pa'i khongs su chud pa dag ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku ni/ dus gsum thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can thams cad 'dul bar mdzad pa ni/ cho 'phrul chen po gsum gyi khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams tshig rab tu dbye ba thams cad la mkhas pa ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi gzungs thams cad kyi khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa bzhir khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba ni/ thugs rje chen po'i khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa ni/ dus thams cad du sems can thams cad la rnam par gzigs pa'i khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ sems can rnam par gdul ba thams cad khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chags pa mi mnga' bar spyod pa ni/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi skad cig gcig tu ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad khongs su chud pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi nyi ma gcig tu ni/ dus gsum gyi bskal pa'i grangs khong du chud par bstan pa thams cad khongs su chud pa yin/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshad med pa'i khongs su chud pa'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten kinds of ways of entry into universality. What are they? All buddhas have immaculate bodies that penetrate past, present, and future. All buddhas are endowed with three kinds of mastery—of diagnosis, prescription, and occult powers—by which they edify beings everywhere. All buddhas are endowed with mnemonic powers able to receive and hold all Buddha teachings. All buddhas are endowed with four special knowledges—of principles, meanings, expressions, and elocution—and operate all cycles of pure teaching everywhere. All buddhas have impartial great compassion and never abandon all sentient beings. All buddhas have profound meditation concentration and always observe all sentient beings everywhere. All buddhas have roots of goodness beneficial to others, and civilize sentient beings unceasingly. All buddhas have unobstructed minds, able to abide calmly in all universes. All buddhas have unimpeded spiritual powers and are able to manifest the buddhas of past, present, and future in one instant. All buddhas have unobstructed intellect, in a single instant defining sets of ages of past, present, and future.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ bdud kyi dkrugs ma rab tu 'joms zhing rnam par 'thor ba ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /mu stegs can gzhan dang / phas kyi rgol ba tshar bcad pa ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /'dul ba'i sems can thams cad rab tu tshim par mdzad pa ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /sems can 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs pa ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /chos kyi dbyings thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par skus khyab cing / sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par phye ba sna tshogs thams cad du mi gnyis pa ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /gsung gi yan lag thams cad la sems can mos par bya ba dang / thos par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba don yod par tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa thogs pa med pas bstan pa'i tshul du tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa bzhi 'byung ba ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o// sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ba spu'i bu ga gcig nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bsam gyis mi khyab cing thogs pa med pa'i tshul du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi thabs kyis 'byung zhing / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyis sku'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'byung ba ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed yongs su ston cing / sangs rgyas kyi rgyan dang / rang bzhin gyi lhab lhub dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rgyun mi 'chad cing / sems can rnam par 'dul ba thogs pa med pa la 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu gtogs pa rnams la'ang mi bde ba dang / gnod pa med kyang rdul shin tu phra ba de yang yangs par ma byas/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang chung bar ma byas par ji ltar gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyang thugs su chud pa'i ye shes mnga' ba ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /mun pa med pa'i khams de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par sangs rgyas te/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mun pa med cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' la/ sems can pha rol gyi bsgribs pa sna tshogs kyi gnas rnam par sel na/ de la de bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan pa ni; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos la bzod par dka' ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rgya che ba'i chos bzod par dka' ba'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten great qualities that are hard to believe in. What are they? All buddhas can destroy all demons. All buddhas can overcome all false teachers. All buddhas can tame all sentient beings and make them all happy. All buddhas can go to all worlds and guide the myriad types of beings there. All buddhas can knowingly experience the most profound realm of reality. All buddhas can, by means of a nondual body, manifest various bodies, filling the world. All buddhas can, with pure voices, produce the special knowledges of principle, meaning, expression, and elocution, and expound truths endlessly, to the unfailing benefit of those who accept. All buddhas can manifest buddhas as numerous as atoms in all worlds in a single pore, without end. All buddhas can manifest in a single atom as many lands as atoms in all worlds, replete with all kinds of fine adornments, and continuously turn the wheel of the sublime Teaching therein for the edification of sentient beings—yet the atom is not enlarged and the worlds are not small; they always abide in the realm of reality by realizational knowledge. All buddhas arrive at the pure realm of reality, shatter the darkness of ignorance of the world by means of the light of knowledge, cause all to gain understanding of the Buddha teachings, follow the enlightened, and dwell in the ten powers.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yang dag par bsgrubs pa bdag nyid che ba ni/ sngon gyi mtha' nas rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud du rigs dang ldan par 'byung ba'i bdag nyid che ba ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnam par dag pas/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par gnas pas/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dus gsum la mi gnas par rnam par spyod cing chos thams cad la rten pa yang dag par bcom pas; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa la rnam par gzhag pa gcig gis len pa med pas/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mthar chos kyi dbyings la gnas pas mnyam pa'i bsod nams mi zad pa dang ldan pas/ mi zad pa'i bsod nams mnga' ba ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gzugs dang / kha dog mtha' yas pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na sems can 'dul ba'i dus dang dbang gis chags pa med par bzhugs pas/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pas bag tsha ba mi mnga' bar bzhugs shing khyu mchog dang / seng ge'i nga ro 'byin te/ rgol ba'i nang na stag lta bu'i mthu dang ldan la/ chos thams cad bstan pa la thugs sgron ma lta bu mnga' bas/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa zhig lon yang mtshan gyi tshig thos pa tsam gyis bzhugs pa dang 'dra bar sems can rnams kyi yon shin tu sbyong zhing / mya ngan las 'das nas de srid kyi yun ring po 'das kyang / sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i yon tan zad par mi 'gyur bas/ sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag na bzhugs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams rgyang ring po na bzhugs kyang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyis rjes su dran par byas na/ sku mngon par ston pa mdzad pas/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bdag nyid che ba ni/ rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten kinds of great virtue that are impeccably pure. What are they? All buddhas are endowed with great spiritual power, impeccably pure. All buddhas are born in the families of the enlightened ones of past, present, and future, of people harmonious and good, impeccably pure. All buddhas’ minds are free from obsession forever, impeccably pure. All buddhas are free from attachment to anything in the past, present, or future, impeccably pure. All buddhas know all kinds of natures are one nature, coming from nowhere, impeccably pure. All buddhas’ virtues, past, present, and future, are inexhaustible, equal to the cosmos, impeccably pure. All buddhas’ boundless physical forms pervade all lands of the ten directions, teaching all sentient beings at the appropriate times, with impeccable purity. All buddhas acquire the fourfold fearlessness, are freed from all fears, and roar the great lion’s roar among the masses, clearly discerning all things, impeccably pure. All the buddhas enter final nirvana in untold ages, and when sentient beings hear their names they gain immeasurable benefit, same as if the buddhas were presently existing, impeccably pure. All buddhas, though in untold distant worlds, can be seen by sentient beings who correctly meditate on them single-mindedly, impeccably pure.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi tshangs pa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa la/ sngon gyi smon lam gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chags pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa sel bas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gis shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'khor gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rigs rnam par dag pas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam par dag pas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi sku rnyog pa med pas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phung po bsgribs pa med pas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa thams cad la mthu chen po brnyes shing / pha rol tu phyin pa dam pa brnyes pas shin tu rnam par dag pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'o/ /

“The buddhas have ten kinds of ultimate purity. What are they? All buddhas’ past great vows are ultimately pure. The religious conduct maintained by all buddhas is ultimately pure. All buddhas’ separation from the confusions of worldly beings is ultimately pure. All buddhas’ adorned lands are ultimately pure. All buddhas’ followings are ultimately pure. All buddhas’ families are ultimately pure. All buddhas’ physical characteristics and refinements are ultimately pure. The non-defilement of the reality-body of all buddhas is ultimately pure. All buddhas’ omniscient knowledge, without obstruction, is ultimately pure. All buddhas’ liberation, freedom, accomplishment of their tasks, and arrival at completion are ultimately pure.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'byung zhing dus thams cad du gnas pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa thob pa'i sems can rnams la dus thams cad du sangs rgyas bstan pa dang / sems can sems cad shes dang ldan pa rnams la dus thams cad du chos bstan pa dang / sems can sangs rgyas la dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dus thams cad du bskyed pa dang / chos skyon med par 'das pa'i sems can rnams dus thams cad du ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dus thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du dus thams cad du chags pa mi mnga' bar gshegs pa dang / sems can thams cad la thugs rje chen po dus thams cad du mi gtong ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs dus thams cad du thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos kyi dbyings gnas pa'i sangs rgyas dus thams cad du 'byung ba ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'byung zhing / dus thams cad du gnas pa'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of buddha-work in all worlds in all times. What are they? If there are sentient beings who think of them single-mindedly, the buddhas appear before them. If there are sentient beings whose minds are unruly, they explain the Teaching to them. If there are sentient beings able to develop pure faith, they will surely cause them to acquire immeasurable roots of goodness. If there are sentient beings able to enter the ranks of truth, they will appear to testify to it, so that they know all. They teach and influence sentient beings tirelessly. They travel to all buddha-lands, coming and going without impediment. With great compassion they do not abandon sentient beings. They manifest transfigured emanation bodies, continuing forever. Their exercise of spiritual powers is ceaseless. They abide in the cosmos of reality, able to observe everywhere.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'i tshul rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i skus ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las tshad med pa brnyes pas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyi yul mnga' bas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' bas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi tshar mngon par 'bebs pas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang / legs pa mang po mnga' bas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sngon gyi mtha'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam dang khyad par mnga' bas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mur 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrub pas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi rigs thams cad ma lus pa'i sems dang spyod pa la ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams zil gyis mi non pas ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes rgya mtsho mi zad pa'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of virtues of inexhaustible oceans of knowledge. What are they? The virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the boundless body of reality of all buddhas; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the infinite buddha-works of all buddhas; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the sphere of the enlightened eye of all buddhas; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the infinite, inconceivable roots of goodness of all buddhas; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of all buddhas showering all liberating teachings everywhere; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of all buddhas extolling the qualities of enlightenment; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the various undertakings and practices carried out by all buddhas in the past; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the eternal performance of buddha-work by all buddhas; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of all buddhas comprehending the mental patterns of all sentient beings; the virtue of the inexhaustible ocean of knowledge of the unsurpassable adornments of virtue and knowledge of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyis mngon par byung ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no; ;'di lta ste/ chos thams cad la mi mkhyen pa gang yang mi mnga' ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad kyang thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad kyang stobs bcu tshad med pa dang ldan pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad kyang bla na med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad kyang sems can 'dul ba yang dag par zhugs pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ thams cad kyang 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du mngon par sangs rgyas pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul ba la thogs pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ mi gnyis par yang dag par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos la rab tu gzhol ba 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin no/ / 'di lta ste/ ji ltar yongs su smin par gyur pa dang / dul bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi yul mu med pas/ sangs rgyas kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi tshul yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi tshul lo; ;

“Buddhas have ten kinds of eternal law. What are they? All buddhas always carry out all the transcendent ways. All buddhas are always free from confusion in regard to all things. All buddhas always have universal compassion. All buddhas always have the ten powers. All buddhas always turn the wheel of the Teaching. All buddhas always demonstrate the accomplishment of true awakening for the benefit of sentient beings. All buddhas always gladly lead all sentient beings. All buddhas always correctly remember the truth of nonduality. All buddhas, after having taught sentient beings, always show entry into nirvana without remainder, because the realm of the buddhas has no bounds.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' yas pa shin tu bstan pa'i sgo rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi khams shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can gyi spyod pa sna tshogs shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi las dang / rnam par smin pa shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can thams cad la gdams ngag dang / man ngag shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can mtha' yas pa rnam par sbyong ba'i nan tan gyi sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la gdams ngag dang / man ngag gis yongs su gzhog pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par gyi smon lam rnam pa tha dad pas 'byung ba shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus pa'i 'du ba dang / 'jig pa shin tu bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su bstan pa'i sgor mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ni bskal pa yangs pa de dang de dag tu bstan cing brjod pa dang / yongs su bshad pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i sgor mtha' yas pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos mtha' yas pa shin tu bstan pa'i sgo'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of exposition of the innumerable facets of the Teaching of the buddhas. What are they? All buddhas expound innumerable facets of the realms of sentient beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of the activities of sentient beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of effects of acts of sentient beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of teaching sentient beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of purifying sentient beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of vows of enlightening beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of practices of enlightening beings. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of the ages of becoming and decay of all worlds. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of enlightening beings devotedly purifying buddha-lands. All buddhas expound innumerable facets of the successive emergence in each age of the past, present, and future buddhas in innumerable worlds. All buddhas expound the ways of knowledge of all buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sems can rnams la sgrub pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku yongs su bstan pa ni/ sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams len pa mdzad pa yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams len pa mi mdzad pa yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gis kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byin gyi rlabs kyi yul dang mi dmigs pa thams cad yul du mdzad pas kyang / sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan kyang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zhing la dmigs par mdzad pas kyang / sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pas kyang / sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi gsung bar bzhugs pa yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sgrub pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las sems can rnams la sgrub pa'o// //

“Buddhas have ten kinds of performance of buddha-work for sentient beings. What are they? All buddhas manifest physical forms to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas make subtle utterances to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas accept things to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas accept nothing to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas do buddha-work for sentient beings by means of earth, water, fire, and air. All buddhas magically show all realms of objects to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas do buddha-work for sentient beings by various names and epithets. All buddhas do buddha-work for sentient beings by means of the realms of objects of buddha-lands. All buddhas adorn and purify buddha-lands to do buddha-work for sentient beings. All buddhas do buddha-work for sentient beings silently, without words.
bam po drug cu rtsa bzhi pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos te/ bcu gang zhe na/ smon lam chen po la rab tu brtan zhing smon lam zhig pa mi mnga' bas ji skad du gsung ba de ltar mdzad cing gnyis su mi gsung ba 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos dang po'o/ /phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa thams cad du/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad par rab tu brtson zhing sgyid lug pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos gnyis pa'o/ /sems can 'dul bar 'gyur ba gcig cig gzigs kyang 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par gshegs shing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gshegs pa la thag thogs med pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos gsum pa'o/ /zhe sdang ba'i sems can rnams la thugs rje chen pos snyoms pa dang / dad pa'i sems can rnams la thugs rje chen pos snyoms pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos bzhi pa'o/ /gang gi tshe bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro snyam du byang chub kyi sems ma nyams pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos lnga pa'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo bas 'jug gi /'jig rten pa'i rgyud la ma yin pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos drug pa'o// sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rjes su bsngo na/ sangs rgyas kyis spyad pa'i sems su lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las kyis slob cing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba med pas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos bdun pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sems rnam par dag cing / 'od gsal la pa/ thams cad du snang zhing kun tu 'od 'byung ba/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la snang zhing thams cad du snyoms pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos brgyad pa'o/ /'jig rten pa'i bde ba thams cad yongs su spangs te/ 'jig rten pa'i dga' ba thams cad la ma chags pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis gos pa med pa'i smon lam thams cad du mnyam pa nyid kyis 'jig rten thams cad bde ba thams cad dang ldan par byas te/ sdug bsngal dang; spros pa thams cad rab tu 'joms pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bos chos dgu pa'o/ /sdug bsngal gyi mi bde ba thams cad nyams su bab ste/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du dka' thub kyis shin tu gdungs kyang bla bar sems bskyed pas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs yongs su bsrung ba dang ldan pa dang / stobs bcu'i sa'i bar du sangs rgyas kyi yul la mos pas mthar thug pa 'di ni/ sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos bcu pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi gtso bo'i chos so/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of supreme qualities. What are they. All buddhas’ great vows are firm and steadfast and cannot be broken; they do what they say without fail, and there is no duplicity in their words. All buddhas tirelessly practice the deeds of enlightening beings throughout all future ages, in order to perfect and fulfill all virtues. All buddhas will go to untold worlds in order to guide a single sentient being, and do the same for all sentient beings, endlessly. All buddhas universally regard both faithful and scornful beings with great compassion impartially, without any discrimination. All buddhas, from their initial aspiration to their attainment of buddhahood, never lose the determination for perfect enlightenment. All buddhas accumulate immeasurable virtues and dedicate them all to omniscience, with never any attachment to the world or its creatures. All buddhas learn physical, verbal, and mental practices from buddhas, only carrying out buddha-practice, not the practice of the vehicles of individual liberation, all to be dedicated to omniscience, to attain unexcelled true enlightenment. All buddhas emanate great light, that light impartially illumining all places, and illuminating all the buddhas’ teachings, enabling enlightening beings’ minds to become purified and to fulfill universal knowledge. All buddhas give up worldly pleasures, without craving or attachment, and wish that all worldlings would be free from suffering and attain bliss, and have no false ideas. All buddhas, out of compassion for sentient beings, undergo all kinds of hardship, preserving the seed of buddhahood, course in the sphere of buddhahood, leave birth and death, and arrive at the stage of the ten powers.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa chags pa med pa rnams te / bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gshegs pas chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad na bzhugs pas chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni; 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na bzhugs pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhud pas chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du chos ston pas chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs kyang / chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba'i mtha' la chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad tsam gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na bzhugs kyang chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa la gzigs shing / thugs kyi skad cig gcig la cho 'phrul chen po gsum gyis sems can rnam par 'dul yang chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sku gcig gis kyang tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa chen por rnam par spyod kyang chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sems can gyi khams 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ma lus pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa bsam gyis mi khyab par ston cing gsung yang / chags pa mi mnga' bar rnam par spyod pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa chags pa med pa'o/ /

“Buddhas remain unhindered in ten ways. What are they? All buddhas can travel to all worlds, remaining unhindered. All buddhas can walk, stand, sit, and recline in all worlds, remaining unhindered. All buddhas can abide in all worlds, remaining unhindered. All buddhas can expound the truth in all worlds, remaining unhindered. All buddhas can abide in the heaven of contentment in all worlds, remaining unhindered. All buddhas are able to enter all the pasts, presents, and futures of the cosmos, remaining unhindered. All buddhas are able to sit at all enlightenment sites in the cosmos, remaining unhindered. All buddhas are able to observe the mental patterns of all sentient beings in each moment of thought, and use their powers of diagnosis, prescription, and occult effects to teach and tune them, remaining unhindered. All buddhas are able to sojourn at the places of innumerable buddhas with one body, and in all places, benefiting living beings, remaining unhindered. All buddhas are able to expound true teachings spoken by infinite buddhas, remaining unhindered.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung yan lag gi mchog dam pa drug cu dang ldan zhing yan lag lnga brgyas yongs su bzung ba dang / rgyan brgya stong du mas rab tu brgyan pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag mtha' yas mu med pas rnam par dag pa dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi don dang / tshig dang / yi ge brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pas rab tu tshim par mdzad pa dang / bag tsha ba mi mnga' bas seng+ge'i nga ro chen po sgrogs pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa chen pos bsnyengs pa mi mnga' bar gyur pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du sems can thams cad la grags cing bsal te khong du chud par 'gyur ba dang / sems can bsam pa tha dad pa dang / dbang po tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'dul bar nye bar gnas pa 'di ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi 'phrin las ni stobs bcus brgyan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin chen po thams cad kyi me tog shin tu rgyas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan cing bsgrubs pas chags pa med pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi la rab tu rten pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos gting med pa rab tu brnyes pa/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi rgyan du gyur pa/ dus gsum gyi chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can kun gyi sems dang spyod pa thams cad skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi rab tu mkhyen pa ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'od zer bye ba brjod du med pa rab tu 'gyed par mdzad de/ 'od zer de dag re re la yang 'od zer gyi 'khor gyi dra ba brjod du med pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par snang bar byed cing / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud thams cad mun pa med par ston pa/ sangs rgyas skye ba dang mi 'brel bas sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las las phyir mi ldog cing don yod pa/ sangs rgyas skye ba brjod du med pas gnas pa med pa rang bzhin rnam par dag cing / kun du snyoms par 'byung ba ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od zer gyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhad mo 'dzum par ston na/ zhal gyi sgo nas 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs kha dog du ma dang ldan pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad snang bar byed pa/ sems can gyi khams tshad med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par ston pa/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur bar lung ston pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du shin tu gsal bar 'byung ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bzhad mo 'dzum pa bstan pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni tshad med pa ste/ bsgribs pa med pas rnam par dag pa chos thams cad chags pa med pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa/ mtha' dang dbus med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa/ 'jig rten thams cad dang ma 'dres pa/ 'jig rten thams cad dang 'dzi ba med pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa/ 'jig rten thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa/ 'jig rten thams cad las 'das pa'i chos kyis yang dag par spyod pa/ tshig gi lam dang bral ba; brjod du med pa'i mthar phyin pa/ phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang bral ba ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'od tshad med pa mnga' ba ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du 'od ma 'dres shing rgyan du ma dang ldan pa/ kha dog sna tshogs brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ 'od kyi snang ba kun du thogs pa med cing thams cad du chags pa med pa/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bsgribs pa med pa tshad med pa'i mdzod du gyur pa/ 'od thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog mtha' yas pa mnga' ba ste/ kha dog yid du 'ong ba mnga' ba'o/ /kha dog 'od gsal ba mnga' ba'o/ /kha dog tshad med pa mnga' ba'o/ /sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mos pa bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o/ /de ma yin pa'i kha dog gzhan khams gsum du gtogs pa thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o/ /kha dog thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog bla na med pa mnga' ba ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi kha dog gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge bas shin tu rnam par dag pa ste/
