sbyong ba/ bsod nams zad mi shes pa'i yon gyi gnas dag ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten du byung na/ de ltar sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa mang po rab tu bsags pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rab tu rdzogs par 'gyur te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bcu pa'o/ /

“When buddhas enter extinction, countless sentient beings mourn and weep; looking at each other in great grief and distress, they say, ‘The buddha had great sympathy and compassion, mercifully aiding all worldly beings, a savior and a refuge for all living creatures. The emergence of a buddha is difficult to encounter, an unexcelled field of blessings, and now the buddha has passed away forever.’ Thus they use this to cause sentient beings to mourn and miss the buddha, thereby doing buddha-work. Also, in order to transform and liberate all celestials, humans, spirits, goblins, titans, cherubim, and so on, according to their desires, they pulverize their own bodies to make countless relics, to cause sentient beings to develop faith, honor, respect, and joyfully reverence them, and cultivate virtues to complete fulfillment. They also build monuments, variously adorned, in the abodes of all kinds of creatures, for religious services; their teeth, nails, and hair are all used to make monuments, to cause those who see them to remember the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, to believe with unswerving faith, sincerely respect and honor them, and make offerings to them wherever they are, and cultivate virtues, so that by this merit they may be born in heaven or among humans, of noble and prosperous families with ample property and pure retinues, not enter into evil ways, always get to see buddhas, fulfill pure ways, quickly attain emancipation from the three realms of existence, each attain the fruit of their own vehicle according to their aspiration, recognize and requite their debt to buddhas, and forever be a reliance for the world. Though the buddhas be extinct, they are still inconceivable pure fields of blessings for living beings, with inexhaustible virtues, supreme fields of blessings, causing sentient beings’ roots of goodness to be complete and their virtue to be fully developed. This is the tenth great buddha-work.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgya chen po tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams so/ /de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis ched gzung bar mi nus pa'o/ /'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'jug par mi nus pa'o/ /

“These buddha-works are immeasurably great, inconceivable: no beings of the world, celestials or humans, and none of the listeners or individual illuminates of past, future, or present can know them, unless they are empowered by Buddha.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gnyis su med par spyod cing / dngos po rnam pa gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbang phyug gi chos rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ lung bstan pa thams cad ston pa la gnyis su med par spyod do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sems can sangs rgyas kyi rjes su dran pa la brtson pa rnams kyi sems dang bsam pa brjod du med pa 'byams klas pa rnams la gnyis su med par spyod do/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi don ma lus par mngon par sangs rgyas pas gnyis su med pa'i sku rnam par dmigs par mdzad do/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la rang bzhin gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa mnga' ba'o/ /'byung ba dang / 'byung ba'i mtha' gnyis su med pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba'i mtha' gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa mnga' ba'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad gnyis su med pas dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad gcig par rab tu mkhyen cing ston pa thugs su chud par mnga' ba'o/ /sangs rgyas gcig dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa mnga' ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis thugs su chud pa dang / 'dul ba mdzad pa'i rnam par dmigs pa gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa mnga' ba'o/ /'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa mnga' ba'o/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig ste/ gnyis su med par thugs su chud par mnga' ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gnyis su med par spyod cing / dngos po gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbang phyug gi chos so/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of mastery of nondual action. What are they? All buddhas can speak words of prediction of enlightenment, definitively, without duality. All buddhas can satisfy sentient beings according to their wishes, definitely, without duality. All buddhas can manifestly be awake to all truths and expound their meanings, definitively, without duality. All buddhas have all the wisdom and knowledge of the buddhas of past, future, and present, definitive, without duality. All buddhas know that all instants, past, future, and present, are one instant, definitely, without duality. All buddhas know that all past, future, and present buddha-lands inhere in one buddha-land, definitely, without duality. All buddhas know the words of all buddhas of all times are the words of one buddha, definitely, without duality. All buddhas know that all buddhas of all times and all the beings they teach are essentially equal, definitely, without duality. All buddhas know that worldly phenomena and Buddhist principles are essentially not different, definitely, without duality. All buddhas know that the roots of goodness of all buddhas of all times are the same one root of goodness, definitely, without duality. These are the ten.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa chos thams cad la rab tu bzhugs pa rnams so/ /bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings gnas pa'i ye shes thugs su chud pa la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs rje chen po mi nyams pa la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni smon lam ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su mi gtong ba la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dngos po med pa la gnas pa'i chos nyid la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku skal ba mnyam pa tha mi dad cing don yod pa la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i thugs la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad nyams pa med par gzhol bar la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chags pa med pa'i thugs kyis rnam par spyod pa la bzhugs pa'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pas grub pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid la bzhugs pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa chos thams cad la bzhugs pa rnams so/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of abode, abiding therein in all things. What are they? All buddhas abide in awareness of all realms of reality. All buddhas abide in compassionate speech. All buddhas abide in the fundamental great vow. All buddhas abide in persistence in civilizing sentient beings. All buddhas abide in the principle of absence of selfhood. All buddhas abide in impartial salvation. All buddhas abide in recollection of truth. All buddhas abide in the unobstructed mind. All buddhas abide in the constantly rightly concentrated mind. All buddhas abide in equal comprehension of all things without violating the character of ultimate reality.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos thams cad ma lus par mngon par mkhyen pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'das pa 'grangs pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / ma 'ongs pa 'grangs pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / da ltar byung ba 'grangs pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / tshig gi lam mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa dang / shes pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la bsam pa tshad med pa yongs su mi btang bas/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'bar bar bya ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / chos thams cad 'tshang rgya ba'i mkhyen pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad rnam par dbye ba'i ye shes gzigs pa mtha' dag thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa lta bur dbye ba thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos thams cad ma lus par mngon par mkhyen pa'o// //

“All buddhas have ten exhaustive knowledges. What are they? They know all things of the past exhaustively. They know all things of the future exhaustively. They know all things of the present exhaustively. They know all principles of language exhaustively. The know all sentient beings’ minds exhaustively. They know all the various ranks, high, middling, and low, of the roots of goodness of enlightening beings. They know all buddhas’ complete knowledge and virtues do not increase or decrease. They know all phenomena come from interdependent origination. They know all world systems exhaustively. They know all the different phenomena in all worlds, interrelated in Indra’s net.
bam po drug cu rtsa drug pa/

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi stobs chen po/ stobs dam pa/ stobs tshad med pa/ stobs bdag nyi che ba/ stobs thub pa med pa/ stobs mi mnyam pa/ stobs snying po dang ldan pa/ stobs mi shigs pa/ stobs 'jig rten thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ stobs sems can thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rgyal mtshan stobs po che dpa' bo chen po'i stobs rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi sku ni pha rol gyi gnod pa thams cad kyis mi shigs mi chod pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi yul thams cad kyis sku tshe'i dbang po nyams par mi nus pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa'i me'i gdung bas 'tshig par mi nus pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'jig par gtogs pa'i chu'i phung por 'grongs par mi 'gyur ba'o/ /bdud thams cad dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad dang / lha thams cad kyi dpung dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang; nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyi dpung dang / sha za dang / srin po thams cad kyi dpung dang / sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi dpung gis brgal bar dka' ba'o/ /rdo rje ri rab kyi ri tsam gyi char pa dang / khor yug gi ri chen po tsam dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po tsam gyi rdo rje'i char bab kyang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ba spu gcig kyang 'gul bar mi 'gyur/ g.yo bar mi 'gyur te/ bag tsha ba'i shas mi mnga' ba'o; ;bzhugs sam/ bzhengs sam/ bzhud dam/ gzims kyang rung ste/ spyod lam 'gyur ba med do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gang na bzhugs ba'i yul de dang / de'i 'khor dag tu yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes na kun tu 'bab par mi 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhabs 'bring rnams la yang gnod par mi 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems can rnams la yang gnod par mi 'gyur zhing mi g.yo na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku lta la smos kyang ci dgos te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po stobs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos dang po'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of might with enormous power, supreme power, measureless power, grandiose, awesome power, power difficult to acquire, undiminishing power, stable power, indestructible power, power inconceivable to any worldlings, power that all living beings cannot shake. What are they? All buddhas have indestructible bodies and life that cannot be cut off—no worldly poisons can affect them; the floods, fires, and gales of all worlds cannot harm the buddhas’ body. Even if all demons, gods, sprites, goblins, angels, titans, and sundry other creatures were to rain thunderbolts as big as mountains with all their strength, hurling them down all at once throughout the universe, they could not cause the buddhas’ mind to be startled or frightened and could not even move a single hair of the buddhas. Walking, standing still, sitting, or reclining, the buddhas never change. That rain cannot fall where the buddhas are unless they let it, and even if they do not prevent it, and let it rain, it does not harm them. If there are any beings sustained by the buddhas or in the service of the buddhas, that rain of thunderbolts cannot even harm them, much less the buddhas. This is the buddhas’ first mighty quality.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgyes na/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyis klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ri rab kyi ri dang bcas pa/ khor yug dang khor yug chen po'i ri dang bcas pa/ rgya mtsho dang ri dang nags tshal thibs po dang / sems can gnas pa'i gnas tha dad pa kun dang bcas pa/ de lta bu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga gcig tu btsud de/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par bzhag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par sems can rnams kyis shes par mi nus so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams sku'i ba spu'i khung bu gcig gis bzung ste/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par bsnams shing / gshegs sam/ bzhugs sam/ bzhengs sam/ gzims kyang rung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs skad cig tsam yang skyo ba mnga'o/ /chad cing dub par mi 'gyur ro/ /mthu dang stobs la yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba mi mnga'o/ /spyod lam rnam par 'gyur ba mi mnga'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dzin kyang skyo ba med do/ /dub pa med do/ /gnod pa med do/ /med par mi 'gyur ro/ /mi g.yo/ mi 'byung / mi 'jig go/ de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad bsnams kyang / de'i rgyus thugs skad cig tsam du yang mi bde ba'i sku nyams mi 'byung ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gnyis pa'o/ /

“All buddhas put the mountains, oceans, forests, and buildings in all worlds in all universes into a single pore for all future ages, yet the sentient beings are not aware, do not know, unless they are empowered by the Buddha. Then the buddhas, holding all those worlds in a pore throughout the ages to come, whether walking, standing still, sitting, or reclining, do not conceive a single thought of fatigue. Just as space holds all the worlds in the cosmos without fatigue, so do all buddhas hold all worlds in a single pore. This is buddhas’ second mighty quality.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gshegs stabs gcig tu bzhud pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'da' zhing thugs bskyed pa gcig gis bskal pa tha dad pa'i rim pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung bar mdzad do/ /de lta bur gshegs pas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du gshegs shing / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud ji snyed pa'i bskal par bzhud de/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du 'khor kun tu rgya che zhing yangs pa'i khor yug chen po'i rdo rje'i ri dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rnam pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la bsgres pa snyed kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang de la bsgres pa de snyed ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu btsud de/ ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu ji lta ba bzhin du sku'i ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du btsud de/ ba spu'i khung bu yang sems can thams cad snyed du gyur la de dag thams cad bsnams te/ de snyed kyi ba spu'i khung bur tshul de bzhin du bshams te; thugs bskyed pa de lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam/ phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam/ nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'grangs pa sngon gyi mthar gtogs pa nas bzung ste/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par de bzhin du gshegs pas bskal pa thams cad zad par gyur kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa la brtson pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ /sku nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro/ /thugs rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro/ /ting nge 'dzin nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gsum pa'o/ /

“All buddhas can take as many steps as atoms in untold worlds in a single moment, passing as many lands as atoms in untold buddha-lands with each step, and travel thus for as many eons as atoms in all worlds: if there were a great adamantine mountain equal in measure to all those buddha-lands, the buddhas could place as many such mountains as atoms in untold buddha-lands in a single pore; the pores on a buddha’s body being equal in number to all beings in the cosmos, they place the same number of great adamantine mountains in each pore, and, holding all those mountains, walk in the ten directions, entering all worlds in space, from the past throughout the future, through all ages, without resting—yet the buddhas’ bodies are not injured and they do not get tired; their minds are always in concentration, without distraction. This is the buddhas’ third mighty quality.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsod snyoms gcig bzhes nas bskal pa brjod du med par skyil mo krung gcig bcas pas nyin mtshan gyi rgyud du sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur gtogs pa'i bskal pa 'das par bzhugs kyang sku mi g.yo zhing bde ba'i dam pa la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par spyod kyang sems can 'ga' tsam la'ang / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su bkod do/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can gcig gi lus kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed tsam du che ba de lta bur gyur la/ sems can gcig gi lus kyi tshad ji tsam pa de tsam gyi lus su sems can thams cad kyang gyur la/ sems can de dag re re'i gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lcid ji tsam yod pa de tsam du gyur te/ sems can gcig ji ltar lci ba bzhin du sems can thams cad re re'i lcid kyang de tsam du 'gyur te/ sems can de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par bsnams te/ phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig gis ji ltar bsnams pa de bzhin du phyag sor thams cad kyi rtse mo la'ang de tsam re re bsnams kyang / de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sku mnyel ba'am/ thugs dub par mi 'gyur te/ thugs bskyed pa'i cha shas shin tu phra ba gcig tsam du yang sdug bsngal mi bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rnam pa la 'jug pa re re dang / de lta bu la 'jug pa/ nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa'i dbyings kyis klas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa/ skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa thams cad re re zhing yang skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal te/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi kun tu khyab pa thams cad ma lus pa'i skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi tshad kyis nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa thams cad du zhugs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam 'di'i tshul dang / skyil mo krung gcig tu bzhugs pa'i spyod pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad par mdzad de/ bskal pa 'da' bar mdzad cing bskal pa la rab tu 'jug ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos bzhi pa'o/ /

“Buddhas, after a meal, sit in the lotus posture through the untold eons of past and future, and enter the inconceivable bliss experienced by buddhas; their bodies remain stable, still and unmoving, yet they do not abandon the work of teaching sentient beings. Suppose someone measured each world throughout space one after another with a hairtip; the buddhas are able to sit cross-legged forever on a point the size of the hairtip, and likewise on all points. Suppose the size and weight of each being in all worlds in the ten directions were equal to those of worlds as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands; the buddhas could put all those beings on a fingertip forever and could do the same with all their fingertips, and enter each world in all of space carrying all those beings, exhausting the whole cosmos, yet the buddhas would never be weary in body or mind. This is buddhas’ fourth mighty quality.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gcig la dbu sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs te/ dbu re re la ljags sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs nas/ de dag re res kyang dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed re re brjod de/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad cing dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung re res kyang mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bshad la/ mdo sde re re la yang chos bstan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu gzhol bar mdzad de/ chos bstan pa gcig las kyang chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed brjod par gyur la/ chos bstan pa gcig las ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa thams cad las kyang de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod de/ de ltar brjod pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du rab tu bstan la/ bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad par gyur kyang / da dung gzhan yang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du brgyud cing rab tu ston pa'i tshul gyi rnam grangs 'dis bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du rab tu bstan la/ rnam grangs 'di 'dra bas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad la sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa snyed kyi bskal pa 'das par gyur te; phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad cing 'das par byas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa chos thams cad snang ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang / chos thams cad rab tu shes par bstan cing lung bstan pa dang / the tshom thams cad rab tu gcod pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / chos thams cad snang bar byed pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad brjod pa'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa dang / mi 'jigs pa chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rgyun mi 'chad de/ sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig gi byin gyi rlabs kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo'i sprin chen po dpe thams cad la dpe med par rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba ma lus pa thams cad chags pa med par rnam par dbye bas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de snyed de snyed du thugs kyi skad cig re re la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par sprul pa mdzad cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku re re la'ang de snyed de snyed kyi dbu mnga' bar gyur la/ gzhung de bzhin du sku re re la'ang de snyed de snyed kyi ljags mnga' bar gyur te/ ljags re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad pa byung la/ dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung de dag re res kyang de snyed de snyed kyi mdo sde bshad par gyur la/ mdo sde de dag re re la yang de snyed de snyed kyi chos bstan pa la rab tu gzhol ba mdzad de/ chos bstan pa de dag re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod par gyur la/ chos kyi tshig dang yi ge de dag re res kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dbyangs kyi rgyas par bkang ste/ sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad go bar mdzad kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs la dub ba mi mnga' ste/ nyams par mi 'gyur la thogs pa mi mnga' zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur te/ de lta bu'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor yang bskal pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos lnga pa'o/ /

“Buddhas can cause to appear on one body as many heads as atoms in untold buddha-lands, manifesting as many tongues in each head as atoms in untold buddha-lands, each tongue producing as many different voices as atoms in untold buddha-lands, which all beings in the cosmos hear, each voice delivering as many troves of discourses as atoms in untold buddha-lands, each trove of discourses expounding as many principles as atoms in untold buddha-lands, each principle having as many terms, statements, and meanings as atoms in untold buddha-lands. They preach this way for as many eons as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and when they finish these eons, they again preach for as many eons as atoms in untold buddha-lands, going on like this successively until they exhaust eons as numerous as atoms in all worlds, as numerous as the thoughts of all living beings. The eons of the future may be exhausted, but the cycles of teaching operated by the emanated bodies of buddhas have no end. This means the cycle of teaching expounded by knowledge, the cycle of teaching cutting off doubts, the cycle of teaching illumining all things, the cycle of teaching opening the treasury of nonobstruction, the cycle of teaching causing sentient beings to be joyful and docile, the cycle of teaching revealing all the practices of enlightening beings, the cycle of teaching of the high-rising, perfectly round sun of knowledge, the cycle of teaching of the bright lamp of wisdom illumining all the world, the cycle of teaching of various adornments of intellectual powers and confidence: just as one buddha-body, by spiritual power, operates different cycles of teaching such as these, to which no comparison in the world may be drawn, in the same way throughout space, in every single point, there are as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and in each world the buddhas manifest in each mental instant as many emanation bodies as atoms in untold buddha-lands, each emanation body also producing voices and teachings like these, each filling all realms, so all beings therein can understand—yet the voice of the buddhas does not change or die out; it is inexhaustible. This is the fifth mighty quality of buddhas.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa rdo rje chen po ltar shin tu bstan par grub pa mnga' ba dag ste/ de dag byang chub kyi shing drung du byon na bdud sdig to can gyi sems can thams cad snyed kyi bdud kyi sde gzugs sna tshogs can shin tu mi sdug pa/ 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa rab tu sdang ba'i gzugs can/ 'jig rten thams cad shin tu 'jigs pa'i gzugs can/ rab tu skyi g.ya' ba skyed pa'i gzugs can/ bdud shin tu mi sdug pa'i gzugs 'chang ba/ rab mchog por 'jigs pa 'jigs pa chen po skyed pa/ 'gro ba thams cad gsod pa/ 'jig rten thams cad phung bar byed pa/ de lta bu sha stag gis byang chub kyi shing drung dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad dang / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug par gang bar gzigs kyang byang chub kyi shing drung na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyengs pa mi mnga'o/ /bag tsha ba mi mnga'o/ /ba spu gcig kyang g.yo ba med do/ /thugs kyi cha shas shin tu phra ba 'ga' tsam gyis kyang de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i gzugs la mtshan ma rnam pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa mi mnga' ste/ shin tu brtan no/ /g.yo ba med do/ /mi sgul to/ /'gyur pa med do/ /rnam par rtog pa med do/ /shin tu zhi ba'o/ /bsnyengs pa dang / bag tsha ba thams cad dang shin tu bral lo/ /sdug pa dang khong khro ba shin tu spangs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad do/ /byams pa chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa'o/ /thugs rje chen po'i gnas kyis dbang po shin tu dben pa'o/ /bag tsha ba mi mnga' ba'i thugs dang ldan pa'o/ /thugs shin tu brten zhing nyams pa mi mnga' ba'o/ /tshur zil gyis mi gnon la phar zil gyis gnon pa'i thugs dang ldan pa ste/ bdud thams cad dang / bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha thams cad dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad shin tu zil gyis gnon to/ /shin tu spa gong ngo/ /de ltar zil gyis mnan te spa gong ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la skyabs tshol lo/ /de dag la'ang bcom ldan 'das de dag cho 'phrul chen po gsum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba mdzad pa nye bar sgrub ste/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro/ / 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos drug pa'o/ /

“All buddhas adorn their chests with the sign of virtue, indestructible as adamant, and sit at the foot of a tree of enlightenment: hordes of demons, boundless in number, with various forms so terrifying that all sentient beings who see them become crazed with fear or even drop dead—such hordes of demons fill the sky, but when the buddhas see them, they are not frightened, they do not pale, not even one hair stands on end, they are not moved or disturbed, they do not think of anything—aloof from emotions, they are tranquil and clear, abiding m the abode of buddhas, imbued with the power of love and compassion, their senses under control, their hearts without fear, impossible for the hordes of demons to upset. In fact, it is they who can subdue the demons, cause them to change their minds and take refuge in the buddhas, after which the buddhas teach them by means of correct diagnosis, prescription, and mystic influence, so that all now develop the aspiration for unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment, never to regress. This is the sixth mighty quality of buddhas.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung thogs pa med pa ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa de dang de dag thams cad du sems can rnams 'dul ba'i don gyis rnam par dmigs par kun tu khyab par 'byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de ni ri rnams la thogs pa med do/ /ri rab la thogs pa med do/ /rin po che'i ri la thogs pa med do/ /khor yug dang khor yug chen po la thogs pa med do/ /lha'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /klu'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /gnod sbyin gyi khyim la thogs pa med do/ /dri za'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /lha ma yin gyi khyim la thogs pa med do/ /nam mkha' lding gi khyim la thogs pa med do/ /mi'am ci'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /lto 'phye chen po'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /mi dang mi ma yin pa'i khyim la thogs pa med do/ /gal te brgya la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i sgra chen po 'jig rten rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgras 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gang ste/ ca co 'dres par gyur kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ni 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi rna ba'i rnam par dmigs pa la bsgribs pa med pa yin te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung 'ba' zhig de dag gi rna ba'i rnam par dmigs pa la lhang nge lham me lhan ne ste go bar mdzad pa'i tshig dang / yi ge rnams kyang rlag par mi 'gyur te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos bdun pa'o/ /

“All buddhas have unobstructed voices that pervade all worlds in the ten directions, and all sentient beings who hear them spontaneously become docile. The sounds of the voices of the buddhas cannot be blocked by any mountains, any habitations of any creatures, or any sounds of any world, no matter how loud. According to the ways in which they need to be influenced, all sentient beings hear articulated statements and doctrines and all attain understanding. This is the seventh mighty quality of buddhas.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs ni chags pa mi mnga' ba ste/ bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par yongs su sbyangs pa'o/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyan gcig tu gyur pa'o/ /rnyog pa med cing rnam par dang ste shin tu gsal ba'o/ /bdag gi zhes bya ba mi mnga' ba'o/ /chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'o/ /nang na gnas pa ma yin pa'o/ /phyi rol na gnas pa ma yin pa'o/ /ma skyes pa'o/ /dmigs pa thams cad kyis dben pa'o/ /zhi zhing gnas pa med pa'o/ /rtsom pa med pa'o/ /'du shes sna tshogs thams cad la mi gnas pa'o/ /dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'gags pa'o/ /rang bzhin gyis 'od dang zhing gsal ba'o/ /yongs su dag pa'o/ /dmigs pa dang / yid la bya ba thams cad dang ma 'dres pa'o/ /chos thams cad nyon mongs pa med pa'i yul dang ldan pa'o/ /yang dag pa'i mtha' 'dod chags dang bral bas dag pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pa'i mthar thug pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings kun nas mi zad pa dang ldan pa'o/ /'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi tshad dang tshad med pa dang bral ba'o/ /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi brjod pa thams cad 'gags pa'o/ /tshig gi lam gyis brjod du med pa'i mthar thug pa'i yul lo; ;mi zad pa dang chags pa med pa'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa'o/ /ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o/ /stobs bcu'i rgyan du gyur pa'o/ /chos thams cad kyis rnam par dag pa'o/ /thabs mkhas pas byung ba'o/ /chos sna tshogs dang / chos du ma dang / chos thams cad shin tu bstan pa dang mi 'gal ba'o/ /dus gsum du tha dad pa med pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings thams cad du chos gzhi med pa thams cad kyi mnga' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis pa'o/ /chos thams cad la mnga' ba'i 'byung gnas dang mdzod du gyur pa'o/ /chos kyi tshul thams cad la dgongs pa khyad par du rmongs pa med pa'o/ /zhing gi rgyud du gtogs pa thams cad dang / phyogs kyi dra ba dang / rgyud 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad la mi gnas pa brtan zhing mi g.yo la; nyams pa med pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu gzigs pa chos ma lus pa thams cad kyi mthar thug pa/ zag pa thams cad yongs su zad pa thugs rnam par grol zhing zag pa mi mnga' ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol bas shin tu rnam par grol ba yang dag pa'i mtha' mi zad pas klas pa/ chags pa med par rnam par spyod pa rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa; dus gsum thams cad kyi bsgrub pa med par 'byung ba/ sems can thams cad kyi dus gsum gyi sems dang spyod pa thams cad ma lus par thugs skad cig gis rab tu mkhyen pa ste; 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos brgyad pa'o/ /

“All buddhas’ minds are unobstructed, eternally pure; all buddhas of past, future, and present are of the same one essence, unpolluted, unblinkered, without egoism or possessiveness, either internally or externally; they realize objects are void, they do not conceive arbitrary ideas, do not depend on anything, do not fabricate anything, do not dwell on appearances, forever end false imaginings, give up all thoughts clinging to objects, are pure in their fundamental nature, are forever free from conflict while in the midst of all things, abiding in ultimate reality, free from desire, thoroughly pure; entering the cosmos of reality, their teaching is inexhaustible, beyond all illusory ideas of assessment and wrong assessment, totally beyond all talk of the compounded and the uncompounded. Having comprehended untold, boundless realms of objects, with unimpeded, inexhaustible knowledge and method they accomplish the ten powers, and their embellishments of all virtues are thoroughly pure. They expound innumerable various principles, all without contradicting the character of reality, impartial with respect to the phenomena of past, present, and future of the cosmos, without variance, ultimately free, entering into the supreme treasury of all truths, correctly remembering all facets of truth without confusion, abiding unperturbed in the fields of all buddhas in the ten directions. Attaining unbroken knowledge, they know all things ultimately, without exception; putting an end to contamination, their minds are liberated and their intellects are liberated. Abiding in ultimate reality, their perceptivity is unimpeded, and their minds are always correctly stabilized. In a single thought they comprehend the things of past, present, and future as well as the mental activities of all sentient beings, without any hindrance. This is the eighth mighty quality of buddhas.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni sku mi mnga' ba ste/ rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul tshad med pa'i sku'o/ /mtha' dang dbus med par yongs su grub pa'i sku'o/ /'jig rten thams cad kyis zad par mi nus pa'i sku'o/ /khams gsum pas gos pa med pa'i sku'o/ /brten pa'i skus rnam par dmigs pa'o/ /lhag pa'i bsam pa dang rjes su dran pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sku'i rang bzhin yang dag par ston pa'o/ /bden pa med pa dang / rdzun pa med pa'i sku mnyam pa nyid kyi yongs su dag pa'o/ /chos kyi sku bzhud pa dang / byon pa med pa'i sku'o/ /'dus ma byas pas 'jig pa med pa'i sku'o/ /mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no/ /yul na mi gnas pa dang / phyogs na mi gnas pa'i sku'o/ /ma lus pa thams cad kyi lus kyi sku'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' yas pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no/ /lus thams cad du yongs su gzhol ba'i sku sna tshogs su rnam par dmigs pa mdzad kyang chos kyi sku'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang ba'o/ /ye shes kun tu snang ba'i snying po can no/ /sku yongs kyi mdzod du gyur pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings rnam pa tha dad pa med pa shin tu bstan pa'i sku'o/ /khams gsum ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pas kun tu khyab pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no/ /mi g.yo mi dgongs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa'o/ /yod pa yang ma yin/ med pa yang ma yin pa'i tshul dang tshul ma yin par rab tu brjod pa'i sku'o/ /sems can gyi mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'dul bar gyur pa'i sku'o/ /'gags pa yang ma yin/ ma 'gags pa yang ma yin pas 'dul ba ston pa'i sku'o/ /yon tan rin po che thams cad yang dag par 'byung bas shin tu 'phags pa'i sku'o/ /chos thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi de bzhin nyid du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i sku'o/ /rang bzhin gyis rab tu zhi zhing bsgribs pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i sku'o/ /thogs pa mi mnga' bas chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i sku'o/ /thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam par dag cing / 'jig rten thams cad du shin tu rnam par phye ba'i sku'o/ /phyir mi ldog cing bsgribs pa mi mnga' la/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pas ye shes thams cad rjes su 'brang zhing yang dag par gzhol bas thugs su chud pa'i sku ste/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos dgu po'o/ /

“All buddhas have the same one reality-body, a body of infinite range, a body of boundless qualities, a body with no limit in the world, a body undefiled by the realms of desire, form, or formlessness, a body manifested at will, an impartial, pure body that is neither real nor unreal, an indestructible body with no coming or going, no compounding, a body of the inherent essence of phenomena, of one form which is formless, an omnipresent body without position or location, a body of boundless forms produced by free psychic transformations, a body of all kinds of manifestations entering universally into everything, a body of skillful employment of subtle truth, a body of a treasury of knowledge illumining everywhere, a body showing the equality of phenomena, a body pervading the cosmos, a body of eternal purity without movement or discrimination, neither existent nor nonexistent, a body manifest in accord with the various interests and understandings of all beings capable of being edified, which is not an expedient yet not inexpedient, neither perishes nor does not perish, a body born of the treasury of all virtues, a body of True Thusness, containing all the teachings of the buddhas, a body free from obstruction, its fundamental nature absolutely still, a body in which all qualities of nonobstruction are developed, a body omnipresent in all realms of pure principle, a body omnipresent in all worlds in multiple forms, a body of universal comprehension, free from clinging to objects, free from regression, forever liberated, imbued with omniscience. This is the ninth mighty quality of buddhas.

gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes mnyam pa med pa dang mnyam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs su chud pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyis byung ba'o/ /mngon par 'grub pa'i spyod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i smon lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas rnam par dag pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'o/ /tha dad pa med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyis bzung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho'i spyod pa'i tshul thams cad thugs su chud pa'o/ /smon lam dang spyod pa chen pos yongs su mi dog pa'o/ /spyod pa thams cad mi mnyam pa med pas yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'o/ /spyod pa'i stobs la thub par dka' ba'i spyod pa thams cad kyis mngon par byung ba'o/ /spyod pa thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa legs par spyad pas rgyud dma' ba med pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyis tshad med bar spyod pa'o/ /ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi spyod yul mtha' yas pa'o/ /lam thams cad kyis rab tu brjod pa ma yin pa'o/ /lam gyi yul med pa'o/ /lam thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa'o/ /ye shes dam pa'i stobs kyi tshul mkhyen pa'o/ /bag tsha ba mi mnga' bas chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i 'khor lo dang ldan pa'o/ /dge ba dris pa dang ma dris pa la rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi tshul ston pa mkhyen pa'o/ /mnyam pa med pa dang mnyam pas shin tu dag pa'o/ /sku dang / thugs dang; gsung gi yang dag par spyod pa rnams la 'phrin las gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsgom pas brnyes pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pas brnyes pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thams cad bskyed pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi mdzad pa thams cad rab tu 'byung ba'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas kyi bstan pa tshad med pa'i gnas rtsa ba med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thams cad kyis mthar thug par mi 'gyur pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi sems kyis spyod pa'i shes pa thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o/ /chos thams cad ma lus par mkhyen cing gzigs pas sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'o/ /dus gsum yangs pa thams cad kyi tshul shin tu phra ba mtha' dang dbus med pa ma lus par mkhyen pa'o/ /'jig rten las 'das pa'i don mkhyen pa'i phyir phra ba'i ye shes thugs su chud pas 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rnam par dag pa/ phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las brjod du med pa 'jig rten thams cad du sbyor ba'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi sku 'grangs pa thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes kyis yi ge med pa'i chos thugs su chud pa'o/ /yi ge sna tshogs rnam par phye ba dang / yi ge thams cad smos shing brjod pa mkhyen pas brjod du med pa thugs su chud pa'o/ /kun tu bzang po'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos spyad pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'o/ /dam bcas pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / skye mched ji lta bar thugs skad cig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad khong du chud par ston pa mkhyen pa'o/ /chos thams cad kyi don du chos yongs su btang zhing rim gror bya bas thugs su chud pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams thams cad ma lus par yul du gyur pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad yul du gyur pa'o/ /dus gsum thams cad la thugs skad cig gis chags pa med par mkhyen cing thugs su chud pa'i yul dang ldan pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas 'byung ba ma lus par yul du gyur pa'o/ /'jig pa med par 'dul ba thams cad yul du gyur pa'o/ /thams cad kyi rjes su song zhing rnam par dag pa'i yul thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o/ /sa mtshams med cing thug pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa rnam par sangs rgyas pa'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa dus gsum du brjod pa ma lus pa thams cad thugs skad cig gis mkhyen cing thugs su chud pa'o/ /sems can gyi rnam pa thams cad las mtshams ma bcad pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi rnam pa thams cad la mu med pa'o/ /dus gsum gyi rnam par thams cad la mtha' yas pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i rnam pa thams cad la tshad med pa'i shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad la lhag ma ma lus pa ste/ de dag thams cad lhag ma med par mngon par sangs rgyas pas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba thams cad thugs su chud pa dang / mkhyen pa thams cad rgyun chad pa med de/ de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i skus mtha' dang dbus med par spyod pa yin/ chags pa med pa'i thugs kyis spyod pas mtha' dang dbus med par spyod pa yin/ thugs rje chen po'i sbyor bas dus thams cad du rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par chos bstan pa la spyod pas mtha' dang dbus med par spyod pa yin te/ 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos bcu pa'o/ /

“All buddhas equally understand all the teachings of buddhas and equally cultivate all the practices of enlightening beings; whether undertakings or knowledge, they are purely impartial, like the great ocean, all reaching fulfillment. Their power of action is supreme, and they never shrink back. Abiding in the measureless realms of the various concentrations, they show all paths, encourage good, and warn against evil. Their power of knowledge is foremost; they expound the truth without fear and are able to answer any question well. Their knowledge, wisdom, and teaching are equally pure; their physical, verbal, and mental actions are all unalloyed. They abide in the abode of buddhahood, the family of buddhas, doing buddha-work by means of enlightened knowledge and wisdom. Abiding in omniscience, they explain innumerable things as having no basis and no boundaries. Their psychic powers and knowledge are inconceivable, incomprehensible to any worldlings. Their knowledge profoundly penetrating, they see all things. The subtle, far-reaching, measureless, boundless gates of truth of past, present, and future, they thoroughly comprehend. In all worlds they are able to awaken understanding by means of transmundane knowledge. In all worlds they perform untold buddha-works of all kinds, attain unregressing knowledge, and enter the ranks of the buddhas. Though they have already realized untold truths that are beyond verbal expression, yet they can explain all verbal expressions. By means of Universally Good knowledge, they accumulate good qualities. Achieving instantaneous subtle knowledge, they comprehend all things and give out teachings to beings in accord with whatever courses of action are appropriate for them as individuals. All things, all worlds, all sentient beings, all times in the cosmos, the range of these phenomena unlimited, they are able to know and see by means of unobstructed knowledge. All buddhas appear in the world in the time of a single thought, according to the possibilities for enlightening, abide in a pure land, attain true awakening, manifest spiritual powers, and open up and enlighten the mind, intellect, and consciousness of all sentient beings of past, present, and future, according to appropriate timing. Sentient beings are boundless, worlds are boundless, realms of natural law are boundless, past, present, and future are boundless, and the supremacy of the buddhas is also boundless; they appear in the midst of them all, attain true awareness, and skillfully enlighten them by means of buddha-knowledge, never ceasing. All buddhas manifest the most wondrous incarnation by means of spiritual power, abide in boundlessness, with great compassion and skill in means, their minds without obstruction, at all times explaining the wondrous teaching for the benefit of all living beings. This is the tenth mighty quality of buddhas.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos rnams te/ 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpag tu med pa nus pa dag go /

These mighty qualities of all buddhas are infinite, boundless, inconceivable, incomprehensible to any sentient beings or followers of individual liberation in any time, unless spiritually empowered by Buddha.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thogs pa mi mnga' ba rnams te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dga' ldan gyi tshe ji srid par bzhugs nas/ 'pho ba la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ zla ba bcus bltams pa bstan pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mngon par 'byung bar dgyes pa'i thugs kyi mngon par 'byung ba la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ byang chub kyi shing drung du bzhugs nas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ thugs skad cig gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ dus bzhin du 'dul ba rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bskyed pa'i tshul bzhin du dus la bab par bshad cing lung bstan pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ dus la bab pa'i tshul bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa' yongs su grub pa rnams lung bstan pa la thogs pa mi mnga'o/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ skad cig gcig tu sems can thams cad kyi dri ba yongs su dris pa skad cig gcig gis lung bstan pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ste/ kye; rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thogs pa mi mnga' ba'o/ /

“All buddhas have ten definite principles. What are they? All buddhas definitely come down from the heaven of happiness to be born on earth. All buddhas definitely appear to be born, spending ten lunar months in the womb. All buddhas definitely tire of social convention and gladly seek to leave the world. All buddhas definitely sit at the foot of the tree of enlightenment, achieve true awakening, and realize all elements of enlightenment. All buddhas definitely realize all truths instantly and manifest spiritual power in all worlds. All buddhas definitely can teach in accord with the time. All buddhas definitely can teach people at the appropriate times in accordance with the bases of goodness they have developed, and give them directions for enlightenment. All buddhas definitely can do buddha-work in accord with the time. All buddhas definitely predict the enlightenment of all fully developed enlightening beings. All buddhas definitely can answer all sentient beings’ questions in a single instant.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ma thag tu myur du 'byung ba'i chos rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du ngan song dang bral bar 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du bsod nams yongs su rdzogs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su smin par 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du mtho ris su skye ba yongs su dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du yid gnyis dang / nem nur yang dag par bsal ba 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas phyir mi ldog pa 'thob par 'gyur te/ sems can mos pa yangs pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba las byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni/ mthong ma thag tu skyon med par ma 'das pa dmigs pa'i lta ba can gyi sems can rnams myur du skyon med pa 'da' ba'i rgyu rab tu 'dzin to/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du bsgribs pa thams cad byang ba 'thob par 'gyur ro; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams myur du snang ba 'thob cing mi 'jigs pa zhum pa med pa'i spobs pa rab tu rtsom ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ma thag tu myur du 'byung ba'i chos rnams so/ /

“All buddhas have ten kinds of speed. What are they? Any who see any buddha are speedily able to avoid bad dispositions. Any who see any buddha are speedily able to fulfill superior virtues. Any who see any buddha are speedily able to develop extensive bases of goodness. Any who see any buddha speedily attain rebirth in an immaculate heaven. Any who see any buddha can speedily get rid of all doubts and confusion. Any who have already aroused the aspiration for enlightenment who see any buddha can soon develop immense resolve, never to turn back, and can be able to teach people according to their needs; if they have not yet aroused the aspiration for enlightenment, they will quickly be able to arouse the determination for unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. Any who see any buddha before having entered the absolute state will speedily enter the absolute state. Any who see any buddha will speedily be able to purify all roots of goodness, mundane and supramundane. Any who see any buddha will speedily manage to destroy all obstruction. Any who see any buddha will speedily be able to acquire fearless intellectual powers.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sngon gyi sbyor bas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ spyod pa rnam par dag pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ yang dag par bsgrubs pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sngon gyi mthar sangs rgyas kyi tshangs par spyod pa la spyad pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sgo nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ gzugs kyi sku tshad med mu med pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa tshad med mu med pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rjes su dran par bya ba yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rjes su dran pa rnam par dag pa'o/ /

“All buddhas have ten kinds of pure things that should always be remembered. What are they? All buddhas’ past events should be always remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ pure superior actions should be always remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ fulfillment of the ways of transcendence should be always remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ accomplishment of great undertakings should always be remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ accumulation of virtues should always be remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ embodiment of spiritual practice should always be remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ actualization of true enlightenment should always be remembered by enlightening beings. The infinity of all buddhas’ physical forms should always be remembered by enlightening beings. The infinity of all buddhas’ spiritual powers should always be remembered by enlightening beings. All buddhas’ ten powers and confidences should always be remembered by enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par spyod pa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings thams cad dang / dus gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi sems sna tshogs dang / sems du ma dang / spyod pa dang / g.yo ba'i rgyud thams cad ma lus par thugs gcig gis thugs su chud pa dang / dus gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyi las dang / las kun nas blangs pa sna tshogs cho ma cho dgu rnam pa tha dad pas mngon par 'gro zhing nye bar gsog pa mang nyung dang / rnam par smin pa tha dad pa ma lus par thugs gcig gis thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can gyi rigs sna tshogs dang / sems can gyi rigs du ma'i sems can ma lus pa thams cad 'dul ba'i dus ji bzhin du yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis byin gyis brlabs yang dag par bstan pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad dang; phyogs dra ba'i rgyud thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi mtshan ma bzung ste/ sangs rgyas bstan pa dang / skye ba dang / rnam par dbye ba ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / mos pa ji lta ba dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med par skad cig tu/ sangs rgyas bstan pa dang / rnam par dmigs par bya ba dang / byin gyis brlabs pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can pha rol gyi bsam pa la/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can rnams 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar len pa med pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba bstan pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gro ba dang / de dang der 'gro ba'i lam ma lus par thugs kyi skad cig gcig gis thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can rnams kyis/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i phyogs thams cad du btang ba'i tshul ma lus par thugs kyi skad cig gcig gis thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang / sems kyi tshad ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sku kha dog mu med pa/ dbyibs mtha' yas pa bstan pa ma lus par thugs kyi skad cig gcig gis thugs su chud pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par spyod pa'o/ /

“All buddhas have ten stations of omniscience. What are they? All buddhas instantly know the minds and mental patterns of all sentient beings of past, present, and future. All buddhas instantly know the acts and the resulting consequences of those acts amassed by all sentient beings in past, present, and future. All buddhas instantly know the needs of all sentient beings and teach and civilize them by means of correct diagnosis, prescription, and occult influence. All buddhas instantly know the mental characteristics of all sentient beings in the cosmos, manifest the emergence of Buddha in all places, and take those beings into their care by expedient means. All buddhas instantly manifest expositions of teaching according to the mental inclinations, desires, and understandings of all sentient beings in the cosmos, causing them to become civilized. All buddhas instantly know the inclinations of the minds of all sentient beings in the cosmos and manifest spiritual powers for them. All buddhas instantly manifest appearance in all places according to all the sentient beings who may be taught, and explain to them that the embodiment of Buddha is not graspable. All buddhas instantly reach all places in the cosmos, all sentient beings, and their particular paths. All buddhas instantly go in response to any beings who think of them, wherever they may be. All buddhas instantly know the understandings and desires of all sentient beings and manifest immeasurable physical forms for their benefit.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos thams cad la rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can rnams la 'ang skad cig gcig tu chos ston pa mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can thams cad la mnyam par bzhag kyang / skad cig gcig gis sems can gyi khams sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa rnams kyang bdag med pa'i mtha' la gnas par yongs su ston to/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi dus gsum la mnyam par bzhag kyang thugs kyi skad cig gcig gis cha shas la'ang mnyam par bzhag cing rnam par spyod do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi phyogs 'byams klas pa'i dra ba thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyud dang / rnam pa thams cad la mnyam par bzhag kyang mi zad pa'i zhing gi mtha' la yang bzhugs shing rnam par spyod do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi sku mu med pa la mnyam par bzhag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi sku sna tshogs rnam par dmigs par yang dag par ston pa mdzad do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyis yongs su rgyas par rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang sems can thams cad kyi sems 'byung ba'i mdzod sna tshogs la yang mos pa dang yid la byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par spyod do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'i mur thug pa la bzhugs pa yang yongs su mi gtong ngo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten thams cad kyi brten pa la rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang thugs skad cig gcig gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod pa yang rab tu ston to/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa 'byams klas pa la rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang thugs skad cig gcig gis sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas mu med pa bstan pa rnam par dgod pa'i tshul mu med pas/ sangs rgyas bstan pa rgyun mi gcod do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni/ chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du bsgribs pa med par rtag tu mnyam par bzhag kyang thugs skad cig gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang rtogs par thugs su chud cing / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa mu med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog brnyes par bzhugs te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams so/ /

“All buddhas have ten kinds of immeasurable inconceivable buddha-concentrations. What are they? All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly reach all places to expound the sublime Teaching for sentient beings everywhere. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly reach all places to teach all sentient beings ultimate selflessness. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly enter the past, present, and future in all places. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly enter the immense buddha-lands in the ten directions, pervading all places. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly manifest innumerable various buddha-bodies in all places. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly in all places manifest body, speech, and mind in accord with the various understandings of sentient beings. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly, in all places, explain the ultimate reality of all things, beyond desire. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly, in all places, expound the inherent nature of interdependent origination of everything. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly, in all places, manifest immeasurable worldly and transcendental great adornments, causing sentient beings always to get to see Buddha. All buddhas, while always in correct concentration, instantly, in all places, enable sentient beings to master all enlightened teachings, attain infinite liberation, and ultimately reach unsurpassed transcendence.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par thar pa rnams te/ bcu gang zhe na/ rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la sangs rgyas skye ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la chos kyi 'khor lo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bskor ba yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas skye ba thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i zhing gi rgyud yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la 'das pa dang / ma byon dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad yongs su bstan pa'i rnam par thar pa ste; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bcu po de dag ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'o/ /

“Buddhas have ten kinds of unimpeded liberation. What are they? All buddhas can cause the emergence in the world of untold buddhas in a single atom. All buddhas can cause untold buddhas actively teaching to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause untold sentient beings being taught and guided to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause untold buddha-lands to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause untold enlightening beings receiving predictions of buddhahood to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause all buddhas of past, future, and present to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause all past, present, and future miracles to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause all sentient beings of past, present, and future to appear in a single atom. All buddhas can cause all past, present, and future buddha-works to appear in a single atom.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i le'u ste/ sum cu dgu pa'o// //
[40. de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i mtshan rgya mtsho bstan pa'i le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-FOUR. The Ocean of Physical Marks of the Ten Bodies of Buddha
bam po drug cu rtsa bdun pa/

de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos mtshan rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i don du/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag la smras pa/ kye rgyal pa'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu la mi chen po'i mtshan chos kyi rgyan rin po che sna tshogs sum cu rtsa gnyis mnga' bas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu de ni 'khor kun nas 'od zer gyi dra ba shin tu 'phro ba'i sprin rab tu 'byung zhing rgyas par 'geng pa ste/ de la mi chen po'i mtshan rin po che dang po dbu'i dbu mtshams na rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyal po las 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang ba bkye bas/ dpal gyis yongs su rgyas shing yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin rnam par bkye ba yongs su 'khyil ba'i klong gi dbyings kyi phyogs thams cad 'od kyis rnam par snang ba zhes bya bamnga' ba dang /

THEN THE GREAT ENLIGHTENING BEING Universally Good said to the enlightening beings, “I now will tell you about the ocean of marks of the Buddha. On top of the Buddha’s head there are thirty-two marks of great people, adorned with jewels. Among them is a mark of greatness called light illumining all regions, radiating immeasurable webs of great beams of light. It is adorned by all exquisite jewels, covered with jewel hair, soft, dense, and fine, each hair radiating jewel lights filling all the boundless worlds, manifesting embodiments of Buddha in all, complete with all the marks of buddhahood. This is the first.

sangs rgyas kyi dbu la 'phro ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor glog gi phreng ba lta bur 'byung bas/ phyogs mtshams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa snying po byang chub tu bzhugs pa ston cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nam mkha'i sprin kun du 'dal bas chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rin po che'i rgyal po sna tshogs mdzod spu g.yas phyogs su 'khyil ba'i dbyibs las gser gyi kha dog bzang por 'od zer 'bar bar 'jig rten gyi khams su byung ba'i 'od kyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gsal ba'i 'od kyi sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called clouds of light of the Buddha-eye. It is variously arrayed with the finest gems, producing a golden light like the light emanating from the curl of hair between Buddha’s eyebrows. That light illuminates all worlds. This is the second.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu la rin po che'i 'od kyi klong g.yas phyogs su yongs su 'khyil ba chos kyi dbyings thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi sgron ma snang bas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi sprin rnam par 'dal ba byang chub sems dpa'i mchog rnams la snang bas/ chos kyi dbyings rgyas par khyab ba'i sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called clouds filling the cosmos. It is arrayed with discs of the finest jewels and radiates the light of the lamp of virtue and knowledge of the enlightened, illumining the oceans of worlds in all universes, making all buddhas and enlightening beings visible. This is the third.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan gser yid du 'ong ba'i sprin sna tshogs kyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba rab tu 'bar bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer rnam par snang bar byas pas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa snang bar bstan pa'i 'od kyi sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called clouds manifesting universal illumination, variously adorned with gold and jewels. Those exquisite jewels all radiate light, illuminating inconceivable numbers of buddha-lands, with all the buddhas appearing therein. This is the fourth.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rin po che bai DU r+ya'i 'od zer dang / me tog gi mdog gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad snang bar rnam par 'phrul pa'i sprin/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po'i mtshan nyid lta bu'i dbu skra/ rin po che sna tshogs snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'od chags pas/ phyogs thams cad rnam par snang bar byed pa/ sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi dka' thub dang / dpal gyi ye shes las rnam pa de lta bur byung ba'i rin po che'i 'od zer rab tu bkye ba'i sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called radiating clusters of jewel lights, with pure arrays of diamonds and flowers of lapis lazuli, their light shining on all worlds in the ten directions, therein manifesting all kinds of mystical projections extolling the past practices, wisdom, and virtues of the enlightened. This is the fifth.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dang / rin po che'i 'od zer g.yas phyogs su 'khyil zhing 'phro bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa/ rin po che'i cod pan gyi 'od de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi rnam par rgyas pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rin po che 'od tshad med par de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyis/ rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag par ston pa'i sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called manifestation of clusters of great powers of Buddha pervading the cosmos, crowned by crystals of flames of jewels in the configurations of mystical projections of enlightening beings, ringed with wheels of light of flames of jewels containing the power of the Buddha enlightening all, those lights illuminating the worlds of the ten directions, making manifest therein all buddhas sitting on the site of enlightenment, clouds of all knowledge filling infinite worlds throughout space. This is the sixth.

sangs rgyas kyi dbu de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rin po che rnam par 'phrul pas/ nor bu rin po che rgya mtshos bkye ba'i 'od dang / 'od zer dri ma med pa rab tu 'phros pas byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pa rgya mtsho rnam par snang ba 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes rgya mtsho shin tu yangs pas chos kyi dbyings kun tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi sprin 'byung ba zhes bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called multitudes of universal lamps of the enlightened, adorned by a sea of jewels of great power that can shake all lands in the cosmos, emanating pure light filling the cosmos, showing therein the oceans of virtues of the enlightening beings of the ten directions and the oceans of standards of knowledge of the buddhas of past, present, and future. This is the seventh.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbu la/ rin po che'i rgyal po sems kyi rgyal po dang / in+d+ra nI la las 'od bkye ba g.yas phyogs su 'khyil bas 'jig rten gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du snang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'od 'phro ba sgron ma'i sprin; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho rab tu sgrogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du nga ro 'byin cing / sangs rgyas kyi stobs yongs su dag pa rgya mtsho dang / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho 'byin pa'i sprin shin tu yangs pa'i 'od ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called immense cloud reflecting all buddhas, adorned with sapphires, wish-fulfilling jewels, and pearls, always radiating light of enlightening beings’ flaming lamps, illumining all worlds in the ten directions, therein revealing all buddhas’ ocean of physical forms, ocean of vocal sounds, and ocean of pure powers. This is the eighth.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i rgyal po bai DUr+ya'i 'od zer rin po che thams cad kyi 'od zer kun tu 'byung ba'i dra ba mngon par 'phags pa las/ chos kyi lus dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dang / phyogs rgya mtshor de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yang dag par ston cing sangs rgyas kyi stobs chos kyi dbyings la mngon du gyur pa rab tu ston par bzhugs pa; sems can thams cad la yongs su ston pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa tshad med mu med par yang dag par 'phags shing yongs su dag la dri ma med pa yongs su mnan te/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od kun tu snang ba'i rang bzhin rab tu bkye ba'i 'od zer dkyil 'khor gyi sprin ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called cloud of light spheres, adorned by flowers of all kinds of jewels, with great webs of flames unfolding from all the jewels and filling all worlds in the ten directions, where all sentient beings see the Buddha sitting before them, praising the qualities of the reality-body of buddhas and enlightening beings, introducing them into the pure realm of the enlightened. This is the ninth.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan rin po che las 'od rab tu bkye bas/ zhing thams cad kun nas yog cing bsgribs pa med de/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi gsung rin po che'i me tog shin tu rgyas pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba rab tu bkye bas/ chos kyi rgya mtsho chen po rab tu sbyar ba las/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi snying po dang / snang ba can gyi sprin langs pa'i 'od ces bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called clouds of light illumining the treasury of practices of all enlightening beings, adorned by exquisite flowers made of all kinds of jewels, the lights of the jewels illumining innumerable worlds, the blaze of the jewels covering all lands, reaching all universes in the ten directions without impediment, causing the voice of Buddha to vibrate, telling the ocean of truths. This is the tenth.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rin po che bai DUr+ya dang / in+d+ra nI la dang / rdo rje mang po las nor bu rin po che rnam par bton te; rab tu bkram pa'i kha dog mtha' yas pa'i 'od rnam par dag pa/ rin po che bai DUr+ya'i 'od kun tu 'byung ba las sgra skad rgya mtsho thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings su sangs rgyas kyi snang ba rnam par ston pa'i chos rgya mtsho'i ye shes sangs rgyas sprul pa'i 'od kun du 'gyed pa'i sprin rab tu snang ba zhes bya bamnga' ba dang /

“Next there is a mark of greatness called clouds of radiant light shining, adorned with lapis lazuli, sapphires, and diamonds, the colors of the jewel clusters clear, illuminating all oceans of worlds, producing wondrous sounds filling the cosmos, all emanating from the ocean of great virtues of knowledge of the Buddha. This is the eleventh.
