ji lta'i tshul du zhugs gyur cing / / 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad rnam par bkod 'dra bar/ / sems can tshul bzhin rab tu 'phags/ / khams gsum thams cad mig yor tshul 'drar shes/ /
'on kyang rtog dang rnam rtog med/ / 'jig rten mtha' dang dbus med kun la rtog mi byed/ / rtog dang rtog med mkhas pa ste/ / rtog pa'i shes pas rnam par rtog pa med/ /
bskal pa brjod du med pa rnams/ / sems bskyed gcig la yang dag 'du bar 'dzud byed cing / / 'jig rten mi khom 'di mthong nas/ / skad cig sems kyis thams cad shes par byed/ /
brjod du med pa'i zhing rnams kyang / / sems bskyed gcig gis thams cad yongs su 'da' bar byed/ / bskal pa brjod med zad byed kyang; ; skra rtse'i cha shas gcig las g.yo ba med/ /
bskal pa brjod du med pa dag / nyi ma gcig dang yud tsam gcig tu 'dzud byed kyang / / ring dang thung la gzhol ba med/ / skad cig gcig la 'jug pa'i pha rol phyin/ /
sems kyi rnam pa 'jig rten kun/ / 'jig rten rnam pa sems can kun gyi sems yin te/ / rnam pa gnyis kyi grangs su zhugs/ / 'on kyang de dag mi gnyis rtog pa med/ /

They study all projections, Projections of lands and beings, Of worlds and civilizations, And finally reach the other shore of projections.
The various distinctions of all worlds All are there due to perceptions and thoughts; Entering buddhas’ knowledge of means, They clearly understand all this.
For each of untold groups They manifest embodiment Causing all to see the Buddha, And liberating boundless beings.
The profound knowledge of buddhas Is like the sun coming out in the world, Ever appearing everywhere In all lands.
They realize all worlds Are provisional names, without reality; Sentient beings and worlds Are like dreams, like shadows.
They do not produce false discriminatory views About the things of the world: Those free from false discrimination Do not even see false discriminations.
Measureless, countless eons They understand are one moment; And they know a moment has no moment— Thus do they see the world.
Innumerable lands They cross over in an instant, Yet through measureless eons They don’t move from their original place.
Untold eons Are the space of a moment; Not seeing long or short, They find ultimate instantaneousness.
Mind is in the world, World is in the mind— About this they do not wrongly create Discriminations of duality and nonduality.

sgyu ma'i rnam pa 'jig rten te/ / sems can zhing dang sangs rgyas chos kyang de bzhin no/ / 'on kyang 'jig rten mgon po'i rnams/ / chos kyi dbyings rnams kun la gcig tu snyoms/ /
lus rnams brjod du med pa yis/ / phyogs bcu thams cad rgyas par bkang zhing yongs su ston/ / 'on kyang lus la gzhol ba med/ / chos nyid rten pa gnas med rab tu shes/ /
'on kyang mi yi seng ge rnams/ / gnyis la gnas pa'i shes pas byung ba ma yin te/ / mi gnyis pa la'ang gnas pa med/ / gnyis dang gnyis med chos rnams rab tu shes/ /
ji ltar smig rgyu rab rib dang / / mig yor sgra brnyan de bzhin rmi lam 'dra ba dang / / rmi lam rnam pa sprul pa ltar/ / 'gro ba thams cad ma lus rab tu shes/ /
de ltar spyod yul nyams med pas/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi rigs kyi rjes su 'byung ba yin/ / kun tu bzang po'i ye shes dang / / chos kyi dbyings la shin tu bdal ba yin/ /
snying rje chen po mtha' yas kyang / / sems can med dang mnyam par zhing rnams thams cad sgom/ / sngon nas nyon mongs nyams med pa'i/ / bsam pa dag pas 'jig rten kun tu 'gro/ /
mi zad mkha' ltar rnam dag pa'i/ / rgya che shin tu yangs pa'i sa la rab tu zhugs/ / gsung ba'i seng ge thams cad kyi/ / tshul gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rjes su dran/ /
'jig rten rab tu spros pa la/ / smon lam tshad med yongs su gdab pa byas pas na/ / de dag spyod pa yongs su dag / 'jig rten khams rnams thams cad rgyas par khyab/ /
sangs rgyas rnams dang rgyal sras dang / / de bzhin sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos rnams thams cad dang / / 'jig rten rnams dang 'jig rten chos/ / chags med tha dad med pa'i tshul du shes/ /
chos kyi sku yi snying po can/ / de yi lus la 'jig rten thams cad gzud byas shing / / 'jig rten de yi lus yin yang / / 'jig rten kun gyis de la gos pa med/ /

Beings, worlds, ages, Buddhas and Buddha teachings— All are like illusory projections: In the reality realm all is equal.
Throughout the lands of the ten directions They manifest infinite bodies; Knowing bodies arise from conditions, They have no attachments at all.
Based on nondual knowledge They manifest the buddhas, Without attachment to nonduality, Knowing there is no duality or nonduality.
They realize that all worlds Are like flames, like lights, Like echoes, like dreams, Like illusions, like emanations.
Thus they accordingly enter The sphere of action of the buddhas And achieve Universally Good knowledge Illumining all the profound realm of truth.
Attachments to beings and lands They completely give up, Yet rouse minds of great compassion And purify all worlds.
Enlightening beings always rightly remember The marvelous teachings of the buddhas, Pure and clear as space, Yet producing great expedient means.
Seeing the world always deluded, They determine to save and liberate all: Their undertakings are all pure, Extending throughout all universes.
Buddhas and enlightening beings, Buddhist principles and things of the world— If you see their reality, All are no different from one another.
Buddhas’ reality-body matrix Is in all worlds, Yet while being in the world Has no attachment to the world.

ji ltar dang ba'i chu gsal la/ / gzugs brnyan yongs su snang yang der song 'phos pa med/ / de bzhin 'jig rten thams cad kyi/ / rjes su lus 'gro der song 'phos pa med/ /
de ltar 'jig rten thams cad kyis/ / gos pa med cing 'jig rten yongs su dag pas na/ / lus ni mkha' dang 'dra ba ste/ / de yi lus rnams gang yang skyes pa med/ /
mi zad pa yi lus shes pas/ / de ni nam yang skyes shes 'gags pa med pa ste/ / rtag dang mi rtag ma yin par/ / 'jig rten kun la'ang rnam par dmigs pa byed/ /
lta ba'i rnam pa rab tu 'gags/ / brtan pa de dag yang dag lta ba ston pa byed/ / bdag gi med cing gnas pa med/ / len pa med cing chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam/ /
ji ltar sgyu mkhan mkhas pa zhig / sna tshogs mtshan nyid rnam pa tha dad gzugs 'phrul byed/ / 'on kyang de la 'gro ba med/ / gang du 'gro ba de bzhin mi dmigs so/ /
sgyu ma tshad med ma yin te/ / sgyu ma tshad kyis dmigs par bya ba'ang ma yin no/ / tshad med tshad dang ldan pa yang / / tshogs kyi dbus su ston pa rab tu byed/ /
de bzhin rtogs pa'i blo ldan pa/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams las byung / / sems ni tshad yod ma yin te/ / tshad med pa la gnas pa'ang de dag min; ;
'du shes rnam pa gcig min te/ / de dag tshad med pa dang tshad dang ldan pa ston/ / lam gyi rgyud dang 'brel ba med/ / tshad med rnams gnas pa'ang de bzhin med/ /
sangs rgyas chos rnams zab pa ste/ / shin tu yangs pas zab cing zhi bas de bzhin zab/ / zab mo sna tshogs rgyud rnams dang / / mtha' yas zab pa rnams kyang rab tu shes/ /
ye shes bzang po rmongs pa med/ / rgyud la dri ma med pas bsam pa rnam par dag / byin gyis rlob la mkhas pas na/ / srog chags bye ba shin tu dag par byed/ /

Just as in clear water Reflections have no coming or going, The reality-body’s being in the world Is also like this.
Thus freed from attachment, Body and world are both pure: Clear and still as space, There is no birth at all.
Knowing the body has no end, No birth and no destruction, Being neither eternal nor impermanent, They show it in all worlds.
Destroying false views, They point out correct insight: The essence of things has no coming or going, Is uninvolved with self or possession.
As when a skilled magician Causes various things to appear, Their coming is from nowhere And they go nowhere,
The nature of illusions is not finite Nor is it infinite, But in the midst of the crowd He manifests the finite and infinite,
Similarly by the mind in silent concentration Cultivating roots of goodness Produces all buddhas, Neither finite nor infinite:
Finiteness and infinity Are deluded notions— Comprehending all states of being, The enlightening do not cling to finiteness or infinity.
The buddhas’ most profound truth Is vast, deep, ultimate quiescence; Their profound, measureless knowledge Knows the deepest states.
Enlightening beings are freed from delusion, Their purity of mind is continuous; By means of spiritual powers They skillfully liberate numberless beings.

dge bar byed pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams/ / rab tu brjod cing dge dang mi dge rnam par ston/ / gnas la mngon par ma chags pas/ / chos kyi dbyings rnams kun tu rab tu rgyu/ /
sems can med mthar phyin gyur kyang / / 'jig rten thams cad ma lus de dag khong du chud/ / 'jig rten thams cad ma lus par/ / rnam par sangs rgyas mya ngan gar mi 'da'/ /
chos rnams bgrang ba'i tshul la mkhas/ / sems can bgrang tshul shes kyang grangs la skyes pa med/ / chos kyi sprin chen char 'bebs shing / / 'jig rten khams rnams thams cad snang bar byed; ;
sangs rgyas byang chub ma lus la/ / sems bskyed gcig gis de dag rab tu 'jug / de dag phyir ldog med pa ste/ / sems can kun gyi khams las phyir mi ldog /
sangs rgyas sku ni thob gyur kyang / / chos rnams 'di dag lus yod ma yin rab tu shes/ / lus rnams kun gyi tshul la mkhas/ / lus kyi rnam phye 'jig rten rab tu shes/ /
sems can kun tu rgyu ba dang / / bskal pa rnams dang zhing la pha rol phyin pa thob/ / phyogs rnams rgya mtsho gangs chen mtshor/ / ye shes rgya mtsho'i tshul la mkhas pas zhugs/ /
lus rnams thams cad re re las/ / sems can kun gyi lus rnams sna tshogs ji snyed dang / / sangs rgyas sku ni mtha' yas pa/ / ye shes shin tu yangs pa de ston to/ /
skad cig gcig gi dus tshul la; ; mi yi gtso bo mang po 'byung ba rab tu shes/ / bskal pa mang po brjod med du/ / mi yi seng ge bgrang bas zad mi 'gyur/ /
de dag mya ngan 'da' ba yang / / skad cig gcig la tshad med shin tu yangs pa 'byung / / ring bsrel rnam dbye mang po yang / / ye shes dri med phra bas ston pa byed/ /
de bzhin ma 'ongs dus kyi yang / / mi yi seng ge mtha' yas smon lam 'debs pa'i rnams/ / byang chub dri med sems bskyed pa/ / ye shes yangs shing shin tu phra bas shes/ /

To those not at rest they bring rest, To those at peace they show the site of enlightenment. Thus do they go throughout the cosmos, Their minds without attachment.
Not dwelling on ultimate reality And not entering nirvana, Thus they go throughout the worlds Enlightening living beings.
The classes of phenomena and beings They know without being attached; Everywhere showering the rain of truth, They fill and enrich all worlds.
In all worlds They realize true awakening moment to moment Yet cultivate the practice of enlightening beings Without ever retreating.
The various bodies in the world They know all completely; Thus knowing physical phenomena They realize the body of buddhas.
They know all sentient beings, All ages and lands, Throughout the ten directions, boundless, Entering fully into the ocean of knowledge.
Beings’ forms are infinite; For each the buddhas manifest a body. The buddhas’ bodies are boundless— The wise observe them all.
What they know in one moment Manifests the buddhas, Impossible to fully tell Even in measureless eons.
The buddhas can manifest their bodies Passing finally away in any place; In an instant innumerable relics Are individually divided.
Thus those of certain knowledge Know the infinite will for enlightenment Of the seekers of buddhahood In the ages to come.

bzang po spyod la gnas bcas shing / / de bzhin du gsum gshegs pa'i sems can gtso bo rnams/ / ji snyed skyes par gyur pa dag / de dag thams cad ma lus rab tu shes/ /
de ltar rab tu shes pas na/ / mtha' dang dbus med spyod pa'i sa dang de bzhin du/ / ye shes 'byung gnas blo gros la/ / ye shes 'khor lo'i spyod pas phyir mi ldog /
ye shes phra mo ra ba yangs pa/ / stobs bcu rnams kyi spyod yul mchog la de dag zhugs/ / bzang po rtogs pa'i blo can rnams/ / phyir mi ldog la 'jug pa brjod bya na/ /
sangs rgyas rgyal ba thams cad kyi/ / yang dag gzhol bar bya la de dag zhugs pas na/ / spyod las phyir ldog med pa ste/ / byang chub dam pa zhi bar 'tshang yang rgya/ /
de 'dra'i sems rgyud gcig la yang / / mtha' dang dbus med sems rnams yang dag 'dzud pa byed/ / shin tu yangs pa'i tshad med las/ / 'du shes de dang de la yang dag bsgrubs/ /
nyon mongs med dang nyon mongs dang / / slob dang mi slob sems kyang de bzhin rab tu shes/ / sems rgyud de dag re re la/ / sems rnams brjod du med pa mngon 'tshang rgya/ /
gcig dang gnyis su shes pa med/ / de dag yongs su 'dres par 'gyur ba'ang med pa ste/ / so so'i 'du shes rnam pa la/ / sems can de dag skyes par gyur pa yin/ /
'di na 'dug par mthong gyur kyang / / sems can brjod med gzhan dang gzhan sems ldan pa'i rnams/ / gzhan gyi zhing phyir 'du shes kyang / / 'jig rten sna tshogs rnams la rab tu skye/ /
'di 'dra'i tshul la 'jug pa la/ / spyod pa'i mchog gis rjes su zhugs par gyur pa rnams/ / kun tu bzang po'i ming thob ste/ / 'jig rten mgon po kun gyi rjes su skyes/ /
sems can bye ba la la ni/ / ngan song 'grangs pa'i ming thogs mtho ris 'du shes 'gyur/ / la la mtho ris sa rnams kyi/ / rnam pa kun la ngan song 'du shes 'gyur/ /

Ability to know in this way All the enlightened ones Of past, present, and future Is called maintaining the practice of Universal Good.
Thus distinctly knowing Countless stages of practice, Entering the abode of wisdom, The cycle never rolls back.
Subtle, extensive knowledge Entering deeply into the sphere of buddhahood And having entered, not regressing Is called Universally Good wisdom.
All the supremely noble ones Enter the realm of buddhahood; Their practice never regressing, They attain unexcelled enlightenment.
The different individual actions Of infinitely many minds All come from accumulations of conceptions: The equanimous know them all.
Defiled or undefiled, Learners’ minds, nonlearners’ minds— Untold numbers of minds They know at every moment.
They know they are not one or two, Not defiled and not pure, And also without mixture— All arise from one’s own notions.
Thus they clearly see All living beings With minds and thoughts each different Creating various worlds.
By such means Cultivating supreme practice And being reborn from the Teaching They can be called Universally Good.
Sentient beings all wrongly produce The conceptions of the good and bad states; Because of this they may be born in heaven Or then again fall into hell.

'jig rten mi mtshungs skal la ltos/ / rnam pa tha dad las kyi sa las rab tu skyes/ / 'du shes rnam pa mtha' yas te/ / gcig min yangs la 'jig rten rab tu 'jug /
'jig rten khams rnams thams cad kyi/ / 'du shes dra ba skal ba mi mnyam rab tu shes/ / mig 'phrul sgyu ma'i tshul gyis na/ / skad cig gcig gis sems kyis rab tu gzhol/ /
de bzhin dbang po rnams la ste/ / mig gi skye mched rna ba sna yi skye mched dang / / lce dang lus dang yid la yang / / 'jig rten rnam pa tha dad 'du shes 'jug /
mig rnams re re'i yul la yang / / mtha' dang dbus med mig rnams rab tu 'dzud pa byed/ / rnam pa tha dad du ma ste/ / tshad med kun la'ang zhen par 'gyur ba med/ /
'on kyang phan tshun gcig gis gcig / bde zhing gnod par 'gyur ba de dag kun na med/ / bdag bdag so so'i las kyi rnams/ / ji ltar bsags pa'i tshul bzhin nyams su myong / /
bzang zhes bya ba de dag kun/ / tshad med stobs dang ye shes sa yi shes rab kyi/ / 'byams klas mig rnams thams cad la/ / rab tu zhugs pas shin tu rtogs pa yin/ /
de bzhin 'jig rten thams cad kyang / / thams cad ma lus rnam pa thams cad 'jig tshul du/ / thams cad shin tu shes gyur kyang / / rgya chen spyod pas mya ngan mi 'da'o/ /
sangs rgyas shin tu bstan pa dang / / sems can bstan dang de bzhin zhing rnams bstan pa dang / / dus rnams shin tu bstan pa dang / / bstan pa sna tshogs rnam pa kun kyang shes/ /
la la 'di la 'das gyur kyang / / gzhan dang gzhan rnams ma 'ongs dus la gnas pa yin/ / 'on kyang ma 'ongs dus kyi rnams/ / la las da ltar byung bar rab tu shes/ /
de 'dra'i tshul can gcig min pa'i/ / 'jig rten mtshan nyid tha dad thams cad rab tu shes/ / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshul gyis/ / sangs rgyas ye shes kun tu mtha' yang yas/ /

Enlightening beings see the worlds As produced by the action of false ideas; Because false ideas are boundless Infinite too are the worlds.
All lands are manifestations Of the network of conceptions; By the means of the net of illusion One can instantly enter them all.
Eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, And the intellect too are thus— Conceptions of the world are different; All can be equally contained therein.
In each object of the eye There are infinite eyes immanent, Their various natures different, Measureless, unspeakable.
What is seen has no difference And also no mixup; Everyone, according to his own acts, Experiences the resulting consequences.
The power of Universal Good is infinite, Knowing them all completely; In all objects of eyes There is great knowledge immanent.
Thus enlightening beings know distinctly Every worldly realm And cultivate all enlightening practices Without ever turning back.
Buddhas teach, beings teach, And lands teach too: Everything in all times teaches thus— The enlightening ones know every particular.
The future is the past, The present is the future, The three times look to each other; The enlightening understand each.
Thus in infinite ways They awaken the worlds: No boundaries can be found To the means of total knowledge.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa bstan pa'i le'u ste/ bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o// //
[43. de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa'i le'u]
BOOK THIRTY-SEVEN. Manifestation of Buddha
bam po bdun cu tham pa/

bcom ldan 'das ye shes chen pos rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang sku gcig pas mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod pa mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa/ chags pa med pa'i spyod yul mngon par mkhyen pa ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos kyi sku mnga' ba/ mtshan nyid yong nas med pa'i chos la rten pa chos kyi dbyings mi gnyis pa'i spyod yul gyis yang dag par spyod pa mtha' dang dbus med cing mtshungs pa'i mngon par 'tshang rgya ba brnyes pa/ rnam par thar pa bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul la shin tu dgyes pa/ chos kyi sku nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas klas pa mnga' ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi pho brang khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal med khang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po can 'od kun nas 'byung ba/ rgyan chen po dang ldan pa 'od dang zhing gsal ba rnam par snang ba'i snying po can/ sangs rgyas skye ba chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i gnas/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus las byung ba/ gzhi 'od zer gyis rnam par brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus rang bzhin du gnas pas rab tu bsgrubs pa'i chos chen po'i gzhir gyur pa/ chos kyi dbyings kun tu rgyas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od dang ldan pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas btugs pa/ ye shes kyi yul yang dag pa'i mtha' spyod yul chags pa med pas rnam par gsal ba na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rin po che bzang po'i pad+mo chen po rang rang gi smon lam gyi byung ba'i dbus kyi snying po la 'khod pa kun kyang tshe gcig gis thogs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang gzhan nas phyin pa/ ye shes chen po rnam par phye ba'i spyod yul la gzhol ba/ chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i gzhi mnyam pa nyid la zhugs pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings gzhi med cing mtha' dang dbus med pa la rnam par spyod pa/ chos thams cad 'byung ba med cing mngon par grub pa med pa mngon du byas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus las ma g.yos par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du kun gyis brjod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las mngon du byung ba sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub mngon sum du gyur pa'i ye shes snang ba thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul rgyun ma chad pa/ ye shes kyi rang bzhin chos kyi lus gcig cing tha mi dad pas/ gzugs kyi lus mtha' yas pa'i sgo kun tu ston pa/ chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug pa shin tu shes pa sems can gyi khams su rnam par spyad pa las phyir mi ldog pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' mnyam pa nyid thob pas sprul pa mngon par sgrub pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / sngon lhan cig tu skyes shing dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa sha stag 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po dang / kun tu grags pa'i dbang phyug rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal dang / rdo rje dpal gyi rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par grol ba bsgribs pa med pa'i zla ba dang; nyi ma'i 'od zer dri ma med pa'i snying po dang / mngon par shes pa chen pos rnam par 'phrul pa'i blo dang / 'od dri ma med pa'i dpal gyi gzi brjid 'od zer gyi rgyal po dang / blo gros rgya mtsho'i mchog 'dzin cing blo la rnam par rtse ba gsal bas mngon par shes pa'i dpal dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa'i seng ge'i nga ro chen pos rnam par rtse bas mngon par shes pa dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so/ /

de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzod spu nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i 'od zer/ 'od zer gyi 'khor bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa mang po'i 'od zer dang ldan pa byung ste/ des 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par snang bar byas/ 'jig rten g.yas phyogs su lan bcur bskor te/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'phrul pa bstan nas/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bskul ba byas te/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad rab tu bskyod nas/ ngan song gi rgyud thams cad kyi skye ba dang / shi 'pho rab tu zhi bar byas te/ bdud kyi khyim thams cad zil gyis mnan nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bas rnam par sangs rgyas ba'i gdan bstan par bya ste/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par bkod pa 'byams klas pa rab tu bstan nas/ 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa; nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par rgyas par khyab par byas nas phyir 'ongs te/ byang chub sems dpa' 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la g.yas phyogs nas bskor nas/ de byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyi spyi bor nub bo/ /

THEN, from the circle of white hair between his brows, the Buddha emitted a great beam of light called manifestation of the realizer of Thusness, accompanied by countless trillions of light beams. That light illumined all the worlds in the whole cosmos, circling ten times to the right, revealing the immeasurable powers of the enlightened, awakening countless enlightening beings, shaking all worlds, extinguishing the suffering of all states of misery, eclipsing the abodes of all demons, and showing all buddhas sitting on the seat of enlightenment attaining perfect awakening, as well as all the assemblies at the sites of enlightenment. Having done all this, the light returned and circled the assembly of enlightening beings, then entered the head of the enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origination of Buddha.

de nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad ngo mtshar cher 'dzin cing dga' ba thob par 'gyur te/ 'od zer gyi dra ba snang ba 'di lta bu byung bas na/ chos chen po brjod par ni 'gyur du nges so snyam nas rtogs pa'i blo yang thob par gyur to/ /'od zer de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyi lus la phog par gyur ma thag tu/ de nas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal pad+mo'i stan las langs te/ bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pad+mo'i snying po de la pus mo g.yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas/ bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der thal mo sbyar ba btud de/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa la tshigs su bcad de gsol pa/

Now the masses at this enlightenment site were elated, ecstatic; they thought, “How extraordinary! Now that the Buddha has radiated great light, surely he will expound a most profound great teaching.” Then the enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origination of Buddha, on a lotus blossom seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, joined his palms, turned toward the Buddha with total attention, and spoke these verses:

rnam dag blo mnga' yon tan mkhyen pas 'phags pa/ / spyod yul chags pa med pa'i pha rol phyin brnyes/ / dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid mnyam pa ston pa/ / khyod la bdag ni bsti stang rim gro bgyid do/ /
mtshan nyid med pa'i spyod yul pha rol phyin brnyes/ / mtshan gyis shin tu brgyan pa'i sku yang ston mdzad/ / dri med 'od can 'od zer stong dang ldan 'gyed/ / bdud kyi sde rnams ma lus rab tu 'joms mdzad/ /
phyogs bcu kun na gang rnams ji snyed mchis pa'i/ / zhing rnams thams cad ma lus rab tu bskyod kyang / / thugs rje ldan pas su la'ang 'jigs par mi mdzad/ / khyod kyi rdzu 'phrul mthu ni de 'dra de tshul/ /
nam mkha'i dbyings la mnyam pa nyid du rab zhugs/ / de bzhin chos dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyang brnyes gyur/ / sems can stong phrag bye ba grol bar mdzad cing / / sems can kun gyi sdig chen rab tu zhi mdzad/ /
bskal pa stong du brtul zhugs dam po spyod de/ / byang chub mchog gi lam ni yang dag bsgrubs nas/ / chags pa med pa'i ye shes spyod yul 'di brnyes; ; sangs rgyas kun dang rang bzhin gcig tu rab 'gyur/ /
rnam par 'dren pa khyod kyis 'di nas 'od bkye/ / 'jig rten thams cad ma lus kun tu bskyod nas/ / cho 'phrul mtha' yas yang dag bstan pa bgyi ste/ / bdag gi lus 'dir de dag ma lus zhugs gyur/ /
de la bdag gi blo gros 'di ltar skyes te/ / chos rje khyod la bdag gis zhu ba'i dus bab/ / shin tu nges pa'i chos la rab tu bslabs pa'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'dus par gyur snyam/ /
tshogs 'di dag pa 'dus pas rnam par dag pa/ / 'jig rten slob dpon mgon pos rab tu bsngags pa/ / ye shes mtha' yas ldan pa yul la chags med/ / de 'dra'i mthu chen dpa' bo 'di dag 'dir phyin/ /
de don 'jig rten slob dpon drang srong chen po/ / ye shes stobs dang brtson 'grus mtha' yas byung gyur/ / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag snang bar mdzad gsol/ / chos rab bdag gis gang zhus de yang bshad gsol/ /
drang srong chen po'i spyod yul 'di dag bstan cing / / yang dag ma nor brjod par nus pa gang lags/ / skyes bu khyu mchog rnams kyi sras ni gang lags/ / 'jig rten mgon gyi gtso bo khyod kyis bshad gsol/ /

The Truly Awake, the Virtuous, the Great Sage, emerges, Comprehending all objects, reaching the Other Shore, Equal to the buddhas of past, present, and future; Therefore I now pay reverent obeisance.
Having risen to the shore of the signless realm And appeared in a body magnificently arrayed with wondrous marks, He radiates thousands of undefiled beams of light And destroys the hordes of demons entirely.
All the worlds in the ten directions He causes to quake without exception, Yet without frightening a single sentient being Such is the spiritual power of the Felicitous One.
Equal in essence to space and the cosmos, He can remain as stable as they. All the living, without count or measure, He has destroyed evil and removed defilements.
Working hard at austere practices for countless ages, He fully attained the highest enlightenment, His knowledge unhindered in the midst of all objects, Of the same nature as all the buddhas.
The Guide radiates these great beams of light, Shaking the worlds in the ten directions; Displaying measureless mystic powers, They have returned and entered my body.
Well able to learn the definitive teaching, Countless enlightening beings have assembled here And inspired me to ask about the Teaching, Wherefore I now petition the Sovereign Teacher.
This assembly is now clear and serene, Able to liberate all in the world, Their wisdom boundless, without attachments— Such eminent sages have all gathered here.
The benefactor of the world, the noble guide, With wisdom and energy beyond measure Now illumines the crowd with great light Causing me to ask about the unexcelled Teaching.
Who can truly expound in full The profound realm of the great wizard? Who is the inheritor of the Buddha doctrine? Noble Guide of the World, please show us.

tshigs su bshad pa de dag gsol ma thag tu de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas/ mi bsnyengs pa'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer 'khor gyi 'od zer khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med pa dang ldan pa byung ste/ des 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par snang bar byas nas/ 'jig rten g.yas phyogs su lan bcur bskor te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa bstan nas/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bskul ba byas te/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad rab tu bskyod nas/ ngan song gi rgyud thams cad kyi skye ba dang / shi 'pho ba rab tu zhi bar byas te/ bdud kyi khyim thams cad zil gyis mnan nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bas rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i gdan bstan pa byas te/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par bkod pa 'byams klas pa rab tu bstan nas/ 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs par 'byams klas pa thams cad ma lus par rgyas par khyab par byas nas phyir 'ongs te/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la g.yas phyogs nas bskor nas/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i kha'i sgor nub bo/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la reg par gyur ma thag tu/ de nas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri sngon ci 'dra ba de las/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri brgya phrag stong 'gyur du bzang zhing khyad par du 'phags par 'dug ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i seng ge'i gdan ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi lus kyi seng ge'i khri las/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lus kyi seng ge'i khri brgya phrag stong 'gyur du bzang zhing khyad par du 'phags par snang ngo/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ /

Then the Buddha emitted a great beam of light, called unimpeded confidence, from his mouth, accompanied by countless trillions of light beams, illumining all worlds in the cosmos, circling ten times to the right, showing the various controlling powers of the Buddha, awakening innumerable enlightening beings, shaking all the worlds of the ten directions, extinguishing the pains of all states of misery, eclipsing all abodes of demons, and showing all the buddhas on the seat of enlightenment attaining true awakening, as well as the assemblies at all those sites of enlightenment. Having done all this, the lights came back, circled the assembly of enlightening beings, and entered the mouth of the enlightening being Universally Good, after which the body and lion throne of Universally Good surpassed their former condition, and that of the other enlightening beings a hundredfold, surpassing all except the lion throne of the Buddha.
Then the enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origination of Buddha asked the great enlightening being Universally Good,

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen po/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis khong du chud par dka' ba/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di lta bu bstan na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de gang gi sngon gyi mtshan mar 'gyur/ de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni bdag 'di snyam du sems te/ sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi cho 'phrul chen po 'di 'dra ba dag kyang mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba bstan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs bstan par dgongs pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po'i rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ston pa mdzad do/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ de bzhin gshegs ba skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ming thos par gyur ma thag tu de'i tshe sa chen po g.yos par gyur to/ /

“This vast miraculous display manifested by the Buddha, causing all the enlightening beings joy, is inconceivable, incomprehensible to the world—what is this auspicious sign?” Universally Good replied, “In the past when I saw buddhas show such tremendous mystic displays, they expounded the teaching of the manifestation of Buddha. I think that now since he has displayed this sign, he is going to expound this teaching. When this teaching is expounded, the whole earth quakes and immeasurable lights asking about the teaching are produced.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su 'byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ legs par spobs par mdzod cig /ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa khong du chud par bya/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'khor 'dus pa 'di ni shin tu dag pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong kun nas 'dus pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sngon spyad pa shin tu spyad pa/ las kyi mtha' shin tu sbyangs pa/ dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rigs pas shin tu 'phags pa/ rgya chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa mchog thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul dang / spyod pa dang / tshul la rab tu gnas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rjes su song ba'i 'du shes yid la byed pa ma nyams pa/ snying rje chen pos 'gro ba thams cad la rnam par lta ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa chen pos rnam par rol pa'i spyod yul can/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin rang gi rgyud du len pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi dpal gyi byin gyis brlabs pa ste; de dag la sogs pa yon tan dang / legs pa tshad med pa mang po dang ldan pa sha stag 'ongs shing 'dus pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod kyang sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po bsnyen bkur ba/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i mchog tu phyin pa/ ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo thams cad kyi rnam par mngon par rol par mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i gnas su chud pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la the tshom yongs su chad pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis byin du brlabs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dbang po la mkhas pa dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi mos pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam yang dag par ston pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs dang rgyud yang dag par 'byung ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa de dag la sogs pa yon tan mang po tshad med pa'i khyad par gyi mthar thug pa yin gyi/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa dang / sku yang dag par bstan pa dang / dbyangs rab tu brjod pa dang / thugs kyi mthu dang / yul gyi gnas dang; spyod yul bstan pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa'i gnas dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mngon par bsgrub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong zhing thos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'grogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba bstan pa la legs par spobs pa mdzod cig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis don 'di nyid yang bzlas te brjod pa'i phyir/ de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/

Then the enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origination of Buddha asked the enlightening being Universally Good, “How should great enlightening beings know the principle of the manifestation of the buddhas, those who realize Thusness, those who are truly awake? Please tell us; these countless trillions of enlightening beings have all cultivated purifying practice for a long time, their recollection and precise awareness is fully developed, they embody the dignity of all buddhas, they have reached the consummation of ultimate great adornment, they correctly remember all buddhas without forgetting, they observe all sentient beings with great compassion, they know with certainty the spheres of spiritual powers of great enlightening beings, they have already received the support of the spiritual power of buddhas, they are able to receive the sublime teachings of all buddhas: imbued with immeasurable such virtues, they have all come and gathered here. You have already attended and served countless quintillions of buddhas, accomplished the supreme practice of enlightening beings, have attained mastery of all modes of concentration, have penetrated the esoteric secrets of all buddhas, know all ways of enlightenment, have put an end to all doubt, are supported by the spiritual power of the buddhas, know the faculties of sentient beings and explain ways of genuine liberation to them according to their inclinations, follow the knowledge of Buddha, expound the Buddha teachings, and have reached the Other Shore. You have infinite such virtues, worthy of praise. Please explain the phenomena of the manifestation of the buddhas, those who realize Thusness, the truly awake—their physical forms, utterances, states of mind, practices, enlightenment, and preaching, until their manifestation of entry into ultimate extinction, and the roots of goodness generated by seeing, hearing, and associating with them. Please tell us about all these things.” Then the enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origin of Buddha, desiring to reiterate his point, spoke these verses to the enlightening being Universally Good:

chags med blo gros shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas blo ldan/ / ye shes mtha' yas yul la mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa; ; rgyal ba'i spyod yul tshad med legs par yang dag shod cig / de thos sangs rgyas sras rnams thams cad rab tu dga' 'gyur/ /
rgyal ba mchog rnams 'byung ba ji ltar byang chub sems dpas/ / khong du chud bya ji ltar de dag yang dag blta bya/ / de bzhin gshegs thugs ci 'drar sku dag dbyangs kyang ci 'dra/ / skyes bu khyu mchog rnams kyi yul dang spyod yul ci 'dra/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub ji ltar rnam par 'tshang rgya/ / chos kyi 'khor lo dam pa rgyal ba ji ltar bskor mdzad/ / bde gshegs mya ngan 'das pa'i yang dag nyid kyang gsung ste/ / sangs rgyas sras po mtha' yas 'di dag dga' bar mdzod cig /
gang gis bde gshegs chos rgyal chen po mthong bar gyur cing / / gang rnams 'grogs shing dge ba yang dag skyed par byed pa/ / de dag bsod nams 'phel ba'ang ma nor brjod par mdzod cig / bde gshegs mthong na cir 'gyur de dang 'grogs na ci 'gyur/ /
bde gshegs mya ngan 'das dang 'on tam bzhugs kyang rung ste/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan rnams gang gis thos par gyur cing / / yon tan 'byung gnas rnams la gang rnams dad pa bskyed pa/ / de dag don kyang cir 'gyur 'khor 'dir bstan par mdzod cig /
byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad thal mo sbyar cing / / bde bar gshegs dang khyod dang bdag la kun kyang lta sdod/ / dris pa 'di dag sems can dag pa khyod kyis lung ston/ / yon tan rgya mtsho che mnga' rnams kyi spyod yul bstan mdzod/ /
de dag don du chos rab ldan pa'i gsung mchog brjod cing / / mkha' 'dra khyod kyi skye bo rnams kyi the tshom gcad mdzod/ / dpe dang rgyur ldan tshig gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ston/ / thos nas sems can khrag khrig byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed/ /
ji ltar zhing rnams thams cad ma lus rgyas par bkang zhing / / rgyal ba sku yi yan lag sna tshogs yang dag ston mdzod/ / ji ltar khrag khrig chos dang ldan pa'i gsung rab brjod pa/ / sangs rgyas byang chub dpe dang rgyu yis bstan par mdzod cig /
gang zhig phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams khrag khrig thams cad kun tu/ / bskal pa mang po bye ba mtha' yas 'grangs par song yang / / de ring rgyal sras 'dir tshogs 'di 'dra'i 'khor dang 'dra ba/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mthong bar shin tu dka'o/ /
de bas rgyal sras rang bzhin dag pa khyod kyis bshad mdzod/ / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs yangs yongs su ston cig / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag thams cad thal mo sbyar te; ; yangs pa'i chos kyis skom zhing chos la don gnyer gnas so/ /

Excellent sage of unimpeded wisdom, You are well aware of the boundless realm of equality. Please explain the practices of infinite buddhas; The enlightening beings will be happy to hear them.
How can enlightening beings follow and comprehend The buddhas’ emergence in the world? What are their spheres of body, speech, and mind? Tell us this, and their spheres of action too.
How do buddhas attain true enlightenment? How do buddhas turn the wheel of the Teaching? How do the Blissful Ones pass away? The masses will be happy to hear.
Of those who see the buddhas, great spiritual sovereigns, Attend them and develop roots of goodness, Please tell us the stores of virtue And what the beings who see them attain.
If any hear of buddhas’ names, Whether present in the world or extinct, And deeply believe in their treasury of merit, Tell us how they will benefit.
These enlightening beings, all in an attitude of respect, Are gazing at the Buddha, and at you and me; Please tell them of the ocean of virtues Which purifies living beings.
Please explain the meanings in the wondrous teaching With stories and examples; When beings hear, they will be greatly inspired, Their doubts will end and their knowledge will be clear as space.
Like the glorified bodies manifested By buddhas throughout all lands, By marvelous speech, stories, and examples Please show the enlightenment of buddhas like them.
In millions of buddha-lands in the ten directions, In countless billions of eons, It is hard to see such enlightening beings As have gathered here now.
These enlightening beings are all reverent, Eager for the subtle doctrine; Please expound with pure mind The great phenomena of Buddha’s manifestation.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la dmigs nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa/ tshad med pa'i chos kyi byung ba 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba ni/ rgyu gcig ma yin pa dang / rkyen gcig ma yin pas yang dag par 'grub bo/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /chos bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa chos rnam pa tha dad pa brgya stong / tshad med/ grangs med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i tshul yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rgyus/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sngon 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems tshad med pa bskyed pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa sngon shin tu sbyangs shing yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po tshad med pas sems can yongs su bskyab pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam tshad med pa rgyun 'chad pa med par yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po mi ngoms par yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gro bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i rgyun tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / thabs dang shes rab kyi lam rnam par dag cing tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / yon tan rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / lam gyi yan lag rnam par dgod pa tshad med pa'i ye shes yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang / don dang ldan pa'i chos tshad med pa khong du chud pas mthar phyin par bya ba yang dag par bsgrubs pa ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ chos bcu po de dag la sogs pa chos rnam pa tha dad pa brgya stong / tshad med/ grangs med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i tshul yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i rgyus/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /

Then the enlightening being Universally Good said to the great congregation of enlightening beings, “This matter is inconceivable. The Buddha, the one who realizes Thusness, the worthy, the truly awake, becomes manifest by means of infinite phenomena. Why? It is not by one condition, by one phenomenon, that the manifestation of Buddha can be accomplished. It is accomplished by ten infinities of things. What are the ten? It is accomplished by the mind of enlightenment that took care of infinite sentient beings in the past. It is accomplished by the infinite supreme aspirations of the past. It is accomplished by great benevolence and compassion, which infinitely saved all sentient beings in the past. It is accomplished by infinite continuous commitments of the past. It is accomplished by infinite cultivation of virtues and knowledge tirelessly in the past. It is accomplished by infinite service of buddhas and education of sentient beings in the past. It is accomplished by infinite pure paths of wisdom and means in the past. It is accomplished by infinite pure virtues of the past. It is accomplished by infinite ways of adornment in the past. It is accomplished by infinite comprehensions of principles and meanings in the past. When these infinite, incalculable aspects of the Teaching are fulfilled, one becomes a buddha.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba ni/ rgyu gcig gis 'byung ba ma yin/ rkyen gcig gis 'byung ba ma yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni rgyu tshad med pa dang / rkyen tshad med pa dang / bsgrub pa tshad med pas yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te/ 'di ltar sprin chen po'i char dus las mi 'da' bar rab tu 'bab pas kyang rgyu byas la/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi rgyun mi 'chad par ldang bas kyang rgyu byas nas yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /bzhi po de dag kyang gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni/ yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ldang ngo/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor yongs su skem pa zhes bya ba ni/ chu'i phung po yongs su bskam pa'i phyir ldang ngo/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor yongs su gzhog pa zhes bya ba ni/ gzhal med khang thams cad yongs su dgod pa'i phyir ldang ngo/ /rlung gi khams dkyil 'khor rnam par dgod par zhes bya ba ni/ sems can stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa thams cad kyi rkyen du skyes pa'i las dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs dang / shugs kyis gnas kyi rnam pa'i rgyan rnam par phye ba; shin tu rnam par dbye bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba'i phyir ldang ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa'i rnam pa tshad med pas/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams chos nyid rab tu thob pa'i phyir yongs su 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang / 'byung ba de la 'byung bar byed pa gang yang med de/ 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med pa ma yin no/ /

“It is as a billion-world universe is not formed just by one condition, not by one phenomenon—it can be formed only by innumerable conditions, innumerable things. That is to say, the rising and spreading of great clouds and showering of great rain produce four kinds of atmosphere, continuously making a basis. What are those four? One is called the holder, because it can hold the great waters. Second is called the evaporator, because it can evaporate the great waters. Third is called structure, because it sets up all places. Fourth is called arrangement, because the arrangement and distribution are all functional. These are all produced by the joint actions of sentient beings and by the roots of goodness of enlightening beings, enabling all sentient beings to get the use of what they need. Innumerable such causes and conditions form the universe. It is such by the nature of things—there is no producer or maker, no knower or creator, yet the worlds come to be.

kye rgyal ba'i sres dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang / rgyu gcig ma yin pa dang / rkyen gcig ma yin pas 'byung bar 'gyur te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni/ rgyu tshad med pa dang / rnam pa tshad med pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa tshad med pas 'byung ste/ 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi drung du sngon chos kyi sprin gyi char chen po bab pas kyang rgyu byas la/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor bzhi rgyun mi 'chad par ldang bas kyang rgyu byas nas/ yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po dran pas yang dag par bzung zhing gzungs kyis chud mi za ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi chos kyi sprin chen po'i char yang dag par gzung ba'i phyir ldang ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas kyis bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su bskam pa'i phyir ldang ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ldang ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po sprul pa'i rgyun rnam par bkod pa rnam par 'byed cing rnam par dgod pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni sems can sngon yongs su smin par byas pa rnams kyi rkyen du 'byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa'i stobs dang shugs kyi phyir ldang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de dag la sogs pa'i rnam pa tshad med pa dang / yang dag par bsgrub pa tshad med pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams chos nyid rab tu thob pa'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te/ de la 'byung bar byed pa'am/ skye bar byed pa gang yang med de/ 'byung ba'ang med pa ma yin no/ /de ltar rgyal ba'i sras dag /dpe'i sgo dang pos khong du chud par bya ba 'dis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“The manifestation of Buddha is also like this — it does not come about through just one condition or thing, but by innumerable causes and conditions, innumerable phenomena. That is, having heard, received, and held the clouds and rain of the great Teaching from past buddhas, by this can be produced the four kinds of atmosphere of great knowledge of the enlightened. What are these four? One is the atmosphere of great knowledge of mental command able to retain memory without forgetting, being able to hold the great clouds and rain of teachings of all buddhas. Second is the atmosphere of great knowledge producing tranquillity and insight, being able to evaporate all afflictions. Third is the atmosphere of great knowledge of skillful dedication, being able to perfect all roots of goodness. Fourth is the atmosphere of great knowledge producing undefiled, variegated, magnificent arrays of adornments, causing the roots of goodness of all beings taught in the past to be purified, and consummating the power of the untainted roots of goodness of the enlightened. The buddhas’ attainment of enlightenment in this way is thus by the nature of things—without production or creation, it nevertheless takes place. This is the first characteristic of the manifestation of the completely enlightened, the truly awake. Great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshe/ gcig tu sdug cing tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab ste/ de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po yongs su sgrub pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor ma gtogs par sa'i phyogs gzhan gyis gzung ba'am/ bzod par mi nus so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba'i tshe/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab ste/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag nyid kyi stobs dang shugs kyis bsgrubs pa'i sems kyi rgyud ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dma' ba can dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzung ba'am/ bzod par mi nus so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo gnyis pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, just as when a billion-world universe is about to form, the rain falling from the great clouds, called ‘the deluge,’ cannot be absorbed or held by any place except the universe when it is about to form, in the same way when the Buddha rouses the clouds of the great Teaching and showers the rain of the great Teaching, those of the two lesser vehicles, whose minds and wills are narrow and weak, cannot absorb or hold it—this is possible only for the great enlightening beings with the power of mental continuity. This is the second characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sprin chen po'i char de dag 'bab pa'i tshe/ gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med la gang du yang 'gro ba med de/ sems can rnams kyi las kyi tshogs chen pos char rab tu 'bab pa yang yod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sprin chen po char mngon par 'bab pa yang gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med la/ gang du yang 'gro ba med de; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs dang shugs chen pos char mngon par 'bab pa yang yod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo gsum pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o//

“Furthermore, just as sentient beings, by the force of their acts, shower rain from great clouds, which do not come from anywhere or go anywhere, in the same way great enlightening beings, by the power of their roots of goodness, rouse the clouds of the great Teaching and shower the rain of the great Teaching, yet it comes from nowhere and goes nowhere. This is the third characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sprin chen po'i char mngon pa 'bab pa de dag ni/ stong gsum gyi stong chen por gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyis shes pa'am/ bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams ni/ sprin chen po'i char de la sems dpas mgo rmongs par 'gyur ro/ /sprin chen po'i char de la bltas pas mig 'khrugs par 'gyur ro/ /stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i dbang phyug chen po ni ma gtogs te/ de'i sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis de la chung ngu na char pa'i thigs pa gcig kyang ma rig par mi 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yang dag par 'byung ba'i tshe/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par 'bab pa yang sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis shes pa'am bsam par mi nus te/ de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char la sems pas mgo rmongs par 'gyur ro/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang phyug / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni ma gtogs te/ blo shin tu sbyangs pa'i mthu dang / shugs kyis de dag la chung ngu na tshig dang / yi ge 'ga' tsam yang ma rig par sems can gzhan gyis sems kyi rgyud la mi 'bab po/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo bzhi pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, just as no beings in the universe can count the drops of rain pouring from great clouds, and would go crazy if they tried, for only the overlord god of the universe, by the power of roots of goodness cultivated in the past, is aware of every single drop, in the same way the Buddha produces great clouds of teachings and showers great rain of teachings that all sentient beings, seekers of personal salvation, and self-enlightened ones cannot know, and they would surely go mad if they tried to assess them in thought; only the great enlightening beings, lords of all worlds, by the power of awareness and intellect cultivated in the past, comprehend every single expression and phrase, and how they enter beings’ minds. This is the fourth characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha — great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sprin chen po'i char de dag 'bab pa'i nang na/ rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni me'i phung po de rab tu zhi bar byed do/ /'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de las chu'i phung po de dag 'byung ngo/ /yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni chu'i phung po de dag yongs su gcod do/ /yongs su bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni nor bu rin po che mang po yongs su 'grub par byed do/ /rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de rnam par 'byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ;de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung ba la'ang / rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed do/ /'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad yang dag par 'byung bar byed do/ /yongs su gcod pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod do/ /yongs su sgrub pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos rin po che yongs su grub par byed do/ /rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bab pa yod de/ de ni sems can thams cad kyi sems dang bsam pa rnam par 'byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo lnga pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /

“Furthermore, it is as when great clouds shower rain, there is a great cloud raining called the extinguisher, because it can extinguish fires, there is a great cloud raining called producer, because it can produce floods; there is a great cloud raining called stopper, because it can stop floods; there is a great cloud raining called maker, because it can make all kinds of jewels; there is a great cloud raining called distinguisher, because it can distinguish the billion worlds of the universe. The Buddha manifesting is also like this, producing great clouds of teaching, showering great rains of teaching: there is a great rain of teaching called extinguisher because it can extinguish all sentient beings’ afflictions; there is a great rain of teaching called producer because it can produce all sentient beings’ roots of goodness; there is a great rain of teaching called stopper because it can stop all sentient beings’ delusions of views; there is a great rain of teaching called maker because it can make all jewels of wisdom; there is a great rain of teaching called distinguisher because it distinguishes the inclinations of all sentient beings. This is the fifth characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ char sprin chen po yang ro gcig la/ chu'i phung po yang rnam par mi rtog mod kyi/ de ltar rnam pa tshad med par tha dad pa'i char rnam par phye ba 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i char sprin ro gcig pa las/ de ltar tshad med cing rnam pa tha dad pa'i chos kyi char sna tshogs 'bab ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa yang yongs su 'byung ngo/ /chos rnam par phye ba tshad med pa yang snang zhing yod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo drug pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, just as the great clouds rain water of one flavor, yet there are innumerable differences according to where it rains, in the same way Buddha appearing in the world rains water of teaching of one flavor of great compassion, yet his sermons according to the needs of the situation are infinitely variegated. This is the sixth characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba'i tshe/ thog ma nyid du gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi gzhal med khang yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de'i 'og tu 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi gzhal med khang yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de'i 'og tu mi rnams kyi gnas yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de'i 'og tu de ma yin pa'i sems can lhag ma gzhan rnams kyi gnas rnam par phye ba sna tshogs 'grub par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i tshe yang / thog ma nyid du byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rgyud rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /de'i 'og tu rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rgyud rnams 'byung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu nyan thos kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i ye shes kyi rgyud rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /de'i 'og tu de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan gyi 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / shes pa'i rgyud rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar dper na/ char sprin chen po yang ro gcig la/ chu'i phung po yang rnam par mi rtog pa las/ sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa tha dad pas gzhal med khang rnam pa tha dad pa yod cing snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i char sprin ro gcig pa las/ sems can gyi snod rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa tha dad pa yod cing snang bar gyur to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo bdun pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, as when a billion-world universe first forms, the abodes of the heavens in the realm of form are made first, then the abodes of the heavens in the realm of desire, and then the abodes of human and other beings, similarly Buddha appearing in the world first produces the knowledge of practices of enlightening beings, then the knowledge of practices of individual illuminates, then the knowledge of practices of listeners, then the knowledge of practices of the conditional roots of goodness of other sentient beings. Just as the great clouds rain water of one flavor while the abodes created are variously dissimilar according to the differences in roots of goodness of the sentient beings, Buddha’s spiritual rain of the one flavor of compassion has differences according to the vessels, or capacitites of sentient beings. This is the seventh characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ chus 'jig pa'i bskal pa chen po 'byung ste/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangs chen mtsho gcig tu gyur pa'i tshe/ chos nyid thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i yon tan rin po ches rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i pad+mo mang po 'byung ste/ de dag gis ni chu'i bskal pa thams cad kun nas khebs so/ /de dag ni 'jig rten thams cad 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs te/ pad+mo de dag byung ba dang / lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po dang / gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha'i bu gzhan rnams kyis kyang bskal pa 'di la ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'di snyed cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khong du chud do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'grub pa'i tshe/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag cing 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni gzugs la spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi gzhal med khang yongs su gnas par byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag cing dang la 'od gsal bas rgyan bzang po zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyi lha'i gzhal med khang yongs su 'god do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor gcig tu sdug cing tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni khor yug dang / khor yug chen po'i ri rnams yongs su gzhog pa byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor khyad par du 'phags zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni ri rab ri'i rgyal po yongs su gzhog pa byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor brtan pa zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni rin chen po bcu yongs su gzhog pa byed do/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ seng ldeng can dang / drang srong ri dang / bdud las rgyal dang / bdud las shin tu rgyal dang / gnya' shing 'dzin dang / sa 'dzin dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / spos kyi ngad can dang / kha ba can no/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor rab tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ldang ste / de ni sa chen po kun nas gnas par byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni sa bla'i lha dang / klu dang / dri za'i khyim kun nas gnas par byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor mdzod mi zad pa zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i rgya mtsho chen po kun nas gnas par byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnam par snang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rin po che'i rigs thams cad kun nas gnas par byed do/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor rtsa ba brtan pa zhes bya ba ldang ste/ de ni yid bzhin gyi shing thams cad kun nas gnas par byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar char sprin chen po'i char ro gcig tu 'bab pa dang / chu'i phung po rnam par mi rtog pa las chos nyid thob pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba tha dad pa'i khyad par gyis rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnam pa tha dad pa yod cing snang ngo/ /rlung gi dkyil 'khor rnam pa tha dad par gyur pas/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang yod cing snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad shin tu bsags pa/ bla na med pa'i ye shes chen po snang ba la mngon du gyur pa rnams 'byung ba'i tshe/ ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa 'byung ste/ 'od zer des ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dbang bskur ba thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyed cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu 'dis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar thugs su chud do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ;de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i tshe/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs 'byung ba'i mthus/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po 'od bzang po dri ma med pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes zag pa med cing / mi zad pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ chos kyi dbyings su gzhol ba yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs mi sgul ba yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po zil gyis mi non cing / yang dag par 'phags pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs dang mi bsnyengs pa zil gyis mi non pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po thams cad mngon par mkhyen pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes thams cad du brjod pa las 'das shing; thams cad du thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po sprul pas mngon par bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong zhing thos pa dang / de dang 'grogs pa don yod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za ba'i ye shes yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes mi zad pa'i tshogs 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po 'jug par dka' ba zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod cing / ye shes zab mo thugs su chud pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po rgyan sna tshogs can zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan sna tshogs kyi 'gro ba thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dga' bar 'gyur ba yang dag par 'grub bo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi 'od zer chen po tshe mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste/ 'od zer des de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes sangs rgyas kyi yul chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs par sku tshe'i tshad rgyun mi 'chad pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po'i char sprin chen po ro gcig pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor chen po ro gcig pa dang / byang chub sems dpas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i chos nyid thob pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / brtson 'grus rnam pa tha dad pa'i chos nyid thob pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi 'od zer rang bzhin gcig pa las rnam pa tha dad du gyur pa yod cing snang ngo/ /ye shes kyi 'od zer rnam pa tha dad pa las/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba yang dag par 'grub pa rnam pa tha dad pa yang yod cing snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'grub pa rnam par phye ba'i ro gcig pa las/ yon tan rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyan tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'byung zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis/ sems can rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du shes par 'gyur ba la ltos / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis ma brlabs na/ sems can sngon chad de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la chung ngu na cha shas gcig tsam bstan pa yang shes par 'gyur ba'am/ khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i gnas med skabs med de/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'i khyad par gyis sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i mthu la 'jug cing rtog pa dang khong du chud par byed kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa la rtog pa mi mnga'/ rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ste / 'byung ba med cing kun nas 'byung ba med la yang dag par 'grub pa med de/ bya ba med cing de la byed pa su la'ang med mod kyi/ yang dag par 'byung ba'i grangs su bgrang ba yang yod do; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo brgyad pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, when the worlds are beginning, there is a great flood filling the billion-world universe, producing enormous lotus flowers, called array of jewels of virtues of the manifestation of Buddha, which cover the surface of the waters, their radiance illumining all worlds in the ten directions. Then the overlord god, the gods of the pure abodes, and so on, seeing these flowers, know for certain that in this eon there will be that many buddhas appearing in the world. At that time there arises an atmosphere called highly purified light which makes the mansions of the heavens of the realm of form. There arises an atmosphere called array of pure lights which makes the mansions of the heavens of the world of desire. There arises an atmosphere called firm, dense, and indestructible, which makes the great and small peripheral mountains and the iron mountains. There arises an atmosphere called supremely high which makes the polar mountains. There arises an atmosphere called immovable which makes the ten great mountains. There arises an atmosphere called stabilization which makes the earth. There arises an atmosphere called adornment which makes the palaces of the earth and sky, of the water and sound spirits. There arises an atmosphere called inexhaustible treasury which makes all the oceans of the billion worlds. There arises an atmosphere called treasury of universal light which makes all the jewels of the billion worlds. There arises an atmosphere called steadfast root which makes all the wish-fulfilling trees of the billion worlds. The one-flavored water rained by the great clouds has no distinctions, but because the roots of goodness of sentient beings are not the same, the atmospheres are not the same, and because of the differences of the atmospheres, the worlds are different. The manifestation of Buddha is also like this, replete with the virtues of all roots of goodness, emitting the light of unexcelled great knowledge, called inconceivable knowledge perpetuating the lineage of buddhas, illumining all worlds in the ten directions, giving the enlightening beings the prediction that they will be coronated by all buddhas, attain true enlightenment, and appear in the world. The Buddha manifesting has another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called pure and undefiled, which makes the untainted inexhaustible knowledge of the enlightened. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called universal illumination, which makes the Buddha’s inconceivable knowledge universally penetrate the realm of reality. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called sustaining the nature of buddhahood, which makes the insuperable power of Buddha. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called outstanding and incorruptible, which makes Buddha’s fearless and incorruptible knowledge. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called all spiritual powers, which makes Buddha’s unique qualities and omniscience. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called producing mystic transformation, which makes Buddha’s knowledge of how to cause the roots of goodness produced by seeing, hearing, and attending Buddha to not be lost or decay. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called universal accord, which makes Buddha’s body of endless virtue and knowledge, doing what is beneficial for all beings. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called inexhaustible, which makes Buddha’s extremely profound, subtle knowledge causing the lineage of the three treasures not to die out, according to those who are enlightened by it. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called various adornments, which makes the glorified body of Buddha, gladdening all sentient beings. There is another light of unexcelled great knowledge, called indestructible, which makes the inexhaustible, supreme life span of Buddha equal to the cosmos and the realm of space. Buddha’s water of the one flavor of compassion has no distinction, but because sentient beings’ inclinations are not the same and their faculties and characters are different, it produces various atmospheres of great knowledge, enabling the sentient beings to accomplish the actual manifestation of buddhahood. All buddhas are one and the same in essence; from the sphere of great knowledge they produce various kinds of lights of knowledge. You should know that Buddha, from the single flavor of liberation, produces infinite, inconceivable qualities of various kinds, which sentient beings think are products of the Buddha’s supernormal powers, but which actually are not created by the supernormal powers of Buddha. There is not a single enlightening being who can ever attain even a little bit of the knowledge and wisdom of buddhas without having planted roots of goodness in the company of buddhas. It is just that by the spiritual power of the buddhas sentient beings are enabled to embody the qualities of buddhahood; yet the buddhas have no discrimination. There is no creation, no destruction, no creator, and nothing created. This is the eighth characteristic of the manifestation of Buddha—great enlightening beings should know it as such.

kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor chu'i phung po'i 'dzin pa bzhi ni; nam mkha' la gnas shing ldang ngo/ /bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor brtan pa dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor gnas pa dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor mi nyams pa dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dag ste/ rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po de bzhi ni rab tu lding zhing chu'i phung po 'dzin te/ chu'i phung po la gnas pa'i sa chen po ni mi 'jig /rnam par mi 'jig pas de'i phyir sa ni chu la gnas so/ /chu ni rlung la gnas so/ /rlung ni nam mkha' la gnas so/ /nam mkha' ni mi gnas pa zhes bya ste/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni tshul de lta bur gnas so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i tshe/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po shes rab kyi snang ba chags pa med pa la gnas pa bzhi ldang ste/ de dag ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'dzin to/ /bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po bsdu bas sems can yongs su dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dang / ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po chos rnam par dgod pa la 'gro ba mos par byed pa zhes bya ba dang / ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su srung ba zhes bya ba dang / ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po 'khor ba thams cad zag pa med pa'i dbyings su khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dag ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /bzhi po de dag ni shes rab kyi snang ba chags pa med pa la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po rnams te/ de dag ni 'gro ba thams cad byams pa chen pos yongs su bskyab pa dang / thugs rje chen pos 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol zhing gzung ba'i phyir ldang ste/ byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'gro ba mang po rnam par phye ba 'byams klas pa'i nang na/ thabs mkhas pa la gnas pa'i byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ;de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni tshul de lta bur 'grub cing de ltar gnas pa yin te/ shes rab kyi snang ba chags pa med pa ni mi gnas pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag / khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dgu pa 'dis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi skye ba 'byung ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Furthermore, it is like the arising of four atmospheres in space that can sustain the sphere of water.
