kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rlung gis 'jig rten pa'i bskal ba byung ba'i tshe/ rnam par 'thor pa zhes bya ba'i rlung dmar chen po 'byung ste/ de dag ni khor yug dang khor yug chen po'i rdo rje'i ri yan chad stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bshig/ bcom/ rnam par gtor te cha shas kyang med par byed de/ de la phyir zlog pa zhes bya ba'i rlung dmar chen po gzhan ldang ba'ang yod de/ de dag ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor kun nas ldang ste/ rnam par 'thor ba'i rlung dmar chen po 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du mi 'gro bar phyir zlog go / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ ci ste phyir zlog pa'i rlung dmar chen po de dag gis rnam par 'thor ba'i rlung dmar chen po de phyir ma bcil du zin na/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med/ grangs med pa dag kyang bshig par 'gyur ro/ /bcom par 'gyur ro/ /gtor bar 'gyur ro/ /cha shas kyang mi bzhag par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par 'thor ba yod de/ ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po des de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnam par 'thor zhing / rnam par 'joms pa mdzad de/ de la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po thabs mkhas pas yang dag par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba rab tu ldang ba yod de/ nyon mongs pa'i bag chags rnam par 'thor ba'i ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams las phyir zlog go / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po thabs mkhas pa'i dkyil 'khor de med du zin na/ de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' tshad med/ grangs med pa zhig nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ro/ /ye shes kyi rlung dmar chen po thabs mkhas pas/ yang dag par 'dzin pa de'i mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te/ rang byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la rab tu 'khod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dgu pa 'dis kyang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs skye ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“When a gale destroys the worlds, a great wind called destruction arises, able to pulverize the billion worlds of the universe, their iron mountains and so on, to smithereens. There is another wind, called blocker, circling the billion-world universe, blocking the gale of destruction so that it cannot reach the worlds in other places. Without this blocking wind, all the worlds in the ten directions would be completely destroyed. Buddha similarly has a great wind of knowledge, called extinguisher, which can extinguish the afflictions and habit energies of all great enlightening beings; and a great wind of knowledge called skillful sustaining, which skillfully sustains the enlightening beings whose faculties are not yet mature, not letting the extinguishing whirlwind totally eliminate all their afflictions and habit energies. Without Buddha’s skillfully sustaining wind of knowledge, countless enlightening beings would fall into the states of those content with individual salvation. By this knowl edge enlightening beings are enabled to transcend the stages of the two lesser vehicles of individual salvation and abide in the ultimate rank of Buddha. This is the ninth characteristic of the mind of Buddha; great enlightening beings should know it thus.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni thams cad du khyab pa ste/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ sems can gyi ris na; de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad du ma khyab pa de lta bu gang yang med de/ de'ang ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni 'du shes su 'dzin pas rnam par dgod pa ma yin te/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes/ rang byung gi ye shes/ chags pa med pa'i ye shes ni 'du shes dang rnam par bral bas rab tu 'byung ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ ri mo'i gzhi chen po stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam zhig yod par gyur la/ ri mo'i gzhi chen po de la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ril gyis rdzogs par bris te/ 'di ltar khor yug chen po'i tshad du ni khor yug chen po bris/ sa chen po'i tshad du ni sa chen po bris/ stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni/ stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bris/ stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni/ stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams bris/ gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni; gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bris/ rgya mtsho chen po'i tshad du ni rgya mtsho chen po bris/ 'dzam bu'i gling gi tshad du ni 'dzam bu'i gling bris/ shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling gi tshad du ni shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling bris/ nub kyi ba glang spyod kyi gling gi tshad du ni nub kyi ba glang spyod kyi gling bris/ byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling gi tshad du ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling bris/ ri rab kyi tshad du ni ri rab bris/ sa bla na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang gi tshad du ni sa bla na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang rnams bris/ 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang gi tshad du ni/ 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang rnams bris/ gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang gi tshad du ni/ gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang rnams bris/ gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang gi tshad du ni/ gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal med khang rnams bris par gyur la/ ri mo'i gzhi chu zheng du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam yod pa de/ rdul shin tu phra ba gcig gi nang du bcug par gyur la/ rdul gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdul shin tu phra ba ma lus pa thams cad re re la yang / de tsam gyi ri mo'i gzhi chen po re re yod par gyur te/ de nas skyes bu mkhas pa yid gzhungs pa/ khong bzo ba/ gsal ba/ de bzhin nyid khong du chud pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhig skyes par gyur te/ de la 'phrul gyi mig kun tu dag pa shin tu 'od gsal ba yang bdog par gyur la/ des 'phrul gyi mig gis bltas na mthong bar gyur nas/ ri mo'i gzhi chen po de lta bu de ltar shin tu phra mo'i rdul de dag la 'khod kyang sems can su la yang phan par ma gyur pas/ de 'di snyam du sems te/ kye ma/ bdag gis brtson 'grus kyi mthu dang stobs shig gis/ rdul phra mo 'di dag kha phye ste/ ri mo'i gzhi chen po 'di dag 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar bya'o snyam nas/ des brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / mthu chen po bskyed de/ ri mo'i gzhi chen po de dag 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa zhig yod na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i ye shes chags pa med pa'i ye shes/ sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i ye shes kyang / sems can thams cad kyi sems la ril gyis chud par gnas te/ sems can gyi sems de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad dang mnyam yang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ni byis pa 'du shes su 'dzin pas rnam par glags pa rnams mi shes shing khong du mi chud la/ mngon du mi byed/ nyams su myong bar mi byed de/ de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chags pa med pas/ sems can gyi khams thams cad la rnam par gzigs nas ngo mtshar gyi thugs skye bar 'gyur te/ kye ma sems can 'di dag de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du'ang mi shes la/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyang khong na yod pa ngo mtshar che'i/ bdag gis sems can 'di dag ci nas kyang rang rang gi 'du shes kyi mdud pa chen po 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs dang shugs kyis bkrol te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khong du chud cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyang thob par 'gyur ba'i 'phags pa'i lam bstan te/ 'du shes kyi rnam pas rnam par glags pa thams cad bsal bar bya'o zhes nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam bstan pas de dag gi 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su bsal bar mdzad do/ /de ltar 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su sel ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'tsho'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo bcu pa 'dis kyang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs skye ba khong du chud pa bya ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de dag la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub pa brgya stong tshad med grangs med pa'i sgos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs skye ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“There is nowhere the knowledge of Buddha does not reach. Why? There is not a single sentient being who is not fully endowed with the knowledge of Buddha; it is just that because of deluded notions, erroneous thinking, and attachments, they are unable to realize it. If they would get rid of deluded notions, then universal knowledge, spontaneous knowledge, and unobstructed knowledge would become manifest. It is as if there were a great scripture, equal in extent to a billion-world universe, in which are written all the things of the universe—there are written the things of the iron peripheral mountains, to an extent equal to those mountains; there are written the things on the land, to an extent equal to the land; there are written the things in the million-world galaxies, to an extent equal to the galaxies; there are written the things in the thousand-world systems, to an extent equal to the systems; there are written the things in the continents, to an extent equal to the continents, and so on; the things of the oceans, the polar mountains, the abodes of earth and sky, the celestial abodes in the sky of the desire realm, the abodes in the form realm, the abodes in the formless realm, are each written down to an equivalent extent. Though this scripture is equal in measure to a billion-world universe, yet it entirely rests in a single atom; and as this is so of one atom, it is also true of all atoms. Then suppose someone with clear and comprehensive knowledge, who has fully developed the celestial eye, sees these scriptures inside atoms, not benefiting sentient beings in the least, and, with this thought—‘I should, by energetic power, break open those atoms and release those scriptures so that they can benefit all sentient beings’—then employs appropriate means to break open the atoms and release the great scriptures, to enable all sentient beings to benefit greatly. Similarly, the knowledge of Buddha, infinite and unobstructed, universally able to benefit all, is fully inherent in the bodies of sentient beings; but the ignorant, because of clinging to deluded notions, do not know of it, are not aware of it, and so do not benefit from it. Then the Buddha, with the unimpeded, pure, clear eye of knowledge, observes all sentient beings in the cosmos and says, ‘How strange—how is it that these sentient beings have the knowledge of Buddha but in their folly and confusion do not know it or perceive it? I should teach them the way of sages and cause them forever to shed deluded notions and attachments, so they can see in their own bodies the vast knowledge of buddhas, no different from the buddhas.’ Then Buddha teaches them to practice the way of sages, so they get rid of deluded notions, after which they realize the infinite knowledge of Buddha and aid and comfort all living beings. This is the tenth characteristic of the mind of Buddha; great enlightening beings should know it thus.
“Great enlightening beings should know the mind of Buddha who has realized Thusness and is completely awake, in terms of such infinite, unimpeded, inconceivably great characteristics.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the great enlightening being Universally Good, in order to explain again what he meant, spoke in verse.

stobs bcu mnga' ba'i thugs ni ye shes mchog las byung / rgyal ba'i ye shes de yang ji ltar brtag ce na/ / phyogs bcu kun gyi sems can khams ni ji snyed pa/ / thams cad lus med rang bzhin med pa'i mkha' las 'byung / /
chos dbyings kun gyi sems can khams rnams ji snyed pa/ / bzo dang mkhas pa'i ye shes sna tshogs bde myong ba/ / de dag thams cad bde gshegs mkhyen las thabs kyis 'byung / / bde gshegs ye shes de ni sngon nas rang bzhin med/ /
chos kyi dbyings las gnas te dpang can tshogs rnams grol/ / phyogs bcu'i rang rgyal theg la gnas pa kun kyang ste/ / sangs rgyas ma lus pa yang chos kyi dbyings su 'byung / / chos dbyings de la rnam par 'phel zhing 'grib pa med/ /
de bzhin sangs rgyas mkhyen la shes pa kun 'byung ste/ / slob dang mi slob 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa 'byung / / bde gshegs dam pa'i ye shes 'phel zhing 'grib pa'ang med/ / sangs rgyas ye shes de la skye zhing 'jig pa'ang med/ /
ji ltar gling rnams chu yi rgyal pos mngon brlan pas/ / sa steng gang 'dod brkos pa'i nges par chu 'byung 'thob/ / sa la rnam rtog med de chu la mu med pas/ / brtson 'grus stobs dang ldan na phyogs kun chu yang 'byung / /
phyogs bcu ma lus sems can khams rnams ji snyed pa/ / de dag sems ni bde gshegs mkhyen pas mngon brlan pas/ / gang dang gang du las byas brtson 'grus mthus bskyed pa/ / de dang de nas ye shes chu 'byung 'thob par 'gyur/ /
rin chen mchog bzhi gangs chen mtsho yi mdzod gnas pa/ / de dag mthus ni chu 'dzin chen por rin chen 'byung / / nor bu rin chen de dag phal gyis mi mthong ste/ / de dag phyogs bzhir rnam phye gangs chen mtsho na gnas/ /
bde gshegs ye shes bzhi po tshad med de bzhin te/ / 'gro ba'i ye shes nges 'byung 'jig par mi 'gyur ro/ / ye shes chen po de dag gzhan rnams sus mi mthong / / stobs bcu rnams dang dbang bskur thob pa ma gtogs so/ /
chu 'dzin chen po'i mtha' na rin chen bzhi yod de/ / stobs chen gzi brjid che bas de dag chu 'grib byed/ / de dag med du zin na gling bzhi rgyas par 'gyur/ / de dag yod pas rgya mtsho 'phel zhing 'grib pa med; ;
de bzhin bde gshegs ye shes rgyal sras don brtson pa/ / chos kyi shugs gcod dba' rlabs shin tu rnam par sel/ / shes rab yangs pa'i ye shes mtha' dang dbus med snang / / de med gyur na rgyal sras gang yang 'tshang mi rgya/ /

If you want to know the mind of buddhas, Observe the buddhas’ knowledge. Buddhas’ knowledge has no resting place, Just as space rests on nothing.
Sentient beings’ various inclinations, And knowledge of expedients, All rest on buddhas knowledge, While buddha’s knowledge rests on nothing.
The liberations of buddhas, Disciples, and the self-enlightened, All depend on the reality realm, While reality has no increase or decrease.
Buddha’s knowledge, similarly, Produces all knowledges, Without increase or decrease, Without beginning or end.
Just as water flows under the ground So those who seek it find it, Without thought, without end, Its effective power all-pervasive,
Buddha knowledge is also like this, Being in all creatures’ minds; If any work on it with diligence, They will soon find the light of knowledge.
Just as the water spirit has four jewels Which produce all gems, Hidden in a secret place Where ordinary people cannot see,
So too do Buddha’s four knowledges Produce all knowledge, While no one can see them Except great enlightening beings.
As in the ocean are four jewels Which can drink up all waters So that the ocean does not overflow And does not increase or decrease,
Likewise does Buddha’s knowledge Stop waves and remove attachment to teachings; Boundlessly great and vast, It produces enlightening beings and buddhas.

'og gi gzhi nas bzung ste srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar/ / 'dod dang gzugs dang gzugs med khams gsum thams cad kyang; / bdag med dbyings la legs par gnas pas gnas pa ste/ / nam mkha' mtho zhing dma' bar 'gyur ba gang yang med/ /
de bzhin bde gshegs ye shes shes pa kun gyi rgyu/ / slob dang mi slob rnams dang de bzhin rang rgyal dang / / byang chub sems dpa' bde bar byed pa'i ye shes kyang / / sangs rgyas ye shes mchog la bde bar rab tu gnas/ /
gangs ri spo la gzi brjid che ba'i sman gyi mchog / rtsa ba grugs med yod de de yi gzi brjid mthus/ / 'dzam bu'i gling gi shing mchog thams cad rnam par skye/ / snying po rtsa ba skyed byed rtsa ba snying po skyed/ /
de bzhin bde gshegs rigs las sangs rgyas ye shes 'byung / / de yi yon tan mthus ni rnal 'byor ye shes 'byung / / spyod pa'i byang chub 'byung ste byang chub spyod pa 'byin/ / sems yid mnyam dang ldan la sangs rgyas ye shes skye/ /
bskal pa'i 'jig dus mi bzad bskal pa'i me byung bar/ / la las spur khur bor mi tshig gnas med de; ; rgyal ba'i sras rnams de ni mi tshig skabs med do/ / rdo rje 'tshig par byed na skam ci zhig smos/ /
la mi tshig ji ste gnas yod srid 'gyur gyi/ / bde gshegs ye shes kyis ni ma mkhyen gang yang med/ / sems can dus dang bskal pa zhing rnams rab tu mkhyen/ / de ltar sangs rgyas ye shes tshad med mtha' yang yas/ /
bskal pa 'jig pa'i tshe na rnam 'thor rlung ldang ste/ / de ni khor yug ri rab kun kyang rnam par 'thor bar byed/ / rnam 'thor phyir ldog byed pa'i rlung dmar gzhan med na/ / tshad med zhing rnams kun kyang rnam par 'jig par 'gyur/ /
de bzhin stobs bcu mnga' ba'i ye shes rlung ldang pa/ / de dag byang chub sems dpa'i nyon mongs rnam par 'thor/ / de la thabs dang ldan pa'i rlung dmar gzhan yod de/ / des ni yongs su bzung bas nyan thos mi 'gyur ro/ /
stong gsum tshad kyi ri mo'i gzhi zhig yod gyur la/ / rdul phran ma lus kun gyi sbubs na'ang de 'dra ste/ / skyes bu mkhas pa'i mig ldan la las rnam phye nas/ / ri mo'i gzhi de 'gro kun nye bar 'tsho byas na/ /
bcom ldan de yang de bzhin sems can kun gyi sems/ / ril gyis bde gshegs mkhyen yin 'du shes bsgribs gyur ces/ / rgyal ba'i thugs rje bskyed cing 'du shes spong bar ston/ / 'du shes yongs su shes nas rgyal sras nye bar 'tsho/ /

From the nadir to the summit of being, The desire, form, and formless realms, All rest in space, While space does not discriminate:
The knowledge of enlightening beings, Of disciples and the self-enlightened, All rest in the knowledge of Buddha, While buddha-knowledge has no discrimination.
On the Snowy mountains is a medicine Called inexhaustible roots Which can make all trees grow— Their roots, trunks, leaves, flowers, and fruits.
Buddha’s knowledge too is like this, Grown from the seed of enlightenment; Once enlightenment is attained, It also produces the practices of enlightening beings.
If someone puts a handful of straw In the eonic fire, Where even diamond blazes, The straw could not but be burned:
The ages and lands of all times And the sentient beings therein Buddha completely knows More surely than the burning of that straw.
There is a wind called destruction Which can pulverize a universe; If not stopped by another wind, Destruction would reach infinite worlds.
The great wind of knowledge is also like this, Extinguishing the delusions of enlightening beings; There is another wind of skillfulness, Enabling them to live, in the land of buddhahood.
It is as there is a great scripture Equal in extent to a universe Existing inside one atom, And in all atoms as well;
Someone with intelligence and wisdom Sees all clearly with pure eyes And breaks the atoms, releasing the scriptures For the benefit of all beings.
Buddha-knowledge, likewise, Is in all beings’ minds; Wrapped up in deluded thoughts, They are unaware, unknowing;
The buddhas’ great compassion Causes them to get rid of deluded ideas So knowledge can appear And benefit enlightening beings.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul ji lta bur khong du chud par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know the sphere of Buddha, who has realized Thusness and is completely awake?

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni shes rab dang ye shes chags pa med cing / bsgribs pa med pas 'jug cing / 'gro ba thams cad yul du gyur pa'i sgos khong du chud par bya ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni 'jig rten thams cad yul du gyur pa dang / zhing thams cad yul du gyur pa dang / chos thams cad yul du gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad yul du gyur pa dang; de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa yul du gyur pa dang / chos kyi dbyings bsgribs pa med pa yul du gyur pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' la mtha' med pa yul du gyur pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings tshad med pa yul du gyur pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la yul med pa yul du gyur pa'i sgos khong du chud par bya ste/ 'gro ba thams cad gyi yul ji ltar tshad med pa de bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang tshad med de/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i yul gyi bar du ji ltar tshad med cing yul med la yul ma yin te/ thams cad gang na'ang med pa de bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang tshad med cing / yul med la yul ma yin te/ thams cad gang na'ang med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems kyi yul gyis sangs rgyas kyi yul khong du chud par bya ste/ ji ltar sems kyi yul tshad med cing mu med de/ ma bcings ma grol ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang tshad med cing mu med de/ ma bcings ma grol ba'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar sems de ni ji lta ji ltar bsams shing rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar tshad med par rnam par dgod pa yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu rnams ni sems kyi khyad par gyis char pa'i rgyun chen po 'bebs te/ char pa'i rgyun de yang klu rnams kyi nang nas byung ba'ang ma yin/ phyi rol nas byung ba'ang ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang rnam pa ji lta ji ltar bur bsams te/ rnam pa brtags pa de lta de lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dgod par 'gyur te/ de ni phyogs na gnas pa yang ma yin/ yul na gnas pa yang ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po la chu'i phung po tshad med pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad klu rnams kyi sems kyi khyad par las byung ba'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho la chos kyi rgyud tshad med pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad sngon gyi thugs kyi smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i khyad par gyis byung pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rgya mtsho chen po ni ji tsam zhig tu tshad med/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgya mtsho ni ji tsam zhig tu tshad med/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gnas 'di bstan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ 'on kyang dpe tsam zhig bstan gyi de nyon cig /

Knowing the spheres of all worlds by means of unobstructed, unimpeded knowledge is the sphere of Buddha. Knowing the spheres of all times, all lands, all things, and all beings, the undifferentiated sphere of True Thusness, the unobstructed sphere of the reality realm, the boundless sphere of absolute truth, the unquantified sphere of space, and the objectless sphere, is the sphere of Buddha. Just as the spheres of all times, and so on, up to the objectless sphere, are all infinite, so is the sphere of Buddha infinite. Just as the objectless sphere has no existence in all places, so also does the sphere of Buddha have no existence in all places.
“Great enlightening beings should know the sphere of mind is the sphere of Buddha; just as the sphere of mind is measureless and boundless, without bondage or liberation, so too is the sphere of Buddha measureless and boundless, without bondage or liberation. Why? Because by such and such thoughts there are infinite such and such manifestations. It is like when the great water spirit showers rain according to will, the rain does not come from inside or outside; the sphere of Buddha is also like this—according to such and such thoughts, there are infinite such and such manifestations, yet they do not come from anywhere in the ten directions. Just as the water of the ocean all comes from the mental power of the king water spirit, so too does the water of the ocean of omniscience of all buddhas all come from the buddhas’ past vows.
“The ocean of omniscience is infinite, boundless, inconceivable, and inexpressible, but I will tell something of it by way of simile, so please listen carefully.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rgya mtsho chen por ni/ 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nas chu klung stong phrag phyed dang gsum 'bab bo/ /nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling nas chu klung stong phrag lnga 'bab bo/ /shar gyi lus 'phags po'i gling nas chu klung stong phrag phyed dang brgyad 'bab bo/ /byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling nas chu klung stong phrag bcu tshang bar 'bab ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar na rgya mtsho chen po der gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nas chu klung stong phrag nyi shu rtsa lnga tshang bar rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ gling chen po bzhi nas rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa'i chu'i phung po de tshad med pa yin mod/

The southern continent has 2,500 rivers, which flow into the ocean; the western continent has 5,000 rivers, which flow into the ocean; the eastern continent has 7,500 rivers, which flow into the ocean; the northern continent has 10,000 rivers, which flow into the ocean. These four continents thus have 25,000 rivers, which continuously flow into the ocean. What do you think—is that a lot of water?”
byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni tshad med grangs med do/ /
“Yes indeed.”

byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de dag pas kyang klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa de dag pas kyang klu'i rgyal po 'od zer brgya pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer brgya pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po rgyan chen po'i sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang ba rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer brgya pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rgyan chen po'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po yid du 'ong ba'i sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ /gzhung de bzhin du de bas kyang / klu'i rgyal po 'gro bar char 'bebs pa'i sprin las ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de bas kyang klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo'i sprin las ches mang bar 'bab bo; ;de bas kyang klu'i rgyal po 'od mtha' yas pa'i sprin las ches mang por 'bab bo/ /de bas kyang klu'i rgyal po shugs chen por 'dzin pa'i sprin las ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de bas kyang klu'i rgyal po shin tu rnam par rgyal ba'i sprin las ches mang bar 'bab ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer brgya pa'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rgyan chen po'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po yid du 'ong ba'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'gro bar char 'bebs pa'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po 'od mtha' yas pa'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po shugs chen po 'dzin pa'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba'i sprin las ji snyed cig bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po rnam par bsgyings pa'i sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ klu'i rgyal po chen po bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa klu'i rgyal po'i rigs khrag khrig brgyad cu so so'i sprin las chu'i phung po chen po mang po rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas/ chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang; klu'i rgyal po chen po bcu'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po'i rigs khrag khrig brgyad cu so so'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po gangs chen mtsho'i bu thu bo 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ /

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du chu klung chen po de dag nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / sprin chen po de dag las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer bcu pa'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu klung chen po dag nas/ chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po snga ma de dag gi sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po gangs chen mtsho'i bu'i thu bo 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po 'od zer bcu pa'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de bas kyang / klu'i rgyal po 'od zer brgya ba'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu klung chen po dag nas/ chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po de dag dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po'i rigs khrag khrig brgyad cu so so'i sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po gangs chen mtsho'i bu thu bo 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po 'od zer bcu pa'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po 'od zer brgya ba'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de dag pas kyang / klu'i rgyal po chen po rgyan chen po'i gnas nas chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab po/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhung de bzhin du de dag pas kyang yid du 'ong ba'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de dag pas kyang 'gro bar char 'bebs pa'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de dag pas kyang dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo; ;de dag pas kyang 'od mtha' yas pa'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de dag pas kyang shugs chen po 'dzin pa'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de dag pas kyang shin tu rnam par rgyal ba'i gnas nas ches mang bar 'bab bo/ /de dag pas kyang klu'i rgyal po chen po rnam par bsgyings pa'i gnas nas/ chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gling chen po bzhi ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu klung nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po bcu po de dag gi sprin dang / gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po'i rigs khrag khrig brgyad cu'i sprin dang; gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen po bab pa dang / 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin las chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de dag bas kyang / klu'i rgyal po chen po gangs chen mtsho'i sprin tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba las chu'i phung po ches mang bar rgya mtsho chen por 'bab bo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du gling chen po bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu klung gi chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por rab tu bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po snga ma de dag gi sprin dang / gnas nas chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen po bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po gangs chen mtsho'i bu thu bo 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin las/ chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa dang / klu'i rgyal po chen po gangs chen mtsho'i sprin tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba las/ chu'i phung po ji snyed cig rgya mtsho chen por bab pa de bas kyang / klu'i rgyal po gangs chen mtsho'i gnas nas chu'i dbab brgal chen po bai DUr+ya sngon po'i kha dog lta bur 'dug pa ches mang ba 'byung ste/ de ni rgya mtsho chen po thams cad kyang chu'i shugs chen pos rgyas par byed mod kyi/ 'on kyang rgya mtsho chen po ni 'bras la 'da' ba med de/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ rgya mtsho chen po de ni chu'i phung pos de ltar tshad med pa ste/ phyi ltar chu'i phung pos tshad med pa de ltar rin po che'i phung pos kyang tshad med de/ sems can gyi gnas kyis kyang tshad med la/ sems can chen po'i lus kyi rnam pas kyang tshad med na/

The water in the abode of the water spirit Ten Light Beams flows into the ocean, even more than the aforementioned; the water in the palace of the water spirit Hundred Light Beams flows into the ocean, even more; the water of the palaces of each of the water spirits, each with more and more water, flows into the ocean, and the water in the palace of the water spirit Rose Apple Banner, son of the water spirit Ocean, which is yet more, also flows into the ocean.
The water in the palace of the water spirit Ocean, which is even more, surges forth into the ocean; the water it produces is violet, and it surges forth at regular times, so the tide of the ocean is regular. Thus the ocean’s water is infinite, its treasures are infinite, its creatures are infinite, and the earth it rests on is infinite too.
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la de ji snyam du sems/ rgya mtsho chen po de tshang med mod/
Do you think that the ocean is infinite or not?”
byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras; rgya mtsho chen po de ni dpes brjod par yang dka' ba tsam du rgya che'o/ /
“It is truly infinite, incomparably so.”

byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar rgya mtsho chen po tshad med pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho yul tshad med pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ /stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas/ rgyur bya ba'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'on kyang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyis/ rnam par rig par bya ba nye bar bzung ste rgya mtsho chen po las de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dper blang gi/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i yul la dpe yod pa ma yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i yul ni dpe las 'das pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i yul de lta bu de ni 'di lta ste/ thugs dang po bskyed pa nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rgyun ma chad pa'i phyir/ yang dag par bsgrubs pas kyang tshad med par khong du chud par bya'o/ /byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / rin po che gsum gyi rgyun mi gcod pas rin po che'i phung pos kyang tshad med par khong du chud par bya'o/ /slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad nye bar 'tsho bas 'byung po gnas pas kyang tshad med par khong du chud par bya'o/ /sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yan chad chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad gnas pas 'byung po chen po'i lus rnam pa tha dad pas kyang tshad med par khong du chud par bya ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i yul 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ni/ tshad med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o/ /de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos don de nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

“The infinity of this ocean does not come up to the smallest fraction of the infinity of the ocean of buddha-knowledge. Similes are made for beings according to their mentalities, but the sphere of Buddha is beyond similitude. Great enlightening beings should know that the ocean of knowledge of Buddha is infinite, because of ceaseless cultivation of all enlightening practices from the very first determination for enlightenment. They should know that the collection of treasures therein is infinite, because all elements of enlightenment, the seeds of the three treasures, continue unending. They should know the sentient beings in which it dwells are infinite, because it is used by all listeners and self-illuminates, those still learning and those beyond learning. They should know the ground it rests on is infinite, because it is the abode of all enlightening beings, from the first stage of Joy to the ultimate stage of Nonobstruction. Great enlightening beings, in order to enter infinite knowledge and benefit all sentient beings, should know the sphere of Buddha in this way.” Then Universally Good uttered these verses to again explain his meaning:

rdul med rnams kyi yul ni tshad med gzhal du med/ / sems kyi yul bzhin rnam pa kun tu tshad med de/ / sems kyis mngon bsgrubs yid kyi yul ni ji lta ba/ / de bzhin stobs bcu rnams kyi yul yang shes par bya/ /
klu yi dbang po gnas nas nam yang mi g.yo bar; ; sems kyi mthus ni char chen rgyun kyang rab tu 'bebs/ / de la'ang 'od dang 'gro bar dmigs pa med pa ste/ / klu yi dbang po'i bsam pa tsam gyis char yang 'bab/ /
de bzhin stobs bcu gang dag nas kyang byon pa med/ / de bzhin thub pa gang du'ang bzhud pa mi dmigs te/ / thugs kyis dgongs pas skra rtse gcig la 'jug par yang / / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshad du de dag shin tu 'byung / /
rgya mtsho chu dang rin chen tshogs kyis tshad med de/ / sems can dag dang 'byung po gnas pas tshad kyang med/ / ro gcig rnyog par mi nus sems can der skyes pa/ / de dag kun kyang chu bo gzhan la spyod mi byed/ /
de bzhin rgyal ba'i yul yang mkhyen pas tshad med de/ / rin chen gsum gnas rin chen tshogs kyis tshad kyang med/ / slob dang mi slob sems can rnams kyis tshad med de/ / ye shes mchog don spyod pa'i 'byung po'i tshad kyang med// //

As the sphere of mind is infinite, So is the sphere of buddhas. As the sphere of mind is born from intellect, So should the sphere of Buddha be seen.
The water spirits, without leaving their places, Shower rain by the power of mind; Though the rain does not come from or go anywhere, Yet it falls everywhere according to the minds of the spirits:
The Ten-Powered Sage, in like manner, Does not come from anywhere or go anywhere, To those with pure minds appearing physically, Vast as the cosmos, yet fitting in a pore.
The treasures of the ocean are infinite, So are its creatures and ground; The nature of the water is one flavor, equal, without distinction, While those born therein each receive benefit.
The ocean of buddha-knowledge is also thus; All it contains is infinite; Those in the stages of learning and no learning All gain benefit therein.
bam po bdun cu rtsa bzhi ba/

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ji lta bur shes par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know the conduct of Buddha?

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni chags pa med pa'i spyod yul du shes par bya ste/ ji ltar de bzhin nyid ni sngon gyi mtha' nas byung ba ma yin/ phyi ma'i mtha' nas 'phos pa ma yin/ da ltar byung bas mngon par bsgrubs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul yang ma skyes/ ma 'phos/ mngon par grub pa med par khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos kyi dbyings la lus med pas chos kyi dbyings de ni/ tshad yod pa'ang ma yin/ tshad med pa'ang ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la lus med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul de yang tshad yod pa'ang ma yin/ tshad med pa'ang ma yin/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'dab chags bya ni nam mkha' las lding ste/ 'gro na lo brgyar song yang ji srid du phyin pa de srid na ma phyin pa'ang yod de/ nam mkha' la mtha' med pas snga phyi khyad par med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul yang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong du bstan kyang / de snyed ni ma bstan pa yang yod de/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la mu med pa'i phyir ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang / chags pa med pa'i spyod yul la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis bzhugs shing / sems can thams cad la spyod yul de yang ston pa mdzad do/ /sems can chags pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyang chags pa'i lam de dang de nas yongs su zlo ba mdzad do/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po chen po'i spyod yul ni nam mkha' ste/ nam mkha' la gnas shing / rang gi mig yongs su dag pas klu'i gnas su bltas te/ rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i phung po chen po nam mkha' lding gi shugs drag po dang / gshog pa'i rlung chen po'i mthus g.yas g.yon du bsal nas/ klu'am/ klu'i bud med dus yongs su smin te/ tshe'i mthar phyin pa brjod cing 'byin to/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po chen po chags pa med pa'i spyod yul mnga' ba yang / bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul las bzhugs shing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan bla na med pa rnam par dag pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi gnas la gzigs nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs kyi shugs dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyi gshog pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po sred pa'i chus gang ba phye ste/ bsal nas sems can dbang po yongs su dag cing sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags par gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du gyur pa rnams 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho nas bton te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi spyod yul la rab tu dgod pa mdzad kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chags pa med pa'i spyod yul la bzhugs pas/ spros pa thams cad yongs su chad de/ rtog pa mi mnga'/ rnam par rtog pa mi mnga'o/ /

Great enlightening beings should know unobstructed action is the conduct of Buddha; they should know the conduct of true thusness is the conduct of Buddha. Just as True Thusness is not born in the past, does not move into the future, and does not arise in the present, likewise the conduct of Buddha is not born, does not move, and does not arise. Just as the realm of reality is not quantified or unquantified, because it has no form, likewise the conduct of Buddha is not quantified or unquantified, because it has no form. It is as if a bird flew through the sky for a hundred years, the places it passed and those it had not passed would both be immeasurable, because the realm of space has no boundaries: in the same way, if someone spent trillions of eons expounding the particulars of the conduct of Buddha, what was explained and what was not yet explained would both be immeasurable, because the action of Buddha has no bounds.
“Buddha, completely enlightened, engaged in unobstructed action, has no dwelling place, yet can show what he does to all beings and enables them to go beyond all obstructed paths once they have seen this. It is as when the golden-winged king of birds flies in the sky, it circles and hovers, observing the dragon palaces in the ocean with its clear eyes; exerting its forceful strength, it churns the ocean waters with its wings, causing the waters to part, and snatches dragons, male or female, whose life it knows is about to end. The ‘golden-winged bird king’ Buddha, in like manner, engaged in unimpeded action, observes all sentient beings in all abodes in the cosmos with the clear Buddha-eye; if any have planted roots of goodness that have developed to maturity, the Buddha exerts the forceful ten powers and with the two wings of tranquillity and insight churns the waters of emotion of the ocean of birth and death, causing the water to part, then snatches those beings, places them in the Buddha teaching, and causes them to stop all deluded notions and false descriptions and abide in the nondiscriminatory unobstructed action of the enlightened.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nyi ma dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dag ni 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba ste/ gcig pu spyod cing grogs med kyang gzhan gyis mi sdug cing gnas pa med la/ nam mkha'i dbyings las rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang 'ong bar mngon yang de dag ni bdag cag gang du 'dod/ gang nas 'gro snyam du sems pa med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nyi zla rnams kyang spyod yul mya ngan las 'das pa mnga' bdag ste/ rang bzhin nyid kyi chos dang ldan yang de dag chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rjes su spyod cing gshegs pa yang dag par ston par mdzad de/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad rgyun mi 'chad pas/ 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho yang gshegs pa dang / bzhud par rnam par rtog pa'am/ spros pa mi mnga' ste/ gcig tu spyod cing 'dra ba med pas thub pa med la/ mi gnas shing chags pa med pas spyod kyang de dag 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / yum gyi sku na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa mdzad pa dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / bdud 'dul ba dang / byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa yang snang zhing yod do/ /'on kyang de dag la bdag cag gis gang du skye bar bya/ gang du mya ngan las 'da' bar bya snyam du dgongs pa mi mnga'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar tshul tshad med pa dang / rnam pa tshad med par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Just as the sun and moon travel alone through the sky conferring benefit on sentient beings, with no notion of where they come from or where they are going, likewise the buddhas, by nature fundamentally silent and extinct, without discrimination, appear to course all universes, performing buddha-work to benefit sentient beings without cease, yet not producing false notions of coming from somewhere or going somewhere. Great enlightening beings should see and know the actions conducted by Buddha in terms of infinite such means, infinite natures and characteristics.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Universally Good, to recapitulate, uttered these verses:

de bzhin nyid ni nam yang ma skyes 'jig pa med/ / nam yang phyogs na mi gnas mi snang de bzhin nyid/ / de bzhin phan mdzad rnams kyi spyod yul tshad med de/ / dngos nyid de bzhin nyid mtshungs dus las rnam par 'das/ /
ji ltar chos dbyings dbyings de dbyings nyid ma yin la/ / tshad yod ma yin de ltar tshad med ma yin pa/ / de bzhin yon tan mnga' ba'i spyod yul tshad med de/ / sngon nas lus med pas na tshad yod ma yin no/ /
bar snang mkha' la khrag khrig lo 'grangs bya lding ba/ / mkha' yi dbyings la dang po de dang tha mar 'dra/ / rgyal ba'i spyod yul bskal pa brgya 'grangs bshad byas kyang / / ji snyed brjod pa de snyed yon tan ma brjod yod/ /
nam mkha' lding ni mkha' gnas klu la rnam par lta/ / chu chen yongs phye klu dang klu yi bu mo 'dren/ / stobs bcu rang gi mthu yis nyon mongs rnam phye zhing / / dge rtsa legs par byas pa 'dus byas khams nas 'byin/ /
nyi ma zla ba mkha' yi dbyings las shugs kyis rgyu/ / sems can bde ba skyed kyang rtog pa yod pa min/ / bcom ldan 'das kyang de bzhin chos kyi dbyings gshegs shing / / sems can mang po 'dul yang rnam par rtog mi mnga'/ /

Just as True Thusness is not born, does not perish, Has no location, and cannot be seen, Likewise the action of the Great Benefactor Transcends in the triple world and cannot be measured.
The reality realm is not the reality realm, yet not not the reality realm; It is not quantified and not unquantified. The action of the Great Worthy is also thus, Neither quantified nor unquantified, because there is no body.
If a bird flies for billions of years, The sky behind and ahead are equal, no different; When Buddha’s conduct is expounded for eons, The told and the untold cannot be measured.
The golden bird in the sky watches the sea, Parts the waters and snatches dragons; The Ten-Powered can pull out virtuous people, Remove them from the sea of existence, and rid them of delusion.
Like sun and moon traversing the sky Shining on all without distinction, The World-Honored traverses the cosmos Teaching beings without stirring a thought.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa khong du chud par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know the attainment of enlightenment of Buddha?

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ don thams cad rnam par dpyad pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos thams cad la nem nur med cing gnyis su med pa rjes su rtogs pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa khong du chud par bya'o/ /mtshan ma med pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / rgyu ba med pa rjes su rtogs pa dang; thogs pa med pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / mu med par khyab pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / mtha' dang mtha' med pa yongs su spangs pa'i dbus kyi gnas khong du chud pa dang / yi ge dang sgra dang brjod pa 'byung ba thams cad rjes su rtogs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / bag la nyal ba dang / rang bzhin mngon sum du rjes su rtogs pa dang; dus gsum thams cad sems kyi skad cig gcig gi ye shes kyis rjes su rtogs pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po la gling bzhi pa'i sems can thams cad kyi lus kyi gzugs brnyan rgya lta bur snang ste/ de'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / dbang po dang / bsam pa rnam pa tha dad pa rnams snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyis yongs su snang bar 'gyur te/ de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zhes bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa de ni/ yi ge thams cad kyis bstan pa ma yin no; ;dbyangs thams cad kyis brjod pa ma yin no/ /tha snyad thams cad kyis smos pa ma yin mod kyi/ 'on kyang gzhan gyi rnam par rig pa nye bar bzung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bstan par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mngon par byang chub pa'i tshe sems can thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa de snyed kyi tshad kyi sku kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ /chos thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / zhing thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / dus thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / tha snyad thams cad kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings dang chags pa med pa'i dbyings kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa'i dbyings dang / rnam par spyod pa'i dbyings kyi tshad ji snyed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi tshad ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sku kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du sku'i tshad ji snyed pa de snyed kyi tshad kyi gsung yang kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ /sku dang gsung gi tshad ji snyed pa de snyed du chags pa med pa'i thugs kun nas gnas par 'gyur te/ de de lta bur tshad med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'phrin las 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa brnyes pa/ rang gi sku de nyid las sems can thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i dmigs pa ston to/ /de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i dbyings su yang dag par gzhol ba'i bar du rab tu ston te/ de ni 'di ltar thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin dang / mi skye mi 'gag pa'i rang bzhin dang / bdag la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin dang / sems can la sems can med pa'i rang bzhin dang / sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin du thugs su chud de/ de lta bu'i rang bzhin mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas/ ma lus par thugs su chud pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rab tu brnyes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po rgyun mi 'chad pas sems can gyi don yongs su sgrub pa mdzad do// kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ nam mkha' ni skye ba med pas 'jig rten gyi khams 'du yang rung / 'jig kyang rung ste/ de bzhin du mi zad mi 'phel bar gnas so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub kyang 'di lta ste/ gcig pa'ang ma yin/ tha dad pa'ang ma yin pas/ mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang rung / mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang rung ste/ mtshan nyid de kho na bzhin du gnas so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi la la zhig skyes te/ des chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed kyi sems bskyed pa mngon par sprul la/ sems bskyed pa de dag re res kyang de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog med pa/ mtshan ma med pa/ dbyibs dang bral ba/ sku dang bral ba chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed cig sprul te/ de de mngon par sprul pa byed pa la yang / bskal pa chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed cig 'das par gyur na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ mi des sprul pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig sprul par 'gyur/

They should know that Buddha’s attainment of enlightenment has no view of any phenomena, is impartial toward things, has no doubts, no duality, no signs, no activity, no cessation, no measure, no boundaries; avoiding extremes, abiding in the middle way, it is beyond all verbal explanation. Buddha knows the thoughts and mental patterns of all sentient beings, their faculties, dispositions, inclinations, afflictions, obsessions, and habits; in sum, Buddha instantly knows all things in all times.
“It is as the ocean can reflect the physical forms of all sentient beings on earth, and therefore is called the ocean: the enlightenment of the buddhas is also like this, reflecting the thoughts, faculties, dispositions, and inclinations of all sentient beings, yet without reflecting anything—therefore it is called the enlightenment of the buddhas.
“The enlightenment of buddhas cannot be expressed in writing, cannot be reached by any verbal expression, cannot be explained in any language; but it is expediently elucidated according to need.
“When buddhas attain true awakening, they acquire a body equal in extent to all sentient beings, a body equal in extent to all phenomena, a body equal in extent to all lands, a body equal in extent to all times, a body equal in extent to all buddhas, a body equal in extent to all languages, a body equal in extent to True Thusness, a body equal in extent to the cosmos, a body equal in extent to space, a body equal in extent to the realm where there is no obstruction, a body equal in extent to all vows, a body equal in extent to all practices, and a body equal in extent to the ultimately calm realm of nirvana. As are the bodies they acquire, so is their speech and mind; they attain measureless, countless such pure spheres of body, speech, and mind.
“Upon attaining true awakening, buddhas see within their body all sentient beings attaining true awakening, and see all sentient beings enter nirvana, all of the same nature, which is no nature. No nature of what kind? That is, no nature of appearances, no nature of exhaustion, no nature of birth, no nature of destruction, no nature of self, no nature of nonself, no nature of living being, no nature of nonliving being, no nature of enlightenment, no nature of the cosmos, no nature of space, and also no nature of attaining true awakening. By knowing all things are natureless, a buddha attains omniscience, and by great compassion continues to save sentient beings.
“Just as space never increases or decreases whether all worlds become or disintegrate, because space has no birth, similarly the enlightenment of buddhas has no increase or decrease whether there is attainment of enlightenment or not, because enlightenment has no signs or countersigns, no unity and no variety.
“Suppose someone were able magically to produce as many minds as grains of sand in the Ganges River, and each mind also produced as many buddhas as grains of sand in the Ganges River, all featureless, formless, and signless, and continued to do so incessantly throughout as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River—how many buddhas do you think would be magically produced by that person’s magically produced minds?”

byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod kyis ji skad du smras pa'i don bdag gis shes te/ ji snyed du sprul pa byas pa de snyed cig ni ma sprul pa'ang yod do/ /

The enlightening being Wondrous Qualities of Natural Origination of Buddha said, “As I understand your meaning, magical production and nonproduction are equal and have no distinction—how can you ask how many there would be?”

byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ ji skad du smras pa de de bzhin gyis/ legs so/ /legs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyis sems can thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyang / de snyed cig ni mngon par sangs rgyas so/ /de snyed cig ni mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa'ang yod par 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni 'di ltar byang chub la mtshan nyid med pas gang la mtshan nyid med pa de'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'grib pa med do/ /de'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'phel ba med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis blo shin tu rnam par sangs rgyas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste/ de dag ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu/ mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku 'byams klas pa gcig las/ sku sems can ma lus pa thams cad dang mnyam pa kun nas gnas par 'gyur te/ mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku 'byams klas pa gcig las ji lta ba de bzhin du/ mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku ma lus pa thams cad kyi sgo nas kyang / sku sems can ma lus pa thams cad dang mnyam pa re re kun nas gnas par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar na mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sgo yang tshad med pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dbyibs kyang tshad med pa nyid du shes par bya ste/ de'i phyir na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings tshad med ces bya/ sems can gyi khams tshad du ma byas pa zhes bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud par bya ste/ skra'i rtse mo gcig la yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems can thams cad snyed du 'jug par bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku de dag ni/ mi mi 'jig pa'i tshul gyis yongs nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro/ /skra'i rtse mo gcig la ji ltar khong du chud par bya ba de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du'ang khong du chud par bya ste/ gnas gang na de bzhin gshegs pa mi bzhugs pa de lta bu ni gang yang med par mos par bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyis thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir te/ de bas na stobs dang mthu dang nyams kyi tshul ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi snying po byang chub dang; byang chub kyi shing dang / gdan seng ge'i khri dang / mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnam pa tha dad pa'ang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la 'jug pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ rang gi sems kyi tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud par bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang bral ba'i sems de lta bu gang yang med de/ rang gi sems las ji lta ba de bzhin du sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems mang po 'byams klas pa rnams las kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub khong du chud par bya ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par byang chub rgya che zhing yangs la kun tu khyab ste/ mi 'bral ba dang / rnam par 'chad pa med pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad par tshul gyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pas khong du chud par bya'o/ /

The enlightening being Universally Good said, “Very good—it is as you say. Even if all sentient beings were to instantly attain enlightenment, that would be equal to not attaining enlightenment, no different. Why? Because enlightenment is signless. If it has no signs, it has no increase or decrease.
“Great enlightening beings should thus know that attainment of true awakening, the same as enlightenment, is uniformly formless. A buddha, attaining true awakening, by the means of unity, enters the concentration of thoroughly aware knowledge and, having entered it, manifests, in one vast body attaining true awakening, as many bodies as there are sentient beings dwelling in that body. As this is so of one vast body attaining true awakening, so it is of all vast bodies attaining true awakening.
“Buddha has infinite such doors of attainment of true awakening; therefore you should know that the bodies Buddha manifests are infinite, and because they are infinite we say the body of Buddha is infinite realms, equal to the realms of living beings.
“Great enlightening beings should know that in one pore of Buddha’s body are buddha-bodies as numerous as all sentient beings. Why? Because the body of the Buddha’s attainment of true awakening ultimately has no birth or destruction. And as this is so of one pore, so is it of every point in the entire cosmos. Know that there is not a bit of space where there is no buddha-body. Why? Because Buddha’s attainment of true awakening reaches everywhere. According to capability and power, on the lion seat under the enlightenment tree at the site of enlightenment, with various bodies, Buddha attains true awakening.
“Great enlightening beings should know that in each moment of thought of their own minds there are always buddhas attaining true awakening. Why? Because the buddhas do not attain true awakening apart from this mind. As this is true of one’s own mind, so is it also true of the minds of all sentient beings—in all are buddhas attaining true awakening, all-pervasive, existing everywhere, without separation or annihilation, without cease, entering the inconceivable doors or means of enlightenment. Great enlightening beings should know Buddha’s attainment of enlightenment this way.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, the enlightening being Universally Good spoke these verses:

chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa gnyis dang gnyis med bral/ / chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa yang dag yul med yin/ / chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin mnyam/ / chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa bdag dang bdag med snyoms/ /
gling bzhi kun gyi gzugs mang ji snyed ji bzhin du/ / gzugs brnyan rgya mtshor rgya 'dra de phyir rgya mtsho ste/ / de bzhin phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad rgya bzhin du/ / bsam pa thugs su chud pas de phyir byang chub yin/ /
ji ltar nam mkha' 'jig rten yongs su 'grub 'gyur kyang / / rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur 'jig kyang 'grib pa med/ / rgyal ba 'jig rten 'das pa'i byang chub de bzhin te/ / byang chub byang ma chub tu mtshan nyid med par gcig /
mkhas pa'i sems kyis sprul pa mngon par sprul byas pa/ / mngon sprul mngon ma sprul kyang sngon dang rang bzhin mnyam/ / de bzhin 'gro ba thams cad byang chub sangs rgyas kyang / / sngon dang rang bzhin gcig ste 'phel zhing 'grib pa med/ /
rnam sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i rgyal ba'i ting 'dzin yod/ / byang chub snying por bzhugs nas ting 'dzin de bsgrubs te/ / sems can snyed kyi 'od zer mnyam par rab bkye zhing / / pad+ma ji bzhin rnam par sangs rgyas sems can 'dul/ /
bskal pa dus gsum sems can zhing gi rang bzhin dang / / chos dang de bzhin sems dang dbang po bsam pa dag /thams cad rang gi sku la mnyam pa nyid du gzigs/ / de bas byang chub gnas ni tshad med shes par gyis/ /

The truly awake know all things Are nondual, beyond duality, all equal, Inherently pure as space, Not distinguishing self and nonself.
As the ocean reflects beings’ bodies And is therefore called the ocean, Enlightenment reflects all mental patterns And hence is called true awareness.
Just as worlds have formation and decay While space does not increase or diminish, While all buddhas appear in the world, The one form of enlightenment is ever formless.
When someone emanates minds emanating buddhas, Emanation and nonemanation are no different in essence; Though all sentient beings attain enlightenment, There is no increase or decrease, enlightenment or no.
Buddha has a concentration called well aware; Entering this concentration under the enlightenment tree, Buddha emits light beams as many as beings, Awakening all kinds, like lotuses blooming.
As many thoughts, faculties, and desires As are in beings in lands of all times, That many bodies appear— Hence true awareness is called infinite.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ji lta bur khong du chud par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know Buddha’s turning of the wheel of teaching?

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pas/ chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba ni/ yong gis ldang ba med pa'i tshul gyis 'khor ba med cing / mngon par grub pa med par shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni mthar lta ba thams cad dang bral ba'i tshul gyis/ 'khor gsum yongs su gcod pa shin tu chad par shes par bya'o// nam mkha'i mtha' khong du chud pa'i tshul gyis/ 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'i mtha' med par shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni brjod du med pa'i tshul gyis; ;smos su med par shes pa bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni/ mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyis shin tu zhi bar shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni; de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gis thams cad du khyab pa'i phyir/ yi ge dang / sgra dang / dbyangs dang / skad sna tshogs su 'khor bar shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni/ chos kyi tshul gyi rang bzhin gyis/ sgra brnyan gyi sgra dang / dbyangs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni bdag po yong nas med pa'i phyir/ sgra thams cad sgra gcig tu khong du chud par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni/ phyi dang nang 'brel ba med pas yi ge zad mi shes par shes par bya'o/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ni chos nyid khong du chud pa'i tshul gyis/ yong gis ma skyes ma 'gags par shes par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ yi ge 'grangs pa thams cad ni bstan pa thams cad kyis shin tu bstan kyang mi 'phel mi 'grib ste/ sngon gyi mtha' bskal ba'i mur thug pa nas yi ge thams cad brjod kyang ma 'phel/ ma 'gribs pa yin no// kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang / yi ge rnam par dmigs par bstan pa thams cad kyis shin tu bstan kyang / mi 'phel mi 'grib ste/ sngon gyi mtha'i mur byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor kyang chos kyi 'khor lo ma zad pa yin te/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de ni dgos pa thams cad dang / spyod pa 'grangs pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dgos pa thams cad kyi nang du 'dus kyang gang la yang mi gnas par shes par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ yi ge'i 'bru 'grangs pa ni dgos pa thams cad dang / spyod pa 'grangs pa thams cad dang / bgrang pa 'grangs pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas thams cad du khyab par 'dug kyang ci la'ang mi gnas par shes par bya'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang sems can dang / chos dang / las dang / rnam par smin pa thams cad du khyab kyang / ci la yang mi gnas te/ sems can gang yang rung / sgra sna tshogs ji snyed du brjod pa de dag thams cad kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgra nyid du brjod do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ sgra thams cad ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i tshul las rnam par mi 'da'o/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /

They should know it thus: Buddha, by the free power of mind, turns the wheel of teaching without arising or turning, because of knowing that all things forever have no arising. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching by three kinds of turning, the cycles of the path of insight, the path of practice, and the path beyond learning, and stops what should be stopped, because of knowing that all things are apart from extremes of annihilation and eternity. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching apart from the realm of desire and the realm of negation, because of penetrating the spacelike limit of all things. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching without verbal explanation, because of knowing that all things are inexpressible. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching ultimately quiescently, because of knowing that all things are of the essence of nirvana. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching with all means of literature and language, because the voice of Buddha reaches everywhere. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching knowing that the voice is like an echo, because of comprehending the true nature of all things. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching producing all messages in one message, because there is ultimately no center. Buddha turns the wheel of teaching without omission or exhaustion, because of absence of clinging inside or outside.
“Just as all writing and speech cannot be exhaustively told of, the same is true of Buddha’s turning the wheel of teaching—all letters are arranged to express it, without cease, without ever exhausting it. The wheel of teaching of Buddha enters into all speech and writing, yet has no dwelling place. Just as writing enters into all business, all words, all calculations, all mundane and transmundane subjects, yet dwells nowhere, so also does the voice of Buddha enter into all points, all beings, all phenomena and principles, all works, and all consequences, yet does not dwell anywhere. All the various languages of all sentient beings are not apart from the wheel of teaching of Buddha, because the real aspect of speech and sound is identical to the wheel of teaching. Great enlightening beings should know the turning of the wheel of teaching of Buddha thus.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khong du chud par 'dod pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par bsgrub pa la 'jug pa khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par bsgrub pa de yang gang zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i tshe/ sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / brtson 'grus rnam pa tha dad pa ji snyed pa de snyed du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las dbyangs kyi yan lag 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la ting nge 'dzin mi bsnyengs pa/ chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba mnga' ste/ de la snyoms par zhugs shing / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad de/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu sems can thams cad ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgra mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sku re re'i zhal nas 'byung ngo/ /sgra'i dbyangs de dag re re zhing yang dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra rnam pa tha dad pa sems can snyed dang ldan par 'byung ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad pa ste/ 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin de nyid la snyoms par zhugs pa'o/ /sems can thams cad mnyam par dga' bar 'gyur ba ste/ gang gis de lta bur de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khong du chud pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang mthun par spyod pa yin/ gang gis de lta bur khong du ma chud pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las log pa'i chos la spyod pa dag go / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshad med pa khong du chud par bya ba'i tshul gyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mngon par sgrub pa mdzad pa khong du chud par bya'o/ /

“Also, if great enlightening beings want to know the wheel of teaching that Buddha turns, they should know where Buddha’s wheel of teaching comes from. What is the provenance of the Buddha’s wheel of teaching? Buddha makes so many utterances, turning the wheel of teaching according to the innumerable differences in mental patterns and inclinations of all sentient beings. Buddhas, truly awake, have a concentration called ultimately unimpeded and fearless; having entered this concentration, with each mouth of each body of attainment of true enlightenment they produce as many utterances as there are sentient beings, each utterance containing all sounds, each different, turning the wheel of teaching, to make all sentient beings happy. Those who know the turning of the wheel of teaching thus are considered to be following all Buddha teachings. Those who do not know this are not following them. Great enlightening beings should know Buddha’s turning the wheel of teaching thus, because it universally enters the infinite realms of living beings.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, Universally Good said in verse,

mtshungs med chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mi dmigs te/ / phyir yang log med dus rnams kun las rnam par grol/ / yi ge thams cad smra bar bya bas zad mi 'gyur/ / de bzhin stobs bcu'i chos kyi 'khor lo mtha' yang yas/ /
yi ge'i 'bru rnams thams cad dgos pa kun tu khyab/ / gang na'ang mi gnas de bzhin sangs rgyas 'khor lo ste/ / sgra rnams kun la zhugs kyang rang bzhin zhugs pa med/ / ma lus sems can spyod pas sems can dga' bar mdzad/ /
grangs las yongs su 'das pa'i chos rnams brjod pa'i phyir/ / ma lus mthar thug ting 'dzin ston pa snyoms par 'jug / de mthus skad cig de la sems can ji snyed pa/ / de snyed rgyal ba'i gsung dbyangs yid du 'ong ba 'byung / /
sgra gcig dbyangs las sems can ma lus ji snyed pa'i/ / sgra dbyangs rnam pa tha dad dus gcig 'byung bar 'gyur/ / 'jig rten dbang phyug kun la rnam par rtog mi mnga'/ / gang rnams ji ltar mos pa de bzhin gsung yang nyan; ;
yi ge rnams ni nang na yod min phyi nang 'byung ba min/ / de dag zad par mi 'gyur bsags pa'ang gang yang med/ / 'on kyang 'khor lo bskor na 'gro ba'i don du 'gyur/ / stobs bcu mnga' ba rnams kyi cho 'phrul ji 'dra ltos/ /

Buddhas’ wheel of teaching has no turning; It has no arising and no attainment at any time. Just as writing is never exhausted, So is the teaching-wheel of the Ten-Powered.
Just as writing enters everywhere, yet with no arrival, Such is the teaching-wheel of the Enlightened, Entering all speech without entering aught, Able to make all beings rejoice.
Buddhas have a concentration called ultimate; They preach after entering this concentration, Speaking to enlighten all beings, Boundless though they be.
In each utterance they also utter Countless sayings, each different, Free in the world, without discrimination, Causing all to hear according to inclination.
Words do not come from inside or outside, Are neither lost nor accumulate; Yet for sentient beings buddhas turn the teaching-wheel— This freedom is most extraordinary.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know Buddha’s ultimate nirvana?
