byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so; ; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po khong du chud par 'dod pas/ rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid la blo yongs su btang ste/ des de bzhin nyid kyi yongs su ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba de bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa khong du chud par bya'o/ /yang dag pa'i mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / rang bzhin yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / rmi lam gyi mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / chags pa med pa'i mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / bdag gi rang bzhin gyi mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtha'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ji lta ba bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba khong du chud par bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni de dag thog ma nas ma skyes ma byung ba'i phyir te/ chos gang ma skyes ma byung ba de la 'bral bar 'gyur ba gang yang med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba shin tu mthar thug pa mi brjod mi ston te/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad da ltar byung ba de bzhin du/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa rnams kyang skad cig gcig la mngon du bya zhing / skad cig kyang ye shes kyi skad cig gis rjes su 'brang bar bya; skad cig de la yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du blta bar bya/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par bsgrub pa thams cad kyang des mngon par bsgrub par bya ste/ des ni gnyis kyi 'du shes kyang bskyed par mi bya/ mi gnyis pa'i 'du shes kyang ma yin/ sems can gyi 'du shes kyang ma yin/ bdag gi 'du shes kyang ma yin pa'i phyir/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpas ni mngon par zhen pa'i lam thams cad dang bral zhing / 'du shes thams cad yongs su spang bar bya dgos pa'i phyir ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can pha rol yongs su tshim par 'gyur ba'i tshig go /de bzhin gshegs pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba 'di ni/ sems can pha rol gyi skyo ba skyed pa'i tshig ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni skye ba med de/ yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings la bzhugs pa'i phyir te/ sems can pha rol gyi sems dang / bsam pa yongs su bsgom par bya ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings kyi tshad dang mnyam pa zhig shar la/ de shar nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi chu yongs su dang ba'i snod thams cad du gzugs brnyan phyin par snang zhing mngon la/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la 'phos pa med cing / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor kun tu phyin par snang bar gyur kyang de'i nang nas chu'i snod gcig cig chag gam/ de nas logs shig tu phyung ba'am/ stong par bzhag par gyur na/ nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan yang snang bar mi 'gyur na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ram gcig gis nyes te/ snod der nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan mi snang bar ma gyur grang ngo/ /

If great enlightening beings want to know the greate nirvana of buddhas, they should know its fundamental essence. As is the nirvana of ultimate reality, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of space, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of the nature of things, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of detachment from desire, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of formlessness, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of selfhood, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of the ultimate essence of all things, so is the nirvana of Buddha; as is the nirvana of ultimate True Thusness, so is the nirvana of Buddha. Why? Because nirvana has no birth and no emergence; if something has no birth and no emergence, then it has no extinction.
“Buddha does not tell enlightening beings about the ultimate nirvana of buddhas and does not show it to them. Why? Because Buddha wants to cause them to see all buddhas always present before them, to see in one moment all the buddhas of past and future, in their full splendor, just as if they were actually present, yet without entertaining any notions of duality or nonduality. Why? Because great enlightening beings permanently abandon all conceptual clinging.
“Buddhas appear in the world in order to provoke inspiration in sentient beings and manifest nirvana in order to provoke longing in sentient beings: in reality the buddhas have no appearance in the world and no nirvana either. Why? Buddha always abides in the pure realm of reality, manifesting nirvana according to the minds of sentient beings.
“For example, when the sun comes out and illumines the world, its image is reflected in all clean vessels of water, being in all places without coming or going. If one vessel breaks, then the reflection of the sun does not appear in it. Do you think it is the fault of the sun that its reflection does not appear there?”

byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta ma yin te/ snod dang mi ldan pa'i phyir/ nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan mi snang gi /nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis nyes pa ni ma yin no/ /
“No—it is just because the vessel is broken; it’s no fault of the sun.”

byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras; de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char bar 'gyur ba'i tshe'ang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings kun tu snga phyi med par 'char te/ de ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa kun gyi sems can sems rnyog pa med pa dang ldan pa'i chu bo snod thams cad la gzugs brnyan snang bar 'gyur ro/ /sems kyi rgyud rnyog pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor snang yang sems can sems rnyog pa dang ldan zhing snod chag par gyur pa rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor mthong bar mi 'gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa la 'pho ba mi mnga' yang / thams cad du skye bar snang ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa la la zhig gi sems can snod chag pa lta bur gyur pa/ sems rnyog pa dang ldan zhing / las dang nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa zhig yod par gyur na yang der ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar snang na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de bzhin gshegs pas nyes te/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba'am/ gcig tu ma gyur grang ngo/ /smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta bu ma yin te/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can gyi rgyud dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mi ldan pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'i/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nyes pa'i phyir zhes ni mi brjod do/ /smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba yang de lta bur shes par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston te/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni 'byung ba yang med/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang med do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me ni 'jig rten thams cad na yang me'i dgos pa bsgrub bo/ /de la grong ngam/ grong khyer ram/ grong rdal lam/ yul lam/ pho brang 'khor tam/ rgyal po'i gnas shig tu me shi bar gyur na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ des 'jig rten thams cad du me thams cad lhag ma med pa'am/ gcig tu shi ste zhi bar ma gyur grang ngo/ /

“The knowledge of realization of Thusness, buddha-knowledge, is also like this, appearing throughout the cosmos, without before or after: Buddha appears in the clean mind-vessels of all sentient beings. If the mind-vessel is always clean, the embodiment of Buddha is always seen; if the mind is polluted, the vessel breaks and the Buddha cannot be seen.
“If there are any sentient beings who can be liberated by nirvana, Buddha then manifests nirvana for them; but really Buddha has no birth, no death, no crossing over into extinction.
“It is like, for example, the element fire, which can make fires in all worlds. Sometimes in one place the fire will go out, but do you think the fire in all worlds is extinguished?”
byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta ma yin no/ /
“No.”

smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las mdzad pa las dus gzhan zhig na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las yongs su rdzogs par grub nas/ zhing gi grangs su bya ba la la zhig nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bstan par gyur na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la ji snyam du sems/ 'jig rten thams cad nas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'am gcig yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ma gyur grang ngo/ /smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta ma yin no/ /smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'o na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang de lta bur khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i mkhan po mkhas pa lobs pa shin tu byang ba zhig gis/ sngags dang rig sngags kyi stobs dang shugs la brten te/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du/ sgyu ma'i rnam pa mang po bstan te/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / pho brang 'khor dang / rgyal po'i gnas thams cad du rang gi lus bstan te/ sgyu ma de dag kyang bskal par gnas par byin gyis brlabs pa las grong ngam/ grong khyer ram/ ljongs sam; yul lam/ pho brang 'khor tam/ rgyal po'i gnas gcig cig tu dgos pa rdzogs par zin nas/ sgyu ma'i mkhan po des rang gi lus mi snang bar byas na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras; de ji snyam du sems/ 'jig rten thams cad nas kyang / sgyu ma'i rnam pa mang po yongs su nub pa'am/ gcig tu ma gyur grang ngo/ /

“Similarly Buddha performs the tasks of buddhahood in all worlds; if what can be done in one world is finished, a buddha manifests entry into nirvana, but the buddhas in all worlds do not all pass away into extinction. Great enlightening beings should know the great nirvana of the truly enlightened thus.
“Again, suppose, for example, a magician well versed in magical arts, by the power of the techniques of illusion, manifests phantom bodies in all cities, towns, and villages in all lands in a billion-world universe, and sustains them there by magical power for an eon, while in other places, the magic performance being finished, the bodies disappear. Do you think that when that great magician disappears in one place, he disappears in all places?”
byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta ma yin no/ /
“No.”

smras pa/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ye shes kyi sgyu ma tshad med pa la shin tu byang ba/ thabs dang / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi rig sngags kyis shin tu byung ba yang chos kyi dbyings thams cad du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa gnas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug par mi 'jigs pa bstan la/ sems can gyi mos pa bzhin du 'phrin las rdzogs par zin nas/ zhing 'byams klas pa la la zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ston kyang / zhing gcig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin te/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos; de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni/ de lta bur khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin mi g.yo ba zhes bya ba yod de/ ting nge 'dzin de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa'i tshe snyoms par 'jug go /ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'byams klas pa re re las kyang 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa 'byung bar 'gyur te/ 'od zer de dag re re'i sgo nas kyang pad+mo grangs med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /pad+mo de dag re re las kyang ze ba brjod du med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /ze ba de dag thams cad la yang seng ge'i khri mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /seng ge'i khri mang po de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mang po bzhugs pa yongs su snang ngo/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la sems can thams cad kyi grangs ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi rgyan thams cad kyis shin tu brgyan pa kun nas bzhugs te/ de dag ni sngon gyi dam bcas pa chen po mthar dbyung ba'i phyir ro/ /de la sems can dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag mthong nas rnam par 'dul bar 'gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag kyang / 'di lta ste / sems can thams cad gang dang gang du yongs su smin par gyur pa'i tshul bzhin du gdul ba'i dus las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir/ phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par byin gyis brlabs pa dag ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag ni yul na gnas pa yang ma yin/ phyogs na gnas pa yang ma yin no/ /yod pa yang ma yin/ med pa yang ma yin no/ /'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam chen po'i byin gyi rlabs dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su smin pa rgyur byas na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag kyang brjod par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba/ chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa/ chos kyi dbyings ltar mtha' dang dbus med pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin can/ de bzhin nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag pa yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa/ dus bzhin du rab tu ston pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa; sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa/ 'gro ba'i zhing thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa thams cad las mi 'da' ba khong du chud par bya'o; ;

“In a similar way Buddha, the Truly Enlightened, knowing the various magical arts of infinite wisdom and means, manifests in all universes, sustaining that permanently, throughout the future. If in one place, according to the minds of beings, what is to be done is finished, Buddha manifests nirvana; but can you say because Buddha has appeared to enter nirvana in one place that Buddha becomes extinct everywhere? Great enlightening beings should know the great ultimate nirvana of Buddha in this way.
“Furthermore, Buddha, when manifesting nirvana, enters immovable concentration, and having entered this concentration, emanates from each body infinite trillions of great light beams, each light beam producing countless lotus blossoms, each lotus blossom having untold petals of exquisite jewels, with a lion throne on each petal and a buddha sitting cross-legged on each throne. The number of those buddhas is exactly equal to the number of sentient beings; all are fully adorned with the most sublime virtues, produced by the power of past vows. If there are any sentient beings with mature roots of goodness who see the buddha-incarnations, they will all receive the teaching; those buddha-bodies remain forever, teaching and liberating sentient beings according to the situation, without losing an opportunity. The bodies of buddhas have no locus, are not real or unreal; only by the power of the past vows of the buddhas, and the capacity of sentient beings to be liberated, do they appear. Great enlightening beings should know the great nirvana of Buddha in this way. Buddha abides in the infinite, unobstructed, ultimate realm of reality, in the realm of space, in the essence of True Thusness, without birth or death, and in ultimate truth, appearing to sentient beings according to the time, sustained by past vows, without ever ceasing, not abandoning all beings, all lands, all phenomena.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos don 'di nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, to recapitulate, Universally Good said in verse,

nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chos dbyings tshad dang mnyam pa ni/ / snod du gzugs brnyan snang ste chag la snang ba min/ / de ltar mi mchog dbang po 'jig rten kun tu snang / / sems can dad med rnams kyis mya ngan 'das par shes/ /
me ni 'jig rten kun na dgos pa'i don sgrub ste/ / shing dang mi ldan de dang de nas zhi bar 'gyur/ / de bzhin rgyal ba'i me 'bar gzi brjid che mnga' ba/ / 'dul ba med pas yongs su mya ngan 'da' ba ston/ /
sgyu ma'i mkhan po stong gsum khams su lus ston pa/ / dgos pa'i mthar phyin bdag gi lus kyang mi snang byed/ / zhing rnams gang du sangs rgyas 'phrin las rdzogs gyur pa/ / der ni rgyal ba mi snang 'on kyang gud na snang / /
rgyal ba'i ting 'dzin mi g.yo thob ces bya ba yod/ / rgyal ba'i 'phrin las rdzogs nas de la snyoms par 'jug / 'byams klas sku rnams gcig las tshad med mtha' yas pa'i/ / 'od zer pad+mo sangs rgyas skad cig gcig gis 'byung / /
rgyal ba de dag chos dbyings kun tu rgyas 'gengs pa/ / sems can bsod nams byas pas sangs rgyas de mthong ste/ / rgyal ba'i sku mdog de dag chos kyi dbyings mnyam par/ / sku tshe byin gyis brlabs pas yan lag kun dang ldan/ /
ji ltar sangs rgyas ma skyes skyes par brjod gyur pa/ / de bzhin zhig pa med kyang mya ngan 'das zhes brjod/ / dpe dang dbyangs dang tshig gi lam rnams kun gyis dben/ / don grub sangs rgyas lha yi dam pa mtshungs pa med/ /

While the sun sheds light illumining the world, When a vessel breaks and water leaks out, the reflection disappears; So it is with the sun of supreme knowledge; Those without faith see it as extinct.
Fire makes fires in the world, While in one city it goes out sometime: Likewise the Buddha pervades the cosmos And appears to pass away where the work of teaching is done.
A magician makes bodies appear in all lands, Which disappear when their function is done: So does Buddha disappear when the teaching is done, While always seen in other lands.
Buddha has a concentration, called unmoving, Which is entered after teaching beings: Instantly Buddha’s body emanates infinite lights, The lights produce lotuses, on which are buddhas:
The buddha-bodies are countless as phenomena, Visible to those with virtue; Each of these countless bodies Has a full span of life and array of adornments.
Like birthlessness is the emergence of Buddha, Like deathlessness the nirvana of Buddha: All words and similes end— All purposes are achieved, beyond compare.

de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal gyis/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po la 'di skad ces smras so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / de dag dang 'grogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji lta bur khong du chud par bya/ de skad ces smras pa dang /
“How should great enlightening beings know the roots of goodness planted by seeing, hearing, and attending Buddha?

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ /kye rgyal pa'i sras/ de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mthong ba dang thos pa dang / de dag dang 'grogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar 'gyur ba ni /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ mi zad pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i blos don yod pa dang / bgegs med pa dang / shin tu mthar thug par 'grub pa dang / mi slu ba dang; bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad la spyod pa'i rgyud mi zad pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi ye shes 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mu mtha' yas pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / rang 'byung gi sa rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa 'thob par 'gyur bar khong du chud par bya'o/ /

They should know these roots of goodness are not fruitless, because they produce endless awareness, because they remove all obstacles, because they certainly reach the ultimate end, because they are free from falsehood, because all vows are fulfilled, because they do not end creative action while according with knowledge of the uncreate, because they generate the knowledge of buddhas, because they go on throughout the future, because they accomplish all kinds of excellent practices, and because they reach the stage of effortless knowledge.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi la la zhig gis rdo rje'i khams shig zos par gyur na/ de ni ci tsam du chung ngu zin kyang / rdo rje'i khams de zhu bar mi nus te/ de ni gdon mi za bar gnas thams cad las 'das nas/ 'og gi phyogs su 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni rdo rje'i chos ma 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni ji tsam du chung ngu zin kyang / 'dus byas la spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas thams cad las mngon par 'das te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'dus ma byas pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos ma 'dres pa yin pa'i phyir ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ dang lo ma'i phung po ni ri rab tsam zhig yod du zin kyang / der me mdag yungs kar gyi 'bru tsam gcig bcug na/ dang lo ma'i phung po de ni gdon mi za bar tshig par 'gyur ro/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni me'i mtshan nyid sreg pa la sta gon du gnas pa'i phyir ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me mdag kyang ji tsam du chung ngu zin kyang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dang / lo ma'i phung po ma lus par bsregs nas/ sangs rgyas kyi mthar phyin gyi bar du 'grub par byed do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ shin tu thug pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro; ;

“For example, if a man eats a little bit of diamond, it will never be digested, but must pass through the body. Why? Because diamond is incompatible with the impurities of the physical body. In the same way, planting a little bit of roots of goodness with Buddha must pass through the body of afflictions of all conditioning and reach the abode of unconditioned ultimate knowledge. Why? Because this little bit of root of goodness is incompatible with the afflictions of conditioning.
“Even if one piled up dry straw as high as a mountain, if one tossed an ember of fire the size of a seed into it, it would all burn up for sure. Why? Because fire burns straw. Like this, planting a little bit of roots of goodness with Buddha surely can burn up all afflictions and ultimately enable one to attain nirvana without remainder, because the essence of this little bit of root of goodness is ultimate.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ dper na/ ri'i rgyal po kha ba can la sman gyi rgyal po chen po blta na legs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ sman gyi rgyal po de sems can gang gis mthong bar gyur pa de dag gi mig rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /sman gyi rgyal po de la rlung gis btab pa'i sgra gang gis thos pa de dag gi rna ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /gang gis dri tshor ba de dag gi sna rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /gang gis myangs pa de dag gi lce rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /gang gis reg pa de dag gi lus rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /gang gis de 'khor gyi su phyogs su phyin pa de dag gi nad kyang yongs su zhi bar 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sman gyi rgyal po chen po bla na med pa yang / sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad du nye bar 'tsho ba yin te/ sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku mthong bar gyur pa de dag la mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni lha'i mig yongs su dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan thos pa de dag la/ rna ba yongs su dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri tshor ba de dag la/ lha'i sna yongs su dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi ro myong ba de dag la/ tshig gi tshul thams cad shes pa'i lce'i dbang po yangs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang la de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis phog par gyur pa de dag la/ chos kyi sku shin tu che ba yongs su dag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa de dag la/ de bzhin gshegs pa dran pa rtse gcig yongs su dag pas/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang gis; de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs bzhugs pa'i sa phyogs sam/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byas na/ de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad zhi zhing / 'phags pa'i bde ba 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ khyod kyis yid ches pa dang / khong du chud par bya na; sems can la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngam/ thos kyang las kyi sgrib pas kun nas 'khor ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa la ma dad pa zhig byas na'ang de dag gi mthong ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du don yod do/ /zhes bdag smra'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / de dag dang 'grogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spang ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad mngon du bya zhing / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyur khong du chud par bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gzhan yang dpe rnam par dgod pa thams cad kyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad du shes par mi rung ste/ cis kyang dper bya ba ma yin no/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems kyi las thams cad las shin tu 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su chim [*tshim?] par bya ba'i phyir; bde bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dpes ston pa mngon par gnang bar mdzad kyi/ de lhur blang ba'i phyir ni ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos kyi rnam grangs rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i gnas zhes bya'o/ /'jig rten thams cad kyis shes par dka' ba zhes bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa zhes bya'o/ /ye shes kyi mthu chen po brjod pa zhes bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ston pa zhes bya'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o/ /shin tu nges par de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya'o/ /sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rnam par sbyong ba zhes bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstan pa'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o/ /shin tu mthar thug pa'i mur phyin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos kyi rnam grangs rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni/ theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i theg pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs par gzhan gyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa ston pa mi mdzad do/ /chos kyi rnam grangs rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma gtogs par sems can gzhan gyi lag tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“For example, in the Snowy mountains there is a tree of the finest medicine called good sight: if any see it, their eyes are purified; if any hear of it, their ears are purified; if any smell it, their noses are purified; if any taste it, their tongues are purified; if any touch it, their bodies are purified; if any take the earth it grows in, that can also perform the beneficial function of removing disease. The supreme medicine of Buddha similarly can perform all benefits for sentient beings. If any see the physical body of Buddha, their eyes are purified; if any hear the name of Buddha, their ears are purified; if any smell the fragrance of the morality of Buddha, their noses are purified; if any taste the flavor of the teaching of Buddha, their tongues are purified, they gain the universal tongue and understand the principles of language; if any come in contact with the light of Buddha, their bodies are purified and they ultimately attain the supreme body of reality; if any think of Buddha, they attain purity of Buddha-remembrance concentration. If any sentient beings honor the ground Buddha has crossed, or a tomb or shrine, they too will be endowed with roots of goodness, annihilate all afflictions, and attain the felicity of sages. I tell you, even if there are sentient beings who see and hear Buddha, but because of being veiled by obstructions due to their deeds do not become believers, if they still plant roots of goodness, none will be in vain—they will reach the ultimate end and enter nirvana. Great enlightening beings should thus know that the roots of goodness planted by seeing, hearing, and attending Buddha are free from all evil and imbued with good.
“Buddha uses all kinds of similes to explain all kinds of things, but there is no simile that can explain this principle. Why? Because the road of intellectual knowledge ends, because it is inconceivable. The buddhas and enlightening beings just tell sentient beings similes according to their mentalities in order to gladden them, but this is not the ultimate. This gate of the teaching is called the secret point of the buddhas; it is called that which cannot be known by any worldlings; it is called entry into the seal of Buddha; it is called opening the door of great knowledge; it is called revealing the essence of Buddha; it is called perfecting all enlightening beings; it is called that which all worldlings cannot destroy; it is called wholly conforming to the realm of buddhas; it is called able to purify all realms of sentient beings; it is called expounding the ultimate inconceivable teaching of the real nature of Buddha. Buddha does not expound this teaching to anyone but enlightening beings intent on the Great Vehicle, only expounding it to enlightening beings riding the inconceivable vehicle of enlightenment. This gate of teaching does not come into the hands of anyone but great enlightening beings.

kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che gang gis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por brjod pa'i rin po che gang yang rung ste/ rin po che de dag ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po de'i bu thu bo gzhon nu btsun mo dam pa las byung ba/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa ma gtogs par sems can gzhan gyi lag tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bu 'khor los bsgyur ba'i mtshan dang ldan pa de lta bu med na ni/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po dus byas nas zhag bdun lon pa dang / nor bu rin po che de dag ma lus par nub par 'gyur te/ mi 'khod do/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin du mdo sde rin po che rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sras kyi thu bo/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams ma gtogs par sems can gzhan gyi lag tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ skyes bu dam pa de lta bu dag med du zin na ni/ ring po mi thogs par mdo sde rnam pa 'di lta bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba chen po chos kyi rnam grangs/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul rgyun mi 'chad par byed pa rnams kyang / thams cad kyi thams cad du nub par 'gyur te mi 'khod do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na; nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la ni chos kyi rnam grangs rnam pa 'di lta bu dag mnyan pa'i mthu yang med na gzung ba'am bcang ba'am/ bklag pa'am/ bstan pa'am/ bri ba lta ci smos te/ de ni gnas ma yin no/ /gzhan du na chos kyi rnam grangs rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ni skyes bu dam pa de dag nyid kyi lag tu phyin pa'am/ glegs bam du byas pa'am/ yid la yod par 'gyur ro/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu dag thos nas/ bsam pa thag pas rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / rje sar byas te/ spyi bo la blang bar bya'o/ /rab tu dga' bar bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ gnas 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dkon pa ma yin no/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos/ bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos yang dag par bsgrub pa la mngon par brtson par byas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid bsam gyis mi khyab 'di ma thos sam/ thos nas kyang yid mi ches shing dad pa med de/ mi 'jug/ khong du chud par mi byed na/ byang chub sems dpa' de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la yang dag par byung ba ma yin no/ /de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung bar bshad par mi 'gyur ro/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes che ba nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ tshad med pa/ chags pa med pa/ bsgrib pa med pa 'di thos nas yid ches shing dad de/ 'jug pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi rjes su song ba yin/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid du shin tu grub pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la rab tu gnas pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang shin tu bral ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul la shin tu byung ba yin/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos nyid rtogs par khong du chud pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang rnam par rol pa la the tshom med pa yin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang rang 'byung gi chos nyid la gnas pas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa yul chags pa med pa la 'jug pa yin no/ /
kye rgyal ba'i sras/ byang chub sems dpas chos 'di dag thos nas blo thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / sems kyi bsam pa'i stobs dang shugs tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas 'jug pa rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa yongs su spangs pa dang / yid la byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du gyur pa dang; dran pa'i dbang nam mkha'i dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par bsgoms pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i blo gros kyi las chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par rnam par dpyad pa dang / rang byung gi ye shes 'byams klas pa yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas mngon par shes par bya ba dang / sems bskyed pa 'jig rten thams cad kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang bsam pa la 'jug pa 'byams klas pa/ phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i ye shes 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pas chos 'di rnams la 'jug pa med par khong du chud pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya ste/ des ni chos gang la yang gcig tu dmigs pas yid la bya bar mi bya'i; kye rgyal ba'i sras/ chos gcig la chos thams cad tshad med pa'i tshul du yid la bya'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni las gron chung ngur rang byung gi ye shes dang / mnga' bsgyur ba 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /

“It is like, for example, the seven treasures of a universal ruler, by which universal rulership is shown; these treasures do not come into the hands of anyone but the crown prince born of the first wife who has developed the characteristics of a sage ruler. If the universal ruler does not have a son with many virtues, after the ruler’s life ends the treasures will disperse and perish in seven days. The treasure of this scripture is also like this: it does not come into the hands of anyone but the true offspring of the sovereign Buddha, born in the house of Buddha, who plant the roots of goodness characteristic of buddhas. If there are no true offspring of Buddha, this teaching will perish before long. Why? Because those in the two lesser vehicles of individual salvation do not hear this scripture, much less absorb and hold it, read, recite, or copy it, or analyze and explain it—only the great enlightening beings can do these things.
“Therefore, great enlightening beings, hearing this teaching, shall rejoice and receive it with respect. Why? Because great enlightening beings appreciating this scripture will quickly attain unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment. Even if enlightening beings spend countless eons practicing the six ways of transcendence and cultivating the various elements of enlightenment, as long as they have not heard this teaching of the inconceivable great power of Buddha, or if they have heard it and do not believe or understand it, do not follow it, enter it, or attain it, they cannot be called true enlightening beings, because they cannot be born in the house of Buddha. If they get to hear this teaching of the immeasurable, inconceivable, unobstructed, unhindered knowledge of Buddha, and having heard it, take it to heart, follow it, and awaken to it, these people will be born in the house of Buddha, accord with the sphere of all buddhas, be endowed with all qualities of enlightening beings, detach from all mundane things, develop the conduct of all buddhas, realize the true nature of all enlightening beings, have no doubts about the power of Buddha, abide in the teacherless truth, and plunge deeply into the unimpeded realm of buddhahood.
“After great enlightening beings have heard this teaching, then they can know infinite things by knowledge of equality; then they can part with arbitrary discriminations by means of a straightforward, honest mind; then they can see the buddhas before them by means of supreme devotion; then they can enter the impartial realm of space by means of the power of attention; then they can travel the boundless cosmos by means of free thought; then they can acquire all virtues by means of the power of knowledge and wisdom; then they can shed all worldly defilements by means of spontaneous knowledge; then they can enter the network of all ten directions by means of the will for enlightenment; then they can know the buddhas of all times are of one and the same essence, by means of great observation; then they can enter this teaching by the knowledge of dedication of roots of goodness, entering without entering, not clinging to a single thing, always observing things through one universal principle. Great enlightening beings, perfecting these accomplishments, attain teacherless, spontaneous knowledge with a minimum of effort.”
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos don de nyid yang brtag par bya ba'i phyir/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Universally Good, to recapitulate, spoke these verses:

rgyal ba de dag thos mthong mchod pa byas pas kyang / / tshad med pa yi bsod nams phung po 'phel bar 'gyur/ / nyon mongs 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad spangs gyur tu/ /'dus byas 'di nang bar ma dor ni zad mi 'gyur/ /
skyes bu la las rdo rje zos gyur de la ni/ / zhu bar mi 'gyur gdon mi za bar phyir byung 'gyur/ / de bzhin stobs bcu rnams la mchod byas bsod nams kyi/ / ye shes rdo rjes nyon mongs ma lus bcom par 'gyur/ /
skam spungs pa ri bo'i mchog tsam yod gyur kyang / / me mdag yungs 'bru tsam kyis de ni tshig 'gyur te/ / de bzhin bde gshegs mchod pa cung zad ci byas kyang / / nyon mongs thams cad 'tshig byed mya ngan 'das rgyur 'gyur/ /
ri bo kha ba can la mthong legs sman yod de/ / mthong zhing reg pas nad rnams thams cad zhi bar byed/ / de bzhin stobs bcu rnams ni mthong ngam thos kyang rung / / yon tan kun ldan sangs rgyas ye shes 'thob par 'gyur/ /

Immeasurable are the virtues attained By seeing, hearing, and honoring buddhas; Ultimately endless in action, Needed to destroy afflictions and remove misery.
As when a man ingests a little diamond It is not digested but must pass through, The virtues of honoring buddhas Destroy illusion and lead to adamantine knowledge.
Just as straw piled high as a mountain A tiny ember of fire will burn up, The small virtue of honoring buddhas Will end affliction and lead to nirvana.
In the Snowy mountains is an herb called good to see Which relieves all sickness when seen, heard of, smelled, or touched; If any see or hear of buddhas, They will gain excellent virtues and reach buddha-knowledge.

de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus/ phyogs bcur 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug dang / ltas chen po bco brgyad du g.yos so/ /rab tu g.yos so/ /kun tu g.yos so/ /'gul to; ;rab tu 'gul to/ /kun tu 'gul to/ /ldeg go /rab tu ldeg go /kun tu ldeg go /chem chem/ rab tu chem chem/ kun tu chem chem mo/ /'ur 'ur/ rab tu 'ur 'ur/ kun tu 'ur 'ur ro/ /shig shig /rab tu shig shig /kun tu shig shig go / 'di lta ste/ shar phyogs dma' bar gyur na/ nub phyogs mtho bar gyur to/ /nub phyogs dma' bar 'gyur na/ shar phyogs mtho bar gyur to/ /lho phyogs dma' bar gyur na/ byang phyogs mtho bar gyur to/ /byang phyogs dma' bar gyur na/ lho phyogs mtho bar gyur to/ /dbus dma' bar gyur na mtha' mtho bar gyur to/ /mtha' dma' bar gyur na dbus mtho bar gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus lha rdzas las 'das pa'i me tog gi sprin dang / na bza'i sprin dang / gdugs kyi sprin dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin dang / ba dan gyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i spos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i phreng ba dang / byug pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub kyi sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i nor bu rin po che 'od chen po ldan pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i legs so zhes brjod pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /lha rdzas las 'das pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus brjod du med pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /'jig rten gyi khams bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su dag par mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par bab bo/ /gling bzhi ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub thugs su chud pa'i chos kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis / byang chub sems dpa' dga' bar gyur pa de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du'ang / phyogs bcu rgyas pa thams cad rab tu dga' bar gyur to/ /phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa brgyad cu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol dag nas kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa/ brgyad cu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mtshan kun tu bzang por mthun pa sha stag gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la zhal mngon par bstan te/ 'di skad ces gsungs so/ /rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul mang po/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / chos nyid rjes su bsnyegs pas bstan pa legs so/ /legs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa brgyad cu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thams cad kyang mtshan mthun pa sha stag chos bstan pa 'di la legs par brjod pa mdzad do/ /nged kyis kyang de skad du brjod pa yin no/ /nged kyis ji skad du brjod pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang brjod do/ /chos bstan pa 'di shin tu bstan pa'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par shes pa rab tu thob par gyur te/ de dag kyang nged kyis thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu tshe gcig gis thogs par lung bstan to/ /sems can sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ de dag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis/ sangs rgyas kyi yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dag tu 'gyur bar nged kyis lung bstan to; ;chos bstan pa 'di yang ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ma thos pa'i chos thos par bya ba'i phyir nged kyis byin gyis brlabs so/ /gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir sems can rnams kyis ji ltar shes par gyur cing dul bar gyur pa de bzhin du/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med/ grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ dpag tu med pa/ brjod du med pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis mthas gtugs pa thams cad ma lus pa dag tu yang sems can rnams rnam par dul bar gyur to/ /sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / chos nyid rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nyams pa med pa las mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku 'thob pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / dus la ji ltar bab pa bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba dang / sngon mngon par bsgrubs pa chud ma zos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / mthu shin tu yangs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mnga' bsgyur ba yang dag par bstan pa'i mthus/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol nas/ byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs shing / byang chub sems dpa' rgyan chen po rab tu bstan pa dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po rab tu dgye ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bskyod pa dang / bdud kyi khyim thams cad rab tu gzhig pa dang / ngan song gi yul thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid rab tu brjod pa dang / chos yang dag par 'gro ba rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i legs pa brjod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos kyi char tshad med pa dbab pa'i sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / lus rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa rab tu bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin chen po rang rang gi rgyud kyi snod tshad med pas yang dag par gzung ba byed cing 'ongs par gyur to/ /de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis 'di skad du brjod de/ kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid mi 'phrogs shing / bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di brjod pa legs so/ /legs so/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ bdag cag kyang thams cad kun tu bzang po zhes bya bar ming mthun pa sha stag ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan kun tu grags pa'i dbang phyug rgyal po zhes bya ba dag gi drung nas 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming kun tu snang ba'i 'od ces bya ba dag nas 'dir phyin te/ thams cad du'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid rab tu thob pas chos bstan pa 'di nyid byung bar gyur to/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar bdag cag kyang dbang du gyur pa sha stag sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor 'dir phyin te/ ji ltar bdag cag 'khor 'dir phyin pa de bzhin du/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mtha' gtugs pa/ thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa thams cad du yab de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus/ byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed phyin par gyur te/ thams cad na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnga' mi 'phrogs pa'i chos 'di nyid tshig 'di dag nyid dang / yi ge 'di dag nyid dang / nges pa'i tshig mngon par bsgrub pa 'di dag nyid kyis don 'di nyid brjod de lhag chad med par brjod do/ /
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la rnam par bltas nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs brjod cing / sangs rgyas kyi che ba nyid smos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid mi 'phrogs pa yongs su brjod pa dang / sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med cing yangs pa don yod par brjod pa dang / rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas skye ba smos pa dang / sems can ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems kyi bsam pa rab tu brtag pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la dus la ji ltar 'bab pa bzhin du chos bstan pa rnam par dgod pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos snang ba mtha' dang dbus med pa yang dag par bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / byin gyi rlabs rnam par dgod pa chen po rab tu bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i lus mi 'khrugs par bya ba byed cing sngon gyi spyod pa'i stobs dang / shugs kyis mngon par bsgrubs te/ rang gi rgyud kyi mthus yang dag par blangs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then, by the spiritual power of Buddha, and by natural law, untold hundreds of quintillions of worlds in each of the ten directions quaked in six ways: surging up in the east, sinking in the west; surging up in the west, sinking in the east; surging up in the south, sinking in the north; surging up in the north, sinking in the south; surging up on the periphery, sinking in the middle; surging up in the middle, sinking on the periphery—moving in eighteen ways: trembling, trembling all over, trembling equally all over; rising, rising all over, rising equally all over; surging, surging all over, surging equally all over; quaking, quaking all over, quaking equally all over; roaring, roaring all over, roaring equally all over; crashing, crashing all over, crashing equally all over. There rained clouds of all kinds of flowers, parasols, banners, pennants, fragrances, garlands, perfumes, ornaments, and radiant jewels, all surpassing those of the heavens, as well as clouds of enlightening beings singing eulogies, clouds of different bodies of untold enlightening beings, clouds of true awakening, clouds of purifying inconceivable worlds, clouds raining the sounds of the words of the buddhas, filling boundless universes. As on this earth the power of Buddha manifested in this way, causing all enlightening beings to rejoice greatly, so did this transpire in all worlds throughout the ten directions.
At that time, in each of the ten directions, past as many worlds as atoms in eighty unspeakable numbers of hundreds of septillions of buddha-lands, there were eighty unspeakable numbers of hundreds of septillions of buddhas, alike named Universally Good, who all appeared to the enlightening beings and said, “Bravo, Offspring of Buddha! You are able, imbued with the power of the enlightened, conforming to the nature of reality, to expound the teaching of the manifestation of Buddha. We buddhas of the same name, eighty unspeakable numbers of hundreds of septillions of us in each of the ten directions, all expound this teaching. And what we expound, so do all Buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions. In this assembly as many great enlightening beings as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands have attained the concentration of spiritual powers of all enlightening beings; we give them the prediction that they will attain unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment in one lifetime. As many sentient beings as atoms in a buddha-land have roused the determination for unexcelled, complete perfect enlightenment; we also give them a prediction, that in the future, after as many eons as atoms in unspeakable buddha-lands, they will all become buddhas, all with the same name, Supreme Realm of the Enlightened. In order to enable the enlightening beings of the future to hear this teaching, we all preserve it together. As the sentient beings are liberated in this world, so are the sentient beings liberated in all worlds in the cosmos.”
Then, owing to the spiritual power of the buddhas of the ten directions, owing to the power of the original vows of Vairocana, because the natural order is so, because of the power of roots of goodness, because the buddhas activate knowledge in an instant, because buddhas respond to conditions without missing the time, because they awaken enlightening beings at appropriate times, because their past deeds have no loss or decay, because they foster the attainment of the great practice of Universal Good, and because they manifest the mastery of omniscience, in each of the ten directions, past as many worlds as atoms in ten unspeakable numbers of tens of quadrillions of buddha-lands, there were as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten unspeakable numbers of tens of quadrillions of buddha-lands who came here, filling all universes in the ten directions, showing the vast magnificent adornments of enlightening beings, emitting networks of great beams of light, shaking all worlds in the ten directions, demolishing the palaces of all demons, extinguishing the pains of the states of ill, revealing the power of all enlightened ones, singing praises of the infinite different virtuous qualities of the enlightened, showering all kinds of rains, manifesting infinite different bodies, receiving the teachings of infinite buddhas. By the spiritual power of Buddha, they each said, “Bravo, offspring of Buddha: you are able to explain this indestructible teaching of buddhas. We are all named Universally Good, and we each have come here from the presence of a buddha called Freedom Marked by Universality, from worlds called Universal Light. In those worlds we also expound this teaching, with the same expressions, the same principles, the same explanations, the same certitude, without increase or decrease. We have all come here, by the spiritual power of Buddha, and by having attained the Buddhas’ teaching, to be witnesses for you. And as we come here, the same is true of all worlds in the whole cosmos, throughout space, in all ten directions.”
Then the enlightening being Universally Good—with the spiritual power of Buddha, looking over all the great congregations of enlightening beings, wishing to recapitulate the immense power of the manifestation of Buddha, the indestructibility of the true teaching of the enlightened, how infinite roots of goodness are not in vain, how the emergence of buddhas in the world always comprises all supreme qualities, the ability to observe skillfully the minds of all sentient beings and teach them the truth according to their needs, without missing the right time producing the infinite light of truth of enlightening beings; the adornments of freedom of all buddhas, and how all enlightened ones are one body, no different, produced by great practices of the past—said in verse:

dpe rnams ji snyed 'jig rten kun na gang yod pa/ / de dag thams cad sangs rgyas spyod lam 'di dang bral/ / 'on kyang 'gro la phan phyir sems can bstan pa'i phyir/ / dpe med rnams la don gyi tshul gyi dpe yang blangs/ /
bde gshegs gsang ba 'di dag tha mal dman mi thos/ / bskal pa brgya phrag stong du de yi sgra dkon no/ / gang rnams brtson 'grus blo ldan shin tu dul gyur pa/ / de 'dra'i skyes bus sangs rgyas gsang ba 'di 'dra thos/ /
gang gis 'di thos gyur nas rab tu dgar 'gyur ba/ / des ni sngon chad sangs rgyas brgya stong bkur cing mchod/ / bde gshegs rnams kyis byin rlabs rgyal bas yongs su gzung / / lha dang mis bstod mkhas pas rim gror bya ba yin/ /
'di ni bde gshegs 'jig rten 'das pa kun gyi dkor/ / rgyal ba sems can sgrol ba kun kyang 'di las 'byung / / 'di ni dkar po'i lam mang kun gyi mtha' yas rigs/ / de phyir bag yod gyis te 'di ni gzung bar gyis/ /

The actions of all buddhas Are beyond mundane similitudes; In order to enlighten sentient beings, They make similes of nonsimiles for illustration.
This subtle, mysterious, profound teaching Is hard to get to hear in a billion ages; Those with vigor, wisdom, and self-control Can get to hear this mystery.
Any who hear this teaching and rejoice Have served countless buddhas; Being absorbed into the power of Buddha, Gods and humans honor and praise them.
This is the foremost wealth transcending the world: This can liberate all living beings, This can produce the pure Path— You should keep it attentively.

de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis mngon par gnang ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba'i dpal yid dga' ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de dag thams cad dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / gtsang ma'i gnas kyi 'khor du bcas pa thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos bshad pa la mngon par dga'o/ /
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo// sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa'i le'u ste/ bzhi bcu rtsa gsum mo// //
